Location: Minneapolis, MN Category: Faculty Posted On: Mon Feb 10 2020 Job Description:

Augsburg's Business Department stresses active, experiential learning and is now housed in our newest building, the Hagfors Center for Science, Business and Religion. Faculty and students work with local businesses and nonprofits on projects both for classes and as internships or field studies. Our location in Minneapolis provides broad ranging opportunities for collaboration with industry partners as well as colleagues at the numerous colleges and universities in the Twin Cities.

We are seeking candidates to teach Business Analytics courses. Candidates should be able to teach classes in GIS, R, Tableau and other statistical or mathematical tools including MATLAB. This candidate must be able to teach upper level courses in Forecasting, advanced business or econometric analysis as well as the data analytics concentration classes in our MBA program. The preferred candidate will be able to teach a wide variety of courses in this area of specialization. The Department of Business Administration strongly values experiential learning as an important component of an excellent educational program. We also value collaboration within the Department and across the University in order to provide the highest caliber education for our students through opportunities such as internships, faculty/student research and service learning. Additional responsibilities, such as service within the Department, the University and the profession may be required. In the future, it may be converted to a tenure track position dependent on the credentials of the successful candidate and approval of the Department and University.

Job Requirements:
A Master's degree or higher in data analytics, statistics or economics or a related field is required
In addition, a Ph.D. in an appropriate field is preferred and is required for any tenure track position
Candidates who have earned their degree from an AACSB accredited institution will be given preference
A minimum of three (3) or more years evidence of teaching excellence and professional work experience

Additional Information:
Augsburg University offers more than 50 undergraduate majors and nine graduate degrees to approximately 3,400 students of diverse backgrounds. With a student/faculty ratio of 12:1, the university focuses on close personal interaction with faculty and experiential education opportunities on campus and in the community. An Augsburg education is defined by excellence in the liberal arts and professional studies, guided by the faith and values of the Lutheran church,and shaped by its urban and global settings. At both undergraduate and graduate levels, students actively engage in international travel and intercultural experiences that broaden their view of the world and deepen
their engagement in it.

Augsburg University values the diversity of persons, perspectives, and convictions. Critical thinking, rigorous analysis, and open discussion across a full range of ideas lie at the heart of the University's mission as an institution of higher learning. Essential to the University in living out its mission of educating students be "informed citizens, thoughtful stewards, critical thinkers, and responsible leaders" is that our foundation be one of diversity, inclusion, equity, and intercultural competency.

Augsburg's main campus is located in the vibrant Cedar-Riverside neighborhood of Minneapolis, one of the most diverse areas in the Twin Cities. The University of Minnesota West Bank campus and one of the city's largest medical complexes are adjacent to Augsburg; the Mississippi River and the Seven Corners Theatre district are just a few blocks away. In addition to its Minneapolis campus, Augsburg has a site in Rochester, the fastest growing city in Minnesota and headquarters of the Mayo Health System. In addition to these locations, Augsburg owns and operates international sites in Central America and southern Africa.

Overview:
We are seeking a proactive leader to guide our Company’s insurance product management and data strategy, vision and operational initiatives. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical, strategic planning & communication skills plus experience in personal lines insurance. This position reports directly to the Executive VP and will be a key member of our Senior Management Team.

Who is Legacy Insurance Services? Legacy Insurance Services, Inc. is a well-established, successful and growing personal auto insurance company. We are a member of the Western National Insurance Group (WNIG), "The Relationship Company®". WNIG is an “A+” rated mutual insurance company with a 115+ year history and current assets of over $1 billion.

Responsibilities:
The VP Product and Data Management will:
Proactively lead, guide, evaluate and adapt Company’s data and product management strategy, vision and operational initiatives to achieve and maintain long-term profitability
Oversee, develop & implement pricing, product and data strategies for existing business, and develop new products and program features to profitably grow business
Enhance pricing sophistication by leveraging internal & external data and emerging technologies, to develop robust & predictive pricing models and methodologies
Oversee and drive execution of product and data team strategic objectives, spanning product development, data & pricing analysis, competitor research, rules & rate filings, and underwriting guidelines
Identify & define common product rating variables & UW segments across multiple states
Develop and deploy effective growth and revenue strategies to proactively counter competitor actions and market conditions
Analyze data and explain differences between actual and expected experience
Work closely with each state’s Department of Insurance for rate filings and monitoring
Continually monitor and evaluate programs for opportunities and enhancements, including but not limited to rate changes
Coordinate with the Claims, Underwriting and Marketing departments to shape product offering based on marketing strategy to develop a strong product demand in the marketplace
Perform other duties or special projects as assigned

Qualifications:
Successful candidates will have:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative or analytic field
5-10+ years of product, data analytics and/or operational management experience in the P&C insurance industry
Knowledge of statistics and basic actuarial techniques with superior analytical skills
Ability to foster collaborative cross-functional relationships and communicate across both technical and non-technical teams and individuals
Proven track record of timely and effective execution with strong attention to detail and business judgment to develop and maintain strong relationships
Ability to take a big picture concept and develop it into a program & implement an action plan
Abilityto manage qualitative and quantitative aspects and understand broad business segments
Ability to analyze and synthesize raw data into meaningful insights and business outcomes
Ability to effectively and independently manage complex workload while exhibiting very sound judgment
Comfortable working with several programs going on at the same time
Able to correlate different kinds of information into a coherent pattern, bringing data together
Ideal candidate will have Non-Standard Auto experience

What does Legacy Insurance Services give employees? Glad you asked! We offer flexible work hours & scheduling, provide nine (9) Company paid Holidays, Personal Time Off (PTO) and even paid Volunteer time to our employees. Our generous benefits package includes medical, dental and vision options as well as company paid long-term care insurance, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, and a 401k plan with a Company match.

Why work at Legacy? We know the key to our continued success is in our people. We provide a casual, comfortable working environment that promotes teamwork, creativity and a sense of purpose. Although we like to work hard, we also like to have fun! We know our employees enjoy our Wellness program offerings (meditation, infused water, wellness room) and our full benefits package. Casual Friday? Not here! At Legacy, employees dress comfortably every day!

We are located in a convenient office park area off of Elliot & I-10 in the Ahwatukee Foothills, surrounded by restaurants, shops and other services all nearby!

I’m interested – now what? We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration. Simply apply online through our website at www.legacymga.com/careers.

Candidates receiving an employment offer will be required to successfully complete a background & credit check.

Position Description - Personal Shopper Description As Personal Shopper at Bodaty, this person will be responsible for various activities related to helping shoppers on the Samyata retail system buy products and deliver them to them. Overview:
Join our rapidly growing company as Manager of Business Analytics!

Summary

As our Manager of Business Analytics for American Credit Acceptance’s Risk department, you will have a high-profile role in a high impact team. Your primary role will be to design and lead an analytics function, developing and guiding a team of analysts to perform empirically derived analysis to understand operational and business performance, identify improvement opportunities, and develop strategies. This position offers growth opportunities for someone who is passionate about analyzing and monitoring business performance, making data-driven decisions, and testing and optimizing strategy.

American Credit Acceptance is a rapidly-expanding company with extensive growth opportunities. We are proud to say, that we have experienced double digit growth for the last 10 years and currently have over $3,00,000,000 in assets. Our team members and corporate culture create a positive workplace that drives us to succeed, making American Credit Acceptance one of the top auto finance companies in the US for the emerging credit consumer. We offer a great work environment, awesome team members, competitive benefits, progressive career opportunities, a casual dress code and we work hard to ensure every team member is empowered to work to their fullest potential.

Responsibilities:
We are hiring a Manager of Business Analytics for our Risk Department!

Responsibilities in your area will include:
Hands-on analyst as well as a leader and mentor in the department.
Development of analytical models such as credit risk scorecards, behavior scorecards, collections models, statistical forecasts, resource allocation.
Responsible for the development of statistical models that drive company processes such as sales, underwriting, funding, pricing, servicing, and finance.
Test and implement models and data used to execute strategy.
Actively monitor the performance of models in production.
Analyze data to drive better business decisions.
Develop complex programming to extract and manipulate data.

Qualifications:
Who Are We Looking for?

Our ideal candidate for this role needs to:
Have knowledge of analytic tools and methods, such as logistic regression.
Experience in complex, data-driven problem solving using in-depth analysis
Able to apply analytical skills to solve problems creatively.
Act promptly and effectively when assigned tasks.
Able to communicate complex information to others in a way they can understand.
Work well with others in a team environment.
Be proactive and make recommendations as opportunities arise with minimal supervision
Background in analytics, statistics and strategy

Position Qualifications:
Excellent professional and academic credentials
MBA with course work in quantitative field such as statistics, mathematics, economics, analytics, decision science or MS in Analytics
4+ years of professional experience
1+ years of leadership / people management experience
Knowledge of SQL and relational databases.
Expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.
Ability to confidently interact with senior business leaders.
Remain compliant with our policies, processes and legal guidelines.
Work onsite at American Credit Acceptance in Spartanburg, SC

Preferred Qualifications:
R programming
Experience in the consumer lending industry, with preference given to automobile finance experience.
Experience leading direct reports.

Recognized on the Inc. 5000 fastest growing companies in the US, Peloton is one of the largest and fastest growing professional services firms specializing in Integrated Cloud Solutions for Enterprise Resource Planning, Enterprise Performance Management, Supply Chain Management, Human Capital Management and Big Data and Analytics. Peloton has the vision and connected capabilities to help CFOs, CIOs and business leaders to envision, implement and realize the benefits of digital transformation. Companies that are equipped with the right information, have the know-how, and the enabling technology to consistently leverage analytics will gain a competitive advantage. Our people are recognized as some of the best minds and most committed people in the industry. We believe in quality. We appreciate creativity. We recognize individual contributions, and we place trust in our team members. And…we love what we do.

Peloton provides Advisory, Consulting, and Managed services with deep functional and technical expertise specializing in serving clients in the Life Sciences, Retail, Manufacturing, Insurance, Aerospace and Defense and Financial Services industries. Our business and technology professionals provide a unique perspective, proven experience, with an innovative and collaborative approach to achieve results for clients.

We are actively seeking highly motivated, enthusiastic, and talented professionals with a background in business analysis and/or project management. The role provides an opportunity to work with consulting professionals in a high energy, entrepreneurial and high career growth environment. The ideal candidate will have strong business analysis, facilitation, and communication skills to manage cross functional projects within various industry verticals.

As a Project Manager / Business Analyst, you will be responsible for:

Tracking project milestones and communicating status during weekly meetings

Development of project deliverables such as:
Providing support creating approach and materials for Workshops involving both business and technical stakeholders
Providing support gathering business requirements and translating into design options
Documenting/defining processes to show where business and system processes align
Design and development of end-user training materials and communication plans
Establishing ‘train the trainer’ model
Development of user accepting testing plans/scripts
Ad-hoc presentations to the business as needed

Required Experience & Skills:
BA/BS Degree
2 to 3 years of experience working as a Business Analyst managing business process re-engineering or software implementations
Demonstrated experience acting as the liaison between business and IT stakeholders with communication skills to speak appropriately to both parties (translating ‘technology’ to the business and vice versa)
Experience in full life-cycle project development including requirements, design, development, testing and roll-out
Demonstrated experience in analyzing a business issue and developing a future state recommendation
Ability to set agendas and facilitate meetings, while focusing in on critical path discussion topics and necessary decisions
Experience creating training/user documentation
Ability to self-manage tasks
Exposure to project related work and standard artifacts
Ability to work with teams to uncover, define and document business processes and related data movements
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Proven ability to work remotely and independently in support of clients
Fit with Peloton culture and company values: teamwork, innovation, integrity, service, “can-do” attitude, and speaking your ideas

Compensation:
Competitive base salary
Medical and dental insurance
Vision Insurance
401K with supporting company match
Flexible Spending
Technical and business skills training
Performance bonus
Paid holidays and vacation days

PepsiCo operates in an environment undergoing immense and rapid change, driven by eCommerce and emergent retail technologies. To ensure continued success in the food and beverage space, PepsiCo has assembled a dedicated eCommerce team – tasked with optimizing eCommerce operations and developing innovations that will give PepsiCo a sustainable competitive advantage. While tied closely to broader PepsiCo, the eCommerce group more closely resembles a start-up environment; embracing the core values of having a bias for action, being results-oriented, maintaining a community-focus, and prioritizing people.

PepsiCo’s Data Science and Analytics group is a team of data engineers, BI developers, technology specialists, and business innovators who operate within eCommerce to build industry-leading systems and solutions. By focusing on machine learning and automation, the Data Science & Analytics group is pushing the bounds of possibility for PepsiCo and its strategic partners.

What PepsiCo Data Science & Analytics does:
Create data visualizations to unlock sales & share trends across e-commerce sales channels
Integrate data utilizing Airflow, SSIS, Tableau Prep, and other tools to provide quick but unified insights
Deploy data platforms and applications to enable business users and data scientists alike to rapidly derive value from raw data
Work with PepsiCo’s strategic partners to expand their technical capabilities, thereby creating a more robust data environment
Develop scalable tools to drive automation and optimize business operations
As a Business Intelligence Engineer, you will be a primary resource for modeling, transforming, & presenting data for final consumption by end-users. You will interact with databases and files regularly aggregating, transforming, unifying, & cleansing raw datasets provided by other internal and external engineering teams. You will form technical requirements & specs based on direct requirements from end-users, other BI analysts, and developers. You will develop and deliver automated, test-driven, & documented data solutions thru both code and software that can be handed off to other technical & non-technical stakeholders or supported on-going by the BI team.

Responsibilities:
Access & transform data from multiple databases (including SQL Server, Snowflake, & Postgres) using tools such as Airflow, SSIS, & Tableau Prep
Dimensionally model raw data for consumption by business users, BI developers, & data scientists
Design data pipelines in both code-based and GUI-based platforms to populate data models
Build quality checks directly into delivered solutions with test-driven development
Understand and translate business requirements from business users and analysts into technical design specs
Present solutions to technical and non-technical stakeholders for continued improvement
Support BI products and pipelines in production

Qualifications/Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree (Computer Science, Engineering, or other STEM-related area preferred)
Intermediate experience with Python data engineering libraries such as Pandas, Airflow, & SQLalchemy
Knowledge of dimensional, data warehousing concepts such as star/snowflake schemas, SCDs, etc. preferred
Experience writing complex SQL queries to retrieve & write dimensional data
Experience with data visualization platforms (Tableau, PowerBI, SuperSet, etc.) or OLAP cubes is a plus
Strong professional communication skills with both technical & non-technical audiences
Be inquisitive for knowledge, drive for results, yet humble

Relocation Eligible: Not Applicable
Job Type: Regular

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

PepsiCo is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity

Our ideal candidate is a goal-oriented individual who is motivated to learn, provide best in class service for clients, and above all – has an entrepreneurial outlook. ability to adapt to new technologies.Desire to research and test new opportunities within the growing search marketplace.Able to multi-task and prioritize—must work well under pressure.Knowledge of integrated digital media campaign planning and execution.Demonstrated grasp of leveraging KPIs to interpret results and make data-based decisions.Requirements: Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Business or Communications3+ years of paid digital media experienceAdvanced knowledge of the paid media landscapeExperience with training and mentoring teammates.Strong writing, editing, and proofing skills.Excellent verbal and interpersonal skills.Ability to think strategically and implement flawlessly.Proficiency in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel.That’s it for the job - moving on to why you should work at CRI: We are a welcoming, fast-growing, upbeat company that takes a different client facing, consultative approach to digital marketing. We support your professional growth and we put you in the middle of an innovative team within a well-established company.Besides getting to do work we’re passionate about, here are some of our favorite things about working at CRI: Small company with a family feelHalf-day summer FridaysOpen work-space promoting collaboration and team learningReverse commute from Boston—avoid the traffic!An array of refreshments and snacks dailyA fun, flexible, creative and laid-back work environmentOnsite fitness facility and cafeGenerous vacation policyAttractive benefits package including health and dental coverageMatching 401(k) investment optionsCompany sponsored charity initiatives and office eventsA fun, flexible, creative and laid-back work environmentSmart, innovative industry professionalsIndustry exposure through CRI’s blog, social media, and other forumsEntrepreneurial approach and spiritAbout Charles River Interactive (CRI):CRI was founded in 2005. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Solutions Leadership

Serve as the subject matter expert for one or more of the following practices: Data Lineage & Validation, Data Architecture, Data integration, Data Presentation, Data Sciences, Enterprise Service Bus, Business Engagement Programs.
Provides technical oversight for data solutions developed and delivered by Data Solutions Analysts and Data Solutions Engineer in support of Technical roadmap
Plan, manage, and orchestrate deliverables for assigned business unit based on business unit leaders’ key priorities
Defines, executes, delivers, and assists with adoption of data solutions roadmap for one or more business line in support of overall data strategy
Applies creative problem-solving skills to data efforts in a way that satisfies business leaders request and lays groundwork for future successes.
Assists Manager of Strategic Analytics & Member Insights to plan and set tactical direction with business adoption of analytics and application of appropriate technology to support business need

Business Relationship & Analysis

Develop understanding of both long and short-term objectives of the business units as it relates to analytics and the ability to garner member insights that drive strategic decisions.
Communicate technical designs of data products in a concise and easily understood format by both technical and non-technical personnel.
Serves as a key resource to the business units and Data Analytics Team for all facets of solution delivery of data & analytics deliverables
Build quality relationships with key members of the various business units while clarifying information & analytics needs across business lines.
Make suggestions to business partners in leveraging technology to improve or automate the rendering of information used by the business unit.

Data Development

Develop ETL processes, create and/or modify data marts, and lead in the application of analytics
Work with large, complex data sets to support implementation of data solutions that help predict, improve and measure the success of key business outcomes.
Prepare the necessary documentation and visuals to ensure clarity in data lineage and firm understanding of developed data solutions.
Provide general guidance and leadership to junior members of the analytics team and business-embedded analysts related to data usage and analytics
Suggest changes to enhance the design, function and development of new/existing data structures.

STANDARDS OF PERFORMANCE:
Complies with Bank Secrecy Act/Anti-Money Laundering/CIP (U.S. Patriot Act) procedures and policies.
Provides members with courteous, friendly service, which exceeds their expectations while processing transactions promptly, efficiently and accurately.
Follows Wings Financial CU’s “Standards of Professionalism” to represent the credit union to members in a professional manner through written and verbal communications, attitude, business attire, work area, and thorough knowledge of our products and services.
Meets individual quality service goals as identified in your performance action plan.
Be an effective team member through cooperation, flexibility, dependability, attendance, lack of tardiness and participation at meetings and training.
Accurately applies technical job knowledge and skills to complete all work in a timely manner in accordance with policies, procedures and regulatory requirements while managing varying degrees of work.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: None.

QUALIFICATIONS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE: Four year college degree or equivalent work experience involving Data Analytics Initiatives and BI Development.

Demonstrated creative problem solving skills focused on data deliverables.
7+ years experience in strategic planning, business analysis, solutions architecture, and/or Business Intelligence Development
3+ years proven successes in consulting with business leaders in designing and implementing strategic plan for delivery of multiple high priority projects, initiatives, and work items.
Development experience using SQL Server technologies (such as SSMS, SSRS, SSIS, SSAS, DQS)
5+ years of Transact SQL, including creation of objects to support data modeling.
Knowledge of Tableau or similar data visualization software required.
Knowledge of advanced analytical functions such as clustering, correlation, and market basket analysis helpful. Experience in R a plus.
Excellent analytic, organization, presentation and facilitation skills; ability to manage multiple tasks under tight deadlines
Demonstrated ownership & leadership of analytics and/or data deliverables
Very strong customer focus and relationship skills.
Ability to work flexible schedule.
Knowledge of financial services desirable
Ability to work alone or with little supervision.
Willingness to pursue further education in Data Analytics & BI.
Working knowledge of computer software (i.e. Windows, Microsoft Office, Visio)
Working knowledge of BI Development processes & awareness of BI technologies
Working knowledge of Excel data functions and Pivot Tables
Demonstrated experience leading collaborative discussions with technical and non-technical staff that result in value to the business unit.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS / WORK ENVIRONMENT: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand, walk and sit. The employee is occasionally required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs, frequently 5-10 lbs. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, ability to adjust focus. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

Description and Functions

Open Until Filled

GENERAL DESCRIPTION:
The Enterprise Business Intelligence (BI) and Data Analytics (DA) Analyst's role is to organize and provide for enterprise BI & DA services while enhancing enterprise database organization and enterprise data visualization services. Primary responsibilities include BI & DA coordination and development, database analyst functions, and data visualization functions. This is a technical position that provides support and guidance in accordance with enterprise data plans. This position is part of the enterprise data team and will work with technical and non-technical people across the state in all branches of government.

Human Resource Contact: 307-214-5835 meg.connor@wyo.gov

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: The listed functions are illustrative only and are not intended to describe every function which may be performed in the job level.

Assess and cultivate long-term strategic goals for BI & DA development in conjunction with end users, managers, clients, and other stakeholders in accordance with enterprise data plans.
Help develop and administer strategies for the control and sharing of enterprise database resources and services.
Direct, organize, and lead projects in the implementation and use of BI/DA software tools and systems.
Lead the integration efforts for merging BI/DA services with enterprise systems and applications.
Create and document models for current databases and/or changes through data flowcharting and mapping.
Design, code, test, and document all new or modified BI/DA systems, applications, and programs.
Develop data visualizations (graphs, charts, maps, etc.) and portal interfaces.
Assist in the design of databases and data warehouses to ensure interoperability with BI/DA solutions.
Produce 'ETL' design guidelines to ensure a manageable 'ETL' infrastructure for BI/DA system.
Design and deliver end-user training and training materials; provide technical support as necessary.
Troubleshoot BI/DA tools, systems, and software; performance-tune these applications as necessary.
Act as advocate for BI/DA benefits across the enterprise in accordance with enterprise data plans.
Perform database transaction and security audits.
Perform data audits and quality control measures.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

PREFERENCES:
Preference may be given to those with a Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, or similar field.
Preference may be given to those with data related positions with increasing responsibility over time typically including business intelligence / data analytics, database design & analysis, and data visualization experience.
Preference may be given to those with hands-on experience with BI/DA tools and collaborating with end-users to meet business needs.
Preference may be given to those with experience with general data visualization principles, BI/DA principles, and general database analysis.
Preference may be given to those with experience with large data systems.

KNOWLEDGE:
Strong ability to analyze user requirements and build front-end BI applications according to specifications.
Strong understanding of relational database structures, theories, principles, and practices.
Full project management and development life cycle experience.
In-depth technical knowledge of network, PC, and platform operating systems.
In-depth experience with data management and data processing flowcharting techniques.
Good knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws.
Broad knowledge of data visualization, reporting, and query tools and practices.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Strong presentation and interpersonal skills.
Exceptional analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities.
Able to prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Strong technical documentation skills.
Ability to conduct research into database issues, standards, and products.
Ability to present ideas in user-friendly language.
Highly self motivated and directed, with keen attention to detail.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Education:
Bachelor's Degree (typically in Computer Technology)

Experience:
0-3 years of progressive work experience (typically in Computer Technology) with acquired knowledge at the level of a Support Technologist III

OR

Education & Experience Substitution:
4-6 years of progressive work experience (typically in Computer Technology) with acquired knowledge at the level of a Support Technologist III

Certificates, Licenses, Registrations:
None

Necessary Special Requirements

PHYSICAL WORKING CONDITIONS:
Sitting for extended periods of time.
Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard, mouse, and other computer components.
Lifting and transporting of objects, such as computers and BI/DA or data visualization tools and supplies - must be able to lift 50 lbs.
Occasional travel and potential presenting in support of the enterprise data plan and team.
Work as part of a team in accordance with defined goals and objectives.

NOTES:
FLSA: Non-exempt
Successful candidate must pass a background check.
All new hires or rehires starting in a non-exempt position on or after January 1, 2018 are required to be paid hourly.

Supplemental Information

job_information:
At 'Humana's Edge we are on a mission to improve health outcomes for our seniors and helping them lead a fulfilling life. The Edge is a business within Humana that exists to help seniors live life on their terms and unlock every senior's potential. We know seniors are focused on achieving their personal goals - staying active, dancing at their daughter's wedding, playing with their grandchild. But sometimes, their health concerns get in the way. By designing and executing on a new integrated operating model, the Edge can deliver an experience that helps seniors stay independent and in control of their lives. The Analytics Product Management team within the Product & Experience organization drives the Analytics as a product strategy.

Responsibilities

As a Business Intelligence Co-op you will have an opportunity to exhibit your passion for solving data and business problems.

Our Analytics Product Management team specializes in establishing and delivering next generation prescriptive business intelligence solutions, supported by a robust data platform. This Co-op position will provide you an opportunity to learn & perform. IQVIA™ is the leading human data science company focused on helping healthcare clients find unparalleled insights and better solutions for patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data, domain expertise, transformative technology, and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward.

Consultant, Predictive Analytics

RWS (Real-World Solutions)Technology Platforms

The Role:
This is an exciting role for a Predictive Analytics Consultant who is keen to help shape and grow a high profile and highly motivated predictive analytics team at the cutting-edge of life science. You will be exposed to both tier 1 and emerging pharmaceutical clients, diverse disease areas, complex healthcare challenges and market-leading anonymized patient datasets. This is an unrivalled opportunity to accelerate your career in an exciting direction. The role will encompass a mix of delivery and business development responsibilities including:

First, you will oversee the design and delivery of advanced statistical / machine learning projects for US clients, such as developing algorithms to find undiagnosed patients with rare conditions. You will assume day-to-day responsibility for projects, oversee multiple work streams involving data scientists, clinical experts, client presentations, etc., demonstrating critical thinking, intellectual engagement and maturity.
Second, you will support business development initiatives, including qualifying leads from clients, writing proposals, pitching to clients, etc. Throughout, you will work closely with internal stakeholders from around the business to ensure the proposed solution is truly innovative and provides an exciting value proposition to clients.
Third, as you grow into the role, you will assume increased mentorship responsibilities, leading and inspiring other team members, serving as the go-to person for predictive analytics solutions, collaborating with software engineers and data scientists to improve the efficiency and quality of project deliverables, presenting at conferences and engaging in a variety of thought leadership initiatives.
As a functional consultant you will work along side data scientists who will provide expertise on how and when to use advanced statistical / machine learning methods; you will require a strong existing foundational analytical knowledge coupled with an enthusiasm to deepen your understanding of advanced statistical and machine learning methods.

The ideal candidate will have:
A strong analytical background and a desire to upskill in predictive analytics / machine learning
A deep understanding and excitement for the application of statistics/machine learning in healthcare/life sciences and the pharmaceutical industry
Experience in healthcare / life sciences with focus on strategic business cases for analytics services or products
Strong capability in managing analytics projects and priorities so that deadlines are met while retaining consistently high-quality deliverables
Experience of working in multi-disciplined teams
Experience of developing credible relationships with senior level managers and executives
Knowledge of key issues and current developments in the pharmaceutical and healthcare industries
Demonstrable analytical, interpretative and problem-solving skills
Inquisitiveness, attention to detail, ability to assess challenges
Excellent presentation, communication and client-facing skills
Well-developed written and verbal communication skills including presentations, small group facilitation, business and analytics report writing
Prior experience with software packages such as R, Python, Matlab and SAS would be desirable but not required
Knowledge of consulting methodologies, tools and techniques would be desirable but not required.

In addition to the skills and experience above, candidates interested in joining as a Consultant will ideally have:

Experience in life sciences, engineering, business, or other quantitative fields
A postgraduate qualification in life sciences, statistics or a related discipline is desirable although not essential
Experience in healthcare consulting or exposure to the life science sector industry
Excellent conversational and business English (written and oral).

The Team:
You will join this high profile team to work on ground-breaking problems in health outcomes across disease areas including Ophthalmology, Neurology, chronic diseases such as diabetes, and a variety of very rare conditions. The Predictive Analytics team, comprising client-facing consultants, data scientists and software engineers, work hand-in-hand with statisticians, epidemiologists and disease area experts across the wider global RWS team, leveraging a vast variety of anonymous patient-level information from sources such as prescriptions, claims and electronic health records. The data encompasses IQVIA’s access to over 530 million anonymized patients as well as bespoke, custom partnerships with healthcare providers and payers.

Our Predictive Analytics team within the Real World Solutions (RWS) Technology Platforms division is a fast-growing group of collaborative, enthusiastic, and entrepreneurial individuals. In our never-ending quest for opportunities to harness the value of Real World Evidence (RWE), we are at the center of IQVIA’s advances in areas such as machine learning and cutting-edge statistical approaches. Our efforts improve retrospective clinical studies, under-diagnosis of rare diseases, personalized treatment response, disease progression predictions, and clinical decision-support tools.

We are looking for a creative, innovative, intellectually curious and entrepreneurial Predictive Analytics Consultant to join our team.

This is an exciting opportunity to work in one of the world's leading RWE teams working with Real World patient data to help our clients answer specific questions globally, make more informed decisions and deliver results.

We invite you to join IQVIA™.

IQVIA is a strong advocate of diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We believe that a work environment that embraces diversity will give us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and enhance our success. We believe that an inclusive and respectful workplace culture fosters a sense of belonging among our employees, builds a stronger team, and allows individual employees the opportunity to maximize their personal potential.

Join Us

Join Us

Making a positive impact on human health takes insight, curiosity, and intellectual courage. It takes brave minds, pushing the boundaries to transform healthcare. Regardless of your role, you will have the opportunity to play an important part in helping our clients drive healthcare forward and ultimately improve outcomes for patients.

Forge a career with greater purpose, make an impact, and never stop learning.

IQVIA is an EEO Employer - Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Job ID: R1123299

QUALIFICATIONS
University student pursuing an advanced degree in a STEM-related field (ops research, statistics, applied math, engineering); expected graduation date of January or May 2021
Experience in one or more programming languages (R, Python, C++, etc.)
Strong intrinsic problem-solving skills
Ability to structure and solve problems and conduct and interpret analysis independently
Demonstrated analytical and quantitative skills
Ability to effectively communicate complex ideas

WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH
You will be joining the Org Analytics team in Waltham, MA.
Org Analytics is a dedicated team of analysts and client managers, and members of the global Org practice. Org Analytics combines innovative design technology and advanced analytics with deep expertise to help our clients make effective organizational decisions.
Org Analytics helps Human Resources and business leaders to make smarter organizational decisions by leveraging advanced data analytics, user-centric design technology and proven methodologies. These approaches help clients to answer critical questions related to cost reduction, efficiency and effectiveness streamlining, merger plans, divestments and carve-outs, and talent deployment.
In creating asset-enabled practices, McKinsey is driving innovation in how we serve clients with analytics and design thinking. In recent years, McKinsey has hired thousands of technology professionals – data scientists, designers, software engineers, product managers, etc. – to serve alongside generalist consultants and identify ways that technology can improve outcomes.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
You will analyze and evaluate a wide range of data, including data from human resources information systems, business metrics, and survey assessments.
Leveraging your advanced data analysis skills, you will create innovative approaches to answer our clients’ most relevant talent questions. You will work on a variety of problems across many different industries, such as a top-tier professional services company trying to improve the efficiency of their recruiting pipeline, an insurance company facing high, inexplicable attrition, and a major pharmaceutical company in need of a road-map to better understand their future talent needs.
You will work with clients and our team to translate clients’ questions into analytical problems, manage the entire data cleaning pipeline, apply machine learning algorithms and data visualization techniques, generate insights, and communicate them back to clients.
Working on projects and exchanging experiences with your colleagues means you will face new intellectual challenges on a daily basis, while continuously building your methodological knowledge and skills.

Are you curious and analytical? Do you thrive on working in a team environment? Are you looking for an inclusive company culture? Freddie Mac’s Single-Family Modeling and Analytics team needs creative, forward-thinking individuals like you! We are searching for quantitative, modeling, and data science talent at all experience levels; we want to hire individuals who seek out complex business problems and develop viable solutions. As a member of our team, you will contribute to a variety of industry-leading models for assessing the creditworthiness of prospective borrowers, underwriting loans, predicting the value and condition of homes, valuing mortgages, forecasting losses, measuring house price appreciation, improving operations, and more! Your work will help make financing a home faster, fairer, more affordable, and safer for borrowers, lenders, and investors.

Apply now and grow your career working alongside talented people who want you to succeed!

Your Work May Fall into The Following Categories

Research and Development

Collaborate with other data scientists to solve demanding and complicated business problems by applying machine learning and statistics to large data sets.
Build predictive models to automate business decisions.
Develop new models and methods to assess the risk of new and existing products.
Research enhancements to existing models and methods.
Build pipelines to process data, train models, and test predictions—all at scale.
Explain the results from your models and their implications for the business to key stakeholders.

Analysis and Testing

Perform R&D and exploratory analysis using statistical techniques and machine learning algorithms to understand data.
Develop data profiling, deduping logic, and matching logic for analysis.
Build dashboards for reporting and analytics.
Coordinate model testing from research and development to implementation and deployment.
Conduct back tests to monitor model performance.
Perform sensitivity analyses and stress tests to validate model forecast results.

Data Engineering

Solve demanding and complicated business problems by applying modern technology and best practices to the engineering of large data sets.
Cleanse, manipulate, and analyze large data sets. Data sets may consist of structured data, unstructured data, or both (e.g. XMLs, CSVs, Fixed length, JSONs and PDFs).
Develop and maintain data processing programs/scripts to filter, map, and aggregate data, as well as transfer data across platforms (BigData Hadoop and Non-Hadoop).
Identify, design, and implement internal data process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build data analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into data origination, operational efficiency and other key business data movement performance metrics.
Develop, manage and implement data quality programs/scripts from source to target with unit testing and data quality reports.

Qualifications

Doctorate, Master’s degree (or Bachelor’s degree with equivalent work experience) in statistics, data science, quantitative finance, or a related quantitative field.
Coursework or work experience applying predictive modeling techniques from data science, statistics, machine learning, and econometrics to large data sets. Qualifying coursework may include-but is not limited to-data science, statistics, machine learning, optimization, numerical analysis, scientific programming, computational methods, supervised learning, unsupervised learning, text mining, and image analysis.
Coursework or work experience writing computer programs to implement data science pipelines and predictive algorithms. Programming languages may include-but are not limited to-Python, R, SQL, Java, SAS, and MATLAB.
Coursework or work experience using technologies for manipulating structured and unstructured big data. Big data technologies may include-but are not limited to-Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Spark, relational databases, and NoSQL.
Coursework or work experience using technologies for data processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
Coursework or work experience using technologies for building data pipelines that includes development unit testing, version controls, data lineage, mapping and data quality/movements validations.
Coursework or work experience of Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, unstructured data sources, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
Coursework or work experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
Coursework or work experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Coursework or Work experience with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.

Keys to Success

Curiosity not just about data, but also about the business
Ability to collaborate with people from diverse backgrounds

job_information:
Fiat Chrysler Automobiles is looking to hire a Data Scientist. This position is responsible for delivering insights to the commercial functions in which FCA operates. The Data Scientist is a role in the Business Analytics and Data Services (BA) department. They will play a pivotal role in the planning, execution, and delivery of data science and machine learning-based projects. The bulk of the work will be in areas of data exploration and preparation, data collection and integration, machine learning (ML) and statistical modeling and data pipe-lining and deployment. The newly hired Data Scientist will be a key interface between the ICT sales and marketing team, the business and the business analytics team. Candidates need to be self-driven, curious and creative.

Primary responsibilities include:
Problem Analysis and Project Management: Guide and inspire the organization about the business potential and strategy of artificial intelligence (AI)/data science; identify data-driven/ML business opportunities; collaborate across the business to understand IT and business constraints; prioritize, scope and manage data science projects and the corresponding key performance indicators (KPIs) for success

Data Exploration and Preparation: Apply statistical analysis and visualization techniques to various data, such as hierarchical clustering, T-distributed Stochastic Neighbor Embedding (t-SNE), principal components analysis (PCA); generate and test hypotheses about the underlying mechanics of the business process; network with domain experts to better understand the business mechanics that generated the data

Data Collection and Integration: Understand new data sources and process pipelines; catalog and document their use in solving business problems; create data pipelines and assets the enable more efficiency and repeatability of data science activities

Machine Learning and Statistical Modelling: Apply various ML and advanced analytics techniques to perform classification or prediction tasks; integrate domain knowledge into the ML solution (for example, from an understanding of financial risk, customer journey, quality prediction, sales, marketing); testing of ML models, such as cross-validation, A/B testing, bias and fairness

Operationalization: Collaborate with ML operations (MLOps), data engineers, and IT to evaluate and implement ML deployment options; (help to) integrate model performance management tools into the current business infrastructure; (help to) implement a champion/challenger test (A/B tests) on production systems; continuously monitor the execution and health of production ML models; establish best practices around ML production infrastructure

Additional responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Train other business and IT staff on basic data science principles and techniques

Train peers on specialist data science topics

Promote collaboration with the data science COE within the organization

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, operations research, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related quantitative field

Minimum three years of relevant project experience in successfully launching, planning, executing data science projects

Coding knowledge and experience in several languages: for example, R, Python, SQL, Java, C++, etc.

Experience of working across multiple deployment environments including cloud, on-premises and hybrid, multiple operating systems and through containerization techniques such as Docker, Kubernetes, AWS Elastic Container Service, and others

Experience with distributed data/computing and database tools: MapReduce, Hadoop, Hive, Kafka, MySQL, Postgres, DB2 or Greenplum, etc.

Must be self-driven, curious and creative

Must demonstrate the ability to work in diverse, cross-functional teams

Confident, energetic self-starter, with strong moderation and communication skills

Preferred Qualifications:
Master's degree or Ph.D. in Statistics, Machine Learning, computer science or the natural sciences, especially Physics or any engineering disciplines or equivalent field

Minimum six years of experience launching, planning, and executing data science projects

Experience in domains of automotive or customer behavior prediction

Experience in one or more of the following commercial/open-source data discovery/analysis platforms: RStudio, Spark, KNIME, RapidMiner, Alteryx, Dataiku, H2O, SAS Enterprise Miner (SAS EM) and/or SAS Visual Data Mining and Machine Learning, Microsoft AzureML, IBM Watson Studio or SPSS Modeler, Amazon SageMaker, Google Cloud ML, SAP predictive analytics

Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: generalized linear model (GLM)/regression, random forest, boosting, trees, text mining, hierarchical clustering, deep learning, convolutional neural network (CNN), recurrent neural network (RNN), T-distributed Stochastic Neighbor Embedding (t-SNE), graph analysis, etc.

Specialization in text analytics, image recognition, graph analysis or other specialized ML techniques such as deep learning, etc.

Adept in agile methodologies and well-versed in applying DevOps/MLOps methods to the construction of ML and data science pipelines

Knowledge of industry standard BA tools, including Cognos, QlikView, Business Objects, and other tools that could be used for enterprise solutions

Should exhibit superior presentation skills, including storytelling and other techniques to guide and inspire and explain analytics capabilities and techniques to the organization

Our benefits reflects the FCA commitment to helping you reach your personal and professional goals. In addition to an environment that promotes career development, we offer benefits for a healthy lifestyle and a rewarding future, designed to take care of you and your family, in various stages of life.

As a global company, our employee packages will vary by country, customary norms and the legal entity into which you are hired.

Description

Job Summary:
As a key member of the Product Quantitative Analytics team, this position is responsible for providing analytical support on structured energy products such as GBP or FB. This includes the oversight of algorithms and calculation of demand forecast at customer level for millions of customers across multiple existing markets. The position is also accountable for leading cross-functional team to provide analytical support routinely. In addition, a major point of emphasis in this role will be developing new forecast models to support the company’s initiative of offering and growing new Structured Products in expanding markets and thus bring tangible gains to the company. The position requires demonstrated capability of leveraging statistical and machine learning techniques to improve existing models and build new analytic solutions.

Job Responsibilities & Accountabilities by Competency

Functional Expertise:
Provide customer specific demand forecast timely and successfully to facilitate the continuous success of existing structured products

Lead cross-functional team to provide analytical support and visualized business insights to ensure the streamline process of renewing current and enrolling new customers

Build and implement model enhancement process to continuously improve the forecast and reporting accuracy

Provide demand forecast for FOM and YTG process in selected LDCs each month

Develop, back test and implement new analytical models by leveraging advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to support different company initiatives and strategies as requested

Develop and provide summary presentations to support commercial operation and financial planning

Support internal and external auditing on models and analytics tools

Business Acumen:
Demonstrate the excellent analytical and modeling skills and knowledge and the ability to apply them to business situations for value creation and operational integrity

Understand the importance of Data Analytics to the profitability of the company. Be committed to continuous improvement through empowerment and management by data and able to make sound recommendations with limited data

Be able to prioritize and attend to critical details and accurately scope out length and difficulty of tasks and projects to meet business goals

Identify opportunities to meld existing data architecture with new ones as technology emerges and is adopted at the company

Open to new ideas and new techniques and leverage them to positively impact business decisions and empower end users with appropriate knowledge

Engagement:
Ability to establish effective work relationship with all levels of employees and customers

Build and lead informal cross-functional teams to develop modeling tools and analysis reports and present project status and results timely and accurately to appropriate audience

Demonstrate the ability to manage and mentor individuals. Must be self-motivated with minimal supervision required

Ability to gain alignment with different opinions and represent a common point of view across multiple stakeholders

Driving Results:
Build and foster productive, collaborative and inclusive work relationship to achieve personal and company goals

Demonstrate a solid sense of accountability and experience identifying and resolving issues independently

Plan engagement objectives and key deliverables; manage using analytics processes to mitigate risks in data, modeling, validation and delivery;

Assess, capture and translate issues and requirements into structured analytics use case, including rapid learning of industry dynamics and development of effective work stream plans

Drive efficiencies through continuous process improvement without implementing undue complexity

Be proactive and anticipate the information others need to accomplish objectives

Qualifications

Education, Certifications/Licenses:
Required:
Master’s degree in quantitative field (Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, etc.)

Preferred:
PhD in quantitative discipline from an academic institution is highly preferred

Related Work Experience:
Required:
5-10 years of applicable working experience in data analytics, preferably in the energy industry or finance industry

Minimum five years of experience involving modeling (regression, machine learning, validation)

Preferred:
Previous supervisory/management experience

Applicant may possess a combination of equivalent education and work experience.

Specific Skills & Knowledge:
Required:
Strong knowledge of database management systems such as Oracle, SQL Server, or Microsoft Access.

Extensive experience with statistical programming tools such as R, SPSS, SAS and Python

Must be able to demonstrate the ability to manage and mentor individuals. Must be self-motivated with minimal supervision required.

Strong business/financial acumen with a working knowledge and understanding of business operations and drivers.

Ability to conduct business analysis and design recommendations for presentation to senior leadership.

Demonstrates integrity and trust in all situations.

Ability to develop relationships and positively persuade others throughout the organization at all levels.

Preferred:
Creativity in solving unconventional problems, entrepreneurial drive to learn new skills and technologies

Demonstrated relationship management experience

Working knowledge of Power BI and Tableau software

Working Conditions/Physical Requirements:
The incumbent works in an office environment

Southern Company Gas provides for the energy needs of millions of U.S. households and businesses. As the largest natural gas-only distribution company in the United States, with more than 150 years of history behind us, we're working to ensure that Americans have access to an abundant, safely delivered supply of natural gas for decades to come. We offer our customers a wide range of energy services under one umbrella: seven regulated utilities as well as non-regulated businesses that offer retail, wholesale and storage services.

Southern Company (NYSE: SO) is a leading energy company serving 9 million customers through its subsidiaries as of Jan. 1, 2019. The company provides clean, safe, reliable and affordable energy through electric operating companies in three states, natural gas distribution companies in four states, a competitive generation company serving wholesale customers across America, a leading distributed energy infrastructure company, a fiber optics network and telecommunications services . Southern Company brands are known for excellent customer service, high reliability and affordable prices below the national average. For more than a century, we have been building the future of energy and developing the full portfolio of energy resources, including carbon-free nuclear, advanced carbon capture technologies, natural gas, renewables, energy efficiency and storage technology. Through an industry-leading commitment to innovation and a low-carbon future, Southern Company and its subsidiaries develop the customized energy solutions our customers and communities require to drive growth and prosperity. Our uncompromising values ensure we put the needs of those we serve at the center of everything we do and govern our business to the benefit of our world. Our corporate culture and hiring practices have been recognized nationally by the U.S. Department of Defense, G.I. Jobs magazine, DiversityInc, Black Enterprise, Forbes and the Women's Choice Award. To learn more, visit www.southerncompany.com.

Southern Company is an equal opportunity employer where an applicant's qualifications are considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other basis prohibited by law.

OVERVIEW:
The Company

Common Securitization Solutions (CSS) is seeking an experienced Manager, Enterprise Service Management to join our team of talented professionals in Bethesda, Maryland.

Established in 2014, CSS is a Joint Venture between Freddie Mac and Fannie Mae. We were established to develop and operate the Common Securitization Platform (CSP), to be utilized specifically by the Government –Sponsored Enterprises (GSEs), but architected in a manner adaptable for use by other participants in the secondary housing finance market.

The CSP is closely linked to FHFA’s Single Security or Uniform Mortgage Backed Security (UMBS) initiative. FHFA believes the transition to the new UMBS will lead to a more efficient, resilient, and liquid secondary mortgage market.

CSS, acting as an agent for both Enterprises, issues the UMBS, tracks performance of the UMBS, calculates monthly bond payments, generates security disclosure information for investor consumption and handles security tax reports and IRS filings. CSS performs similar functions for each Enterprise’s legacy securities. CSS is supporting monthly issuance of $100-150 Billion of UMBS and manages bond administration on over 1 million securities with an underlying unpaid principal balance of approximately $4.7 trillion.

CSS is based in Bethesda, MD and has a growing presence in Pasadena, CA. CSS has a talented and dedicated team of securities operations professionals and a best in class information technology organization that jointly run the largest security management platform in the United States. The CSP was developed on state-of-the-art cloud technologies and will continue to leverage these technologies to innovate the platform.

RESPONSIBILITIES :
Job Information

Responsible for strategic direction of key Enterprise Service Management (ESM) operational processes at CSS including Incident, Change and Problem Management to ensure that they are consistently deployed, executed, and continuously improved in alignment with business requirements. Provide strategic guidance to both business and technology stakeholders to improve CSS services and partner with risk and compliance organization to optimize the technology risk control environment.

Directly manage a team of analyst to provide day-to-day management of operational processes and to continuously monitor their execution to ensure business value is achieved and that compliance to all relevant risk controls are met. Facilitate and participate in all process governance functions and coordinate interactions across ESM processes to ensure consistent alignment to priorities and strategic objectives. Define, develop and leverage data analytics to manage service levels, key performance and risk indicators to optimize process performance.

Key Job Functions

Direct management of the analyst team performing process management duties
Provide oversight around new and existing processes, maintaining and improving process management policies and procedures in alignment with ITIL and other leading practice frameworks
Supervise maintenance and creation of new documentation pertaining to ESM policies, processes, and guidelines
Work with all process stakeholders to ensure to incorporate their feedback into the continuous improvement of the processes
Supervise front line controls testing and support for all process audits and support management in quarterly risk control assessments
Manage the develop of reports that communicate process performance and compliance and present/deliver to various levels of management
Document requirements as needed for process improvement initiatives and/or application enhancements
Participate in recurring and adhoc Enterprise Service Management governance meetings (e.g. Major Incident Reviews)
Supervise the delivery of communications and training to drive process adoption

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

Summary:
The Director, Strategic Partnerships responsibilities reside in three primary areas:.
Implementing and executing an ABB Market Consolidator and Managed Vision Care (MVC) strategy that secures meaningful new business opportunities by targeting market consolidators/MVC with a compelling suite of business solutions that can be customized to their needs. This role will identify, research and update/maintain a comprehensive list of all Market Consolidators and Managed Vision Care Providers. Following an Introductory meeting, this individual will lead a Needs-Based/Gap-Fill discussion with the target opportunity and work cross-functionally within the organization to put together and present a customized proposal that meets that target organization’s unique needs. Upon negotiation and acceptance of the proposal and formal agreement, this individual will collaborate with the Strategic Accounts team to implement the solution(s) and ensure a seamless transition to the go-forward account manager. Finally, this role will serve as a resource to the account manager from time to time to ensure that both parties are executing against the formal agreement and/or as ABB introduces new products and services.
As a build-out of ABB’s comprehensive supply chain solutions, the Director, Strategic Partnerships will lead supplier management that supports ABB’s Frame Strategy for inclusion as a critical consolidator/MVC value proposition. This role will identify, research and maintain a comprehensive list of the targeted Frame Suppliers critical to supporting the ABB Frame Strategy. Additionally this role will lead negotiations with the identified frame suppliers, resulting in direct agreements between ABB and the supplier, economically benefiting ABB. Finally, performance against the established agreements by both parties will be tracked and monitored.
Directly interface and coordinate ABB’s relationship and interaction with the major Optical Industry Organizations including the American Optometric Association, the Vision Council, and the National Association of Vision Care Plans

Essential Responsibilities include the following. Other duties and special projects may be assigned.

Develop, update and maintain a database of all Consolidator players in the optical space. The database will include key data points such as Size, Location List, Key Decision Maker(s), current ABB Business Relationship, etc.
Conduct in-depth research on target opportunities to help prepare for Introduction Meeting
Lead Needs-Based/Gap-Fill discussion with the target opportunities
Summarize and document outcomes of Needs-Based/Gap-Fill discussion
Participate in cross-functional efforts to prepare the formal proposal and present to target opportunities
Lead the implementation of agree upon program(s) with the target opportunities
Ensure a seamless transition to Strategic Account Management
Develop, update and maintain a database of critical Frame Suppliers to include key data points such as Size, Category, Brands, Key Decision Maker(s), etc.
Negotiate Supplier Agreements
Maintain Supplier Agreements and track performance against agreed upon standards and contractual obligations
Coordinate ABB activities with the AOA, Vision Council, NAVCP, and other leading industry organizations as needed

Supervisory Responsibilities: Director, Strategic Partnerships will be an Independent Contributor

QUALIFICATIONS
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in related field
5+ years of optical experience
Successful track record of developing, establishing and closing strategic partnerships in a competitive environment
Proven analytic skills, the ability to apply and interpret results, arrive at logical conclusions, and recommend solutions; inclusive of documentation and reporting
Strong financial background
Experience in building partnerships at senior management level
Proven negotiating skills, influencing abilities and vendor management experience
Self-motivated, results driven and problem-solving ability
Must have passion, curiosity, confidence and a bias for action
Strong influencing skills through verbal communication and high impact, data-driven presentations

Desired Qualifications
Master's Degree in one of these fields is preferred
Experience in working with/within a Private Equity consolidator is preferred

AAA Statement

Advanced Accelerator Applications, a Novartis company, is an innovative radiopharmaceutical company developing, producing and commercializing molecular nuclear medicine theragnostics. AAA offers professionals the opportunity to face new challenges and pursue a career in a fast growing, technology driven healthcare company. We are passionate about improving patient health by leading innovation in nuclear medicine. We are looking for people who share our commitment to help us achieve this goal. Advanced Accelerator Applications is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE).

Job Description

799 million. That’s how many lives are touched by Novartis products globally. And, while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives?

What you’ll bring to the role:
The business analytics leader is a key member of the AAA commercial team. In partnership with the brand marketing, sales leadership, finance, market access and other key stakeholders, the business analytics leader is responsible for using expert analytics to provide meaningful market insights that enable effective, data driven decision-making. The business analytics leader must also demonstrate the ability to work independently with a proactive approach to meet business needs and deadlines.

Provide franchise and brand specific analytics leadership: Become the key problem-solving partner to the relevant franchise and brands by establishing strong relationships with key business leaders and collaborating with them in understanding their unique business challenges. Translate the business needs into actionable analytic-focused initiatives to provide solutions and/or recommendations to enable the business excellence.Lead periodic ‘deep-dives’ for the BU: Lead the synthesis of insights/analytics on a periodic basis (e.g., quarterly, once in six months). Work with stakeholders on pulling together the story, ‘so-what’s, ‘what-next’. Syndicate with key stakeholders prior to discussion.Provide hands-on support to the BU: Provide hands-on support to the BU on a specific brand(s) or topics, ad hoc requests or targeted analysis. Play the role of a ‘player’ or a ‘doer’, not just an integrator/director of work from the team.Steward Insights and data spend (market research budget, data spend) for the BU: Maintain transparency into market research budgets, optimize deployment of resources, identify areas of improvement/productivity, and impact. Also prioritize data spend (current and requested), challenge areas for continuous improvement.Maintain full compliance with internal and external guidelines: Stay current on external and internal guidelines, develop training and approaches for cross function team (where needed) to understand and fully comply with compliance requirements. Collaborate with relevant interval departments and make sure to communicate information across all the key stakeholders.Work across Novartis: Partner with other Novartis commercial teams and business partners (e.g., on US cross-divisional initiatives, understanding how they generate/implement insights), departments (e.g., sourcing, Finance, Managed Markets); develop counselling and working relationships across departments and with Brand team members.Develop succinct executive communications on key metrics, KPI’s, campaign tracking and strategy impact (e.g., questions addressed, ideas generated, innovative tools, approaches; areas of impact)Develop dashboards in coordination with Product Management, Market Access and Sales leadership analyzing market performance, commercial activity, ROI metrics and Veeva analysis
At Advanced Accelerator Applications, we believe the answers are found when highly agile and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you are given opportunities to explore transformative innovation. Where you are empowered to push boundaries/create innovation/challenge assumptions by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.

Imagine what you could do at AAA! Start your career conversation today.
