POSITION PURPOSE
Directs and leads a team responsible for ongoing development and utilization of analytical insights and methodologies for all revenue cycle functions. Oversees the proper use of management and enterprise systems and data, leverage data analytics to systematically influence change for operational excellence, and ensures appropriate standards, controls, and measures are in place. Responsible for developing and maintaining relationships with internal and external stakeholders and providing regular interaction and collaboration with leaders, colleagues, and vendors to access current and future utilization of analytical tools and data to achieve top decile performance across Trinity Health. This position reports to the Vice President of Enterprise Revenue Cycle (RC) Services and Support.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Knows, understands, incorporates, and demonstrates the Trinity Health Mission, Vision, and Values in behaviors, practices, and decisions.

Serves as system-wide leader of data and analytics through direct ownership of Trinity Health System Office, regional PBS, and local RHM data analytics and reporting needs, including but not limited to:

On-going monitoring and trending of key operational, financial, and service line volume metrics;
On-demand strategic analysis and/or custom reports;
Predictive analytical models to proactively identify risks and opportunities, and
Compelling visualizations (e.g., dashboards, presentations, charts) to illustrate trends and performance.
Oversees research and maintains current knowledge of competitive dynamics and analytical models in the market.

Oversees data review, analysis, and audits, and collaborates with Revenue Excellence and vendor leadership to present findings, identify opportunities for improvements and/or cost savings, and pursue such improvements.

Directs development of analytical insights and methodologies for all revenue cycle functions, including Patient Access, Health Information Management, Patient Financial Services, and Reimbursement throughout Trinity Health.

Directs development of and continued relationships with key internal and external stakeholders to assess current and future utilization of analytical tools and data.

Leads collaboration with cross functional teams to promote and provide data-driven solutions.

Manages technology advancement initiatives, such as Robotic Process Automation (RPA).

Maintains Revenue Health Scorecard, standard reporting, and coordination for OEI database.

Manages, oversees, trains, mentors, and develops team of data scientists and data analysts.

Creates and maintains a culture supportive of personnel by fostering individual motivation, teamwork and high levels of performance and accountability utilizing a participative management style to ensure staff retention. Identifies action plans to improve the quality of services in a cost-efficient manner and facilitates plan implementation.

Maintains professional development and growth through journals, professional local, regional and national affiliations, continuing education programs, seminars, and workshops to keep abreast of trends in revenue cycle operations and healthcare in general:

Develops and implements an annual plan of personal and professional development.
Serves in a leadership role and promotes positive Human Resource Management skills by fostering teamwork between business and clinical stakeholders and by recruiting, retaining, training, mentoring, developing and managing staff to achieve strategic objectives.

Other duties as needed and assigned by the Vice President.

Maintains a working knowledge of applicable Federal, State, and local laws and regulations, Trinity Health’s Integrity and Compliance Program and Code of Conduct, as well as other policies and procedures in order to ensure adherence in a manner that reflects honest, ethical, and professional behavior.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Must possess a comprehensive knowledge of revenue cycle functions and systems, as normally obtained through a Bachelor’s degree in Business or Healthcare Administration, Mathematics, Statistics or a related technical field, and minimum of seven (7) years of experience within the area of Revenue Cycle/Management, specifically with experience managing revenue cycle data analytics and with direct oversight of robust data analytics at a multi-entity healthcare organization or large complex revenue cycle services or equivalent combination of education and experience. Master's degree preferred.

Managerial and supervisory experience with two (2) or more years leading a team of data scientists and or/analysts and a track record of being a people-focused manager.

Ability to interpret, draw conclusions, and summarize financial and operational information; exposure to senior management through delivery of business case analyses.

Expert level skills with MS Office Applications: Microsoft Excel, Access, and PowerPoint. Knowledge and experience with statistical software i.e., SAS, SPSS, MiniTab, etc., and the ability to apply a working knowledge of Structural Query Language (SQL) and/or relational databases

Mastery of data management systems, proficiency in predictive analytics, and knowledge of coding languages (e.g., excel-based Macro programming) preferred.

Exhibits superior management skills that emphasize team‑building and strong leadership with the ability to provide clear direction to the department.

Ability to create a culture supportive of personnel, fostering individual motivation, teamwork and high levels of performance and accountability utilizing a participative management style to ensure staff retention. Ability to identify action plans to improve the quality of services in a cost-efficient manner and facilitates plan implementation.

Ability to maintain professional development and growth through journals, professional local, regional and national affiliations, continuing education programs and seminars, and workshops to keep abreast of trends in revenue cycle operations and healthcare in general.

Demonstrated experience serving in a leadership role and promoting positive Human Resource Management skills, which includes fostering teamwork between business and clinical stakeholders, recruiting, retaining and managing a staff able to achieve strategic objective and providing staff training and mentoring.

Advanced analytical, evaluative and problem-solving skills to serve in an advisory role in inspiring and initiating new ideas, determining strategies in the absence of guidelines, fostering innovative approaches to situations/process/issues.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively identify, assess and facilitate improvements and resolution and to present advisory, persuasive and authoritative recommendation to all levels.

Demonstrated experience in the development, analysis, interpretation, and management of a variety of complex data sources.

Must demonstrate strong organizational skills leading a combination of direct and dotted‑line reporting relationships. Exhibits strong, collaborative leadership qualities that can bridge across multiple disciplines.

Must be able to operate effectively in a collaborative, shared responsibility environment

Must possess a personal presence that is characterized by a sense of honesty, integrity, and caring with the ability to inspire and motivate others to promote the philosophy, mission, vision, goals, and values of Trinity Health.

PHYSICAL AND MENTAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORKING CONDITIONS
This position operates in a typical office environment. The area is well lit, temperature controlled and free from hazards.

Incumbent communicates frequently, in person and over the phone, with people in all locations on product support issues.

Manual dexterity is needed in order to operate a keyboard. Hearing is needed for extensive telephone and in person communication.

The environment in which the incumbent will work requires the ability to concentrate, meet deadlines, work on several projects at the same time and adapt to interruptions.

Must be able to set and organize own work priorities and adapt to them as they change frequently. Must be able to work concurrently on a variety of tasks/projects in an environment that may be stressful with individuals having diverse personalities and work styles.

Must possess the ability to comply with Trinity Health policies and procedures.

About mGage:
mGage is a global mobile engagement provider with more than 15 years of mobile CRM (mCRM) experience. Our SaaS, cloud-based technology enables brands to intelligently personalize mobile communications for the omni-channel consumer.

Through a single campaign management tool and a robust set of open APIS, our best-in-class platform powers billions of mobile messages monthly across channels including SMS, Push, and social messaging apps. We serve 1,000+ enterprises and are a trusted connection for more than 500 carriers across the globe.

Do you have a passion for and a desire to shape the business insights into a competitive differentiator and elevate to the next level in business reporting? Desire a pivotal role in the transformation of BI & Analytics capability for a global business that is immersed in Microsoft’s full product and services catalog?

Microsoft Services

We are dedicated to delivering on Microsoft’s mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As one of the largest divisions inside Microsoft - with over 22,000 employees worldwide - the diverse team includes architects, consultants, support professionals, sales, and business leaders who serve customers in 191 countries and 46 languages. Simply put, we help customers get the most out of their technology investments. We are proud to be the face of Microsoft to many of our customers and partners. The power of that connection, in addition to understanding how they use our products, helps us deliver the voice of our customers back to our business groups to make our technology and Microsoft even better.

The Services Insights team is chartered to enable positive business outcomes by driving right behaviors and decisions through bold insights. This team understands the business goals, strategic drivers, success outcomes and associated behaviors, leading to the findings and insights needed to support the business outcomes. You will partner to meet a spectrum of demand across insights, analytics, decision-boards & scorecards.

Services Insights function endeavors to foster an insights-driven culture, to encourage and enable the entire organization to make more informed decisions through bold insights. Your passion and desire to define and enact the vision for insights & analytics will shape this function into a competitive differentiator. Come join a team where you can enable data insights that drives multi-billion-dollar business.

Business Analytics Initiatives Lead

We are looking for seasoned Analytics Lead who will combine business strategy & digital vision and programmatic execution to enable and accelerate the data-driven transformation of Services division across the business lifecycle. This role will spearhead several initiatives enabling business model transformation through structured changes to reporting ecosystem. It will be responsible to lead the next generation BI platform, architect the BI and analytics integration, synthesize, merge and transform the existing BI & reporting capabilities, partner with other engineering teams and organizations to enable a world class support experience and rich insights.

Responsibilities

RESPONSIBILITIES

Drive complex initiatives impacting reporting/analytics ecosystem
Lead thorough business impact assessment of each initiative and workstream therein, with the lens of unlocking business value through the modernization of data platforms/architecture and simplification of insights ecosystem
Enable all stakeholders and leaders on prioritizing on the initiatives/workstreams/features based on business continuity and business value dimensions. Partner with stakeholders to frame, shape and execute on the critical insights for business decisions
Engage broadly with multiple teams to frame, structure and prioritize business problems where insights can have the biggest impact
Synthesize, merge and transform the existing reporting/analytics capabilities with new experiences. Lead the next generation analytics experiences as a self-serve capability
Drive end to end planning for the prioritized workstreams, integrating changes across the fragmented data platforms and data models across the ecosystem
Lead the Design phase of workstreams and drive intentional simplification across reporting/analytics footprint
Drive the programmatic execution of prioritized workstreams in an agile manner. Ensure no business disruption through the execution and landing.
Create and manage standards, processes and procedures to ensure agile delivery and consistent operations
Setup and drive multi-tiered governance process across prioritized work efforts, bringing all the design/engineering leads together.
Govern and guide the vendor partner team(s), as necessary on the expertise, execution and partnership value for maximal impact
Setup ongoing triage and rules of engagement with insight teams, supporting various functions, to drive the ongoing evolution of business in a consistent manner with the initiative’s charter/scope
Review and connect on the prioritization of business needs for the teams to ensure a consistent funnel of requirements for operational data store, data lake, data mart, data pipelines and other assorted reporting/distribution services
Ensure consistent orchestration with groups outside of Services Insights, collaborating with Process, Tools, Landing, Engineering teams for aligned work effort
Drive the adoption with the intended personas to realize the business value
Qualifications

KEY QUALIFICATIONS:
12+ years of experience in managing and/or running large scale and complex programs with focus on BI & Analytics Experience building and operationalizing complex, large scale, highly available BI experiences
Experience in full development lifecycle of an Analytics platform
Strong experience to partner with design/architecture/engineering teams with a strong bias for data platforms and reporting ecosystem. Experience building and operationalizing complex, large scale, highly available BI experiences

job_information:
DATA & ANALYTICS AT MARS PETCARE

The Mars Petcare Segment consists of five Divisions: Pet Nutrition, Royal Canin, Mars Veterinary Health N. America, Mars Veterinary Health International & Diagnostics, and Kinship. Under this new organization of Petcare Product and Service brands, we launched our data strategy in 2018 with an objective to "Create a Better World for Pets by extending global leadership in Nutrition, Health and Services powered by data".

With the breadth and scale of our Petcare businesses we have unique and unrivalled data assets. The potential to create benefits for pets and sustainable competitive advantage is huge and we need to seize this opportunity now.

Our data assets consist of a variety of sources: veterinary data including appointment and invoice details as well as the medical histories and diagnostic details this provides, breed and disease marker data from our DNA diagnostics business (Wisdom Health), location and activity tracking data from our Whistle business, and we have sales data, consumer data, and valuable information about retailers, veterinarians, breeders and shelters from our nutrition business. We also have third party data providing us with product purchasing insights and the potential to develop deeper and broader views into Petcare shopping through collaboration and D2C engagement.

ROYAL CANIN: POWERED BY DATA

The Royal Canin division has a unique role to play in Mars Petcare, leveraging deep insights from the Vet Health Group and Kinship developing specific nutrition solutions to meet the unique needs of cats and dogs in their most sensitive moments. Royal Canin will be accretive to the segment by pushing the limits of health nutrition, and more specifically, by bringing tangible health benefits to cats and dogs through nutrition, in partnership with pet professionals and pet owners.

WHY JOIN US?

This is a game-changing leadership role in our business, and more broadly in the world of Data & Analytics. It is incredibly exciting for many different ways that the right candidates will truly be energized and passionate about.

Leading a totally new capability within our Division: opportunities with a relatively blank canvass, at a global scale in this space are rare. This is a unique chance to get this journey started, to set the direction, establish the ways of working and grow the talentIt is entrepreneurial, and it has the backing of a scale business with serious strategic ambition and leadership backingThe variety of data and spectrum of possibilities is immense and also unique. Most businesses have relatively narrow sector focus. Petcare is our scope and the data assets we can bring to bear are from genetics, medical records, activity tracking, nutrition consumption, shopping behavior, lifestyle, marketing response, digital behavior … across millions of individuals and many geographic markets. These assets together at scale have perhaps never been available like this anywhere else. This is a treasure-trove of data that will have your imagination racing. There are so many possibilities and having both a keen pioneering instinct as well as a focus on practical outcomes will be key to unlocking tangible benefits and valueWe are truly purpose driven and consumer-centric. We are powering our business with data to create a better world for pets. We are aiming for outcomes that improve pets lives and ours as pet parents too. Yes, we are also focused on sustaining and growing our business, as our 5 principles show, we see this mutuality as fundamental to how we operate
HOW YOU'LL CREATE A BETTER WORLD FOR PETS

We are searching for an experienced Data & Analytics leader to drive divisional efforts to be "Powered by Data" in the Royal Canin division of Mars Petcare. This role will articulate the strategic opportunities for data analytics, to develop and deliver the roadmap of use cases from Science to Marketing, to develop the resources and upskill the businesses, and to drive the data strategy all as a connected part of the Petcare ecosystem.

Reporting into our CFO with a dual reporting responsibility to the Global Petcare Data & Analytics leader, this role will engage stakeholders within Royal Canin to create and deliver the Data & Analytics strategy, the role will also provide connectivity with other Divisions for broader Ecosystem impact and benefit creation.

Responsibilities include:
Lead the "Powered By Data" Strategy, roadmap and implementation for Royal Canin

Engage Royal Canin leadership to define the strategic priorities for "Powered By Data" – identifying where our Pet and Pet Owner data and analytics capabilities can drive new levels of pet benefits and/or business performanceCreate the roadmap for implementation from analytics to activation in conjunction with the local teams implementing and in alignment with Ecosystem best practicesEnsure resourcing is aligned with the plan in cooperation with the global Petcare Data & Analytics team, and budget plans reconciled as appropriate across the businessAgree and monitor the KPIs and metrics for the Division strategy
Develop the Royal Canin Data & Analytic (D&A) resources and drive broader upskilling and change

Lead the design of the Royal Canin D&A organization and talent for global, regional and local market needs in partnership with P&O (People and Organization) and global D&A lead'Oversee the talent acquisition, development, rotation and retention in line with global talent standards and approaches, including hiring and leading the first rolesAlign talent needs for ecosystem initiatives with global D&A team, so they are able to supportPartner with P&O and Global D&A to drive Division up-skilling in Data Management and rollout of our Powered by Data plans, and continue to reinforce with relevant communications and appropriate access to data and toolsLead the development of Division data assets, privacy frameworks and data standards as part of the broader Petcare data strategyAppoint a Data Director for the Division to lead this area under your guidanceOversee the Division Data StrategyEnsure effective data provision to the Ecosystem solution and return flows of ecosystem data to benefit Division systems, applications and users. Ensure changes are managed effectivelyOversee data access rights and rules, and the processes to ensure appropriate access is maintainedContribute to consumer and pet privacy frameworks, terms, consents and approaches to ensure we position ourselves to empower consumers, to leverage effectively data for their advantage, to abide by all laws and relevant best practicesDrive Master Data Management collaboration and standards, and provide leadership in key areas of consumer- and pet-oriented data
Connect and collaborate effectively across Petcare to ensure our efforts are consistent, complementary and enable ecosystem benefits that are greater than the sum of the parts

Role model the ecosystem approach within the DivisionEnsure the Division is contributing to the ecosystem data asset and best practices and supporting the needs other divisions might have to power their businessesDevelop and champion Pet and Pet Parent centric approaches even where consumer choices or pet needs might prioritize a different Division's solution above yoursLead Division contribution to the broader Petcare strategies and governance of our Powered by Data efforts
WHO WE NEED TO CHART THE FUTURE OF PET CARE

We strive to hire people who are passionate about our mission: creating a better world for pets. For all of our roles, we look for candidates who exemplify our attributes through consistent behaviors. We believe what we do is just as important as how we do it, and we aim to hire people who care deeply about our Purpose and authentically live our Principles:

Quality ( https://my.mars.com/sites/essence-of-mars-site/SitePage/182507/the-five-principles )Responsibility ( https://my.mars.com/sites/essence-of-mars-site/SitePage/182508/the-five-principles )Mutuality ( https://my.mars.com/sites/essence-of-mars-site/SitePage/182509/the-five-principles )Efficiency ( https://my.mars.com/sites/essence-of-mars-site/SitePage/182510/the-five-principles )Freedom ( https://my.mars.com/sites/essence-of-mars-site/SitePage/182511/the-five-principles )
And for this role, we hope you have the following skills to knock it out of the dog park:

Deep and rich experience in working with data and deliver business-changing analytics, data science and marketing personalization15 years of experience in this space, with particular focus on working with consumer centric data for consumer-centric outcomesProven experience in creating and chairing meetings with senior stakeholdersStrong understanding of Data Protection and Privacy principles and practices including GDPRProven ability in working with technical teams on data, data science, advanced analytics, visualization and statistics to guide and lead them to impactful outcomesGreat inter-personal skills and insight story-telling capabilitiesProven ability to guide and partner with senior business leaders including Division and Segment Leadership teams, C-level technology leaders, Chief Privacy OfficerGreat at developing new relationships, driving positive change, and highly innovativeAbility to motivate and influence highly skilled professionals across geographies and business units to achieve major organizational goalsAbility to communicate complex subjects in a clear and simple waySuperior time management, planning, project management and organizational skillsStrong written and oral communication skills. Attention to detail is a mustWillingness to travel internationally as needed

job_title: Senior Data Warehouse Developer (South of Milwaukee)

job_information:
This exciting newly created role is responsible for developing and executing the market facing data and analytics vision for Cirium, bringing together a unique set of data assets to transform how the Aviation & Travel industry makes decisions. Working across a number of global teams, the VP of data & analytics will lead a world class data capability which considers commercial and business opportunities alongside internal approaches to delivery, building a vision for both today and the future. This involves 1) leading the commercial vision by which Cirium integrates all of its data to enable analytics across the portfolio and building a vibrant data science community that inspires the aviation market through the development of new analytics and data attributes, 2) ensuring Cirium data continues to deliver a market leading experience through building strong global data supply pipelines whilst effectively managing existing data sources 3) Ensuring data operations are optimally run across all datasets 4) Developing an inspiring, diverse and inclusive environment for all teams

Objectives:
Develop a world class data modelling & analytics vision and capability, represent that to the market, act as a mentor to the talented data science team and execute the implementation of the vision to ensure we accelerate commercially impactful innovation from the Cirium data.
Lead a large remote global Data and Analytics team (up to 70 dotted line reports)
Give strategic leadership, oversight & guidance considering business priorities, to the overall Cirium Data model, data architecture and reference data which drives solution innovation and enables delivery of new data attributes through algorithmic R&D and innovation.
Works with technology & data engineering to implement the data vision and develop the data catalogue, associated meta data and scalable mechanisms to develop new data attributes & analytics in partnership with product managers
Working across the business to understand commercial goals, develop the priorities for sourcing new data supply, build and lead a capability which effectively sources that information globally, working in deep collaboration with sales channel
Lead operationally effective data research teams and manage day to day ongoing data supply, whilst implementing the developing data needs of the foundational data defined by the customers and business in a quality/cost effective manner
Ensure all foundational and derived datasets and datapoints have clear ownership and backlogs which enable Cirium to execute against its commercial opportunities quickly
Ensure data policies adhere to relevant global regulations, working with RELX compliance guidance
One Cirium data team: Build excellent cross team and cross functional alignment which inspires our talented experts to deliver innovation for the market

Key Experience:
10+ years Leading and inspiring large, diverse global teams in a matrixed environment
10-15 years Developing and implementing Enterprise data strategies which enable business goals
Conversant and experienced in defining and implementing complex data concepts such as ontology management and data integration
Strong understanding of different data science approaches from statistics through to AI/ML
Enabling business performance through developing sustainable data strategies and roadmaps which balance feasibility, cost and revenue potential
Working knowledge of technology approaches as an enabler of data delivery data management and integration
Market/customer facing representation of data capabilities and analytics in a pre and post sales environment
Experience of delivering data through robust processes, such as six sigma, to meet required business metrics
Working effectively with stakeholders in Executive teams
Experience/awareness of Aviation/Travel datasets is preferred

This position is based in Portland, OR. Valid passport and ability to travel to the UK 4-6 times a year are required.

Cirium

We are an aviation, air travel data, and analytics company, and our mission is to help the movement of people and goods around the world. We keep the world in motion!

Our people are at the core of our company, and they are our priority. We have a shared set of values that focus on: putting the interests of our customers unmistakably first; being empowered by the trust we earn from each other and our customers; have a global vision for Cirium based on diversity, inclusion, and collaboration; and a passion for discovery to transform industries.

Our team delivers industry insights, built from decades of experience in the sector, enabling travel companies, aircraft manufacturers, airports, airlines, and financial institutions, among others, to make logical and informed decisions that shape the future of travel, growing revenues, and enhancing customer experiences.

We are a global company with 12 offices around the world and approximately 500 people in our team. Over 20 languages are spoken here, and our leaders may have grey or sometimes purple hair. Whatever your background, you are welcome to join us.

We are looking for dynamic and talented people that never stand still and can contribute to our continuous success.

A few extra facts:
Cirium is part of RELX PLC, a FTSE 100 global provider of information-based analytics and decision tools for professional and business customers with over 30,000 employees, 8,000 of which are technologists.
We partner with the industries core associations such as the International Airline Trade Association (IATA).
One of our offices is on the runway at Heathrow, and another has its own bar, The Spruce Goose.
We have great benefits (including two days of charitable activity per year).
Our consultancy team have the largest group of ISTAT Certified Appraisers and have been recognized as the Aircraft Appraiser of the Year, an Aviation 100 Award, seven times out of nine years.
Cirium and RBI are founding members of the Tech Talent Charter, committed to increasing the ratio of women and under-represented groups working in technology.

RBI is an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. If a qualified individual with a disability or disabled veteran needs a reasonable accommodation to use or access our online system, that individual should please contact 1.877.734.1938 or accommodations@relx.com.

Our Business Development Managers are responsible for executing an account-based go-to-market strategy, connecting with prospects and building new business & opportunities for the field sales teams. This role is a fantastic way to jump-start a career in field sales. Business Development Managers generate qualified opportunities for our sales organization through relevant and engaging go-to-market strategies including events, campaigns, social selling, and various prospecting activities in order to understand our prospect’s business needs and while consistently delivering the Logility value proposition.

Come join our top-notch team of Business Development professionals at a top-ranked global software company!

Responsibilities

Strategic Prospect Engagement & Planning

Strategize and develop new relationships in targeted industries and functions
Drive strategic dialogues to identify prospect’s business objectives, supply chain requirements & challenges
Build prospect’s confidence in Logility and our solutions
Deliver Logility value proposition and go-to-market messaging and assist field sales in the development of customer presentations and engagements, ensuring that there is a common understanding of alignment and next steps, and effectively articulate the value in using the Logility solutions
ABM strategy, support & execution
Liaise between marketing & sales
Collaborate with internal resources as necessary to develop opportunities
Participate in forums, conferences and industry events to identify & generate new opportunities
Best practice for event preparation, participation, execution and follow-up
Participate & contribute to weekly team calls
Proficiency in The Challenger Sales Methodology – leverage and incorporate into go-to-market messaging

Relationship & Opportunity Development

Demand Creation: Influencing and developing opportunities within target accounts for pipeline development
Actively manage group of assigned accounts to create new opportunities and pipeline
Follow the Business Development defined process and strategies to build strong pipeline of new/unexplored opportunities and achieve targeted new qualified opportunities
Maintain pipeline of new opportunities within the region to achieve targeted qualified opportunity quota
Focus: Identify, research & manage a dedicated set of targeted accounts to maintain focus and specialization in preparation for action
Identify & develop effective relationships with decision makers, influencers and key contacts within targeted customer organizations in respective region, to ensure maximum leverage for Logility interests
Research, collect & analyze target accounts financial information, critical business processes and/or system needs
Research, collect & analyze supply chain, and specific industry trends, challenges and investment areas
Provoke & Nurture: Business Development Managers present challenging messages, talk with multiple contacts on key ideas, and nurture the relationship over a period of time
Develop provocative messaging to then confidently communicate with various senior executives, seeking to challenge them to take action to improve results/ generate value
Use independent judgment to create, analyze and execute pre-packaged multi-part marketing and lead-generation programs
Leverage expertise and add significant credibility by working closely with presales and product management to develop opportunities
Engage: Business Development Managers engage accounts to start discussing a proposed sequence of next steps in the sales cycle. Even after ‘passing’ on the qualified opportunity to the field sales rep, the Business Development Manager continues to provide support as needed throughout the process to promote the opportunity through to close
Participate in the first portion of the sales cycle by driving engagement and building relationships with key decision makers and executives at assigned target accounts
Drive the customers through the entire opportunity development process with goal of having them engage on a sequence of actionable next steps with the sales team
Use independent judgment to qualify and validate inbound and outbound leads via the phone, web, email, corporate events and direct mail campaigns
Track relevant sales activities in the CRM system (e.g. call activity, lead qualification details, lead pipeline, opportunity pipeline) to aid in maintaining communications within sales, and track history of target accounts
Identify and qualify prospect’s project needs, budget, timelines, business issues and obstacles for transition to the appropriate sales individual to win the business
Use professional experience to overcome objections and effectively communicate Logility’s value propositions to key decision makers
Leverage skills to reach decision makers and schedule engagements via direct prospecting and cold calling
Communicate effectively with Sales management in-person, via phone, e-mail and regular updates in the CRM system

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree
Minimum 2 years business development, inside/outside sales w/ experience in technology services
Minimum 2 years Supply Chain experience a MUST
Self-driven, personable, outgoing, helpful, able to initiate conversation and communications in an engaging manner
Proven track record of exceptional pipeline development
Ability to work independently and creatively, without requiring specific direction
Experience of CRM software required (Salesforce, Microsoft or other)
Superior oral and written communication skills
Quarterly travel required
Candidates MUST be located in Europe.
Candidates MUST speak German and English fluently. Candidates fluent in French or Spanish also considered.

About Logility

Accelerating the digital supply chain from product concept to customer delivery, Logility helps companies seize new opportunities, sense and respond to changing market dynamics and more profitably manage their complex global businesses. Logility Voyager Solutions™ leverage an innovative blend of artificial intelligence (AI) and advanced analytics to automate planning, accelerate cycle times, increase precision, improve operating performance, break down business silos and deliver greater visibility. Logility’s Software-as-a-Service (SaaS)-based platform transforms sales and operations planning (S&OP) and integrated business planning (IBP) processes; demand, inventory and replenishment planning; global sourcing; quality and compliance management; product life cycle management; supply and inventory optimization; manufacturing planning and scheduling; and retail merchandise planning, assortment and allocation. Logility customers include Big Lots, Fender Musical Instruments, Husqvarna Group, Parker Hannifin, Verizon Wireless, and VF Corporation. Logility is a wholly owned subsidiary of American Software, Inc. (NASDAQ: AMSWA), named one of the 100 Most Trustworthy Companies in America by Forbes. To learn how Logility can help you make smarter decisions faster, visit www.logility.com.

Department Information

The Colorado Constitution, Article XII, Section 13 requires that applicants for state classified government jobs be residents of Colorado

About Us

If your goal is to build a career that makes a difference, consider joining the dedicated people of the Colorado Department of Human Services (CDHS). Our professionals strive to design and deliver high quality human and health services that improve the safety, independence, and well-being of the people of Colorado. In addition to a great location and rewarding and meaningful work, we offer excellent benefits:

Strong, secure, yet flexible retirement benefits including a PERA Defined Benefit Plan or PERA Defined Contribution Plan www.copera.org plus 401(k) and 457 plans

Medical and dental health plans

Employer supplemented Health Savings Account

Paid life insurance

Short- and long-term disability coverage

10 paid holidays per year plus vacation and sick leave

Discounted RTD EcoPass (Denver Metro locations)

BenefitHub state employee discount program

CafeWell employee wellness program

Excellent work-life programs, such as flexible schedules, training and more

Some positions may qualify for the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program. For more
information, go to https://www.colorado.gov/pacific/dhr/student-loan-forgiveness-programs

Our Culture & Environment

Our vision is that the people of Colorado will be safe, healthy, and prepared to achieve their greatest aspirations. Through our core values listed below, CDHS staff are committed to:

Making decisions with, and acting in the best interests of the people we serve, because Colorado's success depends on their well-being

Sharing information, seeking input, and explaining our actions because we value accountability and transparency

Managing our resources efficiently because we value stewardship

Promoting a positive work environment, and supporting and developing employees, because their performance is essential to Colorado's success

Meaningfully engaging our partners and the people we serve because we must work together to achieve the best outcomes

Committing to continuous learning because Coloradans deserve effective solutions today and forward-looking innovation for tomorrow

About the Unit
The Division of Child Welfare (DCW) provides a range of leadership, management and supervisory functions related to the administration of child welfare services to children, youth and families. DCW provides supervision for all child welfare programs in Colorado's 64 counties and delivers technical support, monitoring, program improvement, regulatory oversight, and other quality assurance functions.

DCW allocates and oversees approximately $450,000,000 in federal and state grants for county programs and operations. DCW develops, analyzes and implements legislative, budgetary and policy initiatives and recommendations related to public child welfare services in Colorado. DCW develops policy, rules, and agency administrative directives and procedures to be implemented at the county level. DCW provides program expertise and consultation to counties and researches, advances, and promotes best practices and evidence-informed programs. DCW manages and coordinates State efforts to maximize federal revenues and program requirements, including the Child and Family Services Review and Program Improvement Plan, Title VI-E, IV-B/Annual Progress and Service Report, and the federal reporting systems (AFCARS, NCANDS, and Colorado's automated case management system, TRAILS).

DCW is one of five divisions/units within the Office of Children, Youth and Families, which consists of the Divisions of Youth Services and Child Welfare, the Domestic Violence Program, Medical Oversight Unit, and the Juvenile Parole Board. The Office is under the oversight of the Director of the Office of Children, Youth, and Families, who report directly to the Executive Director of the Department of Human Services.

Description of Job

The Child Welfare Division welcomes your interest in the Trails Business Analyst position. This position oversees ongoing maintenance, new development and project prioritization of the Trails case management system and collaborates with both internal and external stakeholders. This position is recognized as a subject matter expert for user- and data-issues related to Trails Legacy and Modernization applications.

Responsibilities in this position include:
Oversee ongoing maintenance and new development within the Trails system
Act as liaison between Office of Information Technology, system vendors, and the Division of Child Welfare
Development projects including design, testing, and prioritization of new Trails functionality
Direct meetings with both internal and external stakeholders to gather requirements for new system functionality and requested upgrades and enhancements
Prepare agendas and facilitate discussions for the County Department Trails ModSquad (2x/week) meeting
Coordinate with supervisor to ensure all program workflow and regression testing tasks are organized and executed
Collect, record and validate system bugs and fixes
Assist members of the Trails product team and the Trails Modernization project team as needed
Primary liaison between system developers and county end-users
Use SQL, Crystal Reports, and related software and tools to extract, analyze, and interpret complex child welfare data from Trails
Evaluate methods and reporting logic/procedures used to obtain data to ensure validity, applicability, efficiency, accuracy, and evaluate sources of information to determine any limitations in terms of reliability or usability
Adapt statistical methods to solve specific analytical problems
Prepare data and conducts new data analysis
Conduct critical analysis, identifying patterns in the data and the underlying causes to changes in the data

Minimum Qualifications, Substitutions, Conditions of Employment & Appeal Rights

Education and Experience:
Three (3) years of high level professional experience in business intelligence, business writing, report writing, and data analysis including at least one (1) year of experience writing structured query languages (SQL) or other data query languages from relational databases (RDMS)

AND

Bachelor's degree in computer science, information management, economics, statistics, mathematics, Research and Methodology, sciences, engineers, business, psychology, sociology, political science or closely related field with minimum six credits of statistics or data analysis classes

Substitutions:
Additional appropriate experience will substitute for the degree requirement on a year-for-year basis. Additional appropriate education will substitute for the required experience on a year-for-year basis.

Preferred Qualifications:
Willingness to embrace and adapt to unexpected and varying work tasks
Experience or familiarity with Business or Operational Analytics
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to build professional relationships digitally and in-person
Experience learning or navigating complex information systems
Detailed and organized
Experience with Statewide Automated Child Welfare Information Systems (SACWIS) including Trails
Familiarity with Comprehensive Child Welfare Information Systems (CCWIS)
Experience or familiarity with Agile or Waterfall project management
Ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines

Conditions of Employment:
Ability to pass a standard background check
Travel - This position may require travel within the state of Colorado
Former State employees who were disciplinarily terminated or resigned in lieu of termination must disclose the information on the application and provide an explanation why the prior termination or resignation should not disqualify the applicant from the current position. Absent extraordinary circumstances, prior disciplinary termination or resignation in lieu of termination will disqualify the applicant from future State employment with CDHS.

APPEAL RIGHTS:
If you receive notice that you have been eliminated from consideration for the position, you may protest the action by filing an appeal with the State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director within 10 days from the date you receive notice of the elimination.

Also, if you wish to challenge the selection and comparative analysis process, you may file an appeal with the State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director within 10 days from the receipt of notice or knowledge of the action you are challenging.

Refer to Chapters 4 and 8 of the State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures, 4 CCR 801, for more information about the appeals process. The State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures are available at www.colorado.gov/spb.

A standard appeal form is available at: www.colorado.gov/spb. If you appeal, your appeal must be submitted in writing on the official appeal form, signed by you or your representative, and received at the following address within 10 days of your receipt of notice or knowledge of the action: Colorado State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director, Attn: Appeals Processing, 1525 Sherman Street, 4th Floor, Denver, CO 80203. Fax: 303-866-5038. Phone: 303-866-3300. The ten-day deadline and these appeal procedures also apply to all charges of discrimination.

Supplemental Information

How to Apply (PLEASE READ CAREFULLY)

Applicants are encouraged to attach a cover letter and resume to their application.

Please note that ONLY your State of Colorado job application will be reviewed during the initial screening; if you submit a resume and cover letter, they will be reviewed in later stages of the selection process. Therefore, it is paramount that you clearly describe all of your relevant experience on the application itself. Applications left blank or marked "SEE RESUME" will not be considered.

Your application will be reviewed against the minimum qualifications for the position. If your application demonstrates that you meet the minimum qualifications, you will be invited to the comparative analysis process, which is described below.

Note: Current and former employees (transfers, voluntary demotions and reinstatements) are required to apply and participate in the comparative analysis process.

Comparative Analysis Process

The comparative analysis process for this position may consist of a structured application review, and a structured interview depending on the number of qualified applicants.

Sr DevOps Architect/ Solutions Architect ( Job Number: 048687 )

Description
Join us in revolutionizing technology not only for a more than 100-year-old company, but for the banking industry at large. When you join Zions Bancorporation's Enterprise Technology and Operations division, you will be part of a huge movement to improve how customers bank through technology innovations the banking industry has never seen.

Zions Bancorporation is seeking an experienced DevOps Solution Architect with hands-on experience with CI/CD, Big Data and cloud platforms. This role will lead the growth and expansion of our Big Data and Container as a Service (CaaS) platforms by leveraging cloud services and the advancement of our data processing, AI, ML and Deep Learning capabilities. This person will be working closely with enterprise data analytics teams.

Responsibilities:
Provide leadership/vision on approaches of implementing a hybrid cloud Data Lake/Analytics platform strategy that includes containerization while supporting appropriate levels of governance.

Work with a team of architects to publish data architecture principles, best practices and emerging architecture and design patterns to assist technical teams in implementing optimal solutions.

Stay current on emerging DevOps, cloud, and data technologies to assist with building and refining current and target state architectures

Provide architectural leadership around best practices on how data is acquired, structured, stored, processed, delivered and visualized

Collaborate with business and IT teams to help design high-level data deliverables and ensure teams follow standards and architectural patterns throughout the project

Collaborate with data engineering, data science, enterprise architecture, information architecture, and general IT teams to build cloud and data driven solutions that provide real business value.

Listen and garner feedback from others to maximize successful solution design

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:
Engineering background, in either Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics or Software Engineering

Minimum of 2 years’ experience in using cloud and on-premise CI/CD solutions.

Minimum 6 years’ experience working in an environment focusing on data initiatives/projects

Software Development: 5+ years’ experience in software development leveraging a variety of languages such as Java, Python, Scala etc.

Minimum 3 years’ experience architecting solutions within a Big Data environment (preferably in the cloud)

Minimum 2 years’ experience designing, deploying and/or managing services in the Cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP)

Strong understanding of how data should be stored and organized with hybrid cloud platform to ensure efficient consumption.

Strong understanding of Cloud security, networking, storage, and resource policies.

Experience building/integrating both real-time and batch processing pipelines

Understands how to manage cloud resources economically with consideration to how solutions need to dynamically scale while being cost conscious.

Understands CI/CD methodologies and technologies.

Passionate about collaborating with engineering teams to drive innovative products

Excellent communication and presentation skills

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience within the financial industry with a strong understanding of financial data

2 years’ experience with one or more Cloud Data Warehouse platforms (e.g. Redshift, Snowflake, Azure SQL DW).

Familiarity with one or more SQL-on-Hadoop technologies (Hive, Impala, Dremio, Spark SQL, Presto).

Hands-on experience working with containers and container orchestration systems (e.g. Kubernetes, Docker)

Experience consuming serverless solutions like Azure Functions or AWS Lambda/Fargate

Cloud Microservices

Search analytics with ELK or other search platforms (e.g. Solr, Sphinx)

Good understanding of data storage formats (e.g. Parquet, Avro, Orc, Sequence File) with knowledge of when to use one over the other

Worked with continuous integration tools (Git, Jenkins, TFS, Maven, Nexus)

Strong foundation in at least one distributed processing framework like MapReduce, Spark or Flink.

NoSQL database experience (e.g. Key-Value, Document, Graph, Columnar)

Implemented data security using database and non-database technologies

Web services and service bus architectures

A combination of education and experience may meet requirements.

Job Summary

Comcast Business Advanced Analytics team is looking for an analytical expert with strong SQL skills who enjoys rolling up their sleeves working on solving complex business questions using large, complex real-world behavioral data. Your work will directly impact Comcast highly visible business decisions.

Employees at all levels are expected to:
Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your jobOwn the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and servicesKnow your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiencesWin as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideasBe an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customersDrive results and growthRespect and promote inclusion and diversityDo what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities
Primary Responsibilities:
Collaborates with both the analytic organization and its technology partners to define and publish complex data products.
Provides training to and acts as technical resource for team members.
Acts as a subject matter expert in one or more data subject areas such as sales, call center, network operation, and financial data.
Serves as a team leader within a work group or on cross-functional teams; accepts team lead stretch assignments. Presents results, recommendations, and business insights to broader senior leadership team.
Produces a variety of reports, graphs, summaries and presentations that convey analytic results and align with business needs.
Performs basic research on root cause of data anomalies that are uncovered through normal course of analysis.
Participates in defining business intelligence requirements for projects and data requests.
Participates in multiple enterprise wide projects by providing data analysis to project leaders.
Follows best practices and established policies in business intelligence data analysis, maintenance, and data quality.
Creates technical documentation (internal).
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Independently able to answer a question using the entirety of the data analysis pipeline, including data extraction, data cleaning, model and feature selection, model comparison, data visualization, and oral presentation.
Works closely with other business units to identify current processes and pain points, and then collaborates on innovative and practical solutions.
You are a data translator: you can take even the most complex algorithm and explain it clearly to a non-technical audience.
May serve as a team leader within a work group or on cross-functional teams. Mentors and trains junior team members.
Has experience working and joining together large, disparate data sets to uncover actionable insights.
Develops and deploys predictive models based on historical data that provide future predictions about customer behavior.
Able to produce a deep-dive analysis with limited direction and deliver insights that help the business understand the “why”.

Company Description

WHY YOU WANT TO WORK AT SPARK FOUNDRY

Let’s be honest –in this industry, sometimes we complicate things that should be simple. Here is the bottom line: we want YOU to join us if you are truly passionate about guiding marketers on how to best connect their brands with people. It doesn’t get much simpler than that. At Spark Foundry, we have a unique approach and provide the support to help you do this. In fact, our approach is built on creating the space for ideas that lead to smart work, and Spark Foundry is built to celebrate and develop YOUR ideas.

WHO WE ARE

Throughout our rich history, we’ve taken pride in our ongoing legacy of and commitment to constant evolution. It’s in our DNA to evolve. By melding the spirit of a startup and the soul of a powerhouse across our business, we aim to bring modern heat to brands – the kind of heat that arises at the intersection of startup and powerhouse; of data and content; of art and science; of old and new. Energy and innovation fuels our startup spirit, while the unrivalled marketplace clout, exclusive partnerships, and global practice capabilities we have at our disposal as a full-service Publicis Media agency deliver our powerhouse soul for our clients. We hope you’ll take a few moments to learn more about us, and to begin thinking about how we might put “the power of plus” to work for you. To learn more, visit www.sparkfoundryww.com

Job Description

The VP, Analytics & Insights is responsible for the application of data driven insights into the Publicis Media planning, investment and measurement process. Additionally, the role requires the candidate design and lead the implementation of modern measurement plans and roadmaps for Publicis Media clients. Analytics, Insights, Data, Technology and Innovation subject matter experts are a vital part of the client team. They function as expert technical points of escalation, analytical problem solvers and technical translators to internal account teams and clients. They provide ongoing strategic account direction/vision for technology, process and digital reporting/insights.

The successful candidate will have experience and expertise in how to intersect consulting skills, data, advanced analytics and marketing strategy to drive and improve clients’ business results
Deliver best-in-class media attribution roadmaps, including measuring video and digital multi-touch attribution
Manage client data ingestion for advanced attribution and modeling
Build strong relationships with internal stakeholders and groups, facilitating synergy between the Strategy and Investment functions that manage day-to-day client business
Build and develop relationships with client business directors and brand teams, ensuring that client and overall data proposition is relevant and aligns with strategy direction
Drive a culture of ‘always on’ data driven decision making that will institutionalize the use of consumer-driven analytics in media / marketing investment planning
Grow product delivery and agency revenue organically by cross selling and up selling value add analytical products across client divisions, markets & categories
Scope and direct advanced analytics projects to ensure that the deliverables are designed to answer valuable client and media team questions, and that timelines and scope are adhered to

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Applied Mathematics or related fields
Graduate degree in statistics, economics, econometrics or related disciplines is preferred
10+ years of experience consulting clients on making strategic investment decisions to improve business results
Strong functional understanding of contemporary marketing analytics, advertising technology and research techniques, as well as an innovative vision on how the practice should evolve to keep pace with the ever changing marketing environment
Strong understanding and experience with media buying, KPI development and technology practices during campaign planning and execution
Experience with media measurement tools including 3rd party ad serving, syndicated research and web analytics, such as iSpot, Netratings, Comscore, Doubleclick, Atlas, Omniture, Coremetrics, Google Analytics , etc. is preferred, but not required
Strong client management/consultative experience both presenting and resolving issues
Extensive experience leading and managing marketing technology projects from ideation through installation
Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills – demonstrated ability to mine data for relevant and actionable insights
Advanced written and verbal communication skills with ability to communicate/translate complex concepts to non-technical audience
Demonstrated experience with programmatic audience buying concepts and execution
Strong math and analytical skills
Advanced MS Office skills (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Experience with statistical modeling software (MATLAB, R, SAS, SPSS, Python) database tools (Amazon Web, SQL, MS Access, Excel PivotTables, MS Sql Server) and enterprise business intelligence tools such as Cognos, Business Objects,Tableau, or Datorama
Very good understanding of traditional and digital media data
Excellent project management skills
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail a must
Excellent presentation and communication skills
Client Environment

The candidate will be asked to collaborate as an extension of the clients' in-house media and analytics team, providing both consultative guidance to external stakeholders, as well as strong leadership for the internal Publicis Media Insights & Analytics team. This will require the ability to navigate client silos to drive integrated solutions, as well as the ability to foster collaboration with internal client teams. The candidate will need to embrace a sense of optimism and adaptability to meet the ever-changing demands of this fast-paced client.

Team Structure

The candidate will assume co-leadership of the Publicis Media Seattle DTAI team, consisting of 8-10 full-time employees and 2-3 direct reports.

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

THE SILVER AIR TEAM IS GROWING, AND WE ARE LOOKING FOR AMAZING PEOPLE TO GROW WITH US!

Silver Air is uniquely different than the rest. Our brand is built on the foundation of quality, transparency, advocacy, strong relationships and value for our clients. Our number one priority is supporting our people to deliver our customers an exceptional aviation experience. We are focused on quality over quantity in everything we do, and we are looking for a few of the "Best" in the business, not a lot of average.

POSITION SUMMARY

Silver Air is seeking a Fleet Analytics Specialist who will use their technical skills, industry understanding and knowledge to prepare and present information for ongoing decision making. The Fleet Analytics Specialist will spend most of their time extracting and translating raw data into meaningful information. Reporting to the VP of Business Development, the Fleet Analytics Specialist will work cross-functionality with other departments in the organization, with a heavy emphasis partnering with the maintenance team.

JOB FUNCTIONS

Responsible for providing the Business Development Department with maintenance status review and cost projections for potential Owner's aircraft, current Owner's aircraft, and exiting aircraft.
Responsible for reviewing the coverage, exclusions, and assessed value of new, transfer, and renewal maintenance program contracts of aircraft on Certificate and incoming aircraft.
Responsible for assisting the Business Development Department and the Director of Maintenance with the transition of aircraft entering and exiting Certificate, to include any associated program contracts and coverage.
Responsible for reviewing the specifications for potential management aircraft and providing a breakdown of maintenance coming due.
Responsible for all aircraft subscriptions and programs including transferring them under Silver Air management, including fleet discounts, logging all account numbers, contract details, contacts and tracking renewals.
Gathering information from maintenance vendors, subscriptions, programs & maintenance events to relay to aircraft owners.
Manage aircraft maintenance tracking and maintenance invoice tracking.
Maintain records of all aircraft Ops facts, major inspections, avionics, licenses, etc. for internal aircraft binders.
Track annual utilization and fuel burns
Assist owner services with answering questions for aircraft owners on maintenance events, subscriptions, and programs.
Gathering information from maintenance vendors, subscriptions, programs & maintenance events to relay to aircraft owners.
Manage aircraft maintenance tracking and maintenance invoice tracking.
Maintain records of all aircraft Ops facts, major inspections, avionics, licenses, etc. for internal aircraft binders.
Execute other duties and responsibilities as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS

Education/Experience:
Bachelor's Degree in Sales, Marketing, Business or equivalent in related field preferred
4+ years' sales experience
Some experience in aviation required

Skills/Knowledge/Behaviors:
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to network and foster relationships
Self-motivated and able to work independently in a fast-paced environment
High degree of integrity with the ability to handle confidential and, at times, highly sensitive matters in the appropriate manner
Ability to multitask and prioritize
Strong problem-solving abilities
Strong organizational skills
Strong time management and planning skills
Ability to travel at short notice

Functional & Technical Competencies:
Proficient in Microsoft applications including Excel, Word, and PowerPoint

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Must be able to see, hear, speak, and write clearly in order to communicate with employees, prospect, and/or customers.
Manual dexterity required

Company Culture:
Teamwork, culture, environment – Silver Air is driven to be the best in our industry – to change our industry by creating an environment where our team members can be their very best individually and collectively.

We've built a culture based on core values like teamwork, hard work, and empowerment. Silver Air fosters an environment of safety-first flight operations and service-first client relations. We believe our people are our greatest asset and we encourage contribution and collaboration. Utilizing the latest technologies interwoven with industry-leading business practices ensures an environment of peak productivity and professionalism.

About Us:
Silver Air has built a reputation for being the premium brand within the private jet community. We offer three products to support our client's needs: Aircraft management, Aircraft charter, and sales & acquisitions. All three products work synergistically with each other and give our customers end to end support for all their aviation needs. People and culture are everything at Silver Air, it's who we are and what we are about. We are a team of like-minded people, that all possess the Silver Air core values, and are driven to provide our clients with the best private aviation experience in the world.

Do you believe that data and analytics can drive better outcomes and help make better decisions?

Are you excited about helping protect companies from risks and perils in the age of cyber attacks and other new threats?

As the Cyber Risk Analytics Solutions Consultant at Guidewire you will be helping some of the largest property and insurance companies in North America. Guidewire Cyence Risk Analytics comprises data listening and risk analysis applications for understanding and modeling new and evolving P&C risks. Cyence Risk Analytics enables insurers and other industry participants to generate underwriting insights to understand risks precisely, develop new products, and take advantage of new opportunities to advance their business goals. During strategic events, you will articulate Guidewire's vision and craft, present complex solution demonstrations, and lead data-centric discussions.

A successful Sales Consultant works side-by-side with our prospects to find the right solution while making sure that our product management and engineering staff is kept abreast of product strengths and weaknesses. This position requires a rare blend of insurance industry knowledge, presentation skills, and a passion for data and modeling.

You will work in tandem with the sales executives to actively sell Guidewire's data and analytics software. Our compensation structure provides significant team bonus for achieving and exceeding objectives. Within the team bonus structure, we reserve a pool to reward extraordinary individual contribution.

You have flexibility to choose where you are located and can work remotely or based out of one of our Guidewire offices. Overnight travel for customer visits is required as needed. Guidewire promotes flexible working practices to strive for a work-life balance.

Key activities for the Sales Consultant include:
Supporting the sales team as an authority on the technical and deployment aspects of Guidewire solutions throughout the sales cycle
Serving as a pre-sales technical point-of-contact for customers
Responding to requests for information or proposal (product sections)
Partnering with clients' business and technical teams to identify business objectives and requirements
Identifying new platform requirements and working with Product Management to design solutions for those requirements
Occasionally representing Guidewire for speaking engagements at trade shows, conferences and industry meetings

Desired areas of expertise:
Domain experience in insurance (Cyber insurance in particular)
5+ years insurance software experience or underwriting experience
Strong experience with data modeling
General knowledge of modern enterprise software technologies
Experience presenting to senior customer executives
Proven ability to understand business process needs and to conceptualize which needs are satisfied through our software
Tech savvy and should learn quickly and adapt to the use of new tools

About Guidewire Cyence Risk Analytics

Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE) is a leading provider of software solutions to the global property-casualty (P&C) insurance industry, with over 380 customers, on six continents. Guidewire’s Cyence Risk Analytics helps insurers and other financial institutions to model new and evolving risks such as cyber. By combining internet-scale data listening, adaptive machine learning, and insurance risk modeling, Cyence insights that help P&C customers face new risks, take advantage of new opportunities, and develop new products. To learn more about Cyence, visit https://www.guidewire.com/products/cyence.

You will work closely with the Chief Product Officer and the rest of the product development team to analyze and understand customer needs, propose and recommend solutions with input from the team, and oversee execution to bring the best solution to life. Creative problem-solving skills, proactive collaboration with customers and teammates, data-driven mindset, passion for innovation through technology, and ability to iterate quickly and deliver value in our fast-paced, agile environment are keys for success in this role. Most importantly, you must exhibit our core values: integrity, excellence, accountability and grace.

Obsess about our customers; you will know our customers better than they know themselves
Take full ownership of designing, prototyping, developing and releasing best-in-class products that deliver massive value to customers at scale

Align with business partners and development teams on objectives around time to market, scope and effort; Manage delivery expectations with internal stakeholders and customers

Explore new technologies and think outside the box to constantly test new solutions and improve the product

Find yourself incessantly saying: customer is king, user experience, user stories, continuous improvement
Have a lot of fun, it's unavoidable
Work directly with and learn from the business, product and engineering leaders across the organization

The Labor Management Analyst position will generate, review and analyze Labor Management System (LMS) reports and provide feedback to facility leadership. This role will ultimately support leadership in improving facility utilization and performance to engineered labor standards. This position work will work within the Distribution warehouse environment and will report to General Manager.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Will lead and provide oversight and support the facility and any and all of the facilities dealings within the LMS, specifically Manhattan software.

Analyzes and interprets labor performance on an ongoing basis then effectively communicates findings and makes appropriate recommendations to site leadership and management.

Understand business specific reports and develop analytics to support labor execution and accountability.

Assists in delivering labor process improvement initiatives, adhering to schedule, budget, scope, and quality requirements.

Run, review, and distribute LMS reporting for site leadership.

Work with the Supervisors to ensure they are performing daily standards observations as well as baseline.

Reconcile previous day’s reports which identify errors and communicate to Supervisors for data correction.

Ensure that the supervisors are correctly entering beginning/ending shifts and indirect time.

Train new Supervisors on LMS functionality and teach the benefits of the LMS visibility to local teams as needed.

Solve any Level 1 Help Desk issues for local Operations teams.

Activate and deactivate users as necessary from LMS.

Review associates’ time clock activities to ensure accuracy

Update site Standard Operation Procedures (SOP) in area of labor functionality as needed

Requirements:
Associate’s degree in business administration, logistics, or related field Bachelor’s degree in business administration, finance, engineering, information technology, logistics preferred.

Three to five years of related working knowledge in distribution operations and/or 3PL experience

Past experience working in an LMS environment is preferred

Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) experience (Manhattan WMOS preferred)

Basic understanding of SQL preferred

MS Office – Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio, Project, Access.

Available off-hours as necessary to support the 24/7 facility

Ability to sit, stand and walk for up to 8 hours per day

Ability to work in environments with variable noise levels, lighting conditions and temperature variations and ability to access all areas of building without limitations.

Competencies:
Ability to work collaboratively and seamlessly as part of a cross functional team

Results and detail oriented with excellent analytical and decision making ability

Process driven with the ability to recommend and implement changes to improve processes and increase efficiency

Ability to lead and champion change

Strong interpersonal skills and ability to communicate with the floor associates, facility leadership & corporate LMS Team

Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities.

Ability to proactively and independently resolve and answer routine problems and questions

Monday through Friday 7:00 AM - 3:30 PM

Papertrail: Log aggregation and search for real-time troubleshooting

SolarWinds is looking for a Customer Success Manager to be a customer advocate, increase product adoption and minimize customer churn. This will require both direct interactions with customers as well as data driven analysis of customer behavior to predict churn and measure feature adoption. As the voice of the customer, you will provide valuable product feedback into the internal organizations to improve the customer experience.

Responsibilities:
Manage relationships with customers: Understand customers’ pain points, technical landscape, and business goals; identify how SolarWinds products can best meet their needs.
