Description:
Job Purpose
The Data Analytics Intern is a rising junior or senior who performs routine business analysis using various techniques, such as statistical analysis, explanatory and predictive modeling, and data mining. Researches best practices and supports developing the solutions and recommendations for the current business operations.

Data Analytics Internship Program Details
The Alliant Health Plans Data Analytics Internship Program provides an opportunity for undergraduates to sharpen their skills and gain experience solving real-life problems using data. Health insurers use data daily to guide decision-making, assess risk, price premiums, and steer strategy. Through the Internship Program, students learn and practice skills in data analytics, predictive modeling, and basic actuarial principles that apply data to real problems facing Alliant Health Plans. Interns will contribute to Alliant’s mission and help improve the health and well-being of the communities we serve. Interns will collaborate with seasoned full-time analysts and have opportunities to meet and learn from senior management. The Alliant Health Plans Data Analytics Internship Program is a paid, ten-week program, allowing as many as twelve interns to participate at a time. The program consists of classroom-based learning for technical skills and insurance concepts, group activities, participation in consulting meetings with stakeholders, teambuilding activities, biweekly book club meetings, and collaboration with peers on deliverables. Interns will present results of their projects to management and bring suggestions for actionable results from their study and work.

Interns will be divided into teams (no more than four on a team) to work on group projects, and also be given smaller, individual projects to complete. Types of projects interns will complete include:

Analysis of past claims to look for patternsCreation of models to predict future claimsAnalysis of authorization data to predict future claimsAssisting actuaries in rate filing developmentModeling impact of benefit designs on consumer purchasing behaviorModeling of provider contractsRisk Adjustment AnalysisProfitability analysis for particular disease statesAnalysis of clinical pathwaysProvider network analysisAnalysis of impact of regulatory or legislative changesEfficiency analysis of departmental processes or procedures
Skills interns will learn are:
SQL/ExcelBasic Actuarial PrinciplesModelingHealth Insurance ConceptsHealth Policy ConceptsFinancial statement analysisStrategic planning processes and inputs
For purposes of employment, interns are temporary, full-time paid employees of Health One Alliance and are held to the same standards as all other employees. .

Requirements:
Duties and Responsibilities

Works with variety of stakeholders to identify analytical needsAnalyzes claims and pharmacy data to identify trendsPerforms root cause analysis on emerging issuesDevelops models for evaluating decisionsTests hypotheses using credible statistical methodsProvides business data interpretationProduces ad hoc data and reportsAssists in developing or implementing systems to capture business operation informationOther duties as may be assignedRegular and predictable attendanceConsistently demonstrates compliance with HIPAA regulations, professional conduct, and ethical practice
Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Accounting, Mathematics, Computer Science, Business, or related field, completed or in processUnderstanding of statistical methods, with programming experience in R or SAS preferredBasic proficiency with SQLAdvanced Microsoft Excel skillsExcellent communication skills

Alexa is Amazon’s intelligent cloud-based voice recognition and natural language understanding virtual assistant. We’re building the speech and language solutions behind Amazon Alexa and other Amazon products and services. Come join our team and help improve the customer experience for the growing base of Alexa users!

As a Data Scientist in our Natural Understanding Central Analytics & Research Science team, you will be responsible for data-driven improvements and evaluation for our spoken language understanding models. You will be asked to design and create new customer value metrics impacting retention, satisfaction, engagement and to derive and describe customer segments to recommend opportunities to improve their Alexa experience. Your work will directly impact our customers in the form of products and services that make use of speech and language technology, particularly in developing predictive analytics models for user in continuously improving the Alexa experience for our customers.

You will:
Build and release predictive models for retention and engagement using large datasets of user conversational behaviors and system performance to recommend and track the impact of feature improvements over timeEnsure data quality throughout all stages of acquisition and processing, including such areas as data sourcing/collection, ground truth generation, normalization, and transformation.Collaborate with colleagues from science, engineering and business backgrounds.Present proposals and results to partner teams in a clear manner backed by data and coupled with actionable conclusionsDefine ML based techniques for sampling, judgment monitoring, A/B testing and efficient evaluationsWork with engineers to develop efficient data querying infrastructure for both offline and online use casesMaster’s degree or PhD in a relevant field (Computer Science, Computer or Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics or a related field)Experience diving into data to discover hidden patterns and of conducting error/deviation analysisAbility to develop experimental and analytic plans for data modeling processes, use of strong baselines, ability to accurately determine cause and effect relationsUnderstanding of relevant statistical measures such as confidence intervals, significance of error measurements, development and evaluation data sets, etc.Strong attention to detail and exceptional level of organizationProven ability to achieve results in a fast paced, highly collaborative, dynamic work environmentAbility to think creatively and solve problems

Are you currently seeking a challenging career opportunity to help develop sports analytics capabilities? At TMHCC, we have an exciting opportunity for a Sports Analytics Analyst in our corporate office in Houston, TX. In this role, you will use data to address key issues in the sports including player evaluation, sports science, and player development. A strong candidate will have significant work experience, a degree in a quantitative discipline, and a demonstrated ability to interact with a diverse set of stakeholders. We will prioritize applicants with deep knowledge of modern statistical techniques and the creativity to identify novel analytical directions. The position requires strong organization, communication, and leadership skills, and the ability to work on widely varying projects with distinct audiences. Candidates must have the ability and statistical range to draw insights from many different forms of sports data and a passion for improving sports decision-making.

Performance Objective:
Use data to tell a story. Make insights and recommendations to help acquire new customers and grow our revenue.
Use data analysis techniques to drive new product development and improve existing lines of business.
Perform large-scale data analysis and develop effective predictive and descriptive analysis including various machine learning techniques, time series, regression, optimization, deep learning, etc.
Use data visualizations to clearly and effectively aid key decision makers.
Interact with business partners to understand their goals and objectives, develop analytic requirements, provide answers to business questions, make recommendations, and join forces in driving business improvement and optimization.

Expectations:
Within the first 30 days, become familiar with TMHCC’s policies and procedures
Within the first 60 days, take ownership to develop text analytics capabilities

Qualifications:
BS/BA in quantitative field such Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.
Minimum of 1 year of sports analytics and data scientist experience
Familiarity with concepts such as predictive analysis, cloud computing, machine learning, artificial intelligence, & Bayesian analysis
Proficient with multiple statistical software packages and/or programming languages such as R, Python, SQL, Tableau, Shiny, etc.
Excellent communication skills including the ability to identify and communicate data driven insights
Prior consulting experience preferred
Sports knowledge to identify key questions and topics for analysis
Strong knowledge of sports league structures, rules, current trends, recent sports analytics research, and associated data

The Tokio Marine HCC Group of Companies offers a competitive salary and employee benefit package. We are a successful, dynamic organization experiencing rapid growth and are seeking energetic and confident individuals to join our team of professionals. The Tokio Marine HCC Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. Please visit www.tmhcc.com for more information about our companies.

Description:
Company Overview:
Chiasma is focused on improving the lives of patients who face challenges associated with their existing treatments for rare and serious chronic diseases. Employing its Transient Permeability Enhancer (TPE®) technology platform, Chiasma seeks to develop oral medications that are currently available only as injections. In July 2019, the Company reported positive top-line data from its completed Phase 3 clinical trial of its octreotide capsules product candidate, conditionally trade named MYCAPSSA, for the maintenance therapy of adult patients with acromegaly. In January 2020, the FDA accepted for review the resubmission of Chiasma’s New Drug Application seeking marketing approval for MYCAPSSA in the United States and assigned PDUFA action date of June 26, 2020. The Company is also currently conducting a Phase 3 multinational clinical study designed for EMA commercial approval. Chiasma is headquartered in Needham, MA with a wholly owned Israeli subsidiary.

SUMMARY
We are looking for an IT Business Partner for Data Analytics that will work with the Vice President, Information Technology in delivering Business Intelligence capabilities across the enterprise, with focus on Commercial data sets. This person will be the IT Partner to the business in the area of data analytics, working with the teams to better visualize the data feeds to understand how the business is performing.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Ownership of the BI portfolio related to stewardship and expansion of Veeva Nitro data warehouse, Veeva Network MDM, delivering BI capabilities via BI tools, such as SiSense, ThoughtSpot, Looker, Power BI, Tableau and/or MyInsights. Assist the Vice President, Information Technology in ensuring the BI capabilities and data architectures are understood, properly implemented, and administered effectivelyDeliver high-end dashboards/reports and work to build end-user competency such that they can self-serveEstablish strong relationships with function leaders to understand strategy and execution plansManage vendor relationships for application components of the architectureOversee monitoring of all relational database implementations in conjunction with the infrastructure team to ensure proper security, efficient utilization, allocation and user accessStay abreast of IT best practices around pharmaceutical and other industry technologies and their relevance to the companyDevelop and disseminate application training materials and support standards for the user community supportedOversee application development, implementation, and configuration through a structured project lifecycle methodology to successfully deliver internally developed, purchased/customized, and SaaS solutions related.
Requirements:
A forward-looking, run to the work, solution seeking mindsetAt least 4 years’ technical experience with demonstrated success as a business partner or report developerBachelor’s degree or equivalent requiredA forward-looking, run to the work, solution seeking mindsetBalances creativity with usabilityHands-on experience with several leading BI tools (ex. SiSense, ThoughtSpot, Looker, Tableau, Power BI, etc..).Strong PL/SQL skills: views, stored proceduresWorking knowledge of database and data warehouse system, with at least 3 years’ experienceWorking knowledge of integration and MDM platforms, with at least 2 years’ experience preferredWorking knowledge of HTML5, JavaScript, java, D3.jsWorking knowledge of business intelligence platforms, with at least 2 years’ experience developing data models, reports, and dashboardsExperience in complete life cycle management including but is not limited to: requirements gathering and documentation methodologies, application design, vendor selection, development methodologies and project tracking, source control and defect tracking, change management, release control, and documentation, deployment and trainingAnalytical skills and ability to link work priorities to business imperativesExcellent communication and influencing skills, with demonstrated ability to work collaboratively and effectively across the organizationExperience in a planning and control role (budget tracking, plan development, status reporting, etc.)Team leader with an ability to set specific measurable milestones and monitoring progress against these goals

Illuminate the Power of Your Data
Start. Stay. Grow. Clarity Insights has a diverse, talented team with an uncompromising, singular focus on client success. We share a vision: produce innovative, value-driven data and analytics solutions that transform the way businesses think about, organize and use data.

Leadership Development Program (LDP)
Clarity believes in the practice of hiring the best in the world and growing our leadership team from within our Leadership Development Program (LDP). After starting your career at Clarity, our LDP Consultants are rapidly integrated into an active, transparent, and progressive culture where they are encouraged to contribute directly to the future of Clarity. We support our Consultants by providing ongoing training, diverse networks, mentorship, and formal career planning

Clarity is hiring motivated and talented college graduates to join our team. As an Associate Consultant, you will embark on a challenging and rewarding career with one of the fastest growing professional services firm in the country, implementing cutting-edge business analytics solutions for Fortune 500 companies.

Join our team to collaborate and make a difference with world-class companies that are making a difference. The work we do carries significance for both our clients and ourselves.

Responsibilities
Develop data engineering and analytics applications using industry-leading technologies
Learn and apply new technologies and platforms (e.g. data visualization, MPP’s, cloud computing, predictive modeling) designed to answer our client’s biggest data challenges
Work with experienced teams to ensure application quality and scalability
Work with industry experts to analyze business and data requirements
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree required (Computer Science, Mathematics, Business Analytics or Engineering preferred)
0 to 3 years of experience
Highly analytical and demonstrated technical aptitude - some experience in coding
Desire to work in a highly technical environment
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Proven leadership and teamwork experience
Strong work ethic and entrepreneurial spirit
Ability to travel up to 100% nationally
Travel to the client on a weekly basis is required. Normal weekly schedule is M-TH travel to client location (U.S. based)
NOTE: We are only considering candidates interested in full-time employment who do not require Visa Sponsorship or transfers now or in the future.

Experience with the following a plus:
Structured Query Language (SQL)
Databases (Oracle, MS SQL Server, Netezza, Teradata, DB2)
Experience developing and scripting in Linux and Unix-like OS environments
Programming and Scripting (Java, C#, C/C++, Python, Perl, PHP, Fortran)
Data Integration Tools (Informatica, DataStage, Ab Initio, SISS)
Information Delivery Tools (MicroStrategy, Cognos, BOBJ, SSRS, SSAS)
Data Visualization Tools (Qlikview, Tableau)
Statistical and Analytics Tools and Platforms (SAS, R, Matlab, Mahout, NLTK, Bayesian Models)
Big Data Technologies (Hadoop, NoSQL)
Why Clarity Insights, Why Consulting and Why Now?
We don’t try to be everything to everybody all the time. We specialize in Data & Analytics and will remain a platform and tool agnostic company so you can grow technically throughout your career. It sounds ridiculous but you actually need to be 100% technical and 100% business with strategy because we don’t hire non-communicative robots who have a one size fits all approach. We often could speak to a CFO or Head of Underwriting about a business or finance problem, and based on the need for real-time and affordable scalability, we can outline – in terms they can understand – why they should think about a cloud solution for big data and analytics. If we step across to the DevOps lab, we can easily pick up on a conversation about Apache committers, OSF, full stack development, microservices, containers – you know – GEEK OUT. We’re not trying to boil the ocean. We want to grow from 400 people to 1700 people in 4 years to take the market an accessible set of consulting skills. We have a lot of fun together. Most people join here and stay here for the people. That said, we are popular so we do rack up some travel miles. I have a million things to share about why that may change and why that must stay the same for now, but here’s a suggestion – if you LOVE Cloud Computing for Big Data and/or Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, etc we should talk.

NOTE: We are only considering candidates interested in full-time employment who do not require Visa Sponsorship or transfers now or in the future.

Clarity Insights is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We believe in treating each employee and applicant for employment fairly and with dignity.

Pride and passion live in the heart of downtown Detroit at our iconic Chrysler House occupied by the Data, Analytics and Insights (DA&I) team at Fiat Chrysler Automobiles. We are an analytical activist organization focused on revenue maximization and cost efficiencies through data. Within DA&I, we leverage cutting edge technologies which allow us to deliver diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive analytical models addressed at problem statements within FCA's commercial functions. These are aimed at supporting the objectives and challenges being faced by the entity in a dynamic automotive marketplace. Significant challenges and opportunities await those who join us in this journey. We are on the threshold of the digital transformation and the industries revolution in personal transportation. We need great people who share our passions.

The Business Analyst role has the responsibility to partner with the business functions to develop a robust and repeatable solution addressing the problem statement and resulting use case it is intended to provide insight into. This includes requirements gathering, development of a rich understanding of the data required for the solution, facilitating the design of the deliverable, partnering with the data scientist and data engineering team members for the development of the solution, testing and implementation and support with the users, as well as overall project coordination. Project success is measured by the deliverable having a measurable, profound impact on the problem at hand and the success of the functions relying on deliverable provided.

You will work to ensure knowledge transfer and fostering change management with the functional groups that the model or solution was built for. The Business Analyst will need to develop a robust knowledge of the problem and the solution to have creditability in the knowledge transfer process to ensure a successful implementation and fostering change management.

This person will work within a matrix organization, reporting to the analytics manager, and will be assigned to a team to collaborate in its efforts to deliver analytical projects.

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, Operations Research, or in a quantitative field

5+ years of experience in an analytical role

Excellent quantitative and qualitative skills

Ability to evaluate processes and data objectively

Strong problem formulation, problem-solving and analysis skills

Success in implementing projects and driving change management

Ability to collaborate with external data partners, agencies, and vendors to assist with data collection, taxonomy, reporting

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in a brand management, production sales or media-focused environment

Our benefits reflects the FCA commitment to helping you reach your personal and professional goals. In addition to an environment that promotes career development, we offer benefits for a healthy lifestyle and a rewarding future, designed to take care of you and your family, in various stages of life.

As a global company, our employee packages will vary by country, customary norms and the legal entity into which you are hired.

**Description**

We are the world’s learning company with more than 24,000 employees operating in 70 countries. We combine world-class educational content and assessment, powered by services and technology, to enable more effective teaching and personalized learning at scale. We believe that wherever learning flourishes so do people.

We’re looking for an experienced Product Manager for the World Languages discipline to join a highly collaborative and fun team dedicated to the ruthless prioritization of customer value embedded in the products we build which capitalize on market opportunities, meet customer needs and deliver learner outcomes. The Commercial Product Manager for World Languages is accountable for delivering products and the portfolio using internal & external resources that meet market expectations and drives value for our customers and revenue for Pearson. We value teamwork, trust, flexibility, achievement, and solving difficult problems while having fun. The role reports to the Director Product Management: Humanities, Social Sciences, World Languages and English.

**What you’ll do**

+ Be the voice of the customer by working with colleagues in North America and around the world to support the identification, assessment and prioritization of market opportunities & customer pain points in World Languages to ensure focus on maximizing both commercial and learner outcomes

+ Contribute to the creation of new products and retire existing products as needed (using the product lifecycle methodology) with a hyper-focus on developing the MVP business case for the next generation digital product in World Languages

+ Use research, deep market insight of both your products and competitor products, digital experience and analytics to design product strategy and identify which customers to target/key jobs to be done.

+ Collaborate closely on projects with colleagues from the Content Strategy, Content Production, UX, Efficacy & Learning Research, as well as the Application and Platform Product Manage teams to create products that improve outcomes for learners while driving business value for Pearson.

+ Be accountable for the execution of customer experience for your products including implementation in the classroom/ institution and drive continuous improvement once products have been launched to optimize customer experience, adapt to specific geography/market segment requirements, respond to competitor actions and improve learner, and commercial outcomes.

Support achievement of the financial targets for your product(s) and understand the product P&L

**Qualifications**

**Key Requirements and Attributes**

Degree (or equivalent preferred)

Product management experience, including managing digital products

Good understanding of education and learning from a consumer viewpoint: ability to translate the winning product management strategies into actionable plans and products that drive value for customers and learners.

Great insight into the needs of different markets and the opportunities within them, capability to build execution around product strategies that serve multiple markets at once.

Deep comprehension of the digital world and ability to translate this into product realization, team mindset and ways of working.

High competence to balance strategic thinking with a focus on operational delivery.

Able to maintain a ruthless prioritization to deliver product roadmap, ensuring that the product stays on track to achieve its strategic objectives.

Strong delegation skills. Ability to communicate objectives to constituent teams, delegate assignments / deliverables appropriately and trust teams to deliver.

Preferably experienced in SAFe and agile product management methodologies as both a participant and leader

+ **Expertise** – You have and build a depth and breadth of expertise in your specialized field and can provide expertise to various stakeholders. You demonstrate knowledge of best practices within your area of specialism and how it integrates with related areas of the business.

+ **Accountability and Ownership** – You take ownership and accountability for targets and drive achievement through effective leadership, determination and motivation to succeed. You demonstrate sound judgement in assessing business risks and make decisions that balance a variety of factors taking into consideration set goals. You solve problems by using expertise to evaluate multiple sources of information, and creating innovative solutions to problems. You seek information from internal and external sources, prioritizing and analyzing potential solutions in complex or new situations.

+ **Building Partnerships** – You identify opportunities and take action to build strategic relationships between your area and other teams, departments and organizations to help achieve business goals. You develop relationships with senior leaders across the organization, customers and suppliers and negotiate internally also at senior levels regarding important issues within your own area.

+ **Communication and Collaboration** – You are able to clearly convey information and ideas through a variety of media to individuals and groups in a manner that engages the audience and helps them to understand as well as retain the message. You communicate points of view in a compelling way and with expertise across a wide range of projects as well as across internal & external clients. You have great collaboration skills and are able to work effectively across teams regardless of reporting lines.

+ **Aligning Performance for Success** – You lead through providing technical direction across the business and/or through a team and achieve the completion of substantial projects, operations or customer objectives. You have the ability to guide others in accomplishing work objectives; setting performance goals; achieving targets and creating a learning environment comes naturally to you. You recognize the impact of change on others, and lead through positive behavior and coaching.

+ **Analytical Skill and Learning Agility –** You take a systematic, structured view of situations, while staying focused on the execution and delivery. You have the capacity to be open to new ideas and comfortable exploring areas where there is ambiguity.

+ **Innovation –** Generating innovative solutions in work situations; out of the box approaches; trying different and novel ways to deal with challenges and focusing on opportunities to aid achievement of product delivery are reflected in your ways of working.

+ **Deliver Results –** You have a track record transforming strategy into executable action plans and also a great track record of successful achievement against set execution **.**

+ **Time Management & Organization –** You possess excellent organizational and time management skills, coupled with the proven ability to set priorities, manage deadlines as well as manage resources effectively and make data-driven decisions.

+ **Global Perspective –** You have experience operating in a global environment and are able to demonstrate international cultural agility.

+ **Brave –** Resilient and operating well under pressure and tight deadlines

+ **Accountable** – Has integrity, sets clear expectations and delivers what is promised

+ **Decent** – Does the right thing, represents Pearson’s values and promotes the company’s mission in day-to-day behavior, and is a trusted confidant to colleagues and external partners

+ **Imaginative** – Innovative, is solutions-orientated and unafraid to try new things, and uses insights to tell Pearson’s story in a compelling and simple fashion suited to the relevant audiences

Summary:
Somatus is on a mission to be the world's best provider of integrated care delivery for patients with or at risk of kidney disease. Our team cares deeply about our mission in service to our partners and patients and each team member demonstrates our core values of Authenticity, Collaboration, Empowerment, Innovation and Tenacity.

As the Vice President of Analytics and Reporting, you will oversee the data strategy, business intelligence, reporting and data engineering functions at Somatus and will be responsible for implementing core data capabilities and evangelizing a culture of data-driven decision-making at Somatus. As a senior leader, you will play a key role in the growth of the company and support data driven strategic initiatives working with health plans, nephrology groups, PCPs, hospitals and health systems, specialist groups and other healthcare organizations.

Essential Functions:
Build out and oversee all data infrastructure and processes, including data governance and data integrity approachesImplement data strategies and manage projects and resources. Identify and define both process and data improvements. Ensure compliance with deliverable reporting requirements by performing quality data audits and analysisLeads the work of functional area(s) through subordinate directors. Assists executives in defining organizational goals and strategic plans. Expert business knowledge with comprehensive understanding of the organization and functional area(s).Develop data-centric methodologies and analyses to support core business functionsServe as thought leader on data issues in strategic partnerships and via industry forums to solve key challenges facing the healthcare businessManage data insights and analytics, including building out operational dashboards in partnership with all business areasOwn all data analytics inclusive of performance and financial measurement and reportingEnable BI and Analytics technologies across Somatus various platformsDeliver insightful analysis and recommendations that can be acted upon by the organization at all levelsLead a team of analysts and data engineers that supports cross functional projects and ensuring timeliness and successful completionBuild in-depth knowledge of the business success drivers (including determining the KPIs that will help meet our forecasts) and deliver value added solutions that have a measurable impact on the businessFacilitate the establishment and execution of the data roadmap and strategic vision for information delivery and management; including the enterprise data warehouse, big data, BI & analytics, and data managementCreate the infrastructure to generate reports focused on performance around cost and utilization and create a culture of data driven operational excellenceDevelop new and support existing algorithms that identify gaps in care and integrate the care gap algorithms into business programs that support personal health care guidance, providers and care managers for improved population health.Promotes the importance of the advanced analytics and leverages analytical insights to enhance business results.Hires, trains, coaches, counsels, and evaluates performance of direct reports.Perform other duties as assigned.

Introduction:
For more than 40 years, East West Bank has served as a pathway to success. With over 125 locations across the U.S. and Greater China, we are the premier financial bridge between the East and West. Our teams of experienced, multi - cultural professionals help guide businesses and community members on both sides of the Pacific looking to explore new markets and create new opportunities, and our sustained growth and expertise in industries like real estate, entertainment and media, private equity and venture capital, and high-tech help build sustainable businesses and expand our employees' potential for career advancement.

Headquartered in California, East West Bank (Nasdaq: EWBC) is a top performing commercial bank with an exclusive focus on the U.S. and Greater China markets. With assets of $44.2 billion, we've ranked among the 30 largest banks in the United States. And since 2010, we have been recognized by Forbes as one of the top 15 best banks in America. With a strong foundation, and enterprising spirit and a commitment to absolute integrity, East West Bank gives people the confidence to reach further.

Overview:
East West Bank is seeking a Business Insights & Analytics Lead. The Business Insights & Analytics Lead will work closely with data engineering, product and marketing to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions. This role requires a strong knowledge of BI solutions, data analytics, data management and normalization, data modeling & visualization tools. This position will be responsible for unlocking, designing and implementing data solutions for business partners, utilizing data and tech solutions to drive insights and ultimately value for the company. This individual must function in a fast-paced environment, be adaptable to the many changing processes and technology related to the various data warehouse environments.

Responsibilities:
Provide strategic decision-making and prioritization for the business through analyzing data, identifying trends, and developing best practices
Measure the impact and outcome of business decisions on performance and create content for distribution to drive insights across the product, marketing and communication teams
Enforce best practices and alignment with engineering, product and marketing teams to promote operational excellence by challenging current practices and providing feedback on opportunities to improve
Respond to (or triage) any and all requests related to data with minimal guidance or oversight
Demonstrate initiative and strong attention to detail
Create presentations with analysis and insights for both technical and non-technical audiences

Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Business, Engineering, Analytics and/or other quantitative and technical fields, 4+ years of experience in analytics
Strong Excel and data management skills with knowledge of SQL and Python/R or other statistical programming language
Excellent communication skills, including business writing and presentations
Experience building dashboards using data visualization software (e.g., PowerBI, Tableau)
Experience manipulating large data sets through statistical software or other methods

Do you have a passion for and a desire to shape the business insights into a competitive differentiator and elevate to the next level in business reporting?
Desire a pivotal role in the transformation of BI & Analytics capability for a global business that is immersed in Microsoft’s full product and services catalog?

Microsoft Services

We are dedicated to delivering on Microsoft’s mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As one of the largest divisions inside Microsoft - with over 22,000 employees worldwide - the diverse team includes architects, consultants, support professionals, sales, and business leaders who serve customers in 191 countries and 46 languages. Simply put, we help customers get the most out of their technology investments. We are proud to be the face of Microsoft to many of our customers and partners. The power of that connection, in addition to understanding how they use our products, helps us deliver the voice of our customers back to our business groups to make our technology and Microsoft even better.

Services Insights team is chartered to enable positive business outcomes by driving right behaviors and decisions through bold insights. This team understands the business goals, strategic drivers, success outcomes and associated behaviors, leading to the findings and insights needed to support the business outcomes. You will partner to meet a spectrum of demand across insights, analytics, decision-boards & scorecards.

Services Insights function endeavors to foster an insights-driven culture, to encourage and enable the entire organization to make more informed decisions through bold insights. Your passion and desire to define and enact the vision for insights & analytics will shape this function into a competitive differentiator.

Come join a team where you can enable data insights that drives multi-billion-dollar business.

As Business Analytics Specialist you will contribute to continuing the team’s progress toward being a recognized hub for forward thinking in the field of advanced data analytics. The team consists of experts in statistical data analysis, machine learning, driver analysis, forecasting, big data technologies, fraud analytics, and clickstream analytics etc. We are looking for a talented and motivated analytics professional who can build predictive models and solve a wide variety of predictive analytics problems - all with the goal of providing actionable insights into business processes and customer experience. For the right individual, this job offers a gateway to an ocean of opportunities in the area of:

Using data to optimize sales opportunities, identify delivery issues and understand customers

Recommending delivery resources and optimization to ensure margin

Predicting revenue and developing insights to prevent loss

Ensuring customer satisfaction through timely deployment of resources and delivery of outcomes

Improving throughput and efficiency of support centers for incident management

Evaluating business impact of key strategic decisions through data-driven before/after analysis

Responsibilities

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Build and develop analytical models working alongside a strong team of Leads, Analysts, Architects to deliver priority outcomes in alignment with the strategic roadmap for Services
Engage broadly with teams to frame, structure and prioritize business problems where insights can have the biggest impact
Act as an evangelist and catalyst for BI & Analytics innovation
Manage the portfolio of work for BI & Analytics and partner with stakeholders on monthly governance
Partner on a robust, sustainable cloud first big data architecture, data lake, data mart and other assorted reporting/distribution services with the data engineering teams
Partner with data science team to apply advanced analytics concepts towards rich and bold insights
Attract, develop, retain talent and improving productivity, efficiency and effectiveness of the team and / or business.
Create and manage standards, processes and procedures to ensure agile delivery and consistent operations.
Qualifications

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
7+ years of mixed relevant experience in delivering Advanced Analytics and BI solutions for key business problems for large businesses

ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:
Statistics - Basic probability distributions, estimation techniques, confidence intervals, hypothesis testing (z-test, t-test, ANOVA etc.).
Understanding of Maximum Likelihood Estimation is a plus
Machine Learning - Regression, Classification, Clustering, Data preparation (outlier treatment, missing value imputations etc.),
Feature engineering (polynomial, log and other functional transformations), Feature selection, Time series, Text Mining & Model interpretation through Decision Trees, Linear Models
Programming - Hands-on in R/Python and experience in using different Statistics/ML libraries available (rpart, c5.0, randomforests, GLM, GBM, Scikit-learn etc.)
Data engineering - Hands-on in SQL and experienced in working with RDBMS for data extraction and data read/write.
Understanding of Data Warehouse fundamentals (architectural layers & schema types) is a plus.
Familiarity with big data technologies (COSMOS, Hadoop, MapReduce)
Data Visualization - Experience in one or more Data Visualization tools (MS Power BI, Tableau etc.)

The candidate must also have:
Bachelors/Masters in Statistics/Econometrics/Computer Science or related discipline is preferable, but a candidate with MS combined with strong analytical background in problems relating to Big Data and Analytics is also acceptable.

Excellent written and oral communication skills, particularly the ability to synthesize complex issues/scenarios into easy-to-understand concepts.

An attention to detail with self-discipline and a drive for results.

Demonstrated ability to work in ambiguous situations and across organizational boundaries.

Onsite location: Sammamish, WA

Overview:
Practising Law Institute (“PLI”), an innovative leader in legal education programs and services, is searching for a Business Analytics Intern to join PLI for an 8-week internship program this summer. PLI’s client base includes a large array of prestigious law firms, corporations and government agencies.

This is an exciting opportunity for students to gain professional business experience in their field of interest in a supportive learning environment.

INTERNSHIP PROGRAM SUMMARY

The internship program will begin on June 8th and end on July 31st in our midtown Manhattan office. This is a paid internship at the rate of $16 per hour. A typical work schedule will be 9:00 am to 5:00 pm (including an unpaid one-hour lunch break), Monday through Thursday, and 9:00 am to 3:00 pm on Friday. PLI closes early on Friday during the summer months.

Our internship program will offer students the opportunity to learn, perform tasks and take part in projects that relate to their academic majors.

Below is a brief description of the departments seeking interns and corresponding internship assignment:

Business Analytics

The Business Analytics function supports the Executive Leadership team by reviewing data, assessing workflows across departments, recommending process improvements and business strategies based on analysis.

Internship Assignment:
Responsibilities include market research, data analysis projects for business cases, and financial analysis.
This intern will be working with PLI data in Excel to categorize information and formulate templates and outputs that will help inform business decisions.
A student with interest in data science or data analysis would be most successful in this role. Exposure to data modeling tools a plus.

Qualifications and Requirements:
Qualified interns fall under one of the following categories:
Rising senior college undergraduate
2019 college graduate from an accredited undergraduate program
Current law school student
2019 or recent law school graduate
Must be available to participate in the program the full 8 weeks, beginning June 8th and ending July 31st.
Must have the ability to work Monday – Thursday from 9 or 9:30 am – 5 or 5:30 pm plus shorter day on Friday. Some intern assignments may have varying schedules.
Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Suite. Some intern assignments will require familiarity with department-specific software.
Strong Excel skills using formulas and pivot tables are required.
Must have the ability to provide recommendation letters from school and/or previous employer.
Will be required to provide documentation of academic record displaying a GPA of 3.2 or higher.

Qualified internship applicants may submit resume and cover letter online. Only candidates who provide a cover letter which includes identifying a department(s) of interest will be considered.

ABOUT PLI

For 85 years PLI has been considered the “gold standard” as a leader in continuing legal and professional business training education. PLI presents over 400 live programs each year in state-of-the-art conference centers throughout the U.S. and abroad. Recent international seminar locations include London and Hong Kong.

In addition to hosting innovative live programs, PLI streams webcasts and offers on demand programs for thousands of participants each day. PLI publishes a variety of treatises, answer books, course handbooks and has an award-winning online research platform, PLI Plus. PLI offers the nation’s leading preparation course for the Patent Office’s Registration Exam and provides SEC compliance and accounting training through its SEC Institute. The organization also develops unique, engaging ways of learning through its Interactive Learning Center.

Through its mission as a nonprofit organization, PLI is deeply committed to the pro bono community and public interest organizations.

Due to the volume of applications we will not be able to respond to all candidates who apply.

Practising Law Institute is an equal opportunity employer. More information about PLI may be found on our website www.pli.edu. Thank you for your interest in working at PLI.

EEO Statement:PLI is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any candidate based on age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, creed, national origin, marital status, disability, citizenship or veteran status.

New York City-based company acKnowledge Digital is seeking a Web Analyst to join our team.

Who we are

Founded in 2012, acKnowledge (AKDM) is a New York City-based Digital Marketing agency that helps businesses grow and brands evolve with a strategy-first approach to digital. We provide value to our customers through elite service, measured intelligence, and accountable strategy & execution. The services we provide span across each touchpoint in the digital marketing ecosystem. No two strategies are the same. We develop marketing plans and research that are as unique as a signature and align properly with a brand’s DNA.

AKDM’s extensive offering spans SEO, Digital Strategy, Social Media, Display Planning, Analytics & Insights, SEM/PPC, Mobile Marketing, Business Intelligence, & Projection Modeling.

Our roster includes a great mix of well-known brands and innovative startups such as: A&E Networks, Tablet Hotels, GIPHY, Opening Ceremony, Frederick’s of Hollywood, Veronica Beard, Wusthof, RELATED and many more.

About The Role

As a Web Analyst, designing and implementing tracking solutions doesn’t intimidate you. You thrive in this role when you’re able to track across a wide variety of platforms, collaborate with teams across disciplines, and help establish a data-driven culture of measurement. Your passion for figuring out better ways to track key user actions that directly impact ROI provides the basis for many crucial downstream processes; complex analysis, data products, and measurement of digital marketing performance.

Responsibilities
Develop tracking solutions across web, mobile apps, and offline sources using Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Adobe Analytics, Dynamic Tag Manager, and more.
Partner with client engineering teams to audit tracking implementations, troubleshoot tracking issues, and define quality assurance tests ensuring business requirements are met while capturing accurate data.
Collaborate closely with AKDM’s digital marketing teams to enhance tracking capabilities using your knowledge of what you can track, how you can track it, and why we should track it.
Build and maintain a repository of high quality technical deliverables, methodologies and business development documents.
Assess and recommend the technical feasibility for potential new tools.
Competencies
Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Marketing, Information Technology or other related quantitative fields and experience.
2+ years of analytics implementation with an understanding of the digital marketing or ad tech space.
HTML, CSS and JavaScript skills, including familiarity with a few different frameworks.
Experience with Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Facebook Events, Google Floodlights, and other popular analytics and marketing tracking platforms, including how to setup a new implementation, how they are similar, and how they are radically different.
Proven critical thinking, analytical problem-solving skills, and attention to detail.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to bridge the gap between technology and business management.
Passionate about web technologies (data layers, HTTP protocol, DevTools, etc.) and big data.
Ready to be part of a tight-knit, growing team; ambitious, can work independently as well as collaboratively and possess interpersonal skills.
Bonus Skills
Experience with front-end development, including customizing templates, for popular content management platforms such as WordPress, Shopify, Magento, Drupal, and more.
Experience with one or more data visualization tools, including Tableau, PowerBI, or Data Studio.

National Banking Product Manager - Data and Analytics(Job Number: 200165)

The Wholesale Product Manager – Data and Analytics will define and execute on a data and analytics vision and strategy by creating a suite of capabilities aligned with both Wholesale and Line of Business (LOB) priorities. This highly collaborative role will lead a cross-functional team made up of line of business, enterprise, technology and end users and be responsible for articulating and translating a Wholesale vision into strategy, tactics, and executable solutions to customers through competitive and market analysis, business engagement, and project prioritization. This role requires a passion for data and the desire to create value for both internal and external customers by transforming data into usable information. The successful candidate will design and execute value-added capabilities that create competitive advantages while gaining insights for internal and external customers through predictive analytics.

Major Areas of Accountability
Ensures Wholesale and LOB strategies are aligned and being executed through product roadmaps.
Identifies and tracks Key Performance Metrics; accountable to ensure that KPIs are delivering the necessary business value.
Ensures outcomes on the roadmap fit within capacity constraints, are prioritized, and sequenced in order to maximize value to the customer.
Accountable to ensure product teams understand the business outcomes needed, and that business outcomes are tied to a broader business goal or objective.
Leads cross-functional team to manage and prioritize product roadmap and releases across multiple products.
Analyzes and merges data across multiple sources to ensure alignment with business definitions.
Responsible for relationship with Risk, Compliance and Credit in support of their data requests across the Wholesale businesses.
Translates data to insights; utilizes data to improve the customer experience and customer-facing processes.
Collaborates across product teams to develop and roll out operational plans.
Resolves conflicts in a constructive manner when they arise.
Researches and identifies industry best practices and trends to increase effectiveness.
Acquires, maintains and applies advanced knowledge of the business, its products and processes.

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience
7+ years relevant business experience, banking or financial services domain knowledge preferred.
Passion and understanding of new technology and trends including data science, AI, Modeling, etc.
Strong communicator including the ability to communicate to all levels of seniority and disciplines within the organization.
Proven success developing business cases, roadmaps, product execution strategies.
Experience managing and leading cross functional teams.
Build your career with TCF
You have room to grow at TCF. We promote from within whenever possible. You can expand your career in the financial services industry through our network of operations: retail and commercial banking, inventory and equipment financing, and corporate services.

Established in 1923, TCF has maintained a strong foundation. TCF has over 340 branches in Minnesota, Illinois, Michigan, Colorado, Wisconsin, Indiana, Arizona and South Dakota, providing retail and commercial banking services. TCF also conducts commercial leasing, indirect auto finance, and equipment finance business in all 50 states, and commercial inventory finance business in all 50 states and Canada.

Build a better community with TCF
We are helping make life better in the communities we serve, and we encourage our team members to do so as well. We offer free financial education for teens and adults. Our foundation contributes more than $3 million annually, with preference for organizations where our team members volunteer. We match team members’ contributions to qualified Organizations and we match volunteers with organizations that need the time and talents our team members can provide.

Our Benefits
TCF encourages open employee communications and promotes from within whenever possible. We offer competitive pay, a comprehensive benefits plan, and opportunities for career advancement. For more details on our benefits, click on the Employee Benefits link on our career page.

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, or other status protected by applicable law. TCF is proud to be an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer. Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

DMI (Digital Management, LLC.), the world’s first end-to-end mobility company, combines all the skills and services necessary to deliver mobile enterprise solutions. Built to reinvent business through mobility, DMI has expertise in mobile strategy, UX, web, and app development, omni-channel commerce, brand and marketing, IoT and big data analytics, and secure device and app management. The company’s unique, integrated approach to mobility has resulted in dramatic growth as well as an expanding client base, which includes hundreds of Fortune 1000 commercial clients and all fifteen U.S. Federal Departments. DMI is headquartered in Bethesda, MD, with satellite offices around the world. The company was named one of the 2018 Top Workplaces in the Washington, DC area by The Washington Post and received Inc. Magazine’s Hire Power Award as one of the top 100 Private Job Creators in the US. Additional information is available at www.dminc.com and on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.

Position Overview

The Healthcare Data Analyst supports the IT department and will work side by side with the production support team, development team, and solution consulting team to optimize and/or develop automated processes for importing healthcare industry claims and charge data, analyzing large data sets to optimize client experience and auditing for data integrity. The Healthcare Data Analyst will also be responsible for developing detailed report analysis and communicating analytic insights to management, consulting teams, and product teams. This position takes direction from the Data Management Manager.

Duties and Responsibilities

Extract, load and reconcile large data sets from multiple system platforms and sources.
Review data to determine operational impacts, trends and areas for improvement.
Utilize SQL or other advanced analytic tools to perform data extract and query functions.
Identify and troubleshoot data anomalies and irregularities.
Perform data quality audits.
Perform quantitative and/or qualitative data analysis and share results with internal and external customers.
Develop, collect and document business requirements for reporting and analysis initiatives with internal and external customers.
Ability to guide and communicate effectively with client IT to gather large data sets for importing.
Experience with developing, maintaining, monitoring, tuning/optimizing and troubleshooting SQL queries.
Become a data subject matter expert(SME) and understand various sources and applications of Vitalware data.
Establish best practices for data workflows.
Design, implement and enhance ETL processes.
Excellent logical and problem-solving abilities.
Monitor and troubleshoot data implementation issues through to resolution.
Guide our efforts in all areas of data performance and reliability.

Qualifications and Experience Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent preferred.
4+ years of experience in an analytic role.
Proficiency in managing electronic medical records.
Model data using MS Excel, SQL, and/or other data analytical tools.
Experience with TSQL query language and stored procedures, jobs, etc.
Knowledge of ANSI X12 837 claim files highly desired.
Knowledge of healthcare claims data formats and concepts highly desired.

Skill and Ability Requirements

Enthusiastic about sharing knowledge and experience.
Passionate about learning.
Excellent communication – written and verbal.
Strong presentation, interpersonal and consultative skills a must
Ability to manage multiple projects/tasks simultaneously.
Good judgment and decision-making skills.
Maintains a positive and results-oriented attitude.
Must be well organized, accurate and attentive to detail.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical people.
Be proactive in keeping your skills up to date with the latest technologies.
Be thorough about all tasks and conduct tests as needed to ensure the job is well done.
Ability to work well under pressure and in a collaborative team environment.

UDR, Inc. is now hiring a Business Data Analyst to join our team at our corporate office in Highlands Ranch, CO.

GENERAL SUMMARY OF DUTIES: Responsible for the maintenance and ongoing data integrity of operational (Ops) data used for recurring and ad hoc analytics, metrics, reports and system processes. Provide ongoing review and/or investigation, analysis and ownership of primary data sources. Position will troubleshoot, identify and resolve data anomalies and implement strategic solutions. Provide testing support for IT projects as needed or requested.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
1. Monitor and resolve data related support requests from business users.

2. Pull and analyze data. Present data in a usable format to provide useful solutions-oriented information for key business decisions.

3. Partners with various internal customers throughout the business and provide ad-hoc query support.

4. Provide testing of queries and reports - including researching issues to determine the root cause.

5. Prepare documentation to define system requirements, procedures, or customer communication to resolve issues impacting core work functions and customer group supported.

6. Participate in process review and improvement of team functions and processes.

7. Gather and define business requirements; conduct research projects and report and disseminate the results of those projects.

8. Support financial due diligence effort as it relates to the assigned project or research.

9. Demonstrate high level of customer service with customer contacts and internal team.

10. Maintain recurring daily/weekly/monthly reports and processes for the Operations team including (but not limited to) maintenance of the bi-monthly Renewal process, reporting for Corporate Housing, OneSite/YieldStar Amenities, Pet Analysis, Associate Leases, Market Rent, and Quarterly Transaction Activity for audit as examples.

11. Work with IT to productionalize reports and data exports used by the Ops team.

12. Identify areas where data can be used to improve business activity.

13. Develop requirements for data, reporting, views and tools.

14. Provide quality assurance of imported data.

15. Develop methods to assist with the improvement of data collection.

16. Commissioning and decommissioning of data sets.

17. Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements.

18. Troubleshoot reporting database environment and reports as needed.

19. Training end users on new reports and dashboards.

20. Provide assistance with data mining, and data cleansing.

21. Perform other duties as assigned or as necessary.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
1. Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems Management, Business Administration, Technology Management or related discipline; or equivalent combination of education and experience required.

2. Minimum 5 years’ experience in data analysis role to include database fundamentals necessary to be able to effectively use SQL (SSMS) and MS Access.

3. Demonstrated experience with strong analytical, mathematical, problem-solving, critical thinking, facilitation and elicitation skills required.

4. Proficiency in SQL (build tables, queries, exports, imports, etc.), MS Access and MS Excel.

5. Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license unless otherwise noted.

Who we are:
We are leading a cross-functional initiative to enable our colleagues across operations to have the information they need at their fingertips. Our work requires us to move fast and collaborate with some of the best engineers, creatives, operators, and analysts to discover, build, and scale world-class information delivery products.

The E2E Visibility team develops a vision and implementation model for a standard framework of supply chain events and align ownership from both the supplier AND customer perspective. The team enables the organization to use those events to standardize data sets and metrics, create a world class performance measurement review cycle,and enable tactical analytics and decision making.

Within E2E Visibility, the Transform work stream specifically focuses on the tactical analyses and insights to support just-in-time decision making. We build functions and models to determine process SLAs, flag misrouted packages, predict lost-in-transit items, and more.

What you will do:
Translate high-level business problems into more specific questions which can then be answered by data-driven analytics
Partner with various business stakeholders to identify key factors and requirements for each project, and get buy-in for project methodology.
Leverage multiple data sources to improve existing models
Conduct big data analysis using SQL, python/R, and other software applications.
Have basic understanding of statistical modeling and other quantitative models that the team uses to drive demand forecasts or more accurately predict customer demand across Wayfair’s complex supply chain.
Present data with a clear point of view so that insights can be used to help drive business strategy.

Example Projects:
Modeling the time between events in our supply chain network: Our analysis will lead to the implementation of incident and exception flagging with trigger downstream triage at a package level.
Building dynamically evolving threshold rules to feed into production systems
Generating a suite of functions that generate complex events that other teams can utilize

Who you are:
Have 1+ years of experience in an advanced analytics or data science role
Have a bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Physics or other concentrations with heavy quantitative focus
Not afraid to present business cases to senior leadership
Passionate about solving complex business problems
Experienced with SQL
Experienced with R or Python
You possess an affinity for data, and resourcefulness in obtaining data when clean and or complete information is not available
Possess strong written and verbal cross-functional communication skills
Positive, people-oriented, and enthusiastic
Experience with source code version control (e.g. Git) preferred

Company Description

Spark Foundry is a global media agency that exists to bring HEAT – Higher Engagement, Affinity, and Transactions – to brands. By combining flawless media fundamentals with aggressive innovation, Spark inspires consumers to pay more attention; to care more about our clients’ brands; and to buy more products and services from them.

Balancing the nimble spirit of a startup with the powerhouse soul of Publicis Media, Spark Foundry delivers the best of both worlds to a client roster that spans some of the world’s best and most beloved brands and companies. We combine boutique-caliber insights and service with the buying clout and first-look access of a global leader, bringing the heat to challenger brands that want to act like giants, and to giant brands that want to act like challengers.

With a Millennial-friendly, bottom-up culture that celebrates diversity and aims for all voices to be heard, Spark has become a magnet for the industry’s best talent, with one of the best retention rates in the industry. And by applying a whole-person approach to professional and personal development, Spark develops a workforce that is well prepared for today’s challenges, and also poised to create meaningful careers in the years to come.

Because we know that heat arises the intersection of complementary forces, our professionals come from myriad disciplines and backgrounds: data, analytics, and insights; content and creative production; communications and strategy; finance and marketing; and sociology, psychology, and other liberal arts disciplines.

Job Description

Job Description

The Director, Analytics & Insights is responsible for the application of data driven insights into the Spark planning, investment and measurement process. Additionally, the role requires the candidate design and lead the implementation of modern measurement plans and longer terms roadmaps for Spark clients. Working closely with the internal client teams, Analytics and Insights and Data, Technology and Innovation teams is a vital part of the role. Functions as expert technical point of escalation, analytical problem solver and technical translator to internal account teams and clients. Provides ongoing strategic account direction/vision for technology, process and digital reporting/insights.

Overview:
About Fallon Health

Founded in 1977, Fallon Health is a leading health care services organization that supports the diverse and changing needs of those we serve. In addition to offering innovative health insurance solutions and a variety of Medicaid and Medicare products, we excel in creating unique health care programs and services that provide coordinated, integrated care for seniors and individuals with complex health needs. Fallon has consistently ranked among the nation’s top health plans, and is accredited by the National Committee for Quality Assurance for its HMO, Medicare Advantage and Medicaid products. For more information, visit fallonhealth.org.

Brief Summary of Purpose:
Principle responsibility of the Operation Support Services Star Analyst IV is to collaborate with Fallon Health’s 5 Star owner to produce dashboards, trend and surveillance reports for senior management and department leaders and teams, tracking individual measure and interventions performance. Dashboard reports are based on real time cross sectional segments. This includes working with business areas to design, develop, modify and test reports to support business needs and transaction management in support of Fallon’s 5 star rating goals. The analyst will leverage their developer skill set and experience with large health care data sets and relational databases to develop complex reporting solutions. The objective of the Analyst IV activities is to attain efficiencies and effectiveness when capturing work outputs and transactional history into manageable data segments with actionable activities.. It is also expected that this analyst proactively identifies and addresses scalability and performance bottlenecks to support efficiencies. They are consultative to the business and accountable for the quality and effectiveness of the data in the subject area across all related systems (QNXT, data warehouse) and are expected to be subject matter experts for this data.

Responsibilities:
Produce dashboards, trend and surveillance reports for senior management and department leaders and teams, tracking individual measure and interventions performance. Dashboard reports are based on real time cross sectional segments.

Leverages mathematical calculations to determine integrity of data samples

Evaluates risks; collects statistical information to determine whether business areas have negative impacts on their businesses, or at least improve their business practices,
Consultative to business owners to applying analytical findings to the business.

Actively participate in analyst meetings

Identifies improvements regarding report efficiencies and platform effectiveness
Works with business owners to research root cause and communicate improvement recommendations
Participates in continuing education activities to improve upon skillsSupport design and execution of analytical roadmap in collaboration with organizational 5 star owner and domain experts to drive delivery of analytical projects that support relevant, actionable business insights.
Work collaboratively with Director and business owners
Provides assistance on technical matters and act as a significant information resource
Participant in cross functional initiatives

Proficient in T- SQL, VB, MS Visio and MS office including Access, Word, Excel & Power point. If you are passionate about making a difference in the work you do, being recognized for your talent and expertise in solving complex and challenging analytical/data problems while contributing to the success of key strategic initiatives, consider growing your career with a Fortune 10 healthcare leader!

As a member of the Analytic Development organization you will be responsible for the design, development and delivery of analytic solutions. You will collaborate with business partners from product development and management, operation, finance, and marketing to demonstrate value of CVS Caremark products and services. You will enable data-driven strategic decision-making and identify opportunities for existing product improvement and new product development. Your experience will include translating business needs into analytic questions, using Python, SAS and SQL to access data and develop Tableau dashboards. In this exciting role, you will design and conduct rigorous analyses of pharmacy claims, medical claims and other data translating your analytic findings for appropriate business and customer audiences.

Essential Job Functions:
Collaborating with key internal and external stakeholders to gather and analyze needs and requirements;Designing and implementing robust analytic and reporting solutions to support the identified needs;Accessing data, designing summary data layers and constructing and manipulating large datasets to support planned analyses, using Python, SAS, SQL and similar tools;Assessing existing available data, identifying data gaps, and collaborating with Data Strategy and business partners to develop approaches to closing the data gaps;Building dynamic dashboards using Tableau;Performing testing and validation of summary data layers and reporting tools to ensure the results match the expected outcome;Conducting analyses of the data, ranging from descriptive reports to univariate statistical analyses to regression modeling;Communicating complex technical subjects to technical and non-technical audiences, such as but not limited to training analytic and business users how to use summary data layers and reporting tools, including development of documentation and training materialsConstructing and delivering written reports of the analytic findings in a variety of formats (reports, PPT), including visualization of data and findings, formulate recommendations, and effectively presenting the results to non-analytic audiences;Tailoring analytic solution to the specific client needs and constraints of delivery timelines;Applying creativity in developing analytic solutions based on available data sources, and in representing analytic findings in reports, tools, and other media to support most effective translation and application of internal and external customers;Managing complex projects related to a wide variety of financial utilization, and clinical business needs.
Required Qualifications
Minimum of 1 years* of experience in healthcare data analysis constructing analytical solutions to business problems, including experience with administrative claims data such as pharmacy or medical claims.
Minimum of 1 years of experience developing analytic and reporting methodology.
Minimum of 2 years of experience using SQL or SAS or Python to access, extract, manipulate and summarize data.
Additional postgraduate education may count toward required years of experience
Preferred Qualifications
Independent, curious, eager to tackle a wide variety of problems, and able to quickly develop knowledge and understanding of new domains and underlying data sources.
Experience as a project lead with cross-functional teams to develop innovative analytic approaches leveraging all available internal and external data sources.
Excellent project management skills and ability to deliver in the fast-paced evolving environment.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Experience building Tableau dashboards to reflect business analytic needs.
Experience developing, testing, documenting and maintaining standardized outcome metrics meeting diverse business needs.
Experience developing, implementing, testing, and maintaining methodologies for standardized and repeatable reporting for internal and external audiences.
Ability to interact with and influence decision-making by non-analytical business audiences.
Experience in test-and-learn analytic concepts as applied to patient communications in a healthcare or related setting.
Working knowledge of statistical methods.

Education
Bachelor's degree is required.
Advanced degree in a qualitative field preferred

Regeneron commercializes medicines for eye diseases, high LDL-cholesterol, atopic dermatitis and a rare inflammatory condition and has product candidates in development in other areas of high unmet medical need, including rheumatoid arthritis, asthma, pain, cancer and infectious diseases.

Who is Stanley Black & Decker?
We are the leader in tools and security. We are Stanley Tools. We are DEWALT. We are Mac Tools. We are Vidmar. And we are much more. We are the doors that protect you at airports. We are the lock and deadbolt on your front door. We are the hydraulic breakers that rescue trapped earthquake survivors. We are the people on the phone in an emergency. No matter where you live, what car you drive, what stores you shop at, or what building you work in, you can bet that we had a hand in making it work. And you can guarantee that we’ll keep making it work.

BUSINESS OVERVIEW

Stanley Black & Decker is one of the world’s largest, fastest-growing, and most dynamic companies. The company has a rich and storied history dating back to 1843, with some of the most recognized and trusted brand in the World. We pride ourselves on providing exceptional service to our customers. Our continued growth has created an opening for a Supply Planner in the Power Tool Accessories group located in our Towson, MD, GTS business.

The Supply Planner will be a key member of the PTA Supply Planning Team responsible for providing the highest level of customer service level while maintaining appropriate control of inventory and cost. They will be responsible for production planning for SBDK facility and/or managing vendor purchased products in order to fulfill the planning objectives of the U.S. markets as well as our Global needs.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Inventory management
Manage inventory for specific plants/product portfolios to support the working capital targets.
Achieve 5% Excess & Obsolete for specified sources of supply/product portfolios.
Prevent inventory surplus and drive action to reduce inventory overages
Delivery to customers
Maintain service level of items planned in order to support overall goal of 98%.
Have limited to no out of stocks at the distribution centers.
Update weekly service level root cause analysis and drive resolution and prevention (corrective action) of future occurrences
Minimize short supply challenges, as well as discover, resolve, and communicate any future shortages
Planning
Become an expert in the JDA supply planning systems to support plant planners when needed
Regularly review and update system settings for errors to maintain a clean and robust working environment
Conduct weekly meetings/reviews with key sources of supply
Drive monthly capacity planning reviews
Understand and collaborate with plant on resource planning and capacity constraints.
Cross Functional
Work collaboratively with all functional areas of the business, i.e. Sales, Marketing, Finance, Sales Operations, Demand Planning, to solve problems and identify business improvement opportunities
Serve as link between suppliers/manufacturing locations and the market
Manage promotions and key new product launches to ensure on time and in full delivery to the customer
Analytics
Collaborate on regular review of Statistical Safety Stocks
Use/develop reporting to analyze/measure results and to drive improvements
Coordinate on mid to long term demand management and manage against capacity constraints
Improvements
Drive Process Improvement through projects
Continually develop improvement plans and be able to communicate effectively to various functional areas in the organization

Qualifications:
BA/BS Degree in related field required
3-5 years Supply Chain Experience
Experience in SAP, JDA, Business Objects, and Business Warehouse preferred
Working knowledge and experience with Microsoft Office. Excellent Excel Skills required (pivots, macros, v/h lookups, etc.). Access Skills preferred (Queries, Forms, etc)
Exceptional analytical skills and problem-solving ability. Strong attention to detail required
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written and the ability to effectively communicate throughout all levels of the organization
Effective project management skills, team leadership skills, strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
Strong multi-tasking ability as well as ability to manage deadlines in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
Must be reliable, have a positive attitude, and have a passion for excellence
Demonstrated initiative and willingness to overcome challenges
