Lee & Hayes is a leading national IP law firm at the intersection of business, law and technology. We are currently seeking a Patent Attorney to work out of our Spokane, Washington office. This is an exceptional opportunity to be part of a dynamic team in our highly-regarded practice, while living in one of the most desirable areas of the country. Spokane offers scenic beauty, low cost of living, and a high quality of life. The hub of a vibrant region, Spokane enjoys a thriving dining, art, and music scene as well as four beautiful seasons that support world-class outdoor recreation.Primary responsibilities for this position will include preparing and prosecuting patent applications across a variety of technology areas, with a focus on computer-implemented methods in insurance, financial technologies and e-commerce, medical devices, autonomous vehicles, heavy machinery, and optics. Responsibilities may also include managing foreign prosecution and rendering opinions to clients. The position requires extensive interaction with in-house attorneys, inventors, and firm attorneys.UNIQUE LAW FIRMLee & Hayes provides a unique corporate culture that fosters a collegial atmosphere, encourages camaraderie, community outreach, and work-life balance. Health and wellness initiatives are coordinated year-round and include quarterly wellness activities, healthy snacks in the office, and availability of stand-up work stations for each employee. Members of the Lee & Hayes team are highly-accomplished individuals who take pride in their work, community, and families. Job Description Summary
BD’s Global Customer Services (GCS) organization is transforming the customer experience on our journey to advance the world of health. The mission of the Customer Experience & Analytics team is to partner with GCS businesses to deliver actionable insights, resulting from analysis of Voice of the Customer (VOC) data and operational data, that drive meaningful improvement in customer and associate experience.

We are seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst, Customer Experience Analytics that will develop actionable research hypotheses, prepare and analyze datasets, develop predictive models, and present key findings to stakeholders in a clear way. This individual should be highly analytical and capable of truly understanding data to identify new opportunities and actionable insights that drive BD’s customer experience. In addition to technical capabilities, this individual will be extremely collaborative and continuously seeking new opportunities in a consultative manner.

Job Description

Job Summary

BD’s Global Customer Services (GCS) organization is transforming the customer experience on our journey to advance the world of health. The mission of the Customer Experience & Analytics team is to partner with GCS businesses to deliver actionable insights, resulting from analysis of Voice of the Customer (VOC) data and operational data, that drive meaningful improvement in customer and associate experience.

We are seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst, Customer Experience Analytics that will develop actionable research hypotheses, prepare and analyze datasets, develop predictive models, and present key findings to stakeholders in a clear way. This individual should be highly analytical and capable of truly understanding data to identify new opportunities and actionable insights that drive BD’s customer experience. In addition to technical capabilities, this individual will be extremely collaborative and continuously seeking new opportunities in a consultative manner.

The core responsibilities include:
Partner with internal customers to understand stakeholder needs; translate business needs into analytical requirements that can be answered with available data using statistical and machine learning methods
Extract and prepare data sets from various sources including Hadoop, SQL Server, flat files, etc
Develop visualizations to help explain patterns and trends in large data sets
Communicate analyses and results to executive leadership backed by data and coupled with actionable insights to drive business decisions
Recognize and adopt industry best practices in reporting and analysis
Support the survey methodology of the NPS program, supported by Qualtrics, and capture insights
Draw conclusions and prioritize actions/recommendations with limited data

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Analytics, Computer Science Engineering, Systems Engineering, or Statistics
3+ years of experience in a role requiring application of analytic skills to integrate data into operational/business planning
Strong experience with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau), data extraction, data manipulation, and analysis; demonstrated strength using SQL queries in a business environment
Strong quantitative and qualitative analytical skills with ability to distill large data sets into meaningful insights and takeaways
Strong PowerPoint skills and ability to translate data insights into impactful presentations
Superior verbal and written communication skills with the ability to effectively advocate technical solutions to non-technical audiences
Ability to cultivate and maintain productive working relationships with internal business partners and work successfully in a highly cross-functional matrix organization
Extreme curiosity to understand business operations and data with a desire to work across groups to do so
Qualtrics and Salesforce experience a plus but not required

Primary Work Location
USA CA - San Diego Bldg A&B

Additional Locations

Work Shift

job_information:
Degreed exists to discover, empower and recognize the next generation of the world's expertise. The smartest, brightest, and most bold, the tenacious, willing, the unsung heroes, self-taught, the scrappy, driven, the passionate, daring, the unafraid. Experts.

The Data Science team at Degreed works with large structured and unstructured datasets to understand how people develop the skills that they need to advance their careers. To do this, we use a diverse set of tools and approaches, including feature engineering, clustering, classification and recommendation models, word embeddings, and neural networks. Degreed is looking for a capable, qualified and versatile Data Scientist to help with the development and delivery of high-quality, data-driven, machine learning and predictive modeling solutions.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Work as part of a product team to derive data science products that help improve the experience on the platform
Develop full data science pipelines from early proof-of concept models through full-scale training and working with engineers to deploy models to production
Engineer features, build and optimize recommenders, classification models, and semantic graph, and evaluate the feasibility and performance of these models
Assist with text/data classification and categorization
Communicate about data science with a diverse set of stakeholders and development partners
REQUIREMENTS
Hands on (not just academic) experience in applying advanced analytics to solve complex business problems
Proficiency in Python and SQL
Experience with unsupervised and supervised machine learning techniques and methods
Comfortable blending together diverse data sources to create training data for specific problems
Experience processing large-scale data sets
A strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. We’re a distributed team and rely on good communication to perform at a high level
Experience working remotely - It takes a self-motivated individual to thrive on a distributed team
You are a lifelong learner and passionate about learning new things and taking on new challenges
PREFERRED SKILLS
Professional experience using unsupervised learning techniques - clustering, word embeddings, dimensionality reduction, etc
Experience in Natural Language Processing (NLP)
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

See Degreed Jobs for more details on Degreed and why you should come work with us!

job_information:
About You

More than a candidate that checks every box, we’re looking for people who are excited to work, learn, and grow at Sonos—no matter their background or how they identify. If that’s you, we hope you’ll apply for this role.

You want to be part of a team.

You come with new ideas and a unique point of view. You look forward to collaborating with a diverse team of individuals. You assume everyone’s best intentions, welcome a healthy debate, and embrace differing opinions. You eagerly seek and give help. Transparency tops your list of values, and you proactively contribute to a culture of respect and inclusion.

You enjoy a challenge.

Inquisitive and focused, you see every challenge as an opportunity. You’re ambitious and comfortable making mistakes because you learn from them and bounce back quickly. You would rather create the future than wait for it. You prioritize long-term value over short-term objectives.

You love to listen.

You approach every interaction with curiosity and a desire to understand. You want to make a positive impact in the world. You’re passionate about culture and know the power that music, film, podcasts, games, and stories have to bring people together.

What You’ll Do
Strategic Thinking. Contribute to developing comprehensive business strategies, taking into account consumer, category and market trends. Able to confidently present strategic, data-driven recommendations to senior leaders. Comfortable challenging the status quo and driving change using data and insights.
Leadership. Exceptional communicator with the ability to influence and inspire action. Exceptional relationship builder and collaborator with ability to effectively navigate the organization and at all levels. Project manager with the ability to lead vendors, partners and internal teams to accomplish goals over defined time horizons. Unafraid to take innovative approaches to problems, with a mindset that values progress over perfection.
Business Acumen. Able to connect the dots, using many data sources to identify business insights and recommend solutions that drive results. Focused on ROI and ensuring insights are actionable.
Voice of the Customer. Ability to manage and execute against a framework for Customer Experience (CX) metrics that drive business outcomes, such as Net Promoter Score (NPS). Knowledge of CX metrics, industry trends, best practices, and technology capabilities.
Category, Product, and Brand Research. Plan and lead research activities to underpin business decisions and new product launches with insights on pricing, positioning, and forecasts. Experience conducting both qualitative and quantitative research, including focus group moderation and survey-based research. Experience with brand and marketing analytics.
Data. Ability to navigate and analyze a variety of data including product usage, primary, third party data to answer business questions.
Skills You’ll Need

Basic Qualifications:
5+ years experience in Customer Insights, Customer Experience Analytics, Brand Analytics or related experience.
Experience leading programs from data development, analysis and recommendations, to implementation across the business.
Experience with primary research, customer survey research design, customer experience metrics and methodology.
Experience with survey data and leveraging tools such as SPSS, Marketsight, or similar to analyze and manipulate raw datasets.
Exceptional presentation, verbal and written communication skills to inspire action.
Bachelor's degree.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Tableau, Microstrategy, PowerBI, or similar for dashboarding/visualization.
Ability to synthesize qualitative and quantitative data to develop meaningful customer insights and connect to relevant and actionable business opportunities.
Experience with database languages (i.e. SQL) and statistical software (i.e. R, Python, SAS) for analytics.
Experience working in a fast-paced, data-driven consumer electronics environment.
Advanced degree.
More About Sonos

Sonos is a sound experience company. We pioneered multiroom wireless audio, made it sound amazing, and changed the way people listen, making it effortless for them to enjoy what they want, where they want, how they want.

Today we continue empowering listeners by developing new technologies, thoughtfully designing products, expanding our software platform, and crafting brilliant sound experiences while participating in a culture that values respect, transparency, collaboration, and ownership.

Together we’re working to positively impact the world and inspire everyone to listen better—because listening brings people together, builds understanding, drives change, and makes us happier.

Notice to European Job Applicants: Information you submit as a part of your job application will be used in accordance with Sonos EU Job Applicant Privacy Notice.

Notice to U.S. Job Applicants: Sonos is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Follow the links to review the EEO is the Law poster and its supplement. The pay transparency policy is available here. Sonos is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@sonos.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Micron Technology’s vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life and our commitment to people, innovation, tenacity, collaboration, and customer focus allows us to fulfill our mission to be a global leader in memory and storage solutions. This means conducting business with integrity, accountability, and professionalism while supporting our global community.

About Us

As the leader in creative memory solutions, Micron is helping the world make sense of data by delivering technology that is transforming how the world uses information. Through our global brands — Micron, Crucial and Ballistix — we offer the industry’s broadest portfolio. We are the only company manufacturing today’s major memory and storage technologies: DRAM, NAND, NOR and 3D XPoint™ memory. Our solutions are purpose built to leverage the value of data to unlock financial insights, accelerate scientific breakthroughs and improve communication around the world.

Advanced Materials Modeling and Process Analytics Engineer

Micron Technology’s vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life and our commitment to people, innovation, tenacity, collaboration, and customer focus allows us to fulfill our mission to be a global leader in memory and storage solutions. This means conducting business with integrity, accountability, and professionalism while supporting our global community.

As an Advanced Materials Modeling and Process Analytics Engineer, you will support the predictive materials, process, and structure modeling projects within technology development organization at Micron Technology Inc. You will contribute to application and development of modeling methods to understand, simulate, analyze, and resolve complex materials and process challenges for accelerated technology development cycles. You will perform simulations of complex materials physics and surface chemistry to characterize the fundamental process interactions and its material impact on thin-films and patterned nanostructures. You will guide and support critical projects through enabling informed decisions on materials and process selection along with estimating correlations across processing parameters and structures, and new materials and device performance. You must have strong knowledge and proven background in linking first-principles-based (ab initio) atomic-scale modeling to nano-, micro-, meso-, and continuum-scale simulations.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Modeling of complex materials, films, stacks, and interfaces using ab initio methods within density functional theory and beyond
Estimation of structural, thermo-mechanical, thermodynamic, chemical, transport, electronic, optical, and magnetic properties
Simulation of plasma and feature profile during dry etch processing
Advanced use of DFT calculations and statistical methods is encouraged
Support development of portable 3D structural models with improved meshing algorithms
Contribute to development of standalone applications for large-scale geometry construction and visualization
Clear documentation and dissemination of technical findings, model predictions, and solution recommendations
DFT calculations on high-performance computing clusters
Application of computational materials science, atomistic modeling, statistical mechanics, thermodynamic modeling, transport processes
Contribute to development of predictive process and structure DOE models using statistical and machine learning techniques
Perform quantifiable predictions of etch/deposition rates, and film properties for advanced memory applications
Clearly communicate technical information in verbal and written forms to various stakeholders
Develop models and perform simulations to recommend improvement to materials and processes
Coordinate collection of information on process, spectroscopy, and materials characterization
Work with process development groups to design novel chemistries or processes for deposition and etching
Expert use of DFT, MC, MD, and experience with HPEM simulations to resolve multi-scale problems

Qualifications:
Knowledge of quantum chemistry, statistical mechanics, plasma physics, and proven mechanics
Knowledge of density functional theory, reactive force-fields, embedded-atom methods, MC, MD, and phase field techniques
Proficiency in applying statistical methods, machine learning, and AI techniques (Linear and NL regression, Bayesian Statistics, DOE, Naive Bayes, Clustering, Decision Trees, Random Forest, ANN, CNN, NLP etc.)
Proficiency in estimating surface reactions and performing structural/feature-scale simulations
Experience with VASP, LAMMPS, Jaguar, HPEM
Strong knowledge of numerical methods, Fortran/C/C++ programming, MPI processes and threading, PYTHON/Perl/Tcl/Tk scripting languages, MATLAB, and Linux operating systems on multicore multimode architectures and GPUs
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to operate independently in a highly interdisciplinary fast-paced dynamic environment

Education:
A PhD in Chemical Engineering, Materials Science, Physics, Chemistry, or related discipline.

About Us

As the leader in innovative memory solutions, Micron is helping the world make sense of data by delivering technology that is transforming how the world uses information. Through our global brands - Micron, Crucial and Ballistix - we offer the industry's broadest portfolio. We are the only company manufacturing today's major memory and storage technologies: DRAM, NAND, NOR and 3D XPoint™ memory. Our solutions are purpose built to leverage the value of data to unlock financial insights, accelerate scientific break throughs and improve communication around the world.

Micron Benefits

Employee Rewards Program, Healthcare, Paid time off (Combined Sick and Vacation Time), Retirement savings plans, Paid maternity/paternity leave, Employee Assistance Program, Professional development training, Workplace wellness programs, Micron Health Clinic (Boise only), Fitness Center / Activity rooms (Boise only), Tuition Reimbursement, Micron Corporate Discounts, Casual Dress attire.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

For US Sites Only: To request assistance with the application process and/or for reasonable accommodations, please contact Micron’s Human Resources Department at 1-800-336-8918 or 208-368-4748 and/or by completing our General Contact Form

We Are Hiring:
Advanced Analytical Consultant

For more than a century, ProHealth Care has been the health care leader in Waukesha County and surrounding areas – providing outstanding care across a full spectrum of services. We strive to continuously improve our community’s health and well-being by combining skill, compassion and innovation. All members of our team – whether clinical or non-clinical – have a direct impact on the delivering on our brand promise “The Way You Should Be Treated”. Employees in our corporate departments are a vital part of our overall success and in turn indirectly help us provide exceptional patient care.

What You Will Do:
The ProHealth Care’s Analytics Center of Excellence (ACE) is a centralized team working collaboratively with multiple de-centralized teams across ProHealth around all data analytics activities. ACE has been established to create and sustain a culture of insight-driven decision making across the enterprise.

The Enterprise-wide, Advanced Analytical Consultants reports to and will support the Director of Analytics Center of Excellence in ensuring that ProHealth Care team members both participate in and are served by the Enterprise Analytics Value Cycle methodology. This will ensure all Data Analytics, regardless of where they occur in the organization, are consistently applied.

The Advanced Analytical Consultant is an enterprise-wide analytics expert focused on applying conventional and advanced analytical methods to deliver novel insights and process improvement opportunities to the clinical and business leaders of the ProHealth care. A successful candidate will bring a broad set of skills spanning data (integration, aggregation, standardization), analytics (descriptive and predictive statistical theory and practice, modeling), programming (e.g. Python, R), and consulting (e.g. business needs analysis, project definition, project management, customer management, communication).

Advanced Analytical Consultants work both as independent problem solvers and contribute their specialized data science expertise to clinical and business project teams across the system. As members of the Enterprise-wide Analytics Center of Excellence, advanced analytical consultants help to transition proven methods, algorithms, and deliverables to full production support by the Enterprise wide Analytics teams.

The Advanced Analytical Consultant will support a broad spectrum of ProHealth internal customers – including but not limited to the following:
All leadership: SET, Vice Presidents, Directors, ManagersProHealth Solutions and its ProvidersKey programmatic areas including: Vision 2021, Strategic Initiatives, the Population Health Services Organization, Service lines, Strategic Change office, etc.
What you will need:
Required:
Bachelor's degree, preferably in Business or Clinical area required. Master's degree in business administration, analytics, statistics, informatics, or similar preferred.
At least 2 years in a project manager role or above leading professional staff in a variety of support functions required.
Project Management experience.
Competency with Microsoft Office Suite, basic visualization tools and techniques, basic analytic techniques, basic statistical techniques, basic data validation tools and techniques.

Preferred:
Healthcare experience
Service Now software experience.
Proficiency with one or more analytic and/or visualization tools including:
Microsoft Power BI Suite
Tableau/Qlik or similar
SAS/SPSS/Minitab/R or similar
Experience with multiple analytic techniques including but not limited to: basic descriptive statistics, Bayesian techniques, regression analysis, linear programming, cluster analysis, neural networks, etc.

We have nearly 5,000 dedicated clinical and non-clinical employees and physicians who work together every day to serve the health and well-being of our community. At ProHealth Care everyone contributes to the care our patients receive. And, everyone is treated with kindness and respect in our welcoming environment.

Engaging and community focused culture
Competitive Salaries
Opportunity for professional career growth
Robust benefits including: Generous PTO; Choices in insurance; HSA; Tuition reimbursement; immediate 401K match; discounted tickets to various entertainment, social and sporting events

At Boston Scientific, you will find a collaborative culture driven by a passion for innovation that keeps us connected on the most essential level. About the role:
Boston Scientific is seeking an experienced Business Analyst to fill a highly visible and strategic role and technical role within the Analytics Center of Excellence to manage and support the evolution of our Sales Reporting Data Product and contribute to the Analytics strategy and solutions for our global business.

This role will support end to Analytics processes in the Commercial space as well as act as a SME on Analytics programs involving data analysis, integration, front end reporting and Analytics content. This individual will be collaborating with cross-functional program/product managers, IT and business functions within BSC surrounding Analytics programs. The Business Analyst is responsible for developing complex user requirements/user stories, and analyzes, plans, and implementation of Analytics solutions that meet the business needs.

Your Responsibilities include :
Work on the Analytics COE team with a focus on Commercial Analytics and close collaboration with our Analytics Studio and Analytics Platform teams.
Product leadership and Product management for the creation and refinement of solutions and integrations with other key Commercial technologies such as SAP HANA, Salesforce.com, Master Data Management, Informatica and Hadoop.
Participate in future strategy for Commercial Analytics and transformation initiatives.
Participates in all stages of product evolution from gathering user stories/requirements and researching options, design, configuration/development and testing, to rollout and maintenance.
Identifies opportunities for business process improvements and establishes effective and efficient processes, including prioritizing demand.
Provides requirements/user story analysis, level of effort estimation, and project planning.
Promotes simplified integrations and Analytics solutions with a business process first approach.
Proactively identifies needs of end users; develops and provides the necessary support to meet those needs.
Ability to communicate highly technical solutions to business partners and users at their level of technical understanding.
Appropriately communicates task status, escalates issues, and manages timelines and action items.
Manages communications amongst technical staff, vendors, and internal partners.
Enhances, maintains and supports the development of systems throughout the Software Development Lifecycle according to the IT methodology, department SOP’s, and team guidelines.
Creates and maintains system documentation according to the BSC Global Systems Methodology (proposals, designs, test specifications, and other deliverables as necessary) for new and existing applications.
Ensures that system & related processes meet all applicable compliance requirements.

What we're looking for:
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree required.
3-5 years of work experience with delivery and support of software development solutions and environments.
Understanding of the software development lifecycle and methodologies, including Waterfall and Agile.
Understanding and experience providing software solution analysis, project management, and testing leadership.
Ability to partner with business divisions and functions in delivery.
Experience delivering and maintaining systems within a medical device or a highly regulated environment.
Previous experience working in a cross-functional, highly matrixed business environment.
Ability to identify and implement process improvement opportunities.
Strong written and verbal communication, with the ability to effectively communicate with leadership.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills including analytics troubleshooting skills.
Demonstrates courage in ensuring value-driven solutions are delivered.
Business Process modeling expertise, and deep understanding of translating data requirements into usable front-end business solutions.
Able to work on a team in person and in a collaborative virtual setting, Self-motivated, self-directed, adaptable.
Able to clearly communicate with management, both written and oral communication.
Proven track record of delivery and strong verbal and written skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with Analytics implementations and/or data and reporting projects.

Lead and develop members of the HCM & People Analytics teams, who are responsible for implementing and maintaining HR technology tools (ATS, HCM, Analytics) maintaining and delivering candidate and employee data, reporting, and analytics.

Develop a prioritization for reporting and analytics optimize and warehouse all data sources to meet workforce requirements and drive accuracy and insights by l everaging continual stakeholder feedback, collaboration, benchmarking and internal reviews, generates data-driven insights and delivers those insights summarizing and translating report data into organized, useable, actionable content to drive strategic decision making.

Develop and manage a team, producing products for consumption by stakeholders such as senior leaders, People Solutions Business Partners, COEs, finance, procurement and other internal stakeholders.

Identify opportunities for automation and reduction of manual processes and partner with teams across People Solutions, Finance, and Legal on implementation of solutions. Perform regular business process reviews to make ongoing suggestions and create action plans.

Lead People Solutions data and technology projects by:
Obtaining key partner buy-in
Developing requirements
Testing
Preparing and delivering change management
Implementing
Conducting post-mortems for feedback and improvements

Develop and sustain appropriate controls to maintain reliable data and enable scalable reporting solutions.

Monitor and enhance service delivery standards to ensure global consistency for compliance standards, audit reporting, and how data is digested ultimately enhancing both manager and team member experiences.

Analyze Change Healthcare data against internal and external benchmarks and provide insights and meaningful, actionable commentary that tells a compelling story to drive decisions and direction.

Provide strategic analysis of workforce data from multiple systems and databases to identify trends and areas of interest to help drive informed decisions within People Solutions and across the business.

Guide the HCM & People Analytics team to build and communicate useful and actionable dashboards for business leaders, People Solutions Business Partners and other internal stakeholders.

Apply statistical findings and communicate effectively & compellingly with People Solutions and business stakeholders for workforce capacity planning and enhance their understanding of metrics and reports.

Recommend measurements for workforce initiatives to determine value and effectiveness.

Technical expertise

Must be experienced with HCM platform solutions like Workday, People Soft, SAP with exposure to intelligent business tools such as Tableau, Prism, Power BI.
Must be proficient in data mining and processes, key HR metrics and the benchmarks appropriate to our industry; must be able to articulate how business actions impact our metrics; must be able to distinguish between correlations and causation; must be able to overlay macro-economic impacts against internal metrics; must be able to understand data models and design and how it impacts metrics and reporting.
Knowledge of data governance practices, GDPR and other data related government regulatory requirements, business and technology issues related to management of enterprise information assets and approaches related to data protection.
Experience in generating meaningful dashboards, analytics reports, generating meaningful insights and discussing it with People Solutions and Business stakeholders.
Ability to visualize data and create meaningful visuals to support the problem hypothesis.

Problem Solving

Partners with People Solutions Business Partners and critical stakeholders to effectively plan for workforce needs and provide underlying analytics to predict workforce trends.
Evaluating the People Solutions analytics current state including but not limited to structure, staffing, process evaluation, data management, standards, frameworks, methodology etc.
Builds a foundation of analytical capabilities throughout the People Solutions organization and trains others in advanced analytic methods, as needed.
Designs and implements the analytics frameworks and strategy roadmaps for clients (strategy/ structure/ staffing/ capabilities/ technology).
Researches best practices, trends and performs deep research and statistical analysis on long range strategic People Solutions and talent effectiveness and competitiveness questions.
Identifies baseline metrics for the design and development of accurate dashboards, reports, presentations used to educate, inform, and influence business decisions, thought leadership and support strategic objectives of the organization.
Uses appropriate external benchmarks for workforce metrics and key performance indicators that are linked to business results, identifies risks, insights and develops recommendations
Leverages external data sources to bring new and creative insights to the workforce planning processes and understands patterns and connections within human capital data across functional disciplines to influence business outcomes
Streamlines and simplifies data asks to relevant business drivers and executes robust reporting capabilities that tie to strategic priorities, decision making, and direction.

Skills and Experience

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required; MBA or Master’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, Statistics, Business, I/O Psychology, or related field preferred.
8+ years of relevant experience with at least 4+ years of experience working with People and Business data, connecting the dots and generating meaningful insights for decision making.
Experience building and engaging high performing teams.
Acumen to solve business problems and ability to work with limited supervision
Experience identifying and translating business issues into questions that can be answered with data.
Ability to develop a clear strategy & plan based on high level insights, prioritize actions to deliver, and multi-task effectively in a fast-paced environment are essential.
Demonstrated learning agility, curiosity of data and information, and successful root cause analysis.
Passion for using data to uncover insights and drive business performance and a clear understanding of People Solutions data impacts across various business processes and systems.
Experience working on WD Prism, Tableau, or other such similar data visualization tools.
Some experience with qualitative research, design and analysis of surveys.
Customer orientation with consultative skills—identifying needs, defining solutions, communicating opportunities clearly and compellingly.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with experience in data. visualization; able to translate research findings for a general business audience
Proactive, organized, and detail oriented; able to ensure rigor and accuracy while meeting deadlines.
Leverage subject matter expertise to advise on People Solutions data and technology-related matters across the organization.

As our data collective continues to grow, so does our team! Let's disrupt this $2 trillion industry together.

True Fit, named a Top Place to Work, is looking for a Director of Customer Analytics to work in our Boston location.

Advance your career at Liberty Mutual Insurance - A Fortune 100 Company!

Job Summary:
GRM Actuarial – Predictive Modeling team is searching for a highly motivated Director II, Data Science who is eager to make an impact on the very complex and evolving insurance industry. As the manager of the US Short-Tailed Lines Predictive Modeling team, you will provide analytical direction for a team of actuarial and data science professionals. You and your team will leverage primary data, advanced quantitative modeling and financial analysis to develop predictive models and tools that enable data-driven strategic decision-making. This role requires broad knowledge of predictive modeling techniques, and advanced application of those techniques to a variety of business issues. You will provide highly technical analytical assessments of business issues to management and a mixture of technical and non-technical audiences so good communication skills are essential. This is a highly visible role that will connect often with senior management and other groups across Liberty Mutual.

Responsibilities:
Manage, coach and develop a team of up to six highly-skilled actuarial and data science staff.
Collaborate with other business partners to develop appropriate statistical approaches and tools that will drive strategic decision making related to reserving, trends and other challenging problems central to our business.
Understand the competitive marketplace, business issues, and data challenges in order to deliver actionable insights, recommendations and business processes.
Research, recommend, and implement new and/or alternative statistical and mathematical methodologies appropriate for the given model or analysis.
Supervise and perform highly complex, technical and creative predictive modeling projects.
Effectively communicate results, insights and recommendations in written, oral and presentation formats to technical and non-technical audiences.
Regularly engage with data science and actuarial communities and lead cross-functional working groups.

Qualifications:
Master's Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics or any other quantitative field plus a minimum 7 years of applied business/non-academic experience preferred; OR Ph.D. plus a minimum of 4 years of experience preferred; OR Fellowship in the Casualty Actuarial Society (FCAS) designation required plus a minimum of 5 years of experience, or comparable actuarial education/designation combined with relevant experience.Proficient in predictive analytics including real-world experience in model development, validation, and testing.

Experienced in the following: generalized linear models, survival models, random forests, clustering, and Bayesian approaches to data analysis.

Proficient with at least one language for data analysis, such as R, Python or SAS.

Proven ability to lead and drive projects and assignments to completion through others, and effectively engage talent.

Knowledge of insurance principles, underwriting and the various functions of an insurance organization, including Finance, Underwriting, Sales and Claims desirable.

Exceptional planning, analytical, decision-making, communication and project management skills.

Demonstrated ability to exchange ideas and convey complex information clearly and concisely, both verbally and in writing.

Ability to give effective presentations to and influence senior leaders and other groups.

Management experience is preferred.

Benefits:
We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, it’s our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits

Overview:
At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed.
We’re dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

Whirlpool Corporation is consistently recognized by Fortune Magazine as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies. Our values are the driving force behind everything we do. Respect, integrity, diversity and inclusion, teamwork and the spirit of winning propel our teams to excellence. Get to know us and see what it's like to be part of the world's leading major home appliance company.

Human Resources Manager Business Partner

Function Overview

This Fortune 500 business needs a dynamic HR change agent to provide all aspects of people leadership to drive growth and productivity in a highly matrixed environment.

We are looking for a HR business leader who knows how to utilize and leverage global COEs, shared services and analytics to support business needs.

If you have a passion for employee engagement, leadership development and talent management and have a continuous improvement mindset, this is a great opportunity to lead a highly complex organization. A mix of experience in manufacturing and corporate settings is preferred.

Job Responsibilities

Serve as the HR business partner to Integrated Supply Chain (ISC) support functions including: quality, customer fulfillment, planning & strategy, and global advanced manufacturing engineering. This employee base is located throughout Benton Harbor and across manufacturing locations within ISC.
Partner with HR Operations and CoEs to enable two-way information sharing on business needs, analyze trends and metrics within designated business units, develop integrated solutions, programs and policies in support of business strategy.
Partners to lead and sustain change creating an agile and responsive organization.
Identify talent implications in business strategy, develop human capital strategies and drive business events (M&A, divestiture, plant closure, etc.), as applicable. This includes helping lead talent initiatives across ISC.
Identify organizational needs and gaps, drive to build organizational capability and people excellence.
Partner with business to drive succession planning and management through identifying high impact/critical roles, developing incumbents and successors, as well as identifying global mobility opportunities and candidates.
Creates an effective and strong organization by utilizing organizational diagnosis tools, leveraging organization design principles, and building organization capabilities in line with Whirlpool’s core values to win against the competition.
Effectively coach business leaders and leadership team.
Build people leader effectiveness and drive effective talent management by leveraging globally consistent talent calendar and CoE toolkits.
Lead Strategic Workforce Planning and drive Diversity & Inclusion strategy in business units.
Partner with leaders to develop organizational pay strategy, appropriately budget and manage annual pay planning process, and drive utilization of rewards and recognition programs.
Develops effective relationships with clients by building trust, leveraging networks, applying HR expertise, and measuring and ensuring business results.
Embed a culture of continuous improvement and effectively manage change. Participate with others in completing special projects as assigned.
Applies data analytics and judgment to draw insights that inform business decision making.
Uses coaching and influencing skills to successfully drive change and leaders’ ownership/accountability.

Minimum Requirements

Bachelor's Degree and 3+ years of experience as an HR generalist, HR manager or HR business partner or an Associate's Degree and 5+ years of experience as an HR generalist, HR manager or HR business partner

2+ years using Organizational Effectiveness strategies (e.g. succession planning, data analytics, talent, job levelization)

Experience leading a change management initiative.

Preferred Requirements

MBA degree
Extensive business knowledge and insight to fully engage in business discussions and lead People Excellence strategy to improve talent and business outcomes.

Business Manager, People Analytics

Capital One People Analytics is a center of excellence within HR. From recruiting & hiring to learning & development, diversity, engagement, employee retention, compensation, etc. Our team is the analytics engine supporting our business clients to build and sustain high performing teams.

As a member of our team, you will use data and analytics to build products and derive insights for our internal business customers to make fact-based people and organization related decisions. This is a new area of focus in Capital One, and as such it is a very exciting time to join this team.

The Role:
As a Business Manager on the US Card People Analytics team, you will apply your strategic and analytical skills to the exciting new field of People Analytics to solve open-ended, complex questions about how we should attract, develop, and retain top talent.

You will team up with world-class professionals and senior leadership to delve into major people management and talent initiatives, such as:

Using HR data to accelerate and streamline recruiting and selection
Understanding and predicting associate turnover
Working with business leaders to boost retention
Understanding how culture, learning, and talent management actions shape productivity and performance by using real, hard data about behavior and associate outcomes
…and you will do it all in a collaborative environment that values your insight, encourages you to take on new responsibilities, promotes continuous learning, and rewards innovation.

General Responsibilities:
Analysis:Connect people data to business performance data to generate relevant, actionable insights and make strategic and tactical recommendations
Modeling/Analytics: Perform modeling/analytics to predict employee and business outcomes
Solution Design and Ownership: Leverage emerging technologies to automate existing reporting and make it more insightful. Design, develop, test, and implement new products and solutions. This is a small but high performing team where you will rapidly generate ideas, develop solutions, and see the benefits you have delivered to our customers
Partnership: Work closely with colleagues and senior leaders in HR and the Lines of Business to drive provide insights and drive improvement in associate experience and business results
Strategic & analytic orientation: A proven track record of decision making and problem solving based on analytics. Conceptual thinking skills must be complemented by a strong quantitative orientation
Strong business judgment, leadership and integrity: Able to bring a forward-leaning, yet responsible approach to transforming people management, while acting as a trusted advisor on sensitive and confidential matters pertaining to employee performance, compensation, etc.
Strong communication skills: Impeccable written and oral communication skills, coupled with strategic influencing skills and the ability to drive consensus around complex decisions

General Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree
At least 2 years of experience in quantitative and/or qualitative analysis

Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s Degree in a quantitative field - (Business, Math, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Science, Engineering)
5+ years of experience in people or workforce analytics
5+ years of experience in quantitative analysis
5+ years of experience in qualitative analysis
2+ year of experience in product development
2+ years of experience in financial modeling
2+ years of experience in economic forecasting
2+ years of experience in project management
1+ years of experience in consulting

Our Story

The National Research Center for College and University Admissions™ (NRCCUA®), now a part of ACT®, is a membership organization that links colleges and universities to the nation’s largest college and career planning program for students seeking post-secondary guidance. In addition, members can receive exclusive access to Encoura™ Data Lab—an educational data science, analytics, and research platform. Since 1972, ACT | NRCCUA has been a leading provider of data, technology, and programs servicing public and private colleges and universities to enhance their marketing and recruiting efforts.

Over the years, ACT | NRCCUA has continued to evolve its offering to represent the link between students and higher education institutions. As part of that evolution, ACT | NRCCUA acquired Eduventures—the leading research and advisory firm focused exclusively on higher education. We are now able to provide forward-looking and actionable research based on proprietary market data, as well as advisory services that support both strategic and operational decision-making. All Eduventures Research is now available in the Encoura Data Lab platform.

The Senior Database Engineer is a hands-on technical position for a senior-level professional. The role involves an advanced, experienced skill set to design, develop and implement database objects, procedures and processes using the SQL Server platform to support business objectives throughout the organization.

You'll be working as part of an Agile team, developing the systems that power our business. This is a hands-on role, working with other engineers, writing code, testing, and deploying the finished apps and libraries.
Responsibilities and Deliverables
In partnership with your co-workers, design and develop database infrastructure (tables and views) to support a complex and rapidly changing data environment.
Create working, maintainable, and fast Python scripts and stored procedures using best practices and current organizational standards to support data-driven applications, both internal and client-facing.
Use indexing and other techniques to optimize new and existing objects and processes.
Develop processes for the ETL of data throughout the entire organization.
Generate data to support reporting (ad-hoc and standardized).
Follow and help develop database team standards and methodologies; use source control and build management procedures to ensure stable development, staging and production database environments.
Enhance, refactor, and continuously improve the database schemas and related code.
Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical people.
Solve business needs with short-term deliverables, while constantly improving and moving towards long-term architectural goals.
Generate new ideas, never say or think "that's not my job."
Be proactive in keeping your skills fresh
Qualifications and Experience
5+ years of T-SQL development experience in SQL Server.
3+ years of experience developing ETL processes with SQL Server Integration Services, Pentaho, or other tools. Bonus points for having developed ETL processes with Python and AWS.
2+ years of experience in development with Python 3.
1+ years of experience developing on AWS and Linux.
Mastery of advanced database design methodologies and experience with database modeling tools, dimensional modeling and statistical analysis
Clear understanding of SQL Server best practices for development of stored procedures, views, tables, security objects, indexes, etc.
Experience with any of the following is a plus: Postgres, SQL Server Reporting Services, MongoDB, Redis, Exasol
An appreciation for pragmatism and simplicity in code.
A strong code and architecture design sensibility.
Customized mathematical skills as determined by the requirements of the job

This position will influence decision makers, represent and promote ThoughtFocus’ business solutions to customers, and provide post-sales support to drive sell-through, solution implementation, and usage.

Contributes to and shapes ThoughtFocus’ sales and client service solutions and capabilities relevant to local market needs and competitive dynamics

Who We Are

ThoughtFocus is a privately held IT services, software engineering and business process management firm with offices in the US, India and the Philippines. We support clients in the financial services, manufacturing, education, aerospace and technology industries with their key business and technology challenges. ThoughtFocus brings critical program acceleration to client initiatives while minimizing costs and risks with intellectual capital, technical and process frameworks, operating models and software infrastructure. We have 1,800+ employees globally and are growing rapidly across all its offices. In the U.S., ThoughtFocus has locations in California, New York, Texas and Wisconsin. As an organization, ThoughtFocus strives to build lasting relationships. ThoughtFocus was founded in 2004 and continues to be an employee-owned company.

Life at ThoughtFocus

ThoughtFocus is a global company that brings together skilled professionals from many diverse industries and experiences. Within a broad framework of teamwork, knowledge sharing, and collaboration, we encourage our associates to achieve and excel in ways they may never have imagined for themselves.

Solving complicated client problems requires great people. ThoughtFocus is a firm built on the talent of its people. We work hard every day to nurture and expand the capabilities of our team members. As a member of the ThoughtFocus team, you will be challenged every day to deliver innovative business solutions, elegant technology, and sophisticated business services focused on our client’s end goals.

What is the role?

The Sales Development Representative (SDR) is at the front lines of our growth initiative and as the experts in consumer identity management, our potential at Infutor Data Solutions is limitless. What this means for the ambitious and self-starting professional at the beginning of their career is the ability to nurture your entrepreneurial skills, express your ability to innovate and significantly impact the growth trajectory of Infutor Data Solutions.

The Sales Development Representative position is the training ground for a successful career in tech sales. As part of the Business Development Team, you'll help Account Executives cultivate leads and sell Infutor to businesses. As you ramp up in the SDR role, you'll begin to nurture leads of your own through research, creating outreach strategies and identifying sales opportunities.

Through mastering the Sales Development Representative position and demonstrating high performance and commitment to excellence, you will have the opportunity for career development and advancement within sales. Here's how you would get there:

Your first 3-6 months:
Learn the Infutor Data Solutions' product and messaging
Learn the tools necessary to be successful: SFDC, Outreach.io, prospecting, scripts, objection handling, product info, etc.
Build relationships with your Account Executive, Solution Engineering, and Customer Success Manager counterparts
Leverage any opportunity you can to learn the market and the business
Consistently meet goals for initial presentation setup

6-15 months:
Continue to build on your core skills and product/industry knowledge
Know what it takes to meet or exceed your goals and maintain the momentum to do so
Begin to expand your knowledge of Inside Sales duties and responsibilities
Work with mentors to set goals for yourself to gain consideration for promotion

What does it take?

Capability of understanding customer pain points, requirements and correlating potential business value that can be provided by Infutor
Exceptional communication skills, both oral and written, coupled with excellent listening skills and a positive and energetic phone presence
Be an agile learner who is coachable and intellectually curious

Who are we?

Infutor Data Solutions LLC helps clients accurately identify key consumer identity and attribute data, enabling them to make critical, strategic business decisions. Our Identity Graph combines 30+ years of rich, historical consumer data with hundreds of unique, hard-to-find data assets, updated daily with 97.5 million transactions. This information provides insights into the complete life journey of a consumer, driving marketing effectiveness and optimization.

Why join us?

Great company culture – Designated a "Best to Place to Work" in the Chicagoland area by Crain's Chicago Business, Built In Chicago, and Tech in Motion, as voted by our employees.
Unlimited Growth Opportunity - Our customer base is not saturated and transcends all industries; we believe in promoting from within and offer plenty of room to grow!

What you'll get in return:
Our benefits are subject to change, and offered to Full-Time, Permanent Employees.

In addition to an exciting career in data and analytics, you will receive:

Competitive Base Salary + Sales Incentive Program
Employee Referral Bonus Program
401k Company Match
100% employer paid monthly premiums for Employee Only Coverage for Medical, Dental, & Vision
100% employer paid Group Term Life Insurance, Accidental Death & Personal Loss Insurance, and Long-Term Disability
A variety of medical and prescription drug insurance plan options available through our provider, BlueCross BlueShield of Illinois, including a Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) Plan, two Point-Of-Service (POS) Plans, and a High Deductible Health Plan (HDHP)
Dental (Principal) and Vision (VSP) insurance
Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs) for Healthcare and Dependent Care through WageWorks; Healthcare Spending Account (HSA) is available when you choose the HDHP
Commuter Benefit Program for eligible parking, transit, and ride share expenses through WageWorks
Paid Time Off for vacation, illness, and parental leave.
Company sponsored office parties, events and much more

SUMMARY

This position is responsible for overseeing the daily operations of Armada’s client deductions including product and freight claims, from inception to resolution of deductions while emphasizing the company’s strategic objectives surrounding deductions, including trend and root cause analysis and reduction/elimination of deduction volume. The ideal candidate will possess keen dispute resolution skills, be adept at regulatory guidance research, and be heavily process and policy driven. In order to provide comprehensive deductions guidance to execute, support, and grow the business, the candidate must be able to successfully develop and foster relationships both inside and outside of Armada, and be comfortable presenting to and speaking with Armada leadership.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Supervises the deductions (including product and freight claims) team personnel and ensures coverage of all aspects of deductions process.
Manages overage, shortage, and damage claims and customer deduction process to ensure accurate and timely resolution.
Responsible for determination of “disputed” claims with a value of >$250 and <$5,000.
Collaborates with customer service, accounts receivable, accounts payable, warehouse personnel, vendors, DCs, field services, supply planning, and account management to resolve issues.
Proactively engages with cross functional strategic leads to provide visibility, report trends, improve process and policy, and engage for issue resolution.
Develops, executes, and maintains procedures to provide a consistent deductions process with strong internal control environment. Recommends enhancements to the current control environment as applicable.
Educates organization and external stakeholders on compliance to the deductions and claims policies.
Recommends and executes projects for continuous improvements in the areas of technology systems, procedures, and policies to ensure adherence to company guidelines, add efficiency, and automate.
Designs and implements programs to periodically report key performance indicators as well as special supplemental analyses upon request. Specific focus will be on actionable trend analysis, root cause analysis, and opportunities to reduce exposure and expense. Recommends course of action to achieve success in those areas.
Prepares historical trend analysis reporting of deductions activity. Performs root cause analysis to drive proactive solutions to systemic problems. Identifies areas of opportunity to reduce exposure and expense, recommends course of action to achieve reduction.
Establishes strong relationships with external client stakeholders to increase success in the periodic escalation of deductions resolution.
Coaches and evaluates direct and indirect employees to enhance their performance, development, and work product. Addresses performance issues and makes recommendations for personnel actions.
Responsive, assertive, and courteous but firm in managing relationship with customers, suppliers, and internal cross functional partners.
Adheres to finance policies, procedures and internal controls.

QUALIFICATIONS

Education and Experience Requirement

Minimum Education:
BS/BA Degree Bus Admin, Accounting or Finance or a minimum of 6+ years of AR Managerial experience

Minimum Experience:
3-5 years in AR process flows
3-5 years of supervisory / management experience

Language and Technical Skills requirement

Transaction oriented with detailed understanding of process flows
Well-developed analytic and problem-solving skills
Excellent organizational and communication skills
Ability to work with cross-functionally
Knowledge of JD Edwards ERP preferred
Basic MS Excel knowledge
Motivated and intellectually curious

Physical Demands and Work Environment

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Work is usually performed in an office environment with normal noise levels. Involves prolonged sitting, and computer/phone usage.

Disclaimer

This job description is not intended, and should not be construed to be, an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills, efforts or working conditions associated with the job. It is intended, however, to be an accurate reflection of those principal job elements essential for making decisions related to job performance, employee development and compensation. As such, the incumbent may perform other duties and responsibilities as required. Its contents imply no contractual obligation and may be changed by the company at any time.

Position Purpose: This position is responsible for contributions to the development, maintenance, and execution of analysis as assigned. The position will be reporting to the Director of Analytics and will support various departments within PHP. The analyst will have exposure to multiple streams of data in which to develop the appropriate programs, measures, models, and reports in support of enterprise strategic goals.

Primary Responsibilities:
Ability to identify necessary data elements for tracking to improve performance.
Leverage statistical methods to highlight areas of opportunity for the plan.
Assists in testing enterprise data sources, making recommendations as needed.
Responsible for data and information compilation and analysis; developing and designing clear and concise reports for distribution to internal and external customers.
Documents all existing processes, methodologies, and deliverables.
Identifies, designs, and implements reporting processes. Evaluates functional needs for the various departments. Determines the appropriate data sources and appropriate tools to generate reports in accordance with business needs, including assisting departments with their own ad-hoc reports.
Coordinates efforts between Analytics and functional business partners in the development of deliverables and/or analysis.
Provides related reports and studies as assigned by the Director of Analytics.
Participates in company-wide and departmental quality management activities.
Participates in training on URAC standards pertinent to position, and adheres to same.
Participates in training on federal and state regulations applicable to position, and adheres to same.
Performs any relevant and related duties as required.

Critical Required Skills:
Proficient with SAS, SQL server database, R, Microsoft Office Suite, Power BI, and other tools as needed.
Ability to query data using available systems to complete analysis and reporting requirements. Able to understand custom database layout(s), format, and information usage.
Proficient with pertinent systems and software packages necessary to access required information (e.g., claims, financials, fees).
Analytical abilities required to manipulate data programs used in generating descriptive reports and in their corresponding analysis.
Strong computer-based skills, ability to generate concise outputs, visualizations, and other documentation relative to analysis.
Organizational skills necessary to coordinate and prioritize workload and to maintain tracking systems and related information in a readily retrievable format.
Strong logical and analytical skills, a proven problem solver, detail oriented.
Must be self-directed with the ability to prioritize efforts, deadlines, and coordinate multiple tasks concurrently. Ability to work with diverse groups of individuals in achieving required results.
Highly effective oral and written communication skills, with the ability to present findings to an audience and field questions regarding analysis.
An understanding of medical coding (e.g., ICD, CPT) and business terminology preferred.

Key Challenges:
Effective use of technology and computer systems.
Building and maintenance of data/information sources to support decisions.
Understanding system limitations, working within the system, and working toward solutions/improvements.
Understanding, developing, and implementing basic components of risk analysis (e.g., health status, premium revenue, participation, industry classifications, demographic analysis).
Ability to cleanse, prepare, and present data relative to analysis in understandable and useful format for consumption.
Understanding of healthcare operations, fully-insured and ASO.
Managing multiple priorities and relationships in an effective and efficient manner.
Ability to work with diverse internal professional staff (e.g., Actuarial, Underwriting, Contracting, Sales and Employer Service) to produce effective results.

Qualifications

Experience: A Bachelor’s Degree is preferred with three to five (3-5) years of professional experience in order to demonstrate a thorough knowledge of accepted analysis methods and to fully understand sophisticated data systems. Programming and report generation skills required.

Position Constraints: This individual must function effectively in a stressful, time-oriented, customer service environment. Will require significant amounts of time involved in mental analysis of large and diverse quantities of information. Strong computer skills required.

Content Strategist Job Description

CONTENT WRITER/STRATEGIST
(CWS)

Job Description

The Content
Writer/Strategist will also provide insights and recommendations that can
improve content at the core of the client’s customer experience. He or she
should possess a deep understanding of best practices for content creation and
content management, taxonomy, content authoring workflows and should understand
content governance and the value of user input. Ideally, this individual should
have an in-depth understanding of content creation and the ability to
understand complex scientific (Life Science) content.

The Content Writer/strategist will oversee
content requirements and create content strategy deliverables across a project
life cycle. This may include conducting content audits as well as gap analyses.
He or she will also create and contribute to content migration plans as needed.

The Content Writer/Strategist is a high-level
thinker with a penchant for keeping track of details. This person must be an
idea generator and problem solver with excellent communication and
organizational skills. He or she must possess the analytical abilities
necessary to gather key business and user insights, and apply strategic
planning skills to create a long-term vision for the content that’s generated.

This position requires a highly experienced writer and
message strategist in marketing communications development. This person is
responsible for developing an intimate understanding of the market, products,
and solutions in order to write and edit all messaging and content related to
the marketing communications and campaigns for those accounts. This person
should have the knowledge and experience to be able to research and write full
websites, e-mails, and other online media.

Essential Functions

The Content Writer/Strategist will work closely with
the Strategy, Account and Editorial teams in brief development at the campaign,
program, and project level. He or she will also be involved in ongoing
research, which will enable him/her to drive/develop compelling content for
professional or consumer audiences. Content strategist will be responsible for

the following:
·
Creation of core message development related to
key marketing campaigns (i.e. Theme, Value Proposition, Core Content elements)

·
Involved in concept and idea generation in
collaboration with design teams

·
Provide guidance, approval, and life-cycle
management of content and message across all assets related to key marketing
campaigns and communication assets

·
Assess
existing client content to identify strengths, weaknesses, gaps and
inconsistencies, as well as opportunities

·
Provide
thought leadership on content creation objective and promotional messaging best
practices

·
Manage all aspects of content strategy, from analysis and strategic
planning to influencing the ongoing creation, maintenance, and governance of
content that serves user needs and helps achieve measurable business objectives

·
Create
content strategies to define the what, how much, when, where, why and how for
digital content across multiple channels

·
Plan and facilitate discovery workshops to gather stakeholder input and
align project goals for content management; follow up planning, facilitation,
and analysis of workshop output

·
Provide
thought leadership to develop POVs on key content issues like search, sharing,
user-generated content, and content distribution

·
Outline
content maintenance processes and gain maintenance stakeholder buy-in.

·
Perform content audits and make recommendations for future enhancements

·
Create and
maintain editorial calendars

·
Define standards for the content lifecycle and framework

·
Develop content requirements, including structured content, reuse
opportunities, and adaptive content recommendations

Additional
content creation responsibilities responsibilities may also include:

·
Provide accurate and thorough reference
information for written materials per AMA guidelines

·
Research, write, and revise content to be used
in communications assets including Web sites, online advertising, e-mails,
social media, promotional materials, brochures, and interactive content

·
Produce scripts in concert with in-house editors
and proofreaders that meet or exceed client standards

·
Develop high quality content for interactive
media within branding standards

·
Ensure adherence to compliance and regulatory
issues

·
Collaborate with team to ensure quality and
timeliness of material

CONTENT STRATEGIST

Job description:
The core function of the content
strategist’s job is developing a content strategy based on a company’s or
client’s business objectives and a customer’s or end user’s needs. The Content Strategist
will lead the development of content strategies, working with copy, design and
development teams to provide insights and recommendations that can improve
content at the core of the client’s customer experience. He or she should
possess a deep understanding of best practices for content creation and content
management, taxonomy, metadata, content authoring workflows and should
understand content governance and the value of user input. Ideally, this
individual should also have an in-depth understanding of content creation and
the ability to understand complex scientific (Life Science) content.

The content strategist will
oversee content requirements and create content strategy deliverables across a
project life cycle. This can include conducting content audits (qualitative
analyses of all the content on a network of sites and social media accounts) as
well as gap analyses. He or she will also create and contribute to
content migration plans.

The content strategist is a
high-level thinker with a penchant for keeping track of details. This person
must be an idea generator and problem solver with excellent communication and
organizational skills. He or she must possess the analytical abilities
necessary to gather key business and user insights, and apply their strategic
planning skills to create a long-term vision for the content that’s generated.

Essential functions:
·
Managing all aspects of content strategy, from analysis
and strategic planning to influencing the ongoing creation, maintenance, and
governance of content that serves user needs and helps achieve measurable
business objectives

·
Create content strategies to define the what, how much, when, where, why
and how for digital content across multiple channels

·
Planning and facilitating discovery workshops to gather
stakeholder input and align project goals for content management; follow up
planning, facilitation, and analysis of workshop output

·
Assess existing client content to identify strengths, weaknesses, gaps and
inconsistencies, as well as opportunities

·
Provide thought leadership on content creation objective and promotional
messaging best practices

·
Provide thought leadership to develop POVs on key content issues like
search, sharing, user-generated content, and content distribution

·
Identify opportunities for content testing and measurement. Partner with
the Analytics group to implement testing and measurement

·
Outline content maintenance processes and gain maintenance stakeholder
buy-in. Monitor and evolve ongoing processes

·
Performing content audits, participating in heuristic
reviews and review analytics to make recommendations for future enhancements

·
Creating and maintaining editorial calendars, taxonomies, metadata
frameworks and content migration plans

·
Defining standards for the content lifecycle and framework

·
Developing metrics for content measurement

·
Developing content requirements, including structured
content, reuse opportunities, and adaptive content recommendations

·
Designing and documenting a consistent, relevant, and
on-brand tone across a range of customer touch points

·
Keeping up to date on breaking technologies and
methodologies that allow for more innovative and dynamic content approaches

·
Assisting with the technical integration of content

Required skills and experience:
·
Experience developing and delivering content strategy approaches
and content migration planning

·
Copywriting experience/content creation/writing background
a plus

Ability to collaborate with the
internal digital team to gather business requirements and translate them into
effective, user-centered interactive approaches

·

·

relate content

·

skills
