As a data-driven company, GoDaddy is seeking a talented and highly-motivated analyst to join our Business Analytics team. On the BA team, you will be integral to our company growth through the insights you uncover and the thoughtful recommendations you make. You will join forces with leaders of the Domain Registrars and Investors business unit to understand performance through data. You must be able to tell a clear and succinct story from the data and communicate findings to the executive team.

We are seeking team members that are passionate, extraordinary, analytical, strategic, and inquisitive. The right person will raise the profile and excellence of our entire team. You can make a difference here!

Responsibilities:
Support leaders of the Domain Registrars and Investors business unit by understanding their goals and objectives, developing analytic requirements, providing answers to business questions, making recommendations, and joining forces in driving business improvement and optimization.
Use data to tell a story. Conduct in-depth analytics to identify meaningful insights, suggest recommendations and influence the direction of the business by effectively communicating findings to Global multi-functional groups.
Build dynamic and rich dashboards. Show results in easy-to-understand visualizations that help our partners understand their business and its drivers.
Build end-to-end reporting solutions from multiple data structures and sources. Support the design, development and implementation of enterprise-wide views, dashboards and custom reporting.
Connect customer, sales, renewals, product usage, and churn data to get a complete picture of our Domain Investor customer segment

Requirements:
Minimum 2 years of relevant work experience in analytics, preferably in SaaS/subscription space.
Experience using SQL to discover, aggregate and extract data a MUST. Large dataset experience a plus.
Experience with data visualization and business intelligence tools like Tableau, Google Analytics, or other programs.
Good communication skills, with the ability to explain and summarize complex analysis clearly and succinctly, and to support conclusions with thoughtfully selected visualizations.
Ability to partner and collaborate across teams in multiple time zones, context switching between technical discussions of databases and queries to business discussion's around customer behavior and optimization of marketing dollars.
Familiarity with analytical techniques, including trend analysis, forecasting, and experiment design.
Bachelor’s degree in quantitative field such Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, Economics, etc… Postgrad degree a plus.

We are looking for a great data scientist for our Quickbooks Online (QBO) business. Quickbooks is used by over 5MM SMBs globally to run their businesses and we are the team responsible for using our data to answer the most critical questions facing the QBO Product Managers and Marketers. Everything from understanding the trends in our subscriber growth to shaping our product strategy through A/B testing and more happens within our team and we need top data scientists to help the business deliver the best possible product to our SMB customers. We are growing rapidly and need great people to support our analytical efforts in both Product and Marketing.

What does it take to thrive on our team? You need to be a top-notch problem solver and problem identifier. It’s also a good idea to know the standard suite of analytical tools - SQL, R/Python, some sort of data visualization tool – but we’re more interested in your ability to quickly learn new tools as the set of tools available is constantly evolving. Last, knowing that in most cases done is better than perfect is important - getting the current problem right to the sixth decimal place is almost always less impactful than getting to the next problem.

If this role sounds interesting go check out the product (https://quickbooks.intuit.com/) and if you find this exciting, then we look forward to hearing from you!

The HRIS & People Analytics Business Partner is responsible for managing and overseeing the design, analysis, and maintenance of HR systems in support of HR administration. This will be accomplished through understanding systems as well as interpretation of business through data analytics, resulting in the leverage of technology in solving issues and supporting business requirements. This role will effectively implement and manage HRIS processes, optimizing quality and cost of service for the business. This person will be responsible for defining, developing, testing, analyzing, reporting and maintaining the HR systems and future HR technologies as well as informing strategy through leveraging people data.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Provide project leadership for projects and initiatives as related to HR information system(s) including but not limited to payroll, benefits, ATS, timekeeping, reporting.
Partners with HR leaders and/or business unit leaders on system solution design/project management. Meet with stakeholders to define business needs. Respond and resolve help desk inquiries. Track and report on overall quantity and type of help desk requests and resolutions. Identify areas needed for extra training or communication, including system or process updates. Initiate efforts and procedures to maintain data integrity, troubleshoot and recommend solutions and best practices.
Prepare, coordinate and distribute reporting and people analytics for HR leadership team and the organization on a regular basis.
Coordinate resources, schedules, and communications for assigned projects.
Assists in the planning and implementation of specific HR departmental projects, such as integration of software and education of staff as related to HR technologies.
Representative for HR during new hire onboarding for HRIS end-user training; educate employees on HR systems.
Identifies new HR needs and the software products to fulfill these needs.
Complete(?) projects and execute project plans while driving change management strategies. Provide support including researching and resolving problems, unexpected results, or process flaws; recommending solutions or alternate methods to meet requirements, build efficiencies and drive optimization.
Write, maintain and support a variety of reports or queries using appropriate reporting tools. Assist in development of standard reports. Maintain data integrity in systems by running queries and analyzing data. Partner effectively with HR, IT, Finance and other functions to ensure appropriate flow of data and reporting. Assist in the review, testing and implementation of system upgrades. Document process and results. Develop user procedures, guidelines and documentation. Trains new system users as needed and ensure successful implementation of change
Recommend process improvements, innovative solutions and ways to remain compliant with policy and legal change
Direct responsibility for EDI feed development and testing validation; coordination and communication with relevant external vendors.
Maintain required HRIS information by designing, implementing, training and/or communicating efficient record keeping systems globally – writing and updating policy and procedure.
Develop, implement, and manage processes to ensure accurate collection, calculation, and entering of data within system to ensure systemic data integrity.
Develop and facilitate training programs to support maximizing technology and automation of processes.
Prepare, coordinate and distribute reporting and people analytics for organization on a regular basis.
Regularly audit systems to ensure data accuracy.
Other duties and projects as assigned.

Qualifications:
3-5 years of experience in a lead or supervisory role within HRIS required. Experience developing and implementing strategies related to HRIS preferred.
3-5 years of experience as a HRIS Analyst experience required working with leadership to identify reporting needs, manipulating data, and developing reports that meet those needs.
3-5 years of experience utilizing UltiPro preferred.
Experience providing HRIS support for Payroll and analytics required.
2+ years developing and implementing system applications and conversions required.
Ability to train and support immediate team members as well as organization’s global employees in new technology implementations.
Strong project management skills as well as evidence of experience playing a key role in system upgrades or implementation.
Strong analytical skills coupled with expert-level reporting skills required.
Strong interpersonal, written, verbal, and presentation communication skills, with the ability to develop a high degree of personal credibility across the business unit and corporate locations.
High energy level, strong sense of urgency, proactive, resourceful, resilient and well organized.

ETHOS:
At 5.11 Tactical, everyone has the opportunity to be a leader and perform in an exceptional manner. We strive to uphold our Ethos which defines our culture – Trusted, Responsive, Accountable and Committed.

Trusted
Strive to create trust in everything we do, starting with self-trust and relationship trust. We work on the components of integrity, intent, capability and results.
Responsive
Listen to the needs of our end-user Professionals, then develop, produce and deliver solutions to their problems. Each of us chooses to be a leader and takes charge of what is within our circle of influence.
Accountable
Seek to achieve results with a bias for action. We like to compete and be measured against the most demanding standards to ensure our continued success.
Committed
Overcome obstacles to accomplish our goals and support our team members when challenges arise. We complete commitments and seek to ‘over-deliver” relative to expectations

It is 5.11 practice to hire at age 18 and older

Do you have a passion for and a desire to shape the business insights into a competitive differentiator and elevate to the next level in business reporting? Desire a pivotal role in the transformation of BI & Analytics capability for a global business that is immersed in Microsoft’s full product and services catalog?

Microsoft Services

We are dedicated to delivering on Microsoft’s mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As one of the largest divisions inside Microsoft - with over 22,000 employees worldwide - the diverse team includes architects, consultants, support professionals, sales, and business leaders who serve customers in 191 countries and 46 languages. Simply put, we help customers get the most out of their technology investments. We are proud to be the face of Microsoft to many of our customers and partners. The power of that connection, in addition to understanding how they use our products, helps us deliver the voice of our customers back to our business groups to make our technology and Microsoft even better.

The Services Insights team is chartered to enable positive business outcomes by driving right behaviors and decisions through bold insights. This team understands the business goals, strategic drivers, success outcomes and associated behaviors, leading to the findings and insights needed to support the business outcomes. You will partner to meet a spectrum of demand across insights, analytics, decision-boards & scorecards.

Services Insights function endeavors to foster an insights-driven culture, to encourage and enable the entire organization to make more informed decisions through bold insights. Your passion and desire to define and enact the vision for insights & analytics will shape this function into a competitive differentiator. Come join a team where you can enable data insights that drives multi-billion-dollar business.

Sr. Business Analytics & Insights Lead

We are looking for seasoned analytics lead who can drive the vision and strategy for our new role-based experiences focused on the Microsoft Global Enterprise Support Business. You will be responsible to lead the next generation BI platform, architect the BI and analytics integration, synthesize, merge and transform the existing BI & reporting capabilities, partner with other engineering teams and organizations to enable a world class support experience and rich insights.

Responsibilities

RESPONSIBILITIES

Engage broadly with stakeholder teams to structure and prioritize business problems where insights can have the biggest impact.
Drive highly visible, high impact and complex analytic engagements impacting the data platform and reporting/analytics ecosystem
Own the end to end insights creation-to-consumption lifecycle, leading business problem definition, hypotheses formulation, designing and delivering the solution
Be Savvy in usage and application of advanced analytics concepts in the realm of Classification, Regression, Forecasting, Decision trees, NLP & other ML techniques to yield futuristic rich and bold insights.
Design holistic solution architectures for complex business problems across reporting ecosystem. Synthesize, merge and transform the existing Insights capabilities with the new experiences
Oversee the design of the data and technical architecture of the operational data store, data lake, data mart, pipelines and other assorted reporting/distribution services.
Lead the next generation BI and Analytics experiences as a self-serve capability and modernized user experience.
Create and realize an approach that leverages a cloud first, big data-oriented techniques.
Ensure high quality, adherence to standards and best practices, high performance, and scalable, repeatable processes and deliverables.
Oversee and provide direction to a team of vendor developers, PMs to drive scale

Act as an evangelist and catalyst for insights innovation, aligned to the tactical and strategic business initiatives

Qualifications

KEY QUALIFICATIONS:
12+ years of experience in BI/reporting/analytics, strong passion for solving big challenges with demonstrated history of innovative thinking and problem-solving skills
Experience building and operationalizing complex, large scale, highly available BI experiences
Experience in full development lifecycle of an Analytics platform
Strong design and architecture skills with bias for BI, with demonstrated experience in using industry standard practices to requirements, design and development
Strong skills and experience in Microsoft BI stack, SQL, Integration & Analysis Services, Power BI and preferred skills in big data technologies, ADL, Hadoop
Some experience and desire to learn machine learning (Azure ML, Python) and advanced statistical modelling techniques
Excellent written and oral communication skills, particularly the ability to synthesize complex issues/scenarios into easy-to-understand concepts
Leading with engineering & information architecture partners on design & architecture
An attention to detail with self-discipline and a drive for results
Demonstrated ability to work in ambiguous situations and across organizational boundaries
A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business Information Systems, or closely related field

Location/Travel – You will be based in Sammamish/Issaquah near Microsoft HQ. You can expect limited global travel, less than 10%.

JOB SUMMARY

The Director Analytics is responsible for direct management of the Analytics team and working with account teams and their clients to undertake client analytics, back office analytics and decision modeling - including report design, data capture development and implementation processes. This candidate will work with a variety of data sources to continuously evolve the metrics used to measure the effectiveness and ROI of activity across all campaign types.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

Assist in business development and growth by working with partners and clients in developing and implementing new analytical methodologies with a targeted result of increasing revenue.
Provide marketing performance analysis for client engagements. Understand client’s business goals and requirements, design and develop analytic approaches tailored to its needs.
Work with internal and external stakeholders to develop client tools and services such as modeling, dashboard development, decision aids and business case analysis to support programs, creative and recommended solutions.
Work closely with the team in making specific and actionable client recommendations and sell in additional client engagements.
Develop data strategies (e.g. what we should capture, how we should capture it, and the triggers/decisioning as a result, etc.).
Partner seamlessly across the enterprise to access information and create and drive strategies and implementation.
Determine and implement operations procedures and lead the analytic group in the management of projects and resources.
Cultivate solid relationships with staff, internal partners and clients.
Marshal change to align with vision of the department and organization.
Manage a team of 4-6 employees.
Promote process and organizational efficiency through automation.

KEY COMPETENCIES

6+ years of experience in marketing analytics or business intelligence (focused in analytics).
Experience in the digital media space is a must.
Demonstrated ability to apply cutting edge analytics techniques to business problems and to leverage external thinking (from academia and/or other industries).
Ability to translate data into insights that understand customer needs and behavioral drivers.
Must have a good understanding of statistical modeling, segmentation, value analysis, as well as reporting for web site, online advertising, social media, mobile, e-mail campaigns and e-commerce activity.
Must be capable of contributing expertise and leading efforts both in advanced analytics techniques and in ad effectiveness research and analysis.
Must have a track record of implementing operational excellence (process efficiencies, effective tools and technologies) in an analytics function.
Will be able to show they have exhibited leadership with conviction and how they have proposed new paths based on analysis findings.
Promotes a culture of collaboration and teamwork across organizational boundaries: ability to share techniques with analytical community.
Strong knowledge of strategic marketing, media, social, web site analysis, audience targeting tools and vendors, including both quantitative tracking and ad effectiveness research methodologies.

IA and OS certs per DoD 8570

The National Leader will help drive the analytics strategy for total cost of care initiatives related to national vendors and providers across the $60 billion medical spend portfolio. The leader will drive the savings and return on investment pricing expectations for initiatives. Engage directly with vendor partners to design contractual utilization and unit cost criteria, performance guarantees and vendor payment levels. Operate across the enterprise to align clinical, network and operations leaders to savings and timing targets.

This will include:
Drive the strategy for national vendor cost of care savings delivery
Set pricing targets for trend reduction timing and savings on national providers
Develop analytic framework for utilization, site of service and unit cost contributions to overall initiative savings
Direct engagement with internal partners and external vendors to set measurable, accountable performance metrics for programs
Evaluate internal vs. external vendor alignment of programs and speed to market
Consult with clinical and network leaders for access and quality of care implications
Engagement of local market teams to deliver savings opportunities
Drive expansion of programs to the Medicare line of business

Key financial impacts:
Direct financial accountability for providers driving $3-4 billion of claim activity (National ancillary vendors & providers)
Drive actions to improve the penetration and revenue of our service channels(eviCore/Accredo)
Financial assessment and litigation support for provider payment matters

Duties and Responsibilities
Working with the national and regional management teams and other key personnel, oversee the effective analyses of healthcare provider level data to determine ROI and key levers to ensure strategic development of initiatives that drive favorable quality and affordability outcomes for Cigna customers
Ongoing communication & identification of cost reduction opportunities and quality improvements via comparative analyses utilizing various benchmarking capabilities
Drive change initiatives to address prospective business needs. Acts as catalyst through multiple layers to spark enthusiasm, collaboration and results
Communication with and influencing of key matrix partners to ensure goals and targets are met
Responsible for overseeing, consulting and executing healthcare initiative analytics in support of these initiatives and accuracy of achieved results in support of pricing functions
Support the development of policies and procedures to ensure adequate controls are in place for the review and signoff of new and existing programs

GEICO’s Data Science team uses predictive analytics and innovative machine learning models to create value from data. We solve problems across GEICO, from Marketing to Claims and Underwriting, and are responsible for developing and driving strategic modeling initiatives. We see our projects through the entire data science lifecycle, from problem definition to data exploration, data munging, modeling, analysis, and deployment into production systems. We maintain a close partnership with IT to ensure that our models can be deployed quickly and monitored in a flexible deployment framework.

As a Data Scientist, you will be a member of this diverse and highly skilled team. On any given day, you may be exploring new data sets with a business or IT partner, learning the intricacies of a business process, building models, or coordinating the productionalization of a model. You will use a variety of tools (including SQL, Python, R, Spark, and shell scripting) in a variety of environments (including various databases, Linux servers, and Hadoop). You’ll work in a highly collaborative, team environment where you will quickly develop wide ranging exposure to new methods and best practices for conducting data science in a commercial environment.

Expected Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline, such as statistics, data science, computer science, mathematics, engineering, physics, etc. Advanced degree strongly preferred

2+ years of combined academic/industry experience with predictive modeling, machine learning, advanced analytics

Solid understanding and experience with advanced statistics and modern machine learning predictive techniques such as GLMs, decision trees, forests, boosted ensembles, neural networks, deep learning, etc.

Strong coding skills using common data science tools, such as Python (strongly preferred), R, Linux/Unix command line and shell scripting, etc.

Strong skills in data processing using SQL, Hive, Impala, Spark, or equivalent querying language

Familiarity with distributed storage and big data computing technology (AWS, Hadoop, Spark, etc.)

Excellent communication skills

Passion for extracting hidden insights and building machine learning systems that enhance business outcomes

The Head of Business Intelligence & Advanced Analytics (BIA) defines the data warehousing, business intelligence and advanced analytics capabilities for the organization. He/she will manage the BIA office and lead in planning, evaluating, and selecting the right tools and data science capabilities for the enterprise, and ensures that distributed analytics teams have the best data and analytics skills, processes, and technologies available to produce measurable business outcomes. He/she will serve as an advisor to the leadership team to develop and deliver enterprise-wide solutions for complex data challenges, including developing and applying algorithmic models to derive insights, improve decision making, and automate processes.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Defining Data & Analytics Strategy: Identifies and standardizes the use of data, analytics and related artificial intelligence capabilities. Builds and sustains a center of excellence from the ground up; this includes the governance of algorithms used for data analysis. Creates value by unlocking and sharing data and information in ways which will spur innovation.
Identifying and Defining Data & Analytics Investments: Works with business and IT leaders to identify areas of technical needs for future data science capabilities. Drives the development and deployment of the data warehousing and analytics platform. Identifies and prioritizes business projects and enterprise data initiatives utilizing data science capabilities.
Advising and Reporting: Serves as the Data Analytics technical advisor. Represents the BIA team and enterprise data stewards at leadership meetings and conferences. Develops and gives oral presentations on the power and value of data. Leads and/or serves on steering committees and helps leadership use its data effectively at these meetings.
Facilitating Internal and External Collaboration: Collaborates with industry data experts to allow a proactive approach to improving insights derived from various data sources. Applies expert knowledge and mastery of advanced mathematics/statistical/computer science methods, theories, and standards to analyze enterprise results and reports, relevant external publications, and conference papers. Recommends and pursues collaboration and provides appropriate technical guidance to ensure the success of such collaborations. Interacts with business areas and IT on BIA solutions.
Identifying Opportunities for New Data Products: Lead strategy development for BIA products to ensure the program becomes pervasive throughout the organization and helps enable new revenue streams. To support these endeavors, collaborates with the CIO/CTO to ensure that digital products are released on time, on budget and with high quality. Be a champion for the information services and related BIA capabilities.

Supervisory Responsibilities

This job has supervisory responsibilities for a team of BIA employees (BI Architects, Senior Analytics Analysts, Data Warehousing Specialists, matrixed Program Manager and contracting resources).

Education and/or Experience

At least 5 years’ experience defining strategic initiatives and overseeing the development of long-term plans and proposals
10 years of progressively responsible relevant experience in business intelligence and data architecture, including creating partnerships, implementing BI and data integration strategies, and understanding the underlying technologies needed to enable productivity and innovation across a midsized or large organization
Proven experience driving business, culture, and technology change in dynamic and complex operating environments
Demonstrated ability to effectively coordinate, allocate, and manage resources and projects throughout multiple teams
Knowledge of trends and developments in the fields of data management and data analytics
Information management and quantitative skills, including working knowledge of IT infrastructure, various technologies/platforms, and enterprise-specific vendor solutions
Industry-specific knowledge of data security protocols, policies, and regulations
Good analytical, written, oral, and presentation skills with proven track record of effectively communicating actionable insights
Strong diplomatic skills and ability to help senior business leaders see value, opportunities, and risks beyond their own area of expertise
Ability to understand problems from a broad perspective and anticipate the impact of administrative issues and solutions
Experience in computer programming, query languages, and internet based data visualization platforms such as Tableau are also preferred
Demonstrated experience with developing data strategy, policies, and procedures, as well as successfully executing programs that meet or exceed expectations in a dynamic environment; experience creating tools and capabilities to assist with data discovery & collaboration, ensure data quality, and to load, clean, enrich, manage, and share data and metadata from a variety of sources
Familiar with big data technologies (e.g. Hadoop, HBase, Lucene) and Extract Transform Load (ETL) tools
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Analytics, Computer Science or related fields; master’s preferred.

Amazon has the world’s richest collection of e-commerce data: Hundreds of millions of customers and products, billions of transactions, petabytes of data. A core part of the operations is forecasting: We forecast the demand of tens of millions of products up to a year into the future. The forecasts are used to automatically order hundreds of millions worth of inventory weekly, to establish labor plans for over hundreds of warehouses, and to predict the company’s financial performance.

The Demand Forecasting Science team seeks a Business Intelligence Engineer to join our team. Demand Forecasting leads the development of novel algorithms toward the ultimate goal of accurately predicting customer demand for millions of products world-wide. This drives down supply chain costs and enables the offer of lower prices and better in-stock selection for our customers. We need a creative, smart and enthusiastic thought leader with a background in data analysis and analytics ready to help us identify our best opportunities for improvement and make key business decisions.

Responsibilities
Understanding the opportunities for improvement and partnering with PMs, Science and Engineering to design solutions to tough forecasting problems.Implement analyses that drive to the root of the issue and create actionable insights or paths to solution.Build customer-facing reporting tools to provide insights and metrics which track forecast performanceCommunicate and earn trust with our customers in retail & our downstream systemsDevelop solutions that utilize the highest standards of analytical rigor and data integrity.4+ years of relevant experience in business analytics or business intelligence with hands-on experience in writing complex, highly-optimized SQL queries across large data sets.Advanced ability to draw insights from data and clearly communicate them to the stakeholders and senior management as required.Experience in developing automated business intelligence systemProficiency in at least one statistical software package such as R, Python, Stata, or MatlabFamiliarity with supply chain management concepts including forecasting, planning and optimization

RN Clinical Data Abstractor - Cardiovascular - Full Time

HCA Healthcare Mountain Division (Work Location - Bountiful, Utah)

Do you want to be a part of a family and not just another employee? Are you looking for a work environment where diversity and inclusion thrive? Submit your application today and find out what it truly means to be a part of a team. We have an exciting opportunity for you to join the nation's largest provider of healthcare services as a Clinical Data Abstractor.

Every role has an impact on our patients’ lives and you have the opportunity to make a difference. Join us in our efforts to better our community!

At HCA Healthcare we offer you an excellent total compensation package, including competitive salary, excellent benefit package and growth opportunities. We believe in our team and your ability to do excellent work with us. Your benefits include 401k, PTO medical, dental, flex spending, life, disability, tuition reimbursement, employee discount program, employee stock purchase program and student loan repayment.

The Clinical Data Abstractor reports to the Division Clinical Abstraction Manager and is responsible for the abstraction of clinical data from a patient’s medical record and input into an electronic database for summary analysis and public reporting. Attention to detail, accuracty in abstracting clinical information, and proficiency in the required data abstraction tools will be necessary for success in this role.

The Clinical Data Abstractor tracks and validates data accuracy and timeliness in accordance with HCA policies and procedures and performs quality assurance tasks such as inter rater reliability (IRR) and validation tasks as assigned. They communicate medical record status and key project issues to management as needed, and are familiar with medical terminology and basic medical record design and requirements. This individual utilizes basic computer skills, to include the navigation of several electronic databases (Horizon Patient Folder—HPF, MEDITECH, Epic, EXCEL, Lumedx, Analytics Manager, DRCI, etc.).

HCA’s Mountain Division offers careers within 11 highly-respected and tightly integrated hospitals within Utah, Idaho and Alaska. While each site is unique in location, size, and community, all Mountain Division facilities share commonalities of compassion, patient-focused, quality care and collaborative teamwork. We know that together, we’re greater. We also know that what makes us better makes our patients better. That’s why our facilities consistently receive national recognition for superior quality and exceptional safety.

HCA’s Mountain Division hospitals are part of a network of more than 300 affiliate hospitals, outpatient centers and business offices across the country – offering employees the opportunity for travel and relocation. HCA facilities are all about caring for people, and that care extends to patients, families and employees.

If you find this opportunity compelling, we encourage you to apply. We promptly review all applications. If you are highly qualified you will hear from one of our managers. We are actively interviewing so apply today!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Qualifications

LICENSURE / CERTIFICATION:
Current RN license

LICENSURE/CERTIFICATION/REGISTRATION:
Associates degree required; Bachelor's degree preferred.

EXPERIENCE:
Minimum of 2-5 years experience in a Hospital/Acute Care setting as a Registered Nurse and/or Abstractor (Med/Surg, Cardiovascular O.R. or ICU nursing experience preferred).

CVS Health, a Healthcare Innovation company, is recruiting an experienced, enthusiastic, and innovative leader to join our Analytics organization focusing on prescription benefit management area of the enterprise. In this important role supporting one of the core functions of our business, you will work closely with multiple business partners, leading a group of analytics professionals, to deliver a range of analytic solutions to help enable data-driven decision-making to influence patient, caregiver, and prescriber experience and outcomes related to CVS Health programs and services. You will focus on analytics understanding the impact of PBM offerings on enterprise KPIs and population health, and you will help identify opportunities for analytics to drive program innovation and improvement. You will develop analytic solutions that include assessment and stratification of patient populations, their needs, and opportunities to improve convenience and cost efficiency of PBM clinical and member-centric services

The essential roles and responsibilities of the role are to:

Required Qualifications
10-15 years of progressive experience in the analytics field.Excellent ability to establish and maintain collaborative relationships with analytic and non-analytic business partners, including executive leadership, in order to elicit business needs and formulate, propose and refine analytic solutions in order to meet the business needs and to drive efficiency and effectiveness improvements and business value.Experience building and leading project teams in a matrix environment.Proven team leadership and management experience, with ability to recruit, engage and develop staff with advanced degrees and diverse backgrounds and in different geographic locations, ability to allocate resources based on priority and skill level, strengths, and area of expertise; ability to train and mentor junior colleagues.Solid understanding and hands-on experience with a variety of analytic processes and techniques, including health economics outcomes research, population health, measurement methodologies development, hypothesis testing, statistical significance testing, modeling and machine learning.Solid understanding and hands-on experience working with large data sources, particularly administrative claims, digital engagement, and clinical program data, focusing on efficient data extraction from large databases, data manipulation, and setting up optimized summary data layers.Excellent written and oral communication and data presentation skills, with ability to tailor the communication style to the right audience, from the analytic professionals to the senior business leaders.Excellent project management skills with ability to lead and engage in multiple projects and initiatives and appropriately prioritize one's own time as well as that of the direct reports and contributing resources.Understanding of the healthcare administration landscape and familiarity with PBM industry and business model, including patient and payer concernsExtensive hands-on experience with, SQL, Python, R, Tableau and other data, statistical and data visualization tools and techniques, and ability to understand and adapt emerging analytic tools and solutions into the analytic standard operating procedures.

Overview:
Nashville, Tenn.-based Bridgestone Americas, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of Bridgestone Corporation, the world’s largest tire and rubber company. Bridgestone Americas and its subsidiaries develop, manufacture and market a wide range of Bridgestone, Firestone and associate brand tires to address the needs of a broad range of customers, including consumers, automotive and commercial vehicle original equipment manufacturers, and those in the agricultural, forestry and mining industries.

The companies are also engaged in retreading operations throughout the Western Hemisphere and produce air springs, roofing materials, and industrial fibers and textiles. The Bridgestone Americas family of companies also operates the world’s largest chain of automotive tire and service centers.

Guided by its global corporate social responsibility (CSR), commitment Our Way to Serve, Bridgestone embraces its responsibility as a global leader by striving to improve the way people move, live, work and play.

Position Summary:
The Business Analyst is responsible for supporting Strategy Deployment and Realization Office's goal of reducing complexity across the Bridgestone Americas enterprise with a primary focus on Bridgestone Americas Tire Organization (BATO). The Analyst will be the primary resource for maintaining and developing complexity tools and providing input to multiple functions regarding how they can achieve complexity reduction goals. Candidate needs analytical skills combined with business acumen to develop new solutions and align existing tools with changes in the business. The analyst also needs to be able to develop insights from analysis and use them to drive complexity reduction across the enterprise. The role requires influencing the functions without direct authority, so social awareness and facilitation skills are also required.

Responsibilities:
Responsible for supporting BSAM's goal of reducing manufacturing / cross-functional complexity across the enterprise with the goal of achieving modularity within our product portfolio.
Provide analytical support and insights to advance enterprise goal of achieving modularity with the tire product portfolio
Evolve and extend existing complexity assessment models as portfolio and manufacturing technologies change
Generate KPI's and own metric tracking and report generation for complexity and modularity programs
Consult with project teams and SME's on design and execution of complexity tools, processes, and methodology
Accountable for managing multiple projects and complexity reduction efforts across the operations team, including Logistics and Supply Chain (LSCM), Manufacturing, Procurement, Product Planning, and the Americas Technical Center (ATC)
Build strong relationships through frequent communication with project teams, sponsors, portfolio manager/leader and stakeholders

Collaborate and Support LSCM
Support supply chain organization in monthly supply planning process by applying models to future demand forecasts and informing the team on trend changes and outliers
Support sales and operations execution team with complexity suite of tools to better inform decision making
Support supply chain organization with analytical tools that minimize complexity impact and development cost

Collaborate and support New Products Team:
Inform SKU rationalization process by providing complexity analysis on current and future portfolios
Assist in business case development for proposed technological investments and technology roadmaps
Generate complexity cost estimates for new projects and support existing gate process (New Product Development)
Conduct additional ad-hoc analysis assessing complexity impact from proposed business decisions

Collaborate and support ATC:
Support Value Added – Value Engineered (VAVE) initiatives by providing complexity benefit valuations as well as updating tools that identify unique parts and components within a plant
Create transparency across organization through analysis of tire designs in gate process compared to design guide standards set by Americas Technical Center design engineers (ATC)

Collaborate and support SCL (Strategic Cost Leadership) and SDRO:
Support SCL value tracking process by using existing models to track complexity savings
Support SDRO by using existing models to track and analyze enterprise portfolio roll-up workstream

Qualifications:
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree required
Technical proficiency in working with analytical software such as Excel, R, Python, Alteryx, SQL etc.
Experienced in connecting data sets (database, txt, Excel etc) to visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar software
Experienced in dashboard creation as well as ad hoc graphical insights (Tableau, Power BI, Plotly, etc)
Able to analyze a dataset, then find and communicate insights found within
Able to strategize, design and execute towards goals and come up with solutions to solve problems
Able to build relationships and influence others while having no direct authority
Blend of strategic thinking, project management skills and problem solving along with ownership and urgency
Demonstrated ability to be successful when working with ambiguity and in a change environment
Ability to present complex concepts to both leadership and operational/project teams
Ability to envision future state business services/processes and to construct roadmaps representing evolution from current to future state
Drives a workplace culture of innovation, high performance, accountability, commitment, respect and teamwork

Preferred Qualifications:
5+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: data/analytics, manufacturing, supply chain, engineering, statistics
Demonstrated success developing and managing high priority initiatives with enterprise wide mindset
Proven analytical skills through KPI generation, insight development, and manipulation of complex and varied datasets
Knowledge and understanding of Bridgestone Businesses & Industries
Experience working closely with senior leaders across the enterprise
Strong understanding of BSAM core business and functions preferred

At Xandr, our data is our life line - we can only be as good as our data, and great data is critical for business success. Our data pipeline processes tens of billions of log records a day (more than 150TB of data) generated by our real-time Bidding Engines and Ad Serving Platform. This data is used to generate aggregated analytics reports, pace spend accurately, and drive optimization engines. Our Engineering Team builds technology that identifies and analyzes relevant data to match buyers and sellers such that they each achieve their business initiatives. To do this, Engineers’ partner with our Data Science team to implement, test and deploy probability-based heuristics and intuitive, high-performance, real-time solutions for our diverse client base. This is an energizing community of engineers that is committed to building dependable products – the software and systems being built drive our real-time bidding business with a multitude of other core initiatives for Xandr.

About the job:
Xandr has a very fast-paced software development life-cycle, we’re on the hunt for a Senior Software Engineer in Test who wants to play a critical role in driving and automating the quality of Xandr features, functions, products and platforms. You will be responsible for driving all automated test and quality activities within a strategic software development team. You will strive to detect and fix every bug as close to generation of that bug as possible by encouraging team members to test their code at all levels. You will develop test tools to make testing as efficient as possible. Beyond the code, you will partner with the Product Team and Support Team to deeply understand how our customer use our products and set up the checks and balances that protect our customers from seeing bugs.

You will:
Develop Automated Testing Frameworks to cover our back-end components individually and the whole system from end to endAutomate and emulate various componentsDevelop A/B testing frameworks to compare results by splitting trafficDevelop regression testing frameworksPerform other automated testing work as requiredProvide direction and leadership to the team in the testing area
Qualifications
5+ years industry experience writing software for production systems
2+ years of software test automation and framework development experienceProficiency in multiple languages, especially Java and Python, and proven ability to pick up new languagesStrong cross-functional collaboration experience with stakeholders – understanding their needs, and building solutions that solve their problemsExperience mentoring fellow Software Engineers
More about you:
You are passionate about a culture of learning and teaching. You love challenging yourself to constantly improve, and sharing your knowledge to empower othersYou like to take risks when looking for novel solutions to complex problems. If faced with roadblocks, you continue to reach higher to make greatness happenYou care about solving big, systemic problems. You look beyond the surface to understand root causes so that you can build long-term solutions for the whole ecosystemYou believe in not only serving customers, but also empowering them by providing knowledge and tools

Our Company

Womply's mission is to help small businesses thrive in a digital world. Founded in 2011, Womply is the leading provider of data and software to local businesses and the top software partner to the payments industry. Our AI-powered data platform powers our CRM and marketing software, which serves more than 450,000 small businesses in every corner of America. In addition, Womply's data platform helps innovative developers create more powerful software for businesses and consumers alike.

The Opportunity

As a member of the Analytics team, the Product Analyst will drive the analyses behind the decisions our internal teams and executives make. You'll work with a cross functional team of Data Engineers, Business Intelligence Analysts, Data Scientists, Product Managers, and the Software Leadership Team to address the complex challenges of growing our business. You will provide quantitative support, market understanding, and a strategic perspective to our Product Managers.

You should be able to see different angles of a product or business opportunity and know how to connect the dots and interact with people in various roles and functions. You should have substantial experience with analytical tools and techniques, and bring expertise in analyzing data and communicating recommendations. You will deepen your analytical skills by working with thought leaders across our company. Excellent business, communication, and project management skills are crucial for this role. We look for people who take pride in their work, execute on it, and deliver phenomenal results.

What You'll Do

Consult with Sales, Customer Success, Product, and Growth to develop visualizations and analyses that lead to actionable insights that accelerate profitable growthOwn data pipelines and architecture that support our software growthManage cross functional projects that lead to actionable analysis of how our customers interact with our productWrangling and modeling data from multiple data sources including Snowflake, AWS, and SaaS toolsOutlining and developing insightful visualizations of business performance in tools such as Tableau, DOMO, Qlik, LookerIdentifying and understanding source data systems and become an expert of data architecture, sources and flowsReviewing current state and identifying improvement opportunities and best practice recommendations
You Must Have

BS/BA in Computer Science, Information Systems or related fieldStrong project management skills and ability to meet tight deadlines3+ years experience with MySQL, Postgres, or T-SQLAdvanced knowledge in database technologies and an excellent understanding of trade-offs in building data models2+ years working with large and complex datasetsExperience using Segment and analyzing SaaS products through tools like Mixpanel and AmplitudeTeam-oriented, self-motivated, success-driven, roll-up-your-sleeves attitudeSelf-directed leader who requires little oversightStrong intellectual curiosity and demonstrated ability to understand and question the dataDeep analytical skills with demonstrated ability to translate data results into actionable business insightsExceptional written and verbal communication skills
Nice to Have

Master's Degree in Statistics or MBAPrevious consulting experienceExperience with R or PythonExperience with Salesforce

Taking the clean canvas of an analytical app and designing something that tells a cool story with data is fun. Our industry has a set of tools that requires someone crafty. You may be a fit for our data visualizations team if…

You have been designing and developing content in data and analytics environments for more than five years. Knowing old school tools gives you street cred, but current platform knowledge is preferred. Cloud data and analytics architectures are a huge plus.
We’d prefer it if you were a Master of the Universe. Even better – you love modeling altogether.
There are many tools in the toolbox. Knowing the difference between a report and a dashboard will go over well.
You can’t really support fundamentally helping a customer change a business process without knowing a bit about the databases that content consumes. Do you know SAP BW, Oracle, SQL Server, Teradata, SAP HANA, Sybase IQ, Sybase ASE, DB2, Netezza, to name a few?
You and your customer may not be using cloud technologies, but you see the potential and are hungry to use it in the right place.

We are seeking qualified candidates with some strong skills.

True creativity and problem solving skills in taking data and giving it shape as analytical content.
The ability to correctly triage and diagnose issues and take corrective action in adherence to corporate change policies.
Documentation experience, creating requirements, specifications, or design documents and the ability to articulate their meaning to stakeholders, both technical and non-technical.
The ability to define both full regression test as well as system test plans for changes to an reporting set.
Demonstrate that you have the aptitude to not only get information out of a database, but can make it tell a visually compelling story.
You squeal for SQL. Or No SQL, for that matter.

Extensive travel may be required.

Do you believe you are a fit? Please send your resume/CV to hr@evtechnologies.com.

Location: Indianapolis, IN
Employment Type: Full Time

**Remote applicants will be considered if they are accessible to our customers.

About KiZAN

KiZAN Technologies, a Microsoft Gold Partner for twenty-seven years, is always on the lookout for the best and brightest talent. As a gold-certified and managed Microsoft partner, KiZAN allows business leaders to focus on the vision, not the technology. We provide strategic planning, application, and infrastructure services for Healthcare, Manufacturing, Financial Services, Retail, Professional Services, helping companies identify and solve business problems and take advantage of opportunities using innovative technologies, demonstrated consulting expertise and proven project management. Our clients range from mid-sized organizations to enterprise corporations, and they represent a variety of industries. Combining world-class products with our commitment to excellence has enabled us to be the local and regional technology solution provider of choice.

As a company, we exist to enable everyone to follow their passion. We succeed by attracting, developing, empowering, and promoting quality people; we embrace, kaizen, and evangelize processes; and place high value on continuous learning, creativity and an entrepreneurial spirit. As a team, we strive to create Raving Fans with our clients, as well as our employees. KiZAN provides a family culture, has received the Alfred P. Sloan Award for Workplace Flexibility multiple years, and encourages a fun environment by providing "just because" events for our family to get together outside of the workplace.

KiZAN Technologies has an immediate need for an exceptional individual to join our family as a Business Intelligence and Analytics Consultant. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills, is a true team player with a commitment to success, has leadership skills, and will be able to thrive in a fast paced, rapidly-changing environment.

Responsibilities

As a Consultant on our Business Intelligence and Analytics team, you will work closely with clients to define and deliver business intelligence and analytics solutions using Microsoft SQL Server and Power BI technologies. The Consultant provides guidance and hands-on technical expertise in designing and building solutions that unlock the value of data for our clients. The Consultant works both independently and as part of a project team on a variety of solutions, such as database design, data integration, data warehousing, business intelligence, data visualization, and others.

Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:
Implement data warehousing, reporting, business intelligence and analytics solutions
Design, deploy and administer business analytics solutions using Power BI
Create both paginated and interactive reports
Create dashboards and scorecards
Create ETL processes using SSIS, Azure Data Factory and similar tools
Design and implement relational databases
Assist in creating tabular models using Analysis Services and/or Power BI
Provide input in database design and review sessions
Troubleshoot existing BI solutions
Identify and strive to realize desired business outcomes from customer engagements
Manage successful completion of project initiatives on-time and within budget
Transfer knowledge to customers as part of the delivery of services and through classroom instruction
As the client's trusted advisor, identify and pursue additional opportunities to provide value
Communicate with clients about project status, handle customer concerns, involving Practice Lead or Project Manager as needed
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor's Degree in computer science, information systems, business, mathematics, engineering or equivalent work experience
2+ years building data warehousing, business intelligence and analytics solutions using Microsoft technologies
Proficiency with Power BI (1+ years of work experience)
Proficiency with SQL Server or cloud-based databases services with strong T-SQL development skills (2+ years of work experience)
Proficiency with data integration tools, such as SSIS or Azure Data Factory (1+ years of work experience)
Proficiency with paginated report development using SSRS (1+ years of work experience)
Proficiency in Excel
Strong track record of Business Intelligence solution development
Ability to travel, overnight up to 25%
Ability to travel independently to client sites; if by car, a valid driver's license or reliable method of transportation is required
Authorization to work in the U.S. without sponsorship

Skills and Abilities
Strong analytical, design, data modeling and problem-solving skills
Ability to show initiative and work independently in a self-reliant manner with minimal supervision
Ability to quickly learn new technologies and apply appropriately to business situations
Strong team player who enjoys working in a fast-paced team atmosphere
Ability to balance team and individual responsibilities
Ability to work under pressure; meet strict deadlines
Ability to listen effectively and seek clarification
Excellent written and oral communication skills in English. Must be able to effectively and comfortably communicate with all types of individuals from the customer technical expert to the customer executive management
Preferred Experience, Skills and Abilities
Experience with Power BI adoption, administration and governance
Knowledge of dimensional modeling and database optimization techniques
Knowledge of ETL and report development best practices and optimization techniques
Experience with SSAS and proficiency in DAX and/or MDX
Experience with developing data and analytics solutions in Azure, using such technologies as Azure SQL Databases, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory, Azure Stream Analytics, Azure HDInsight, Azure Machine Learning and others
Work experience in a consultant capacity
Knowledge of Agile/SCRUM SDLC Methodologies
Microsoft Certifications in Database Development, Database Administration, Business Intelligence, or related fields.

The IHOP Strategy + Business Analytics team reports directly to the President of IHOP. We work constantly with every group across the business: Marketing, Culinary, Operations, Development, Consumer Insights, Finance and franchisee leadership committees.

The Analyst/Sr. Analyst will report to the Director, Strategy + Business Analytics, and will work closely with the Manager, Strategy + Business Analytics. Work spans a broad spectrum from big strategy questions looking over the horizon to regular business reporting and quick ad-hoc analytics. Key responsibilities include:

Execute projects and analyses for the broader organization, across all functional areas (Culinary, Marketing, Operations, Development, IT, Finance) and levels, including regular interaction across the IHOP Leadership team of VPs, SVPs and the President
Support the Manager and Director on the team both in daily data needs and in larger projects
Develop relationships across the organization and provide insights and analyses to key VPs, Directors, and Managers
Collaborate closely with the Consumer Insights and Business Intelligence teams to bring together key insights from various teams into a synthesized, distilled and compelling answer

WHY you should want to join our team

You like food and you have a deep personal interest in the restaurant business
You like rolling up your sleeves and getting your hands dirty…
…In the office: Sitting back is not part of our mentality. All members of the team, from VP to Analyst, are driven to own their own work products. As analyst, you carry out much of the core work of the team
…And outside the office: Working in the restaurant business, we realize the importance of forming and maintaining strong relationships with our restaurants and keeping up to speed on their offerings
You enjoy working in and helping to steer a business through the center of seismic cultural and industry shifts
Dining habits are changing faster than ever before, but casual dining brands still serve billions of meals a year – it is a wide-open race to see who will win those meals
You crave the opportunity to see your projects through from beginning to end
You want to see your work progress past the recommendation stage and come to life in the real world
You want the chance to go back and improve the answer based on that real-world feedback
You take deep satisfaction in the ability to point at something and say “I helped build that”
You like working in small, nimble environments
Our brand headquarters occupies a single floor and so we interact constantly with little or no bureaucracy
Dining is a perishable goods industry – we cannot go back in time to sell yesterday’s meals, so we need to act quickly
You enjoy wearing multiple “hats” – often in the same day
We work with literally every functional area of the business on a regular basis
We work with all levels – Analysts up to the President – wherever we can help out
You are not afraid to be wrong
We put forth hypotheses to get the process moving so our colleagues can react and weigh-in quickly
We iterate swiftly and act as soon as we agree we have a “good enough” answer
You are reflexively Guest-centric
We tend to look at any business problem from the Guest’s eyes first
At some point in our lives most of us worked in Guest services somewhere, and we leverage those experiences and learnings to make our work more than just a Corporate role
You empathize with our network of franchisees and their teams who delight our Guests every day
From large private equity firms to single-location owners who started out washing dishes and have been with us for decades
You appreciate working for a brand with a rich history, yet while it is already deeply ingrained in the lives of millions…
…this brand remains also eager to grow and evolve our place in the dining and cultural landscapes

WHAT we are looking for

Education/work experience:
Business/Economics/Analytics degree from top university
0-2 years in top tier consulting or corporate strategy

Helpful industry experience:
Restaurant industry
Franchisees and franchised businesses
Product development
Marketing
Financial planning and analysis
Consumer insights
Forecasting
Food / hospitality operations
Food / hospitality real estate development

Personal traits we love:
Curiosity paired with skepticism
Ownership mentality – you see it as your responsibility to ensure things get done and to ensure Guests have the best experience
You take your work personally and hold yourself to high personal standards – you got good grades for your own sake, not because anyone demanded them of you
Comfort with ambiguity – you are able to proceed confidently and efficiently with incomplete and imperfect data
Ability to pivot – when new data comes in or decisions change, you are able to re-evaluate and continue driving forward, even if it may be in a new direction
Mental flexibility – the ability to look at the same problem from multiple angles
Resilience – the energy to keep trying those different angles until you find the one that works better
Structure – the skills to ensure all those iterations make forward progress toward a clear goal
Creativity, storytelling – the ability to wrap the analytical answer into something truly compelling that gives your colleagues the confidence to act
Energy, sense of humor

Job Summary:
Focuses on the use of information and analytics to improve health and optimize consumer focused business processes. Responsible for the extraction and analysis of health care information regarding but not limited to network utilization, cost containment and clinical quality information. Evaluates, writes, and presents healthcare utilization and cost containment reports and makes recommendations based on relevant findings to drive the decision-making process and support business operations for internal and external customers in an effort to control medical cost and improve the quality of services provided to members. Performs research and analysis of complex healthcare and/or clinical data regarding network utilization, cost containment and quality improvement information. Responsible for research using multiple sources of data and analyzing algorithms to determine health care expenditures and utilization patterns. Combines complex IT capabilities with advanced clinical knowledge to determine trends, cost/benefit ratios, and forecasting of health care costs, medical management, and health economics. May also be responsible for designing and implementing the systems and programming to analyze and report findings. This position requires a high level of expertise in both analyzing medical data and information systems. Acts as an advisor to the business and may provide guidance or expertise to less experienced analysts. Typically requires Bachelors in Statistics, Mathematics, Epidemiology or equivalent training and mastery; minimum 5 years’ experience in related health care analytics; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.

This position will be required to have expertise in several different technologies used by the Cigna Medical Group analytics team. These include multiple database technologies such as Epic Cogito tools, MS SQL Server, Teradata, IBM DB2 and Access. In addition, several other tools such as Tableau, SSIS, SAP Crystal Reports and Cognos will be used to help drive analysis and reporting. These technologies will be used to develop complex data processes for operational reporting and in depth analysis for specific projects such as evaluating the success of clinical programs.

Detailed Responsibilities:
Manage reporting functionality on BI applications – across Epic Electronic Health Record and other systems.
Design and develop data analysis processes.
Work directly with clinical staff in intake resolution.
Perform analysis of clinical programs.
Analysis of medical costs for potential capitated contracts with specialist organizations.
Support strategic initiatives for Cigna Medical Group.
Successfully complete project deliverables associated with all aspects of life cycle methodology including design, build, test, train and implementation.
Interact closely with customers to understand their needs and expectations.
Proactively monitor, identify, and help our IT partners resolve system production issues.
Develop and maintain user/technical documentation of responsible system areas.
Provide status reports, verbal and written.
Participate in regular customer or project meetings.
Take initiative to identify process improvements and implement them when needed.
Support and assist in the successful completion of team goals.
Perform other tasks as assigned.

Qualifications:Personal Competencies :
Establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect.
Can effectively cope with change.
Uses rigorous logic and methods to solve difficult problems with effective solutions.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Exceptional customer service and interpersonal skills.
Excellent planning, organizational and task management skills.
Ability to determine potential trends by thinking forward or "outside the box".
Ability to manage own time and set priorities with little or no management direction.
Ability to "think on the fly" and adapt to rapidly changing priorities.
Ability to establish and maintain effective and professional working relationships with managers and employees, along with working with external clients, or customers.
Strong intellectual capacity and curiosity.
Take pride and responsibility in work produced/results achieved.

Experience/Knowledge :
Experience working with Epic Electronic Health Record system.
Two or more non-expired Epic Clarity data models or Cogito Data Models Certifications required.
7+ years’ experience writing and troubleshooting complex SQL queries.
Experience with automation (stored procedures and SSIS) preferred.
Experience with data modeling and understanding how to integrate data from multiple EHR sources to create data marts across several subject areas preferred.
Proficiency with Microsoft software applications (Excel, Access, Visio) and Windows operating system environment.
SQL query tuning and experience preferred.
Tableau experience preferred.
Crystal Reports and Epic Crystal Integration experience required.
Experience with Visual Basic for Applications is preferred.
Experience interpreting and defining business requirements for complex business problems.
Demonstrated ability to work under pressure and take initiative with limited direction.
Demonstrated ability to work on multiple tasks simultaneously.
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience in Biostatistics, Statistics, Mathematics, Business or health care related field.

About Cigna
Cigna Corporation (NYSE: CI) is a global health service company dedicated to improving the health, well-being and peace of mind of those we serve. We offer an integrated suite of health services through Cigna, Express Scripts, and our affiliates including medical, dental, behavioral health, pharmacy, vision, supplemental benefits, and other related products. Together, with our 74,000 employees worldwide, we aspire to transform health services, making them more affordable and accessible to millions. Through our unmatched expertise, bold action, fresh ideas and an unwavering commitment to patient-centered care, we are a force of health services innovation.

When you work with Cigna, you’ll enjoy meaningful career experiences that enrich people’s lives while working together to make the world healthier place. What difference will you make? To see our culture in action, search #TeamCigna on Instagram.

How do you want to grow?
Think back to your last job. Did you trust your boss to have your back, to be looking out for you? Enova managers and leaders actively look to develop your skills, to give you more interesting projects, to help you get promoted. When we talk to our team members, they tell us that they really do believe in their managers and directors. Where else will you have regular conversations about your career progress and how to get to your goal? We invest in our people so they can grow, whether it's straight up the ladder or along their own unique path. This creates a culture where you can truly be seen. This is the core of Enova.

About the role:
As an Analytics Intern, you'll immerse yourself in the Analytics department and get a unique experience by working on real projects that impact our day-to-day business and production. We are problem-solvers, self-directors and action-oriented thinkers so you'll be expected to hit the ground running and own your projects, with guidance from your manager and teammates. You'll be placed on one of our four workgroups (Portfolio, Fraud, Customer Insights, or Research, Architecture and Platforms) and, while that will be your primary team for the summer, you'll gain exposure to and work with the other groups throughout your internship so you leave Enova with a strong understanding of what we do and what you'd like to focus on post-graduation. When you're not performing your Analytics responsibilities you'll be having fun, learning professional skills and networking with the rest of Enova.

What you'll be doing:
Learn the technologies, strategies and analytic techniques we use here at EnovaDevelop, enhance and test the company's models for use in determining the appropriate lending criteria and verification proceduresConduct ad hoc analysis using statistical and financial tools to recommend risk management, marketing and operational strategiesWork with senior management to develop key performance indicators (KPI's) to ensure that our products are performing optimallyPresent on your project findings and results to key executives and the department at the conclusion of your internship
We get excited about you if you have:
Working towards a Bachelor's degree, Master's or PhD in a related field of study with a planned graduation of Fall 2020 or Spring 2021Advanced programming ability to write customized code for meaningful data analysis in at least one programming languageWorking knowledge of SQLProficiency in spreadsheet applications and advanced use of statistical applications and databasesExperience communicating technical concepts to a non-technical audience
About the Analytics team:
We live and breath data at Enova, and our 70+ person Analytics team is at the heart of it all. They use cutting-edge machine learning and advanced modeling techniques to drive business value in a number of different ways. Depending on the team, that could mean building a state-of-the-art credit risk model; it could mean spotting patterns in data that indicate fraud; it could mean researching a brand new type of algorithm we've never even used before. Whatever it is, it'll typically be used to make real-time decisions on our website. What makes us different from Analytics teams elsewhere? We're language agnostic here which means YOU get to pick the tool that works best for you and the analysis at hand. The team primarily uses Python, R, SAS, and SQL but if you think another tool is right for your project, go for it.

About Enova:
Enova is a FinTech company dedicated to using technology to help hard-working people get access to fast, trustworthy credit. To date, we've helped more than 5 million customers around the world. Born and raised in Chicago, our philosophy is simple, "Life's short. Work someplace awesome." Want to learn more? Just ask any of our almost 1,500 employees.

Our goal at Enova, we believe that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity for all persons and not discriminate in employment decisions by placing the most qualified person in each job, without regard to any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. California Applicants: Click here ( https://www.enova.com/ccpa/ ) to review our California Privacy Policy for Job Applicants.

We are looking for a Senior Analytics Associate to join our Operations Business Intelligence team. Our team provides athena business leaders with insight into the efficacy of the critical services we deliver on behalf of our clients. These actionable insights enable a systemic improvement in the overall performance of our service delivery. When we create a new insight that improves our delivery, there is an opportunity for a significant impact on our clients - removing noise and freeing them to do what matters: delivering patient care. But enough about us; let’s talk about you!

You are a curious teammate, someone who loves to explore, learn, and use data to make things better. You are excited to frame business problems, dig through data to find solutions, and then craft compelling visualizations to bring your findings to life. You help others in the business understand the story the data tells. We work closely with partners across the business, so your ability to collaborate with multiple teams is also important.

The Team: We are a bunch of data aficionados who are passionate about creating visibility into business performance, telling an actionable story, and helping business teams drive impact for athena and most importantly, our provider customers. We use an agile-based framework to execute our work and ensure we are always focused on the most important and impactful needs of the business. Technology-wise, we increasingly live in the cloud using Snowflake, Tableau, and other tools for loading, extracting, transforming, and visualizing our data to provide solutions.

Job Responsibilities

Pull data from a variety of sources to provide visibility into performance, deliver in an actionable format, and ensure data quality/integrity

Develop the back-end and/or front-end components of tools and visualizations that surface insight into the health of our operational processes; build root cause drill-in reports

Consult with partners to define the success of initiatives by aligning business objectives with existing metrics or newly proposed metrics

Typical Qualifications

2-4 years of professional work experience in a data analytics environment

Experience extracting data from relational databases; Oracle SQL and SnowSQL a plus

Experience with at least one data-extraction, scripting, and/or programming language (e.g., SQL, R, Python)

Familiarity with Data Visualization/BI Tools, such as Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, and/or Google Analytics

Watertown is our Global Headquarters and our campus, the Arsenal on the Charles, is home to several restaurants, a local gym and large outdoor space. This office also has a cafeteria, coffee café and food trucks that rotate every day.

We value teamwork and believe that the strength of our team comes from supporting each other and leveraging our specialized skills. Our Perks : Along with health & financial benefits, our athenistas are offered a variety of perks that promote employee wellbeing such as commuter support, collaborative workspaces and dog-friendly offices - just to name a few.
