Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN), a Fortune 500 company based in Seattle, opened on the World Wide Web in July 1995 and today offers Earth's Biggest Selection. Amazon.com, Inc. seeks to be Earth's most customer-centric company, where customers can find and discover anything they might want to buy online, and endeavors to offer its customers the lowest possible prices. Today, we operate retail websites in 15 countries, offering millions of products in more than different categories worldwide, and we still like to work hard, have fun and make history!

Amazon is looking for a strong leader who is passionate about Customer Experience, who thinks/acts globally, and who has the ability to contribute to new innovations in the Disability and Leave industry. As a Principal, Service Delivery, he/she will execute capacity ramp up and ramp down across internal service centers, drive productivity and cost efficiency by challenging operations teams across multiple geographies, and monitor and react to stability of vendor supported operations. The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytical background that enables him/her to analyze and standardize workflow activities across large, cross-functional teams. In addition, this person should exhibit exceptional and influential communication and organizational skills, superior attention to detail and an ability to prioritize in a fast-paced environment. This individual will demonstrate strong analytical and critical thinking skills, along with customer service focus that employees expect from Amazon.

This person would be responsible for managing the team that executes to short/long term capacity plans by aligning actual staffing to forecasted requirement. An individual in this position must understand Amazon business units supported and have a deep understanding of ADA, FMLA, statutory Leaves and disability policies and laws, in addition to understanding the job accommodation processes and Amazon’s re-assignment obligation. He/she will be partnering with a team of leaders spread across multiple sites and countries and will be responsible for validating their performance in ensuring staffing accuracy in the internal network for service level delivery. Strong initiative, team leadership, project management and quantitative skills are imperative, as well as the ability to lead and grow top-notch people.

Work in lock-step with DLS Operations and Program Managers.Coordinate with Operations across multiple locations to execute short term and long term capacity movements.Mitigate capacity risks by identifying dependencies across multiple operating units and sites. Who We Are:
Design Interactive Inc. (DI) is a woman-owned small business specializing in human systems integration and committed to developing innovative solutions that accelerate human performance. Beyond human performance research and experimentation, DI's capabilities extend to user experience design, full software development capabilities including immersive, mobile, and web application development, systems engineering and integration, and testing and evaluation. DI solves the most pressing human performance challenges for customers across the DoD, Federal, and commercial markets and is on the cutting edge in areas of: eXtended Reality (XR) training and operational support, adaptive training solutions, biosignature analytics, and user experience design.

Why Work for Us?

Enjoy the opportunity to be part of an innovative and dynamic team on the cutting edge of emerging technologies and help expand our portfolio of novel non-invasive biosignatures of human physiology and performance.

Summary:
The Research Associate will participate in and lead development of technologies and methods for human Biosignature Analytics, including non-invasive physiological sensing. This role will require on-site data collection and analysis, along with reporting to internal and external stakeholders.

What You Need:
BS, MS, or Ph.D. in Biomedical Engineering, Exercise and Sports Science, Physiology, Industrial and Systems Engineering, Human Factors Engineering, or related field.
Strong planning and organizational skills; ability to prioritize tasks and show personal initiative.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and an understanding of non-invasive human physiological sensing and assessment.
Statistical analysis experience and experimental design.
Familiarity with machine learning and signal processing concepts.
Experience writing scientific publications and desire to pursue funding for research.

What You Will Be Doing:
Provide technical leadership for the development of Biosignature Analytics solutions and associated intellectual properties.
Responsible for leading the development of solutions by researching advanced technologies for non-invasive human physiological assessment, rehabilitation, methods for modeling and predicting human performance, as well as working with DI's UI/UX designers and software developers to fully develop the solutions.
Design and execute studies to ensure the usability of solutions, analyze data, and provide actionable recommendations to the project team.
Conduct independent research to validate the efficacy (e.g., training effectiveness) of solutions, assimilate results, prepare written technical reports, follow-on proposals, and publications.
Communicate project status to key customers in relevant functional and technical areas.
Maintain knowledge pertaining to DI's strategic direction, goals, and objectives and align projects appropriately.

Other Responsibilities:
Promote DI products and services at various customer locations and functions.
Interview, recommend and train staff as required. May evaluate performance or assist in the evaluation process.
Recommend staffing requirements as necessary.
Physical requirements involve performing general office activities.
Position requires local, overnight, and a minimal amount of extended travel.

Perform or assist with any additional assignments as required.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Please, no calls or emails from staffing/recruitment agencies.

Job Title: Advanced Analytics Analyst - Rush Health
Department: Rush Health
Shift: 1st

Specialty:
Job Number: 2019-3975
Date Posted: 12/18/2019
Position Type: Professional

Job Qualifications:
Advanced Data Analyst

Rush Health is a clinically integrated network of physicians and hospitals working together to improve health through high quality, efficient health services covering the spectrum of patient care from wellness, prevention and health promotion, to disease management and complex care management.

Our network includes Riverside Medical Center, Rush-Copley Medical Center, Rush Oak Park Hospital, Rush University Medical Center, and more than 1100 physician members and 300 non-physician network clinicians.

Position Highlights:
The Advanced Data Analyst supports clinical, contracting, network, and business intelligence at Rush Health. The Data Analyst will support key clinical processes, contracting initiatives, network analyses, and the development and maintenance of reports and other business intelligence projects. The successful candidate must demonstrate critical analysis skills and an understanding of healthcare data and processes, and have the ability to communicate such information to a wide variety of audiences in visual, oral, and written formats. Exemplifies the Rush mission, vision and values and acts in accordance with Rush policies and procedures. This position will be focused on conducting analytics as described above using Rush Health's Health Information Exchange data, which is a repository of Electronic Medical Records data for Rush Health providers and hospitals.

Position Responsibilities:
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends and patterns in complex data sets for specified projects. Develop graphs and figures, reports, and presentations to summarize key results and create easy-to-understand visualizations of complex information. Create dashboards with some end-user manipulation and data-drilling functionalities. Prepare supporting documentation and presentation materials to accompany the release of reports and dashboards.
Provide data and analytic support for Rush Health Clinical, Contracting, and executive teams.
Work with IT teams to interpret requirements, aid in documentation, and develop and validate reports to support internal teams. Assist in documentation and creation of web reporting (Rush Health Insights)
Create and maintain routine and ad hoc reporting as required to support Rush Health initiatives. These projects may include data from payer claims, EMR, HIE, and other data sources (including external and public databases) and will include internal and provider-member focused reporting
Provide ad hoc and ongoing support for physician and hospital quality bonus program
Participate in UAT for physician incentive program and other Rush Health initiatives
Assist IT team with data validation in onboarding new practice data and other projects
Assist with data mapping and profiling
Train end users in the interpretation of dashboards, tools, and results; ensure that data is understood by end users and that documentation is accessible to the appropriate audiences.
Consult with senior leadership to develop, implement, evaluate, write, conduct, and edit plans for complex analyses of healthcare data.

Position Qualifications Include:
Bachelor's Degree
Minimum of 5 years relevant work experience
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Demonstrated experience in data querying, profiling, analysis, and reporting; proficiency in SQL, including the ability to design and write complex queries.
Experience in creation and maintenance of dashboards intended to summarize data for multiple audiences. Strong preference for competence in Tableau or similar platforms for data visualization
Excellent written and verbal communication skills required. Must have demonstrated ability to present complex information to a variety of audiences in an interesting and compelling manner.
Strong customer service orientation
Strong organizational skills
Ability to seamlessly handle multiple complex projects in a timely fashion
Skilled in advanced analytics, data science, and statistical algorithms.
Knowledge of statistics and the ability to communicate with statisticians
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Experience auditing and querying large volumes of data using SQL
Exemplary written and verbal communications skills
Proficiency with data visualization software (Tableau, etc.) strongly preferred.
Proficiency with statistical software (SAS, R, etc.) strongly preferred
Advanced used of Microsoft Office suite, particularly MS Excel and PowerPoint
Ability to adapt to a rapidly changing environment
Able to prioritize workload

Preferred Job Qualifications:
Knowledge of healthcare or related industry. The candidate will need to quickly develop an understanding of P4P and VBC contracts, ACO program requirements, and quality measures reporting
Experience in SAS, R, or other statistical software
Experience with any of the following is preferred: electronic medical records data, payer claims data, Health Information Exchanges, clinical performance and outcomes data, meaningful use, University Healthsystem Consortium (UHC), Premier, HEDIS, PQRS, Leapfrog, ICD-10, CPT and other code sets.
Experience creating analytics to identify healthcare quality and efficiency opportunities
Experience reporting key performance metrics for physicians and hospitals

Company Highlights:
Rush University's Clinical Nurse Leader program is ranked #1 in the nation by U.S. News & World Report.
Rush University's Family Nurse Practitioner program is ranked in the top six in the nation by U.S. News & World Report.
Rush University's Doctor of Nursing program is ranked in the top four in the nation by U.S. News & World Report.

Rush is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Job Details

JOIN A GROUP OF EXTRAORDINARY PEOPLE

Senior Client Partner, Commercial Healthcare

Los Angeles, CA or San Francisco, CA - (West Coast)

The Senior Client Partner is accountable for representing Kantar at Life Sciences/Rx clients. This role is responsible for all aspects of account management for a set number of client accounts and success is measured against the sales and revenue Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) as outlined by the leader of the team for those accounts . This position reports to the Executive Client Partner position.

Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar’s 28,000 people help the world’s leading organizations succeed and grow.

Our health colleagues help life sciences companies develop and market products that improve people’s lives and well-being. Their blend of consulting, data analytics, and real-world research and evidence enables clients to understand patients, physicians and payers, bring products to market quickly, navigate the regulatory pathway and negotiate payer reimbursement and coverage.

KEY OUTCOMES

As Senor Client Partner you will:
Set and execute business planning strategy and tactics against client priorities for Kantar.

Manage and coordinate business development for Kantar at client level.

Establish and maintain client relationships at all client levels.

Make pitch casting decisions, proposal development, and decisions on how best to win the engagement in conjunction with research and consulting leaders. You will also serve as senior sponsor on client engagements.

Provide guidance and training to more junior team members when required.

May lead an engagement. Help to select teams and resources to be placed against specific client engagements.

Work closely with Research & Consulting to determine final engagement pricing to client.

Positively participate in the global ecosystem and will be expected to be a strong team player within a collaborative cultural environment.

CAPABILITIES

To succeed, you will need:
Bachelor’s degree in Business and/or Life Science’s area is required and an advanced degree is highly desirable.

A high level of experience made up of a combination of healthcare or pharma business knowledge; technical skills involving market research, commercial consulting, and client relationship building skills to guide the Kantar Health strategy and communicate the value of our offer and its role as a business asset to all levels within the Kantar organization and client organizations.

Ability to build cross-functional relationships; influence and inspire others; strategic thinking; effective presentation skills and organizational agility .

To be able to do overnight travel, both domestic (60%) and some international travel a few times a year for client meetings, attendance at conferences, or internal meetings.

JOIN US

At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.

At Kantar, the diversity of our employees provides a richer environment for our employees and broader depth and breadth of thinking for our clients. Kantar is committed to inclusion and diversity, therefore we welcome applications from all sections of society and do not discriminate on the basis of age, race, religion, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status or any other legally protected characteristics.

Your details will be kept on our Internal ATS (Applicant Tracking System) for as long as is necessary for the purposes of recruitment, which may include your details being shared with the hiring manager.

Aon is the leading global professional services firm providing advice and solutions in Risk, Retirement and Health at a time when those topics have never been more important to the global economy. Aon develops insights - driven by data and delivered by experts - that reduce the volatility our clients face and help them maximize their performance.
We have an exciting opportunity for a Producer (Risk, Retirement and Health) in our Boston, MA office.

DESCRIPTION: Responsible for bringing new business to Aon. Provides leadership to organize internal industry and product resources to develop Aon’s value proposition and strategic plan. Sells complex services/solutions and may be selling to a C-Suite level at prospects with an emphasis on cross-selling all Aon solutions. Works on complex issues where analysis of situation or data requires evaluation of a variety of factors, including an understanding of current trends. Identifies, develops and cultivates prospects for Aon solutions and positions Aon to win the work. Together with other Aon subject matter experts, uncovers and identifies prospect needs, primary goals and corporate and departmental objectives. May be responsible for planning, scheduling, resourcing and executing large projects/ programs. Serves as a senior member of the production team and may serve as a mentor or strategic advisor to other less seasoned producers Frequently interacts with senior level colleagues and prospects, frequently involving matters between different departments (i.e. – Finance and HR), other company divisions or units. Leads team selling efforts internally and with the prospects team. Often leads cooperative effort among members of a project team to deliver results. Able to influence outcomes beyond the scope of their individual function. Manage a team or play the lead role in the management of a portfolio of prospects’ business. Delegates responsibility and provides guidance to team members. Must possess extensive knowledge and experience and in-depth knowledge of the insurance industry and our products and services.
MINIMUM SKILLS AND REQUIREMENTS: 5-10 years of experience in selling insurance or related products. Experience within in the insurance industry preferred. Demonstrated capability to adhere to and champion the sales process. Active Life and Health and/or P&C license or willingness to obtain.
This position is provided a base salary plus commission based on the amount of business brought into the firm.

Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience

We offer you

A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.

Our Colleague Experience:
From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience .

About Aon:
Aon plc (NYSE: AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.

Job Title: Prospect Researcher ___ _Job Status: Full-Time Regular Reports To: Manager, Donor Services The Union Gospel Mission Twin Cities is a Christian ministry responding in faith to Biblical principles to serve those experiencing homelessness, poverty, or addiction in our community. We provide Christ-centered, discipleship-oriented pathways and programs that restore dignity and wholeness to men, women and children.POSITION SUMMARY: This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and managing prospect research information to help advance theMission’s development program. As Union Gospel Mission adds major and planned giving programs to an already robust direct mail and events-based fundraising model, Prospect Researcher will provide a key strategic role at UGM, focusing on providing research, prospect management, principal giving services and analytics to develop portfolios and pipelines.The Prospect Researcher will collaborate with development officers and are at the forefront with development leadership to provide information with actionable insight, helping to clarify priorities, increasing overall portfolio philanthropic capacity, and partnering to optimize portfolios. This position serves as a prospect research professional experienced in production, analysis, tracking, campaigns, customer service, and research deliverables.DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:  Research individuals, corporations and foundations, subscription databases, and library resources, as well as public and government websites. Analyze data and synthesize results to assess financial capacity, philanthropic tendencies, giving propensity, linkages to UGM, and other information to aid in the development process; produce accurate, detailed background reports. Employ research, analysis and reporting strategies useful to the prospect development stages and in proportion to prospect/donor value. Partner with colleagues as the primary point of contact for research needs as required, especially to support high-priority campaign-related work. Lead assigned research projects, employing customer relationship strategies to ensure positive service experiences, proactively discover ongoing needs, and recommend approaches to meet those needs. Collaborate with supervisor and Development and Marketing & Communications colleagues to identify and respond to opportunities for improved customer service, organizational efficiencies and resource enhancement. Identify, evaluate and prioritize potential donors using database queries and analysis. Input, utilize and manage relevant prospect information within prospect database. Collaborate with Development team’s donor services lead and external strategic partners that provide database management and analytics services, e.g., Blackbaud Target Analytics. Query data, manage electronic screenings, create prospect management models and design constituent surveys. Manage multiple projects or customers, requests and initiatives, with frequently competing deadlines, ensuring timely project completion and delivery of high-quality products.1 Provide creative and resourceful approaches to research, prospecting, and reporting challenges. Assist development manager and vice president of development in campaign prospect identification and assignments, generating gift pyramids and tables to inform committee activities. Stay current on leading industry trends; transfer and apply expertise. Maintain and expand research expertise with continuing education about new sources, search methods, and relevant information technologies. Develop project proposals, work plans, reports, or other written documents. Perform other related duties as assigned by manager.*Maintain strict confidentiality and handle sensitive information and material in an ethical and professional manner. ability to analyze and report a wide range of research findings; experience developing presentations and leading training, professional meetings or team projects. Demonstrated work with data in a wide variety of formats, including Excel and Access. Demonstrated understanding of major gifts fundraising process/strategies and the contributions and integration of data management and analysis to process/strategies.WORKING CONDITIONS AND PHYSICAL EFFORT:  Work is performed in a typical interior/office within an emergency shelter / transitional housing environment with occasional outside work required. While performing the duties of this job, the employee may, on occasion, be exposed to angry or violent clients or community members; At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and help them succeed financially. We’re looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you’ll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.

Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

Wells Fargo Technology sets IT strategy; enhances the design, development, and operations of our systems; optimizes the Wells Fargo infrastructure footprint; provides information security; and enables continuous banking access through in-store, online, ATM, and other channels to Wells Fargo’s more than 70 million global customers.

Wells Fargo Digital Technology group is seeking a Technology Manager who will be responsible for applications in one area of Technology. The Technology Manager participates in the growth of a framework that has to deliver 20+ million daily user sessions to very large set of devices used by our diverse customer base, from the oldest web browser to the newest smart watch.

This position is part Digital Channels Technology (DCT) group that manages Wells Fargo Retail Online Banking serving 40+ million customers 24/7/365 days. Our Mission is to support our company’s Vision & Values by delivering; maintaining and supporting high quality software solutions that provide our customers with outstanding digital experiences that will help them manage their financial needs.

The candidates responsibilities will be: Working closely with application teams, infrastructure and middleware teams to maintain applications that are secure and highly scalable/available. Plan, execute and maintain road maps in alignment with Enterprise Security standards and in accordance to established business SLA's.

As a Team Member Manager, you are expected to achieve success by leading yourself, your team, and the business. Specifically you will:

Lead your team with integrity and create an environment where your team members feel included, valued, and supported to do work that energizes them.
Accomplish management responsibilities which include sourcing and hiring talented team members, providing ongoing coaching and feedback, recognizing and developing team members, identifying and managing risks, and completing daily management tasks.

3+ years of experience in front end application development, operations and automation using React, Redux, AngularJS and Node

2+ years of experience managing off property Application Programming Interface (API) orchestration and integration
2+ years of experience in building integrations with Oracle Maxymiser Web Optimization platform
2+ years of managing teams building Command Query Responsibility Segregation (CQRS), event sourcing and data streaming based microservices

3+ years of experience with Application performance, monitoring and optimization using Blazemeter, JMeter, Splunk and AppDynamics
2+ years of experience in building and deploying microservices and cross channel restful Application Programming Interface (APIs) using Apigee, Consul, Resilience4J and Redis

Ability to interact with all levels of an organization

Ability to plan technology strategy for customer facing web initiatives while using industry trends, and lead technology teams towards common business objectives.

The Business Planning Manager role is an internal sales role designed for a career path progressing into a sales and/or cross-functional management role. This position serves as the liaison from field sales to the cross functional areas within the company and is primarily focused on sales support, strategy, analytics, and business/operations planning. Specifically the Business Planning Manager will provide analytical support/expertise to the Sales function and is the primary contact between the Field Sales, Management team, and other DFS internal cross-functional departments. This position will lead assigned sales and customer projects from start to end utilizing internal resources such Finance, R&D, Culinary, QA, and Procurement. In addition, the role of Business Planning Manageris the voice of sales to senior management and the organization in respect to reporting customer volume, profitability, and key business drivers affecting sales revenue. The Business Planning Manager will also work closely with Customer Service on Inside Sales Accounts.

Responsibilities & Duties

Strategy and Planning: Act as an internal consultant responsible for identifying opportunities and risks in the market, supporting customer growth with analytics, developing/executing customer business plans, and understand financial implications of strategies.

o Initiate new item projects requested by sales managers, whether current or new customers, from origination of Project Evaluation Forms (Stagegate) to Product Specification Data

§ Pricing

§ Ensure cost parameters are aligned with commodity markets, working closely with procurement to execute customer pricing.

o Able to provide insight into customer trends both positive and negative with causals. Intimately familiar with existing business and factors/variables that may affect sales. Provide representation in weekly sales and ops meetings, reporting to Field Sales any feedback from management, internal departments, and/or customer that may affect development work.

§ Sales Strategy development

§ Customer Business Plan Development

§ Sales Budget development

§ Tracking results vs. plan

§ Help resolve service related issues

Reporting: Lead development of and generate daily/weekly/monthly customer volume reports by identifying key items shifts that positively or negatively affect sales volume. Identify specific causals that are impacting revenue results and corrective actions when necessary. Communicate this information clearly to sales function through written reports forecasting/supply management

o Consistently communicate with sales function and Management Team and report in real-time accounts and items that are impacting DFS volume. Act as the “voice of field sales” in the corporate office to cross-functional and Executive teams

Customer Communications: Organize customer communications between sales managers and DFS corporate regarding supply agreements, NDA’s, RFP’s, and floor stock agreements to ensure sales managers have information on requested delivery dates

o Ensure customer documentation is completed in its entirety by working closely with other cross-functional departments managing the customer’s time-line.

Financial Responsibility: Review item profitability reports and communicate in real-time to sales team customers/items that need attention.

o Review customer profitability by item with Finance monthly to ensure that margins remain intact and that Sales is meeting or exceeding EBITDA targets

§ Develop selling materials e.g. presentations, brochures, website updates, etc.

Budgeting: Organize and assist to lead annual revenue/sales budget, ensuring deadlines are met.

o Efficiently manage top-line Trade, Revenue and T&E expenses within budget.

§ Identify and propose solutions for business needs on an ongoing basis

§ Monthly management and tracking (by customer by product) of sales performance against forecast (actuals vs estimate)

§ Ensure system accuracy related to sales/revenue and projected data

§ Leading quarterly and yearly Forecasting analysis review to enable vital decisions regarding pricing, promotion and distribution, based on trends, anticipated demand and performance

Qualifications

o Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Finance or Related Field

o Master’s Degree preferred

o Minimum 2-3 years in analytical, planning capacity role

o Competent in strategic and analytical thinking

o Ability to review and extrapolate data from reports

o Basic understanding of ERP systems

o Demonstrated communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal

o Demonstrated ability to work cross functionally, e.g. Finance, Manufacturing, Procurement

o Demonstrated ability to work in teams (Project Management skills)

o Self-motivated, results oriented

o Financial acumen

o Able to meet deadlines with multiple competing priorities

o CRM experience preferred

o Strong background in Food Service and/or Chain accounts preferred

o Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office, exceptional in Excel skills

The successful candidate will have the opportunity to apply and grow their skillset in data management, analysis, and reporting, work with a motivated and entrepreneurial team, engage with a wide range of stakeholders, and build CGGS’ capabilities in data analytics while serving our clients.

Company Overview:
A global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, Capgemini is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of client’s opportunities in the evolving world of cloud and digital platforms. job_title: Junior Business Intelligence and Analytics Consultant

job_information:
MOBE is seeking an experienced Director of Business Intelligence who can collaborate with departmental leadership to deliver data insights on how the organization is performing. The Director of Business Intelligence will be responsible for leading a team of high performing analysts. In addition, we need someone who can look at existing business process results and make specific recommendations about how it can be used to improve operations. The ideal candidate will possess proven leadership skills, strong ability to problem solve and technical depth in order to make sound, data-driven decisions.

Responsibilities:
Trusted advisor to Operations leadership
Responsible for accurate measurement, forecasts and analytical support for engagement growth and operational efficiency initiatives
Lead a team to develop scorecards that enable a data driven-culture
Act as a player/coach, leading and developing a team of analysts as well as able to step in to lead by example in overcoming data obstables, particularly technical in nature
Serve as source of truth on business performance metrics with speed and accuracy
Lead R&D on the latest BI, Data and Analytics technologies and methodologies, improving speed, agility and time to market in developing end user solutions that drive better decisions
Develop and set strategic direction for achieving business goals through data, partnering with matrixed business & IT leadership
Contribute to the long term information delivery strategy, encompassing enterprise reporting and database tool choices, business and power user access and education delivery methods

Minimum Qualifications:
Required

Bachelor’s or equivalent
5 years experience with Business Intelligence
Prior experience leading a team of analysts
Highly proficient with SQL
Experience building out a BI reporting library
Leadership competencies with the ability to collaborate with others and establish working relationships, communicate effectively across the organization and at different levels, think and act strategically, and influence key leaders

Preferred

Master’s
5+ years of healthcare or medical economics experience
Tableau experience
Experience with data warehouse structures and concepts
Experience working in a cloud-based environment (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.)

Guiding Principles:
We want employees who are kind, talented and committed, who live by our guiding principles and choose to work at MOBE because of these principles.

Care about people. We only succeed in our mission because we take good care of our own with the same energy, empathy and expertise we bring to the MOBE program. We honor who people are at work and outside of work.

Attitude counts. Our people believe in a friendly, human approach to helping people with their health and enjoy a culture built on trust, positivity, and well-being.

Do good together. As a mission-based organization, we need people who like to collaborate and are energized by doing good things.

Believe in the power of human potential. We need people who want opportunities for personal growth and believe in making a difference in the health care space, person by person.

Embrace new ideas. As a high-growth organization, we need people who have the energy and flexibility to innovate and evolve with our program.

Apply learnings. We learn by doing, and we’re going to get better at helping people by being able to anticipate their needs. We need people who embrace continuous improvement and are dedicated to delivering results.

Be relentless in the pursuit of awesome. MOBE offers a unique opportunity to help others lead more fulfilling, enjoyable lives. We need people who are ready to embrace this mission.

At ASICS, we empower our employees to pursue their career goals. If this sounds like you, then we want you on our team.

ASICS has been dedicated to designing the most technically advanced footwear and athletic products in the world for over 60 years. All of that comfort, fit, and functionality starts within the minds of the passionate people that work within our walls.

Based upon our core values, everyone's input and contributions are respected at ASICS America. We nurture a collaborative environment and hire team members that are never content, always pushing through their own limitations, continually in the pursuit of improving performance, are innovative and creative, reach for new challenges, and always aim to surpass the next goal.

Our Mission: We pledge to bring harmony to the body and soul

ASICS, an acronym derived from the Latin phrase, Anima Sana In Corpore Sano - a sound mind in a sound body. Staying true to the philosophy by which it was founded, every ASICS innovation, every concept, every idea is intended to create the best product. Our mission is to become the number one brand for the sports enthusiast. To accomplish this, we pledge to continue to make the best product; striving to build upon our technological advances and pushing the limits on what we can learn from the body and its needs in athletic gear.

POSITION PURPOSE / SUMMARY STATEMENT (defines the major functions/purpose of the position):

The BI & Analytics Specialist will work with the BI & Analytics Architect to understand business needs/requirements, to help build and support processes and/or technology solutions in the SAP planning, reporting, and analytics space. Develop, test, and support SAP BI and HANA reporting/analytics solutions. Assist with analysis to gather requirements for integration with other SAP modules (S/4HANA Finance, MM, SD, PP, etc.). Create test plans, test cases, and perform functional testing. Assist with new user training as requested. Understand requirements, assist with development of functional/technical and design documents. Contribute to application roadmaps/implementation approach and project plans.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES (include titles of positions directly reporting to this position):

This position does not have supervisory responsibilities.

ORGANIZATIONAL RELATIONSHIPS:
Interacts with all levels throughout organization including employees and outside vendors.
Develops and maintains a strong relationship with BI Global Team, to ensure full alignment with Global BI.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Uses data mining, statistics, statistical modeling, machine learning to understand relationships and patterns in data – insights gathered from this analysis are translated to actionable steps and best practices.
Build and test Analysis for Microsoft office report, Webi report and SAC dashboards.
Build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to identify and address critical issues.
Serve as a technical resource for business teams to help define, estimate, and propose solution for business opportunities.
Design institute-wide “views” and custom reports that are visually appealing and informative for large and small scale distribution.
Educate and train clients to use the data as an analytical tool, displaying the information in new forms and content for the purpose of analysis and option exploration.
Skillfully communicates data, reports, and findings using a number of media including: oral presentation, written reports, charts, graphs, web-based interactive reports, data visualizations. Excellent documentation skills.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:
Knowledge of financial analytics and Sales reporting
Able to execute with superior attention to detail and accuracy
Skilled at proactive thinking that provides insight based on data and performance analysis
Able to be team player who loves a challenge
Skilled at data analysis and able to work through complex details of data formatting, query massaging, and dashboard design
Skilled at going beyond the obvious, delving into the source, the definition, philosophy, and foundational roots of a data element in order to create information
Knowledgeable of how data is turned into information and how that knowledge supports and enables key business processes
Strong statistical knowledge, proficiency with a statistical analysis tool such as R preferred.
Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills
Must be knowledgeable of the business environment
Able to work well within a team environment

CORE COMPETENCIES:
Communicates Effectively – Non Leadership
Connects with the Customer – Non Leadership
Cultivates Collaboration – Non Leadership
Delivers Results Effectively – Non Leadership
Initiative – Non Leadership
Innovative – Non Leadership
Job Expertise – Non Leadership
Shows Great Judgment – Non Leadership

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:
1-3 years of business analysis, report development or related technical experience (will consider strong related academic background in lieu of work experience)
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Systems or any other analytic endeavor. M.B.A or M.S. a plus
High level of proficiency with Excel a must
Computer skills: Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), HANA Data Studio, SAP FMS
MS Power BI, Google Applications such as Google Analytics, Gmail, Google Hangouts, etc. a plus.

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS:

Join our team and experience Workday!

It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they're doing. At Workday, we're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business of enterprise applications. We work hard, and we're serious about what we do. But we like to have a good time, too. In fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day: One of our core values is fun.

Job Description

Senior People Analytics Analyst

If your professional passion is creating a high-performance work environment by pioneering innovative people analytics and insights -then we should talk. We are looking for a results-oriented professional ready to channel their experiences into the challenge of creating pioneering solutions that deliver breakthrough business results.

As the Senior People Analytics Analyst on Workday’s People Analytics & Insights team, you will work closely with the various People & Purpose Centers of Excellence to help build analytical insights that our business leaders need to help scale and grow Workday. This key team member will need to influence internal and external stakeholders and use data to impact key strategic business decisions.

This role will deliver results in these mission-critical areas:

Analyze complex business problems using data from internal and external sources to Provide insights to decision-makers

You will be responsible for helping to solve complex problems faced by our leadership and management by providing scalable analytics and insights of our people and people practices.

Identify and interpret trends and patterns in datasets. Provide recommendations based on business data, people data, and organizational knowledge.
Create specifications for analysis based on business needs and required or available data elements.
May provide consultation to users and lead cross-functional teams to address business issues.

Develop analytics, tools, and insights that drive Improved Decision Making about our People, Culture, and Leadership

You will help enable our people strategies through high quality, compelling analytics that arm our Leaders with the insights they need to scale our business and ensure that Workday is a great place to work for all.

Develop and execute insights that inform decision making around our people, culture, and leadership.
Build and execute an autonomous insights mechanism whereby People Leaders and Executives receive analytical insights and strategic nudges derived from their data, personalized to their context, and delivered via Workday.
Generate new and innovative analytics and insights based on business needs, audience feedback, cutting-edge neuroscience, behavioral economics, network, leadership, and management research.

Explore, Test, and Validate New Advanced Analytics Approaches

You will design and execute new analytical methodologies in service of our people and talent strategies.

Provide applications and interpretations of advanced analytic methodologies and processes designed to provide insights to our business leaders to improve decision making an ultimately drive growth.
Identify patterns and insights from rich transactions (structured and unstructured) and people data to help optimize decision making, including building predictive models that inform this process.
Conduct research studies to solve key people business issues. Implement research findings in Workday technology through analytical apps, PRISM, and campaigns.

Qualities Required for Success

We believe the person for this role will possess interests and experiences in the following areas:

Problem Solving:
Uses rigorous logic and methods to solve difficult problems

Probes sources for answers and can see hidden problems beyond what is obvious
Is excellent at honest analysis and clear about the results to be achieved through the analysis and looks beyond the obvious and doesn’t stop at the first answers

Collaboration:
Cultivates and leverages productive collaborative relationships to deliver results

Creates constructive and candid dialogue and influences others without using formal authority
Thoughtfully challenges the status quo

Innovation

Creates new ideas and associations that generate new value

Thinks independently and comes up with novel solutions, analytics, and programs that add value and demonstrates high tolerance for ambiguity as ideas are being formulated
Builds support for new ways through the personal excitement they exhibit and is willing to take risks and persists in the face of crisis and failure; hard to discourage

Results-Oriented
Delivers committed results in a fast-paced, high-growth environment

Is focused, disciplined, and self-directed in addressing opportunities that deliver results and acts with a sense of urgency, embracing high-value stretch over safe goals
Holds oneself accountable for contribution goals, not being thwarted by challenges and setbacks and consistently delivers successfully at scale, globally

Communication
Designs and delivers skillful messaging and storytelling to effectively reach people and influence behavior

Overview:
Our Summer Internship starts June 1, 2020 and ends August 21, 2020.

Calling all beautiful minds. VSA is looking for a Data Analytics Intern to help us connect the dots with data and deliver real business impact for our clients. And you’re right for the job if you’ve got a background in data analytics, quantitative research, and a healthy appetite for solving tough problems. You’ll learn how we embed data within design thinking to deliver impactful branding and marketing solutions. From proprietary consumer research methodologies to performance optimization, there will be abundant opportunities for you to show off your data skills.

A little bit about the VSA Summer Internship Program: If you’re looking for another bullet point on your resume, look elsewhere. At VSA, like much of what we do, we take our internship program seriously. Which means our interns work on “real work,” with real meetings, deadlines, and business challenges from our brands and clients. This is the education you won’t get in a classroom. Consider it career practice, with the freedom to learn, make mistakes, refine, question and tag along. You’ll work with an individual mentor and supervisor in a unique cross-disciplinary environment focused on brand, communications, marketing and digital.

As part of the larger program, you’ll take part in intern meetings, team outings, activities and initiatives (can you say networking?). And yes, it’s paid, with an hourly rate, for 40 hours/week, on-site. It starts June 1st. Bet you can’t wait for summer. Note: this position is part of VSA’s Strategy Practice.

***

VSA Partners is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive, equitable environment for all employees. All employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit and business need.

Overview:
We are looking for a proven leader that is experienced in partnering with executive finance leadership to create an application vision then transforming that vision into actionable plans based on priority, demand, and urgency. This leader will think innovatively and constantly be seeking to challenge and improve the “Record to Report” (RTR) team. This position requires a person that has a mindset of continuous integration and continuous delivery to meet the needs of the global finance team.

This position will lead internal and external global teams to work with Bio-Rad colleagues worldwide to manage and deliver RTR business processes. This position will be responsible for leading and managing the RTR team in the rollout of Bio-Rad’s SAP system globally, management and resolution of day-to-day incidents to achieve operational excellence, partner with executive finance leadership to influence the vision to prioritize and deliver projects and ERP enhancements for the RTR process area.

The position requires a well-rounded global leader in Financial business principles, processes and practices background, is analytical and organized with a strong business acumen & vision, demonstrated working knowledge of process design, strong management skills, and the ability to be hands-on and a desire to “dive into the details.” The position will ensure that the processes are in alignment with the company’s strategic initiatives and that the solutions and processes developed enable the realization of those initiatives.

The position requires a person that has experience in leading a global RTR team of 15 – 20 IT professionals, uses design thinking, agile development methodologies and the latest technologies, such as, SAP Cloud Platform, Internet of things (IoT), Robotic Process Automation (RPA), Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML) and mobile to solve and deliver the next generation of financial solutions. Additionally, the position requires a person that is analytical with strong business knowledge and vision, has a demonstrated working knowledge of industry best Finance processes and practices, strong management skills, and the ability to be hands-on with a desire to “dive into the details”, as needed. Provides effective leadership to the project team ensuring that team members are motivated and developing their skills and experience.

Responsibilities:
The position will focus on the global aspects of the “Finance” processes; below are a few of major business processes areas:

Financial and Management Accounting
Financial Organizational Structures and Master Data
Controlling functions
Product Costing
Tax
General Ledger
Asset Management
Treasury / In-House Cash
Consolidation
Planning & Budgeting
Internal and External Financial Management Reporting and Analytics
Sales Commission

Work with Bio-Rad subject matter experts and stakeholders globally to:

analyze and document current and future business needs
provide IT leadership to RTR team
ensure future business processes satisfy the intent
lead the configuration for the business processes
liaison working cross-functionally with other business teams to ensure business processes operate at their optimum efficiency
identify and manage all data integrations to/from legacy applications
manage data conversion sources from legacy applications
lead team ensuring systems are built for intended use
maintain system integrity through the traceability of requirements to delivery
document system configuration

Partner with global business process owners to:
manage RTR ServiceNow queue and assign work
establish roadmap of projects and enhancements for the RTR domain
related prioritize enhancements

The position must utilize a broad business and IT perspective and work effectively with multiple areas of the organization, including:

partnering with Global Process Owners
other process area managers on the ERP team
key managers and stakeholders throughout the company
external consultants

Qualifications:
Bachelor/Masters degree in Computer Science or commensurate experience
Experience with systems implementation and/or process transformation. The candidate must have experience documenting processes “as is” through process maps and SOP’s and have a working knowledge of business process decomposition techniques. The candidate must be able to design processes and sub-processes and to think through the implications of those designs. Understanding how these processes provide Bio-Rad competitive advantages or operational efficiencies is essential.
Ten (10) or more years direct experience in supporting “RTR” functions in finance, tax, accounting rules and procedures, principles, processes and practices including US GAAP and IFRS along with system integrations supporting these business functions.
Eight (8) plus years experience in a personnel management role, with a strong record of building and managing teams through leadership, direction, coaching and mentoring.
Relevant Life Science industry experience with experience with SOX and GxP is highly desired.
Provide effective leadership to the project team ensuring that team members are motivated and developing their skills and experience.
Sound business and IT acumen.
Think and approach complex problems with an Agile mindset.
Proven experience leading global teams with a demonstrated ability to work under time constraints while meeting critical milestones
Proven leader that builds and fosters global open working team environments
Experience with international business processes and relationships a strong plus.
Think cross-functionally
Make sound global business decisions
Understand the impact of those decisions on the broader organization
Be an ambitious self-starter
Work well in pressure and in ambiguous situations
Have demonstrated working with global business teams to formulate actionable plans and solutions
Ability to think strategically and then converting strategy into tactical execution
Ability to establish global critical relationships throughout the company and to build trust and credibility throughout the organization.
Ability to effectively, succinctly, and confidently communicate team decisions to all levels of the organization with the appropriate level of detail (verbal, written, and presentation)
Ability to travel on average 30%, including international, with the ability to travel extensively as project needs require.
Proven ability to work independently and collaborate closely with others to accomplish business objectives

About Bio-Rad:
Bio-Rad is a global leader providing a broad array of clinical diagnostics and life science research products. With a team of more than 7,800 employees and a global network of operations serving our customers, we help people live longer, healthier lives.

Bio-Rad was founded over six decades ago and has continued to provide the healthcare industry with innovative and useful products that help life science researchers accelerate the discovery process and medical diagnostic labs obtain faster, better results.

Support regional Management and Sales Managers with ad hoc sales data requests and Salesforce CRM training and functionality enhancements.

Excellent organizational, communication, collaborative and interpersonal skills, including inter-cultural understanding.

Job Description Summary
This Senior Manager of Modeling will be responsible to build and analyze sophisticated models for insurance products, investments and/or portfolios to increase company risk adjusted returns. They should be able leverage advanced knowledge of actuarial, financial, statistical, data science and/or balance sheet modeling analytics to develop, test and validate models for various functions within the company.
Job Description

What you will do:
Lead modeling activities on various insurance liabilities, fixed-income assets and derivatives in actuarial systems, including AXIS/ALFA/MoSes.
Model and quantify risks including equity and interest rate sensitivities, cash flow variability, credit, alternative investment, or liquidity risks.
Collaborate with key stakeholders from business line valuation, ALM, risk management, financial/risk reporting, etc.
Embrace new technologies to improve workflows.
Design and build external or embedded controls to mitigate operating risks in workflows.
Apply risk management techniques and procedures, including the company's mandated risk methodologies.
Gather and analyze market data, calculate hedge program or portfolio statistics and develop/use models to simulate financial reporting processes.
Serve as a company-wide expert in multiple specialties.
Act as a subject matter expert for colleagues with less experience.
Apply and integrate statistical, mathematical, predictive modeling and business analysis skills to manage and manipulate complex high volume data from a variety of sources.
Design and lead multiple projects, with accountability for ongoing activities and objectives.
Review the work of others, providing direction and insight on research solutions to problems presented.
Develop staffing plans, recruit qualified candidates, and develop internal staff resources.
Lead multiple advanced research projects.
Interpret internal or external issues and recommend solutions/best practices.
Solve complex problems; take a broad perspective to identify solutions.
Build efficient models and processes
Apply judgment to modeling choices in a defensible manner.
Assess the materiality of various modeling and data choices.

What you will need:
Bachelor’s degree in a technical/quantitative discipline such as statistics, math, actuarial science, computer science, economics, engineering, or a related business field such as finance
Ten years of modeling experience (or eight with Master's degree) with expert knowledge in two or more products such as insurance liability, asset valuation, derivatives modeling, liquidity management, machine learning, or artificial intelligence
Seven years of experience in advanced programming or actuarial systems customization
Experience with asset liability management practices
Comprehensive understanding of investment and finance concepts to creatively solve complex analytical problems
Leadership capabilities to direct teams and projects

Preferred Qualifications:
Advanced degree
Insurance or asset/derivatives modeling experience
Actuarial Science background
Experience with database design and usage
QRM or similar asset liability software experience
SAS, R, SPSS or other statistical software experience
Six Sigma or other process improvement background

Working Conditions:
Office environment

Primary Location - USA-PA-Canonsburg
Organization - Mylan Inc.

Intern, Analytics, Data Science - 20000256

For Us, It's A Mission
At Mylan, we mean it when we say we work every day to provide access to high quality medicines to the world's 7 billion people. If you are unconventional, relentless and passionate. If you believe in doing what's right, not what's easy. If you are a doer and have a passion for serving others, we want to talk to you.

Make a Difference
At Mylan, each person has the ability to make a difference. From the providers who sell and market our products, to the producers who develop and manufacture them and finally to our business partners who support the providers and producers, we all have a mission critical role. Here's how this role will help:
The analytics team is responsible for the data science capability at Mylan. A typical day for the data scientist team focuses on leveraging vast amounts of data by applying machine learning, artificial intelligence, advanced process automation, and advanced analytics research. In this capacity, our data scientists work across the enterprise and with our business partners to help drive results and identify opportunities within advanced analytics. A successful data scientist intern will be part scientist, part strategist, part engineer and part artist.
Work with the Latest Technologies: You will work with a team of data scientists working on machine learning algorithms and mathematical models on the Azure platform. You will also get a chance to work on some of the latest technologies in the data science field such as Hadoop, Spark, HBase, Stream Analytics, Cognitive Services, Data Lake Analytics, Data lake Store, U-SQL, Cosmos DB along with tools like Alteryx and Tableau.
Develop and Enhance Data Science Skill Sets: You should be comfortable developing algorithms, mathematical models and cognitive capabilities that interact with other software and analytical components that run autonomously with minimal human supervision. We expect you to have a solid foundation developing Machine Learning algorithms and Data Science models which to build upon over the course of the internship.
Build Strong Partnerships: We are striving to integrate advanced analytics into our everyday culture. You will be asked to work with the business / domain experts to understand what they want to solve. Then, apply data science capabilities to help us overcome the hardest challenges, breakdown the data silos, connect the disparate parts and champion the data-driven culture.
The Art of Data Science: You can be the best data scientist, but if you cannot communicate your research no one may ever know. Data storytelling will be part of your internship experience. You should expect to assemble the data science tools and models and apply them to data to answer the relevant questions – and communicate that answer in a way a non-data scientist will understand. A proactive, creative, curious mind-set and a desire to influence your own development will go a long way.
Data Science Internship Responsibilities
Identify the data and advanced analytics needs to address the project challenges, define the appropriate solution and deploy the advanced analytics models to deliver results
Drive the collection of new data and the refinement of existing data sources
Explore the data to drive value where value has yet to be realized
Develop data science models to drive insights based on hypotheses provided by our business partners
Develop visualizations to support and communicate findings to AABI and business partners
Prepare written and verbal communications along with preparing and delivering data science artifacts (abstract, data sources / data dictionaries, code library, research / findings, modeling / deployment report, new ideas / next steps)

Make Our Values Your Values

Mylan hires only the best. People who thrive in a culture of innovation and empowerment. People who are active learners and have a positive attitude. People who are leaders and know that by working together we can run faster, reach higher and achieve more. By doing so, we will continue to set new standards in health care. Here are the minimum qualifications and essential functions for this position:

Must possess knowledge of data science, machine learning, computer science, applied mathematics, statistics, and/or a related advanced analytics field of study.
Must possess a professional or academic exposure to data science concepts, mathematical modeling, algorithm development and computational tools on a variety of platforms, frameworks, and methodologies (i.e. R, Python, Spark (PySpark), Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Data Lake Analytics, etc).
The successful candidate will have preferably completed a minimum of their sophomore year and be currently enrolled in an accredited college or university in a STEM degree program, or a related field of study. Master’s degree preferred. A minimum 3.0 GPA is strongly preferred; however, a combination of experience and/or education will be taken into consideration.

Why Mylan?

If you want to be part of a global health care company that is making a difference and changing lives, Mylan may be the place for you. With a workforce of more than 35,000 worldwide, we can make a difference. We encourage you to visit Mylan.com to learn more about our unconventional culture, our approach to doing business and how we plan to set new standards in health care.

Mylan offers competitive salary, excellent benefits and an environment conducive to professional growth and advancement. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their disability or protected veteran status. Mylan is an Equal Opportunity Employer, Minorities/Female/Disabled/Veteran.

Position Description:
The Muscular Dystrophy Association is undergoing a digital transformation as we embrace new forms of technology across the organization. Just last year, Salesforce and FinancialForce were integrated and launched as our new CRM and ERP systems respectively to support the organization and both platforms are continuing to grow and develop. In addition, our Mission has embraced technology through the creation of the MOVR Data Hub to improve the ability of researchers and healthcare providers to enhance the care and management of individuals living with neuromuscular disease and to aid in the development of clinical trials for promising new treatments.

MDA is looking for a technology focused individual to partake in these unprecedented times to continue the growth and utilization of technology in the Marketing department.

The Digital Media Marketing Manager will plan, execute, and deliver a full funnel media plan that drives MDA strategic acquisition and retention goals across all channels efficiently. This role will manage Paid Media and will oversee all lower funnel efforts. He/she will also work directly with various leaders throughout the organization to stay abreast of organization going-on in order to prioritize and delivery appropriately.

Responsibilities:
Support seasonal media plan and strategy development in partnership with Sr Manager, Digital Marketing.
Make budget allocation recommendations for each phase of marketing funnel by channel including forecasting and modeling.
Assist in developing quarterly budget plans and monthly targets, and approach agile budget planning process based on the business flows.
Partner closely with our media agency partners to deliver on our media performance plans and goals.
Identify and continuously optimize the best placement, audience and creative optimizations. Leverage the digital consumer journey to optimize audience targeting to deliver on KPIs on a weekly/monthly basis for all paid media channels.
Lead weekly status and working sessions with agency partners and ensure plans and KPIs are being delivered.
Develop test and learning opportunities on new/existing channels with aligned KPIs.
Own campaign taxonomy and setup to ensure accurate analytics and measurements are being captured.
Work closely with creative agencies and/or internal content teams to develop content calendars by channel that support seasonal marketing stories.
Help to provide strategy and media guidance to global regions.
Assist in providing monthly, quarterly and campaign-based results for Integrated Marketing or other leadership teams.

CentralReach is a leading provider of end-to-end practice management and clinical solutions that enable applied behavior analysis (ABA) clinicians and educators to produce superior outcomes for people with autism. The company is revolutionizing the ABA space with cutting-edge solutions including precision teaching, clinical data collection, scheduling, billing, learning management, fully digital evidence-based programming and more. Trusted by more than 80,000 clinicians and educators, CentralReach is committed to ongoing product improvement, market-leading industry expertise, world-class client satisfaction, and support of the ABA community to propel industry practitioners into a new era of excellence.

We are looking for a Financial Analyst to join our finance team reporting directly to the FP&A Manager! The ideal candidate will be a self-starter with a desire to complete recurring and ad-hoc tasks with minimal supervision.

The Financial Analyst is a key financial position supporting our fast-growing SaaS business, including an associated revenue cycle management business. Initial responsibilities will focus on providing detailed financial and operational reporting and enhancing/create key performance indicators (“KPI”). This position will report to the FP&A Manager and work closely with other members of our Finance and Business Operations teams, as well as cross-functional areas of the business such as Engineering, Product Management, Sales, Client Operations & Marketing.

What You'll Do:
Assist in developing and tracking SaaS and other relevant business metrics that help drive business success
Develop and maintain financial models, templates and dashboards to track, organize and report on initiatives and key projects, work closely with regional teams to drive for standardized reporting
Prepare reporting materials for presentations
Perform ongoing variance/trend analysis among actual, budget and forecast targets
Assist with in-depth periodic customer analysis including bookings, net expansion, churn and retention
Participate actively in the design, creation and management of high impact financial models
Ensure all off-line reporting reconciles with existing system-based management reporting
Assist with the preparation of detailed budgets and forecasts, including P&L, cash flow, and balance sheet projections on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis
Support process improvement initiatives
Provide ad hoc analysis as needed

What You'll Need:
Bachelor’s Degree required; concentration in Accounting or Finance strongly preferred
3+ years’ experience in a FP&A role; preferably with SaaS / Cloud industry experience, or alternatively investment banking analyst experience
Experience working with BI tools to access different data sources such as ERP, enterprise data warehouses, SQL, data visualization systems (Tableau, Sisense) and business support systems (e.g. Salesforce, NetSuite, Namely)
Experience building dashboards is preferred
Exceptional skills in MS Excel and PowerPoint a must, with ability to comfortably use pivot tables, macros, and importing / manipulating data
Proficient in financial system and other database, strong ability in data mining and analytics
High attention to detail with excellent analytic and research skills
Strong finance acumen and financial analysis skills – including being detail oriented and proficient in building and using complicated data sources
Proven ability to work with large amount of data from different sources, and provide meaningful insights
A highly motivated, proactive and collaborative work ethic, with the ability to independently move projects forward
Positive and upbeat personality to work in a dynamic environment with all levels of management and functions and to proactively anticipate and resolve potential issues
Multitasking skills, act with sense of urgency, ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
CentralReach was developed for Clinicians by Clinicians. The story of CentralReach begins at an ABA clinic based out of Pompano Beach, Florida. The company’s founder, a practicing Board Certified Behavioral Analyst, was drowning in manual management of her clinic from scheduling staff and filing claims to reporting on clinical data. She decided that there had to be a better way to manage her operations so she could spend more time on what mattered most — working with her clients and patients. To help ABA practices focus on what they do best, CentralReach launched the first iteration of its EHR and practice management platform in 2012.

Today, under the leadership of Chris Sullens, an award-winning CEO in the technology space, CentralReach is committed to their mission of providing cutting-edge technology and services to help clinicians and educators produce superior client and patient outcomes. Already a market leader, CentralReach is expected to grow exponentially through its four core tenets: hire and develop great people; build industry-leading products; provide exceptional service to customers and continuously invest in systems, processes and infrastructure.

We value our employees and offer a robust benefits package including health and dental, paid time off, life insurance, disability coverage and a 401(k) matching. We also provide comprehensive onboarding, ongoing training, mentoring and career pathing to help you develop your career. We pride ourselves on our fun and energetic environment that also provides our employees with a meaningful way to make a difference by helping clinicians produce superior outcomes for children and adults with disabilities.

Overview

Myriad Genetics, Inc. is in search of an outstanding candidate, ideally with revenue cycle, contact center or service organization experience to work as an Analyst II for a group of products that represent pioneering advances in the field of molecular diagnostics.

Continued growth and expansion of our portfolio has necessitated this new position that is responsible for analysis of insurance and patient revenue cycle effectiveness, efficiency and excellence. This position joins an elite team building a culture of revenue cycle excellence and continuous improvement, and will influence the entire department to deliver material revenue and profit to the company.

The Revenue Cycle Analyst II reports to the Manager of Revenue Cycle Analytics reports and will serve as a key thought partner for the Vice President and Managers, as well as ASP and analytics leaders throughout the company.

Responsibilities

Drives a culture of continuous improvement that engages the Revenue Cycle Management team.
Effectively communicates problems, root causes and proposed solutions to the Analytics team and translates those solutions into a comprehensive plan of metrics and analytic deliverables for stakeholders to drive improvement.
Develops and adheres to a cadence of timely reporting and delivery of business analysis to stakeholders.
Presents data with conciseness and recommendations that build credibility for the Analytics team and the Revenue Cycle team at-large.
Builds models to support consistent, accurate and timely analysis.
Develops a thorough understanding of systems, processes and payor-specific reimbursement mechanisms and billing requirements, contributing in the proactive identification of opportunities for revenue cycle improvement and enhancement.
Participate and, at times, represent Revenue Cycle in ASP meetings and discussions
Assists management and staff with tracking action plans to ensure timely collections and timely follow-up.
Assist the Revenue Cycle Managers with measuring predictors of staff success and productivity, and identifying root causes for changes in predictors and outcomes.
Prepares analysis and uses data as a key driver to plan, organize, manage, and control collection processes.
Work effectively with the data management team to develop dashboards and inclusion of relevant Revenue Cycle data for consumption by Revenue Cycle leaders.
Analyzes data to identify trends related to adjustments, denials and rejections; develops and executes plans to avoid, reduce, and resolve denials and rejections.
Finds ways to use data to improve efficiency and automation in the revenue cycle.
Develops relationships with revenue cycle vendors to ensure vendor performance and quality meets or exceeds standards set for those relationships.
Measures and suggests improvements in clinically-based appeal strategies.
Assists in PAMA reporting for new and existing tests with accuracy and timely delivery to the Vice President for regulatory reporting.
Coordinate payor reviews with Revenue Cycle and Operations leaders to meet company goals for revenue and profitability.
Working knowledge of ICD-10, CPT and HCPCS coding, DSO reduction, accounts receivable, HIPAA regulations, and EDI claims submission methods.
Assists with requests for information from MGI Finance and Accounting and external auditors.
Participates in the Quality Assurance plan.
Qualifications

At least 2 year's directly related or equivalent professional experience
Bachelor's degree in Business, Informatics or a quantitative field is required
Fundamental understanding of revenue cycle principles, the theory of bottlenecks and use of data models to measure and predict outcomes of processes.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and experience with data tools

We're looking for team members who are inspired by challenging and meaningful work for the good of every patient. People who are compassionate and serve with a purpose. People who aspire to excellence every day.

Position Summary

Facilitates and supports the local adoption of care redesign strategies. Collaborates with IU Health system leaders to develop and execute on regional performance improvement strategies that are aligned with IU Health system goals. Assists in the development of strategic plans for the system and leads the development of sustainable, documented processes to support the business. Executes on initiatives based on sound data and leads performance improvement initiatives. Guides and supports the local implementation of care redesign methodologies. Collaborates in the development of clinically based performance analytic tools. Reports progress and clinical performance improvement opportunities to key stakeholders.

Looking to build your career at a growing company? Apply now - we can't wait to hear from you!

Requirements

Bachelor's Degree is required. Master's Degree preferred.
Clinical licensure or RN is required.
5-7 years of relevant clinical experience is required, including 3-5 years of relevant program management experience.
Requires experience managing multiple complex projects involving multiple customers.
Requires knowledge of state of the art clinical care, research and education.
Requires demonstrated proficiency in addressing and understanding organizational and system complexities.
Requires demonstrated knowledge and expertise of quality improvement methodologies.
Requires demonstrated proficiency in the use of MS Excel and MS PowerPoint. Incumbent will be expected to learn SQL.
