This job manages, designs, and conducts quantitative, statistical, and advanced analyses on a wide range of health care financing, delivery, quality, and coverage issues.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties.

This job description is a summary of the primary duties and responsibilities of the job and position. It is not intended to be a comprehensive or all-inclusive listing of duties and responsibilities. Contents are subject to change at the company's discretion.

Education

Required - Bachelor's degree in Healthcare, Public Health, Business or related field

Preferred: masters or PhD in healthcare, statistics, mathematics, data science, public health or related field

Work Experience

Required - 8 years related work experience.

Preferred - 5 years of supervisory experience.

Knowledge Skills and Abilities (KSAs)
Must have computer skills and be proficient with Windows-style applications and keyboard.
Effective verbal and written communication skills and the ability to present information clearly and professionally to varying levels of individuals throughout the patient care process.
Must have strong analytical, financial and systems skills.
Experience in building and managing highly competent and talented advanced analytic teams.
Experience working with analytics in the payor/insurance space (fraud, epidemiology/care management, actuarial, marketing/consumer dynamics, or financial) or provider/clinical space (Pharma, health system).
Experience with healthcare claims data and/or clinical data from electronic medical information systems.
Experience managing large data sets and using quantitative and qualitative analysis to draw meaningful and valid insights.
Experience using SQL, SAS/Python/R; Strong understanding of R, Python, or SAS.
Strong understanding of TSQL or PL/SQL; Strong understanding of different database environments including cloud-based ones (AWS, Azure).
Experience with modern visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Cognos) and/or other data analysis tools.
Strong communication skills (both oral and written); Must be able to present results to senior leadership, internal and external stakeholders.
Excellent organizational, motivational and interpersonal skills, capable of interfacing well at multiple levels within a large organization.
Outstanding analytic and modeling skills, proficient at conceptualizing, implementing, and evaluating highly accurate and scalable advanced analytics solutions to business problems.
Knowledge of health-related analytics concepts such as risk stratification, episode groupers, and benchmarks.
Professional and positive approach in building relationships and quickly gain credibility with senior executives.
Job Duties
Leveraging extensive, deep analytical knowledge and team leadership skills to drive the development of advanced analytical solutions and implement data-driven recommendations and outcomes.
Leading a multi-disciplinary team to develop advanced analytics, including predictive modeling/machine learning algorithms and advanced statistical tools; Function as a senior level coach and mentor to analysts; ensure quality results across the team while scaling our advanced analytics functionality.
Leading the initiatives involving exploration and analysis of data across a variety of data platforms.
Champion the execution of sophisticated analysis to address specific clinical/business problems determined by consultation with various stakeholders across the organization.
Develop sophisticated data products (visualizations, models, insights etc.) for business users.
Challenge conventional thinking and traditional ways of operating as you work with stakeholders to identify and improve the status quo.
Partnering with data science peers to identify gaps, improve quality, and share advanced modeling techniques and learnings.
Serve as the subject matter expert in analytics methodologies and best practices, including outcomes measurement and study design.
Act as a subject matter expert in advanced analytics and bring best in class, innovative ideas to test and measure performance and impact programs.
The above statements describe the general nature and level of work only. They are not an exhaustive list of all required responsibilities, duties, and skills. Other duties may be added, or this description amended at any time.

Remains knowledgeable on current federal, state and local laws, accreditation standards or regulatory agency requirements that apply to the assigned area of responsibility and ensures compliance with all such laws, regulations and standards.

This employer maintains and complies with its Compliance & Privacy Program and Standards of Conduct, including the immediate reporting of any known or suspected unethical or questionable behaviors or conduct; patient/employee safety, patient privacy, and/or other compliance-related concerns.

The employer is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Physical and Environmental Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Light Work - Exerting up to 20 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 10 pounds of force frequently, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly (Constantly: activity or condition exists 2/3 or more of the time) to move objects. Physical demand requirements are in excess of those for Sedentary Work. Even though the weight lifted may be only a negligible amount, a job should be rated Light Work: (1) when it requires walking or standing to a significant degree; or (2) when it requires sitting most of the time but entails pushing and/or pulling of arm or leg controls; and/or (3) when the job requires working at a production rate pace entailing the constant pushing and/or pulling of materials even though the weight of those materials is negligible. NOTE: The constant stress and strain of maintaining a production rate pace, especially in an industrial setting, can be and is physically demanding of a worker even though the amount of force exerted is negligible.

Must be able to sit and stand for prolonged periods of time.
Must be able to stoop, bend, reach and grab with arms and hands, manual dexterity.
Must be able to travel throughout and between facilities.

Normal routine involves no exposure to blood, body fluid or tissue and as part of their employment, incumbents are not called upon to perform or assist in emergency care or first aid.

There is no occupational risk for exposure to communicable diseases.

Slalom is a purpose-driven consulting firm that helps companies solve business problems and build for the future, with solutions spanning business advisory, customer experience, technology, and analytics. We partner with companies to push the boundaries of what’s possible—together.

Founded in 2001 and headquartered in Seattle, WA, Slalom has organically grown to nearly 4,000 employees. We were named one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For in 2016 and are regularly recognized by our employees as a best place to work. You can find us in 25 cities across the U.S., U.K., and Canada.

Job Title: Business Analyst

Slalom Consulting is seeking a talented, experienced Business Analyst. Working independently under limited supervision, the individual in this role will plan, design, develop, and analyze business plans for complex problems. The primary responsibilities of this role include gathering and coordinating project impact assessments from various groups within a client’s organization; working with stakeholders to understand their business requirements and define project scope; and helping program managers define requirements and successfully track projects throughout their respective lifecycles.

Responsibilities:
Demonstrate a logical, rigorous, and analytical problem-solving approach, leading requirements gathering sessions and preparing and delivering client presentations and work products/prototypes
Handle release schedules, prioritize projects, and ensure adequate resources are available
Attend and lead meetings; provide project status reporting to management; assist with testing scenarios; and validate results
Conduct and document complex business analysis projects
Perform technical analysis to figure out present and future business performance
Provide functional advice or training to less-senior business analysts
Occasionally lead direct or indirect employees for specific projects or objectives
Build and execute system test plans

Qualifications:
3 or more years of business or functional analyst experience in a consulting environment
Bachelor’s degree
Skilled at analyzing complex issues and distilling concepts to clients
Able to proactively identify risks, and drive action to mitigate and resolve issues
Strong analytical and interpersonal communication skills, with the ability to work independently
Strong organizational skills and the ability to handle a vast array of information
Broad understanding of the role of data management, information flow, and data governance issues
Experience with market data and vendor integration and management
Able to serve as a liaison between both business and technical teams to drive effective, timely solutions that fulfill both strategic and operational needs
Skilled at defining and documenting business processes and requirements for ongoing system improvement initiatives

Slalom Is An Equal Opportunity Employer And All Qualified Applicants Will Receive Consideration For Employment Without Regard To Race, Color, Religion, Sex, National Origin, Disability Status, Protected Veteran Status, Or Any Other Characteristic Protected By Law.

Description:
The current healthcare landscape is ever-changing, but the desire to provide patients with better, more affordable care is consistent. Healthcare providers are working to evolve and support population health management and today’s value models, but there is still uncertainty in the market. Providers need a proven, integrated approach that takes the best of today’s technology and matches it with deeply experienced professionals.

Innovista Health Solutions is an Illinois-based service organization with management services operations in Illinois and Texas. We are currently looking for a Business Analyst in our Oak Brook, IL office. At Innovista, we believe that positive forward movement in today’s uncertain healthcare market stems from the combination of innovative programs and dedicated people. Join the Innovista team and lead the charge to a better, more efficient healthcare system.

JOB SUMMARY:
The Business Analyst is responsible for supporting clients in efficiently managing contracts and reporting requirements across multiple contract types. The Business Analyst works closely with internal customers and the data department and reports to the Director of Analytics.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Create reports and analysis based on business needs and on available data elements.Produce datasets and reports for analysis using market standard tool sets (financial and healthcare).Analyze technical and general business problems and issues using and managing data from internal and external sources to provide insight to decision-makers.Identify, analyze, and interpret trends and patterns in datasets.Communicate and interact effectively and professionally with co-workers, management, internal and external customers.Develop skillset in core technologies, expand technical capabilities within department and continually learn healthcare business competencies.Work with market to analyze and interpret information from data, recommend actions to drive financial and clinical performance.Work with market to develop and leverage consistent capabilities related to the presentation and interpretation of data for clients.Identify data and reporting needs with Market LeadsPerform other duties as assigned.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience requiredAt least 4-5 years of relevant professional experience, including current or previous experience within a Hospital, Healthcare or Managed Care organization conducting analyses using claims, medical management and other data sources.Managed-care experience required (Has a working understanding of how Utilization per thousand works, Per Member Per Month (PMPM), understanding of differences between OP and IP services.)Excellent organizational skills.Demonstrate effective verbal and written communication skills.Demonstrate analytic skills when problem solving.Demonstrate working knowledge of tools to support key position requirements such as SQL, Excel, PowerBI or other reporting and analytical toolsProficient in MS Office Applications and ability to learn department and job specific software.Demonstrate high attention to detail and a high degree of accuracyAble to commit to Innovista’s corporate mission and valuesAble to switch priorities in a positive and effective manner when directed by Company leadership.Able to effectively bridge communication effectively between business and technical concepts.
BENEFITS:
Innovista is dedicated to hiring passionate individuals who embody our core values: integrity, determination, and teamwork. We recognize the importance of work-life integration and seek to provide our employees with competitive benefits, which include:

Comprehensive health plan options, dental, and vision coverage subsidized by InnovistaOpportunity to work from home, based on position and manager discretionCompany-paid benefits, such as short- and long-term disability, employee life, and AD&DDiscretionary bonus401(k) with company matchOpportunity for career advancement and growthFlex time options may be available

Overview:
Reinventing Geospatial, Inc. (RGi) is looking for a talented and motivated Software Engineer with experience in data science to join our team! The candidate will be responsible for researching, developing, implementing, testing, and evaluating various data mining and machine learning techniques within a diverse team to solve challenging problems.

The Software Engineer will work closely with researchers in support of an NGA Machine Learning and analytics project. The candidate works as part of an agile software development team to design and rapidly prototype scalable solutions and must be motivated, self-starting, and able to work well within a team environment.

Take this opportunity to support an exciting and challenging project, play with the latest technologies, all while helping our nation bring the best modern capabilities to our soldiers and analysts!

Responsibilities:
Software Engineer Responsibilities

Communicate with government customers and stakeholders
Design and build full stack application with modern technologies, intuitive user-interfaces and scalable data processing architectures using HTML5 and open source software
Rapidly prototype new methods for processing and exploiting data
Research and communicate state-of-art methods from industry, academia, and government
Evaluate and quantify trade-offs for competing methods and products
Mature solutions and deploy systems in classified environments

Qualifications:
Software Engineer Basic Qualifications & Skills

TS/SCI security clearance required; CI Poly is a plus
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or related field or years of experience

5-8 yrs. of related experience in:
Full Stack development
Data analytics and Machine Learning
Experience with one or more of the following languages: Java, C/C++, Javascript, Python
Experience with Spring,React/Vue/Angular
DevOps with Jenkins and/or AWS
Apache NiFi ( nice to have)
Kubernetes or similar
Data Processing tools (e.g. Spark, Sci-kit Learn, OpenNLP, TensorFlow)
Analysis of algorithms, software, and software architectures
Windows & Linux/Unix environments
Open Source Applications

Software Engineer Desired Qualifications & Skills

Masters in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or related field
SCRUM Team leadership, product owner, or similar role on an Agile team
Experience mentoring junior developers on a software development project
Web Application Development with Angular, Leaflet, Open Layers
REST APIs, or OGC web standards such as WFS and WMS
Databases (PostGIS, SQLite, PostGRES)
Geospatial Servers (GeoServer, MapServer)
Geospatial Data Processing (GDAL, OGR, PostGIS)
Graph analytics / Network science

Software Engineer Bonus Qualifications & Skills

Eclipse Plugin Development
Automated Testing Frameworks (JUnit, Mocha, QUnit)
Continuous Integration, Testing, and Deployment

Who We Are

Reinventing Geospatial Inc. (RGi) is a fast-paced small business that has the environment and culture of a start-up, with the stability and benefits of a well-established firm. We solve complex problems within geospatial software development and national defense to make an immediate impact for our nation’s soldiers and analysts.

We pride ourselves on giving employees an exceptional life experience, where creativity thrives and challenges are simply part of the fun. We provide truly excellent benefits, including:

100% paid employee healthcare & dental insurance
Paid parental leave
401k with matching
Escalating vacation time
Referral bonuses
Tuition reimbursement
Professional development training
Free beverages and snacks
Catered breakfast on Friday’s

NGA utilizes all processes and procedures of the Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS). Non-executive NGA employees are assigned to five distinct pay bands based on the type and scope of work performed. The employee's base salary is established within their assigned pay band based on their unique qualifications. A performance pay process is conducted each year to determine a potential base pay salary increase and/or bonus. An employee's annual performance evaluation is a key factor in the performance pay process. Employees on term or temporary appointments are not eligible to apply for internal assignment opportunity notices.

This position is a DCIPS position in the Excepted Service under 10 U.S.C. 1601. DoD Components with DCIPS positions apply Veterans' Preference to preference eligible candidates as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 USC, in accordance with the procedures provided in DoD Instruction 1400.25, Volume 2005, DCIPS Employment and Placement. If you are an external applicant claiming veterans' preference, as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 U.S.C., you must self-identify your eligibility in our ERecruit application.

Demonstrated experience in organizational skills and multi-tasking in an administrative office environment. EDUCATION REQUIREMENT: A. Education: Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in Business Administration, Criminal Justice, Criminology, Police Science, Political Science, Psychology, Sociology, or a related field. -OR- B. Combination of Education and Experience: A minimum of 24 semester (36 quarter) hours of coursework in any area listed in option A, plus professional investigative experience that demonstrates the ability to successfully perform the duties associated with this work. As a rule, every 30 semester (45 quarter) hours of coursework is equivalent to one year of experience. Candidates should show that their combination of education and experience totals to 4 years. -OR- C. Experience: A minimum of 4 years of professional investigative experience that demonstrates the ability to successfully perform the duties associated with this work.

DESIRABLE QUALIFICATION CRITERIA: In addition to the mandatory qualifications, experience in the following is desired:

1. Completion of some college classes in criminal justice or law enforcement related areas. 2. Demonstrated experience in data analysis (such as MS Excel spreadsheet). 3. Ability to keep proprietary or confidential information secure and respecting confidences. 4. Ability to develop and prepare PowerPoint slides for briefings. 5. Ability to research, understand and apply laws, rules and regulations.

Overview:
Looking for an opportunity with a dynamic, fun and goal-oriented company? We’re growing quickly and we’re looking for some not-so-typical talent to join our team.

Progress Residential® is one of the largest providers of high-quality, single-family rental homes in the United States. With more than 34,000 homes in fifteen of the country’s fastest-growing markets, our residents appreciate the flexibility, freedom and convenience of living in a single-family home without the obligations of home ownership. Progress is committed to making the home rental process easy and enjoyable for over 100,000 residents we serve by empowering our team members and investing in innovative systems and technology.

Over the past three years our portfolio has doubled in size and we have added new, top-notch executive leadership. We see increasing demand for professionally managed single-family rental homes and anticipate continued growth.

Progress Residential has a national footprint with our executive office located in Dallas, Texas, our corporate office in Scottsdale, Arizona and market offices in Atlanta, Charlotte, Dallas, Houston, Indianapolis, Jacksonville, Las Vegas, Memphis, Miami, Nashville, Orlando, Phoenix, Raleigh, Sarasota, and Tampa.

Job Summary:
The Marketing Analytics Manager supports the marketing organization to execute web analytics and deliver insights that enable proactive decisions to drive our business.

The Marketing Analytics Manager to applies state of the art quantitative methods to convert data into insights and meaningful solutions. Utilizes business and statistical knowledge to use directional indicators to make recommendations and forecast marketing goals to meet KPI metrics.

This role requires strong analytical skills, hands-on experience with metrics-driven marketing, and a passion for ingesting large and diverse data sets to analyze and produce insightful dashboards and reports that simplify marketing decision-making. Must have a true aptitude and passion for understanding and translating complex data in a way that is simple and easily comprehensible, especially for non-technical audiences.

Essential Functions:
Derive actionable insights from campaign performance reports that are meaningful and tie back to marketing goals. Based on insights, set future marketing goals and targets
Proactively explore data to find trends, discover KPIs, and apply proper hypothesis testing
Execute web analytics and deliver insights that allow our marketing team to understand the performance of campaigns and proactively manage the business
Develop insights on how to drive incremental traffic, improve engagement and increase conversion on our website experiences
Monitor campaigns to optimize performance based on industry best practices. Provide recommendations that enhance future campaign performance and measurements
Develop robust KPIs and scorecards for marketing performance monitoring
Determine leading and lagging web metric indicators than can inform future pipeline performance
Evaluate new technologies and add-on applications to improve and optimize marketing team performance
Be the first point of contact for reporting and data questions for marketing team for overall marketing programs
Familiar with key metrics to track for Data Driven Marketing such as impressions, conversion rates, click thru rates, etc.
Analysis includes but not limited to: cost per lead, cost of acquisition, customer segmentation, pipeline growth, RO.
Partners with the other members of the Marketing Team to improve the overall online experience through a comprehensive approach to SEM, SEO, Email and Social execution
Inform our customer segmentation, targeting and personalization strategizes by ensuring unique, relevant experiences for users by analyzing and optimizing audience targets
Have an in-depth knowledge of Marketing processes and strategies

Qualifications:
Certification in Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics preferred
Bachelor's Degree in IT, computer science, math or related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience
5 years of experience, including management level assignments, in a dynamic business environment conducting analysis, requirements definition, and reporting support
Understanding and familiarity with advanced analytics practices (Descriptive Statistics, Linear Regression, Forecasting
Direct experience either analyzing or managing digital performance marketing channels such as Search Marketing, Display and Social media
Extensive experience with relational databases (SQL Server, MS Access, Oracle).
Expert in complex Excel formulas
Strong critical thinking skills - understand the intersection of business use cases with analytical needs
Financial/budgeting acumen with financial accountability
Extreme attention to detail
Highly organized with ability to multi-task
Demonstrate strong project management skills
Familiarity with marketing automation and CRM systems, preferably Salesforce and Marketing Cloud
Understanding of marketing concepts and business practices; the ideal candidate should be able to demonstrate understanding of lifecycle marketing – from acquisition through retention/building loyalty

What you can expect from us:
Progress Residential® offers all the financial and non-financial incentives you would expect from an innovative, not-so-typical real estate investment and management firm:

In addition to outstanding training, we host quarterly summits and town hall meetings to encourage growth, knowledge sharing and fun at work. After all, it’s about progress, not perfection.
We offer competitive compensation, including a performance-based bonus.
Our generous benefits package includes comprehensive healthcare coverage for you and your family, parental leave, paid time off, 9 paid holidays, and a 401(k) program with company matching contributions.

Closing Statement:
This brief summary is not an all-inclusive description of job duties. Other job duties and responsibilities may also be assigned by the incumbent’s supervisor at any time based upon Company need.

Progress Residential® is a proud Equal Opportunity employer, m/f/d/v.

Auth0 is a pre-IPO unicorn. We are growing rapidly and looking for exceptional new team members to add to our teams and will help take us to the next level. One team, one score.

We never compromise on identity. You should never compromise yours either. We want you to bring your whole self to Auth0. If you’re passionate, practice radical transparency to build trust and respect, and thrive when you’re collaborating, experimenting and learning – this may be your ideal work environment. We are looking for team members that want to help us build upon what we have accomplished so far and make it better every day. N+1 > N.

Auth0 is looking for a Data Scientist to join our Growth Marketing team. This role will blend research and application to develop and apply data-centric models that support all aspects of marketing at Auth0. Additionally, this role will collaborate directly with analysts and business owners in these functional areas to understand their challenges and develop practical solutions. If you love to work with big data, scaled optimization, probabilistic inference, and machine learning this is the right role for you! The Growth team is an innovative and forward thinking team of analysts and engineers working to impact Auth0’s marketing funnel and user engagement.

This role can be based from our Bellevue, WA office or from a remote home office anywhere in North America.
What You Will Do
Work with Growth Marketers to understand best practices and propose strategic ideas and turn them into initiatives for driving growth
Define and regularly monitor KPIs, success metrics, and other analytics to maximize our conversion rate across their digital channels.
Build models, such as LTV, and help drive strategic and operational changes across all marketing initiatives
Collaborate with internal marketing and other cross-company teams to understand challenges and create data-focused solutions
Stay abreast of technology trends and best practices in data modeling
Apply creative analytical problem-solving skills to a wide variety of marketing questions to deepen our understanding of campaign effectiveness, customer journeys, and go-to-market performance
Collaborate with leadership in marketing and cross-functionally to provide a data-driven viewpoint on strategic decisions
What You Bring
3+ years of relevant analytics/data science experience in a technology company with at least 1 year working with innovative projects dealing with applications of analytics/data science
Understanding of multi-channel digital marketing
Ability to communicate across multi-functional teams for technical and non-technical audiences
Experience with emerging or existing Data Science technologies and techniques to enhance Auth0’s marketing efficiency
Assist in designing a data and computational infrastructure that can handle near real time model execution, perform machine learning, and batch large scale data for our users including data pipelines, training environments and decreasing production runtime
Understanding of computer science fundamentals, data structures, and algorithms. In-depth knowledge of one or more programming languages (including Java, C/C++, Python)
Experience in specialized areas such as Optimization, NLP, Probabilistic Inference, Machine Learning, Recommendation Systems
Experience with large data sets and related technologies, e.g., Hadoop/Spark. Knowledge of SQL is needed
Experience with LTV/CAC models, Marketing ROI and Performance management, Attribution models, digital and paid media analysis
Auth0’s mission is to help developers innovate faster. Every company is becoming a software company and developers are at the center of this shift. They need better tools and building blocks so they can stay focused on innovating. One of these building blocks is identity: authentication and authorization. That’s what we do. Our platform handles 2.5B logins per month for thousands of customers around the world. From indie makers to Fortune 500 companies, we can handle any use case.

We like to think that we are helping make the internet safer. We have raised $210M to date and are growing quickly. Our team is spread across more than 35 countries and we are proud to continually be recognized as a great place to work. Culture is critical to us, and we are transparent about our vision and principles.

Join us on this journey to make developers more productive while making the internet safer!

HR068 - Senior HRIS Analyst Workday

***No sponsorships offered at this time***

ACCOUNTABILITY STATEMENT

As the internal Workday expert for HR, the Senior HRIS Analyst will obtain requirements from the Subject Matter Experts and will perform the research necessary to provide the HR teams with alternatives. The Senior HRIS Analyst will then document the HR Subject Matter Expert’ requirements and obtain approval of the requirements prior to starting configuration changes. This role will own configuration for assigned areas, while providing advice and coaching across all configuration areas for the team. Upon completion of system changes in a test environment, will request that the SME test the changes prior to moving the changes to production.

The incumbent will provide analytic observations and development of Workday reports, dashboards, and scorecards on HR metrics to assist HR management in assessing the effectiveness of people management practices, including: recruiting, employee relations, performance management, retention, turnover, talent management, mobility, career progression. Serve as subject matter expert and act as a key resource of HR Systems projects including Workday system upgrade processes, deployment of new functionality, partnering with HR functional areas on system related process work, and major system implementation or integration project work.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
Responsible to translate business needs into functional and technical requirements, to implement solutions and to coordinate & lead activities related to project work plans.
Own configuration for assigned areas, while providing advice and coaching across all configuration areas for the team.
Meets with the user community on requests for reporting, dashboards, scorecards and analysis needs, assesses those needs, gathers requirements and develops the best structure to maximize the functionality of Workday
Develops and executes test plans to ensure reporting is operating to specifications.
Sets-up, modifies and maintains HR System Security (including but not limited to adding, changing and deleting, user ID's, passwords, role based permissions, etc.)
Works with functional leads to complete deployment activities needed to support the business intelligence reporting, insights and analytics. Creates user training documents and implementation documents as necessary.
Provides advanced support for information, reporting, analytics, and dashboard functions to all areas of the business.
Ensures data quality and integrity by performing regular maintenance and system audits.
Creates documentation for business processes and updates as necessary.
Maintains business process configuration and identifies opportunities to alter business processes and configuration to enhance or simplify current process.
Maintains organization foundation data in the Workday including, department and location data, position management, compensation administration data, performance management data, etc.
Develop new, or modify existing integrations from Workday to internal and external clients using Workday technologies including calculated fields, custom reports, EIBs, document transformation, Workday Studio, Web Services, etc.
Assists in leading projects for reporting, dashboards, integrations and scorecards in supporting system upgrades, changes and modifications. Provides timely communications to VyStar users and provides direction and required time lines with respect to required user testing based upon each upgrade. Incumbent will perform analysis in advance of all upgrades and work with each Subject Matter Expert to determine the impact on existing processes and will facilitate the decisions needed.
Researches new enhancements and education opportunities on a regular basis through Workday Community.
Acts as a Named Support Contact with Workday for all HR functionality.
Works as support and backup for the HRIS Support Specialist.
Ensures confidentiality of information and protection of rights of end-users and owners of data based on security requirements and functional area.
Incumbent is expected to demonstrate each of the following VyStar Excellence behaviors in performing the duties and responsibilities of their job.

Ø Focus Focus your full attention by carefully listening to and observing your client or member.

Ø Connect Consistently be friendly and approachable. Demonstrate you care.

Ø Understand Listen empathetically and ask questions. (70%/30%)

Ø Counsel Recommend solutions based on your client’s or member’s needs and objectives.

Ø Advance Ensure that member's expectations were exceeded.

JOB KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

Required

Candidate must have 5+ years’ experience working with Workday in a technical capacity with Compensation, Security, Report Writing, Advanced Analytics and business processes.
Must be an active user of Workday Community to increase knowledge and skills related to the various subject matter areas of HR.
Broad knowledge of the various HR areas of practice.
Able to compile reports and various analytics to aid in dissemination of actionable information.
Able to elicit requirements for process, system and integration design from technical staff and non-technical end users through well-developed communication and active listening skills.
Able to distill steps in simple and complex business and systems processes into their most granular form.
Able to create project plans and timelines based upon understanding of tasks and milestones.
Able to drive completion of project phases from discovery and design through go-live and support.
Able to create detailed test scripts to validate system functionality, business rules, and integration/data integrity.
Able to apply logic in thinking through downstream impacts for regression testing purposes and investigate system issues to root cause
Able to work in a fast-paced environment, and have proven ability to work with others.
Must work under the philosophy of “people helping people” and can communicate with staff and legal counsel at all levels.
Candidates must demonstrate the qualities of a self-starter and one who follows through on all job duties.
Advanced Excel experience working with large data sets utilizing advanced formulas and functionality

Preferred

Experience working with Workday in a technical capacity with Benefits, Performance Management and Recruiting.
Able to understand and have a "line of sight" to the impacts being made to the organization's strategic goals by the technology based solutions and business processes that are being and have been implemented.
Knowledge of Government and other Regulatory reporting processes

EDUCATION

Required

Bachelor’s degree in computer sciences or a similar degree or equivalent work experience.

DISCLAIMERS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT

Nothing in this position description is an implied contract for employment. The position description is intended to be an accurate account of the essential functions. The functions are not all encompassing and are subject to change at any time by management.

The work environment characteristics described are representative of those that an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

As required or requested, may exert up to 20 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects.

There are currently openings on Monday - Friday, Tuesday - Saturday, and Sunday - Thursday schedules.

PURPOSE OF JOB:
The Sr. Sales Operations Analyst is responsible for driving value to the Sales and Marketing teams by defining and implementing analytical and operational efficiencies. The Sr. Sales Operations Analyst utilizes their strong technical and quantitative skill set to cross functionally develop workflows and data driven insights to help drive the success for the commercial organization.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Administration

Manage the day to day functioning of the platform.
Adapt the platform to meet the evolving structure of the sales team and the company’s product portfolio.
Evaluate the reports/dashboards/fields/objects to ensure its meeting the evolving needs of the sales team.
Continuously learn about advancements with the CRM platform and ancillary applications that could be harnessed by the commercial team.
Educate end users on how to utilize the platform to analyze their territories, forecast, add relevant data.

Marketing Operations and Analytics

Collaborate with marketing team to define, develop, and assess the impact of various marketing initiatives on product sales. This includes but is not limited to physician engagement, digital marketing, comarketing initiatives, and provider/patient marketing.
Customize and adapt Salesforce CRM to meet the data collection and reporting needs for specific marketing initiatives. This also involves integrating this platform with other marketing tools the team currently utilizes.
Providing overall support for the marketing team’s operational and analytical functions.

Sales Operations Strategy: Design, Planning & Execution

Define, develop, and implement sales metrics to understand how the business is performing.
Identify sales trends and creative proactive solutions that help management gauge the performance of the business and create proactive solutions to maximize sales performance.
Develop quarterly product specific quotas.
Utilize sales analytics to help support quarterly sales forecasts, quota setting, and sales deployment decisions.
Lead the geographical territory alignment process to accommodate evolving sales team structures.

Measurement of Results: Reporting, Analytics, & Sales Data

Create and maintain sales reporting tools for use by the sales team.
Ensure data integrity and consistency across all technological platforms.
Ensure automated reports and metrics are accurate and delivered in a timely manner.
Work with third parties to troubleshoot any reporting and data issues and evolve the reporting tools to meet the changing needs of the sales teams.
Develop and present monthly sales metrics package to commercial leadership.
Provide support in development of leadership presentations (i.e. investor calls, board meetings, etc.).
Develop any ad hoc analysis requested by sales and marketing leadership teams.

Business Operations Optimization

Harness technologies and process improvements to make the field sales leadership team more efficient in analyzing their geographies and collaborating as a team.
Cross functionally collaborate with departments (from customer service, finance, HR, marketing) to ensure business processes are efficient and effective.

EDUCATION /EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:
BA/BS degree required
Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite products, with expert proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Minimum 5 years of progressive experience in data, forecasting, and/or analytics
Expertise managing data from an ERP system
Experience with CRM solutions, including Salesforce.com
Communication, relationship-building, and project management skills are critical to success
Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills
Excellent written, oral, and presentation skills
Up to 10% Travel required

PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES AND REQUIREMENTS, VISUAL ACUITY, AND WORKING CONDITIONS:

Physical Activity - Repetitive motions: Making substantial movements (motions) of the wrists, hands, and/or fingers. Fingering: Picking, pinching, typing or otherwise working, primarily with fingers rather than with whole hand or arm as in handling. Talking: Expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word.

Physical Requirements - Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects, including the human body. Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time. Jobs are sedentary if walking and standing are required only occasionally and all other sedentary criteria are met.

Visual Acuity - The worker is required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading; visual inspection involving small defects, small parts, and/or operation of machines (including inspection); using measurement devices; and/or assembly or fabrication of parts at distances close to the eyes.

Working Conditions - The worker is not substantially exposed to adverse environmental conditions (as in typical office or administrative work).

Drive financial aspects of product development, including budgets, expenditures, research and development appropriations, returns-on-investment and profit-loss projections
Oversee the creation of strategic plans to ensure the sale and profitability of products, lines, and services
Influence internal and external key stakeholders to support growth, profitability and performance of consumer and card products

Bloomberg Trade Order Management System (TOMS) is an industry leading, comprehensive fixed income solution for the trading community. Fixed Income markets have increasingly become electronic and require advanced analytic solutions to help manage the scale, speed and complexity. ETOMS is our electronic trading strategy and our aim is to be the global leader of Fixed Income Electronic trading solution.

Role:
We are looking for a Product Manager to help drive the analytics strategy building on Bloomberg's market leading platform. You will help shape the next generation of intelligent trading tools that leverage data and drive automation. The analytics strategy spans across the TOMS and ETOMS product which spans the full range of relevant tools for traders such as BI, automation engines, price engine, quoting engine, model engine, RFQ ticket, auto-quoting, STP, hedging tools, smart order router, virtual market trading. Product managers will need to apply working knowledge of every aspect of electronic trading to define the analytic product vision and detailed specifications.

Responsibilities:
The Product Manager will be responsible for:
Presenting the vision, value proposition, and development progress to senior Business Management
Influence cross functional teams including: engineering, sales, account management, support
Working collaboratively with other Product Managers to integrate analytic services across all relevant voice and electronic workflows
Documenting clear functional specifications (including SLAs) for each phase of product development
Ensuring projects are delivered on time, to specification, and that all development milestones are met

Qualifications:
Expertise in Fixed Income workflows across voice and electronic trading
Extensive experience managing complex projects and teams
Extensive experience working directly with Fixed Income traders
Asset class lifecycle expertise spanning Rates, Credit, FX, Derivatives
Experience with trading business processes including Electronic Trading, Pricing, Risk, Trade Capture, Trade Lifecycle, Business Intelligence
Highly motivated, consensus builder, collaborates well in a team
Detail-oriented with solid analytic skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent presentation skills including written, graphic and verbal
Ability to engage senior technology staff both internally & externally

Required Knowledge/Experience:
Working knowledge of Machine Learning frameworks
Intermediate level of proficiency on database frameworks, data pipelines and data analytic tools
Skilled in SQL, BQL, BQNT or Python (BQL and BQNT preferred)
Software development process (Agile methodology preferred)
Fixed Income electronic trading systems and order management systems Project management (status, risks, issues, dependencies)

The Company:
Bloomberg, the global business and financial information and news leader, gives influential decision makers a critical edge by connecting them to a dynamic network of information, people and ideas. The company's strength - delivering data, news and analytics through innovative technology, quickly and accurately - is at the core of the Bloomberg Professional service, which provides real time financial information to more than 310,000 subscribers globally. Bloomberg's enterprise solutions build on the company's core strength, leveraging technology to allow customers to access, integrate, distribute and manage data and information across organizations more efficiently and effectively. Through Bloomberg Law, Bloomberg Government, Bloomberg New Energy Finance and Bloomberg BNA, the company provides data, news and analytics to decision makers in industries beyond finance. And Bloomberg News, delivered through the Bloomberg Professional service, television, radio, mobile, the Internet and two magazines, Bloomberg Businessweek and Bloomberg Markets, covers the world with more than 2,300 news and multimedia professionals at 146 bureaus in 72 countries. Headquartered in New York, Bloomberg employs more than 15,000 people in 192 locations around the world.

If This Sounds Like You:
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this:https://www.bloomberg.com/careers/about/

Bloomberg is an equal opportunities employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Great attention to detail
Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills

Overview:
Penn Interactive (PI) is an interactive gaming company headquartered in Philadelphia with offices in Las Vegas. As the digital arm to Penn National Gaming (NASDAQ: PENN), the largest regional casino operator in the U.S., we are poised for fast-paced growth in the sports betting and online casino space. We are also partnered with some of the most innovative media companies in the world to drive growth in our businesses. As such, PI is looking for a Director Marketing Analytics to accelerate the growth of PI’s real money gaming products, including its online sportsbook and online casino games.

As a passionate and result-driven senior marketing analytics leader, you’ll lead the Sportsbook Marketing Analytics team, and will be responsible in creating a well designed and documented marketing analytics strategy and functional framework in order to deliver consistently high value data-rich actionable analysis. The goal of this strategic approach to marketing analytics will be to ensure that the marketing organization will be making smarter and ever-increasingly informed and technologically sophisticated marketing decisions to improve the overall player journey & UX, as well as to exceed the marketing SMART objectives by improving all marketing KPIs across all delivery departments.

You have had experience growing and leading a marketing analytics team in a hyper growth environment and ideally in the $100M+ annual revenue range, while not forgetting what being resourceful means, and taking on functional roles and tasks when the situation calls for it.

PI is committed to cultivating a diverse and stimulating work environment to achieve extraordinary results. We are looking for an individual who enjoys working in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment, likes to be challenged, and values the opportunity to make impacting change! We have a strong culture of teamwork, collaboration, mutual respect, and transparency, and its vital that the Director, Marketing Analytics will assist the VP Marketing in continuing to cultivate this culture as we grow.

Your daily responsibilities include:
Plan, document, execute and manage the overall marketing analytics strategy
Lead teams responsible for analysis around marketing campaign effectiveness measurement, marketing attribution, marketing mix modeling, and customer lifecycle analysis providing insights that will change future marketing decisions
Proven analytics leader. Responsible for all facets of analytics management: from requirements gathering, development of advanced statistical models utilizing typical and atypical methodologies, delivery of findings, and managing production and refinement of results
Work closely with data science, and engineering teams to build and monitor tools and dashboards to track and optimize channel performance
Supervise the development and enhancement of data models for statistical modeling purposes, tracking results against actuals, and re-specify when required
Supervise direct reports in delivering high quality, accurate, and methodologically consistent advanced analytics results
Lead, mentor, and grow team members responsible for analytical solutions to enable better decisions by the marketing organization
Execute in an intense, fast-paced, and highly iterative environment
To be successful in this position it will require the following skill set:
Bachelor’s degree (B.S./B.A.) in Business Administration, Marketing, Mathematics or equivalent combination of education and experience
8+years in an analytics role with at least 3 of those years in a Business Intelligence/Analytics management position focused on marketing analytics
Must have at least 5 years hands-on experience performing advanced quantitative analyses and 3 years leading high performing teams
Experience mentoring and coaching direct reports in delivering high quality, accurate, and methodologically consistent advanced analytics results
Proficient in digital marketing principles (omni-channel) and best practices based on extensive data collation and analysis
Ability to apply principles of logical or scientific thinking to a wide range of intellectual and practical problems while dealing with a variety of abstract and concrete variables
Ability to manipulate, analyze, and interpret large quantities of data and translate findings into actionable insights
Ability to communicate the vision of an analytics based business solution to managers/analysts who are responsible for bringing this to life
Demonstrated Business Intelligence management experience in regulated online gaming or e-commerce marketing not required but highly desired
Proven ability to develop and execute business intelligence strategy
Excellent people management skills with a proven ability to lead, motivate and influence team members and business counterparts
Ability to meet deadlines and to work under the pressure of short time constraints
Must have advanced technical & application experience with relational databases, SQL programming, Microsoft Excel, Google Analytics & Firebase, Attribution platforms (AppsFlyer, Singular etc), Marketing management and analytics platforms for reporting purposes (GTM, CRM platforms etc), and data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI etc)
Ability to clearly translate technical data into a framework and language that internal clients can understand
Ability to clearly communicate and persuasively present data and conclusions in an organized manner to a wide variety of audiences, up to and including Executive management
Experience with a variety of campaign management tools is preferred
Passion for sports AND/OR sports betting highly regarded

Something to leave you with:
Penn National Gaming is more than you may realize. We have properties throughout the United States and Canada and are embarking on an aggressive growth mode. Our departments and areas of opportunity are ideal for just about any skill set. And our company-wide commitment to making sure our guests smile as much as we do means you’ll enjoy a fun working environment.

Now that you have read about who we are, here is your opportunity to see what we're about!

The T Rowe Price Fixed Income Front Office technology team is looking for an experienced Lead Engineer in building a suite of next-generation n-tier, native cloud enabled applications.

This is a role where you can take responsibility for the full development cycle – from requirement gathering to the delivery of the end product. In this role, you will be part of a high performing engineering team whose mission is to architect and develop new capabilities using modern web/cloud technologies in AWS used by our Portfolio Managers, Quantitative and Fundamental Analysts.

This is a hands-on, full development lifecycle role which provides an opportunity to solve complex business, logic, data and technical challenges. As a leader across Fixed income technology, you will be required to think outside the box and bring cutting edge technology in-house.

You’ll work with smart, talented people across our business. We will expect you to be agile / to lead / to think outside the box. In return, we’ll give you challenging work that has an impact / opportunities to learn and grow / and a collaborative culture that encourages every member of our team to bring their point of view to the table—because that’s how we help our clients succeed.

Recommends and contributes to software engineering best practices, including those that have enterprise-wide impact

Innovate design and deliver in terms of high reliability, scalability, extensibility and high-reliability

Build large scale distributed computing programs to generate insightful analytics and present results in user-friendly visualization

Makes decisions that are cognizant of the firm’s broader business strategy

Stays abreast of industry trends and technologies and knows when/how/if to apply them appropriately

Leadership and Influence

Capable of leading large software development projects in terms of team size, technical complexity and/or organizational complexity
Drives consensus at senior levels and diffuses technical conflict when it arises
Provides feedback and coaching to others who have management responsibility of resources

A career with CAES is more than just a job, it is the pathway to a bright future.
Are you searching for a career with a company that offers challenging, diverse projects and opportunities? Are you looking for a position with a company that is growing and able to offer long-term professional advancement? Searching for a company that values a friendly work environment and that values YOU? Consider Cobham. #peoplefocusedmissiondriven #everymissionmatters

We are Cobham Advanced Electronic Solutions (CAES), a technologically advanced electronics company employing more than 3,600 talented makers, thinkers, innovators, and doers nationwide. We build things that solve challenging problems from deep space to the depths of the ocean. We serve customers in defense, aerospace, security, medical, and industrial markets. These solutions include radio frequency antennas and apertures, digital receivers, integrated microwave assemblies, and motion control solutions.
In July 2019, Cobham plc agreed to be acquired by Advent International and the deal closed in January 2020. Following the acquisition, Cobham's Advanced Electronic Solutions (CAES) business will be managed as stand-alone company and immediately re-positioned for accelerated top and bottom line growth.
Job Description
With Advent's sponsorship, CAES will initiate an enterprise value creation program with initiatives that will include growth levers (go-to-market, pricing, key account management) as well as ops improvement levers (procurement, operational improvement, product portfolio rationalization, supply chain optimization, lean, working capital) - and concurrently hire a Transformation Director to help lead this program. The Transformation Director will be responsible for supporting the day-to-day driving / tracking of the key transformation initiatives that will increase the company's value. The Transformation Director will report to the Chief Transformation Officer of the business and be headquartered remotely within geographic proximity to CAES sites on either the West coast (e.g., San Diego, San Jose, Colorado Springs, Dallas) or East coast (e.g., Philadelphia, Long Island, Washington DC, Boston).
Domestic travel of 25% - 50% of the time required.

Key responsibilities include:
Governance. Lead a company-wide transformation program that ensures the execution of the strategy and performance goals. Systematically dissect and deploy the strategy as executable deliverables with accountable owners across the leadership team and ensure adequate resourcing. Establish measurable KPIs and OKRs for each deliverable that are directly linked to the financial performance and are cascaded into team goals. Build and facilitate a system of reviews and accountability that provide real time insight into the performance of the company. Orchestrate root cause analysis of performance issues and ensure action intervention. Understand and support strong change management approaches that engages people and develops talent. Prioritize where time is spent across the enterprise to ensure teams are aligned and targets are met, leveraging the CEO to identify the most critical areas of focus.

Initiative Management. Provide hands-on execution leadership of strategic initiatives, either through personal project management or the leadership of key partners and service providers. Use data-driven analytics and root-cause analysis to build fact-based decision models while coaching others to do the same. Link project-level financials to company P&L through active partnership with the finance organization. Provide proactive resourcing and investment solutions that will solve problems, improve output, and accelerate time to impact. Apply professional project management techniques, within the frame of the governance process. Build project management tools and methods that are repeatable across the organization and establish a network of internal experts to support the spread of their use.
Communication. Provide regular reports and scorecards on progress being made against initiatives and targeted results for each. Report to executive team, board, and PE sponsors on project status, resource management, and planning for future work initiatives.
Partnering. Work collaboratively and collectively with the Senior Executive team on key initiatives and business priorities. Partner with Business Area General Managers and leadership teams to understand their business and offer opportunities for increased efficiencies and value creation. Support the coordination and communication of the transformation plan, ensuring alignment with key stakeholders and linkage to company goals.

Key success factors include:
Leadership experience in an industrial or product manufacturing environment of similar scale and complexity
Experience delivering results through complex and cross-functional improvement programs, including but not limited to operational efficiency and cost-out
Superior advisory, relationship, and stakeholder management necessary to drive change in high growth, investor-backed environment

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelors or Masters degree in finance, business, or a technical field
8+ years of professional experience in manufacturing, operations, supply chain, and other operations functions to include leading multi site, enterprise wide initiatives, including large scale programs requiring change management via a systematic approach/governance process
US Citizenship required in order to obtain/maintain a security clearance

Preferred Qualifications:
MBA
Experience operating in the Aerospace and Defense sector
Experience at a top tier consulting firm
Naturally inclusive and collaborative across a full range of internal stakeholders/levels; track record of breaking down silos; Demonstrated ability to manage and lead by influence as an individual contributor; actively seek out and promote collaborative thinking and problem solving
Inclination to invite, challenge, and explore new ideas while understanding and communicating the risks to the organization
Ability to challenge status quo when/where necessary and pivot style to produce results, e.g., reporter/partner/driver, depending on stakeholder engagement and nature of challenge
Collaborative and able to work effectively with stakeholders across a broad multi-site matrixed organizational environment
Demonstrated confidence and self-control, particularly when dealing with conflict; as well as demonstrated flexibility and an ability to deal with ambiguity and change
Expert financial, quantitative, and analytical skills; able to baseline and track operational KPIs; demonstrated track-record drawing accurate conclusions from diverse quantitative and qualitative data and then developing actionable business solutions
Able to work in a fast-paced, private-equity sponsored environment
Functional expertise in manufacturing, supply chain, and other operations functions; experience with site rationalization, supply chain optimization, and operations cost take-out

About Us:
Founded in 1934 by aviation innovator Sir Alan Cobham, our values of Trust, Talent and Technology have driven us to become a global leader in state-of-the-art aerospace and defense systems. It's the insights of our innovators today that will secure our collective future. Innovators like you!

If you are authorized to work in the United States, then we encourage you to apply. We are unable to sponsor work visas. U.S. Citizenship required for positions requiring a Security Clearance.

Cobham is one of the world's leading companies engaged in the development, delivery and support of leading-edge aerospace and defense systems in the air, on land and at sea. Our clients and partners trust Cobham to deliver the mission-critical technology they need, and we trust our employees to draw on their ingenuity and passion to deliver those solutions. This leads to an empowering culture for our people. Our Leadership team is open, sharing plans for the next five years, driving retention by offering demanding, exciting work, and providing full guidance and mentoring.

job_title: Business Analyst II Arch Bus Intel and Analytics

job_information:
The San Francisco 49ers and Elevate Sports Ventures have an exciting opportunity for a current undergraduate or graduate student to join the Business Strategy & Analytics (BSA) team as a Business Intelligence Intern for the 2020 summer and NFL season. This paid internship is uniquely positioned to play a critical role bridging the gap between data analysis and strategy development. The role requires end-to-end analysis work, including querying databases, designing reporting dashboards, building predictive models, and communicating results to management. The individual in this role will have the opportunity to interact with almost every department in the company and gain experience in all facets of the business operations of a professional sports team.

The internship includes opportunities to support Elevate Sports Ventures, a sports consulting group of which the 49ers are part owners. This work will look like more traditional consulting projects, including competitor analysis, financial modelling, and presentation deck construction.

The intern will be expected to work up to 40 hours a week, but specific schedule is flexible. Ideally, candidates will stay on for 9-12 months (April/May 2020 to March/April 2021), but exact timeline is also flexible. May be asked to work some weekends and event days (primarily NFL games).

Areas of Responsibility
Support the day-to-day business needs of the organization by building visualizations, reports, and dashboards.
Identify new KPIs to track metrics against goals, and provide actionable business insights.
Support our transition to a new consolidated data warehouse.
Assist in the validation and QA of new sources of data.
Conduct primary research and develop financial models
Draft client-facing presentation decks.

Qualifications
Proven business acumen. Previous consulting experience a plus.
Detail-oriented self-starter with proven ability to learn new skills quickly.
Team-player willing to contribute to any project.
Interest or experience in working in the sports industry, specifically within business strategy.
Advanced experience with Microsoft Excel.
Advanced experience with SQL or other database languages.
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, SAP Analytics Cloud).
Experience with data science and statistical software (R, SAS) a plus.
Development experience in Linux or scripting languages (PHP, Python, Perl, etc.) a plus.
Experience with CRM a plus.
Pursuing or completed a Masters or BA/BS in Business, Data Science, Math, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or other quantitative field.

About BSA
The Business Strategy & Analytics department has a direct hand in developing strategy for almost all departments of the 49ers business, including ticket sales & service, corporate partnerships, community relations, digital & email marketing, retail, concessions, and stadium operations. The 49ers BSA team is at the forefront of analytics in the industry, and hosts the annual Horizon Summit to promote innovation in sports and exchange ideas. The BSA team is also heavily involved with the development of Elevate Sports Ventures, a firm that provides consulting services for sports entities around the country.

About Elevate Sports Ventures
Elevate Sports Ventures is a best-in-class sports and entertainment consulting firm, providing proven, innovative solutions to organizations across the global sports and entertainment landscape. Elevate SV taps into the extensive resources, relationships, and expertise of its partners to innovate and execute comprehensive strategies and solutions in Venue Renovations, Stadium Licenses, Premium Ticketing, Corporate Hospitality and more. Formed in 2018 via a partnership between the San Francisco 49ers, Harris Blitzer Sports & Entertainment (HBSE), Oak View Group (OVG), and Ticketmaster and Live Nation, Elevate already boasts a strong portfolio of clients including the XFL, Oakland A’s, Seattle NHL, and Purdue University, among others.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Overview:
Velir is an established mid-sized agency with a top-tier portfolio of clients, ranging from the world's largest non-profits to Fortune 500 brands. We pride ourselves on our people-first culture and a low-ego workplace that embraces experimentation, collaboration and continuous improvement. We have a fun office environment located in Davis Square (Somerville, MA) and offer competitive pay and excellent benefits.

At Velir we believe and know that great design can change perspectives, drive behaviors, and spark action. It all starts with genuine people, purpose-driven projects, and a work environment that supports the creation of inspiring work. In short: You’ll work on purpose-driven brands ranging from globally recognized foundations, non-profit organizations, associations, healthcare, and higher education. You’ll work with cool people, in a flexible work environment.

Responsibilities:
Work collaboratively and clearly communicate design decisions. You can balance design objectives with the user and business in mind and offer creative options along the way. You continuously follow visual design trends and know when and how to use them in your projects.
Design information architectures, taxonomies, and wireframes that turn messy, disorganized and often very complex websites and applications into clear, navigable, and valuable resources for users.
Own a variety of activities throughout a project lifecycle, including content audits, heuristic reviews, competitive analyses and user research via interviews, surveys, and user tests.
Create engaging, usable, and effective design solutions to achieve user-focused goals and business objectives.
Familiarity with leading and/or assisting in workshops and brainstorming sessions with internal team members or with the client to define requirements and conceptual approaches.
Partner closely with Strategy, Business System Analysis, Analytics, SEO and Development to translate business and users’ goals into elegant and practical experiences.
Use best practices and strong foundational standards related to human centered design and human factors.
Use participatory and iterative design techniques, including observational studies, customer interviews, usability testing, and other forms of user discovery.

Skills & Qualifications:
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

5 to 9 years of experience designing for web and mobile
An online portfolio that showcases your conceptual design skills and demonstrates originality, innovation, and strong problem-solving skills
Broad-thinking and an ability to offer a variety of creative design solutions
Experience developing and running design-focused workshops
Ability to communicate conceptual ideas, detailed design, and design rationale, both verbally and visually to internal teams and clients
Ability to provide expertise and mentorship to others
An agency mindset; excellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and multitask, and work under shifting deadlines in a fast-paced environment

Physical Requirements

Domestic travel for client meetings as needed
Frequent sitting at a desk performing work on a computer
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions

Core Company Values

Take the Long View - Ensure the company is built to last
Be Courageous - Make the right decisions even when they aren't the easiest decisions
Be Genuine - Bring honesty and authenticity to all that you do
Work with Focus + Passion - Display purpose and pride in your work and never stop learning

At this time, Velir does not sponsor candidates and unfortunately cannot accept those on OPT or CPT.

Sharecare is the digital health company that helps people manage all their health in one place. The Sharecare platform provides each person - no matter where they are in their health journey - with a comprehensive and personalized health profile, where they can dynamically and easily connect to the information, evidence-based programs and health professionals they need to live their healthiest, happiest and most productive life. With award-winning and innovative frictionless technologies, scientifically validated clinical protocols and best-in-class coaching tools, Sharecare helps hospital systems, providers, employers and health plans effectively scale outcomes-based health and wellness solutions across their entire populations. We are always looking for people that value the opportunity to work hard, have fun on the job, and make a difference in the lives of others through their work every day!

Crossix, IQVIA, Comscore Symphony, etc.

Contribute efforts towards successful contract renewal and ongoing relationship with Key Accounts

Infectious passion for teamwork, client service, digital advertising and reaching business results

Job Description

The Pluralsight Data Org boasts one of the most innovative and highest performing Analytics teams in the world. We focus on using data to improve outcomes for our colleagues, our leadership, our customers, our authors, and everyone in the Pluralsight community. In addition, we are a team that values and encourages diverse ideas, backgrounds, and strengths. And lastly, we consider carefully the ethical and security implications of choices we make when using data, as well as the impact of our work on customers and colleagues.

It’s within that context that we are seeking an Analytics Engineer focused on Analytics Architecture and Data Modeling. In this role, you will need to leverage your knowledge of data modeling best practices, data migration strategies, data architecture, and function collaboratively within a team environment.

The perfect applicant for this role should be comfortable managing multiple concurrent work streams. In addition, they should have the capacity and willingness to completely own her/his own work streams. In short, you aren’t afraid to ask for help; however, you do not require routine guidance in order to execute on your assignments.

We love team members who are aware of how crucial it is to be proactive and communicative, fully dedicated to providing insights and recommendations in both a technical and non-technical manner. Also, we love those who routinely and reflexively create “statement of work” documentation, seek opportunities to mentor others, and create metadata to help place code in context.

Who you're committed to being:
You subscribe to the concepts of DataOps, focusing on agility, reproducibility, and scalability in a dynamic business context.
You use data to improve outcomes for your colleagues, our leadership, our customers, our authors, and everyone in the Pluralsight community.
You are a proactive, self-aware, and empathetic communicator.
You create reproducible and extensible work.
You appreciate being on a team that values and encourages diverse ideas, backgrounds, and strengths.
You create a roadmap for excellent output by identifying the questions and objectives that drive each project.
You are open to changing your methods and conclusions in response to new knowledge.
You present your work in ways that empower others to make more informed decisions.
You carefully consider the ethical and security implications of choices you make when using data, as well as the impact of your work on customers and colleagues.
You respect and invite fair criticism while promoting the identification and open discussion of errors, risks, and unintended consequences of your work.
You help others understand the most useful and appropriate applications of data to solve real-world problems.
You deeply understand existing and new technology trends, and you work with stakeholders to review and recommend innovative and cost-effective solutions.

What you’ll own:
Collaboration with stakeholders and data leaders to define and develop the analytics architecture and solution roadmap for the areas supported by the Data Insights & Analytics org
Building data models that enable business insights
Modeling from an enterprise perspective rather than from a single business function perspective
Subject matter expertise for technical guidance, solution design, and best practices within the Data Insights & Analytics org
Work with the various data teams to design/implement holistic approach to analytics architecture, pipelines, reporting, dashboarding, data exploration, processes and quality controls to enable self-service business intelligence
Process improvement via automation
Creation and implementation of standards for production-worthy data flows
Define and socialize an analytics pipeline deployment process (i.e., dev, test, prod)
Oversight of management processes related to implementation of changes in code and/or data outputs
Promotion of a culture of knowledge sharing and collaboration by organizing knowledge bases, contributing regularly, and encouraging others to contribute
Using your ability as a “systems thinker” to proactively identify and transform suboptimal data, code, or infrastructure for the purpose of maximizing impact
