job_information:
Position Summary

The Business /Data Analyst is responsible for core strategic priorities which impact the entire service portfolio of North American organization. This person will immerse themselves in analytics and data to develop deep insights that will enable improvements in our customer impact. The ideal candidate will work across the organization to curate content and build a robust data set to proactively identify opportunities to drive improvements. Key responsibilities will include revenue, Customer Support performance metrics and Customer relationship measurements. This individual will partner with service leadership to develop the approach to drive customer engagement and successful measures for continuous improvement.

Major Responsibilities
Design and implement logical data models that will collect, store, and manage key performance metrics for the organization.
Develop and maintain standard queries, reports, and dashboards for key metrics and suggest new reports as needed. Assure accuracy of all delivered data and publish data for key stakeholder review.
Compile and analyze reports, charts, graphs, and statistics from multiple source materials to accurately describe and present analysis of data.
Proactively monitor the database environment and to make changes to data structures to optimize performance and recommend changes for optimization.
Implement security protocols and test databases, including a database auditing capability to document compliance.
Implement an appropriate database backup and recovery strategy based on data volatility and application availability requirements. Maintain database data integrity and structural integrity.
Respond to data requests in a timely and concise manner using a standard reporting format.
Determine and develop key measures of success for customer engagement and core business growth and translate these measures into strategic initiatives to increase customer success and drive business growth.
Accurately communicate relational database technology and design to others. Integrate database administration requirements and tasks with general systems management requirements and tasks.

Qualifications:
This position is to report to Buffalo Grove, IL Prefer candidate to be based locally to work onsite however will consider REMOTE/Work from home options with 20% travel to Buffalo Grove, IL. This position will require 20-30% travel both domestic and internationally.

Required:
A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree is required OR a Master’s degree with relevant experience.
A minimum of four (4+ ) years’ of relevant experience is required. Preferably in business analytics or a data specific role.
Technical expertise building data models and datasets to gain valuable insights.
Experience in Microsoft Excel, Power BI, and/or Salesforce reporting.
Demonstrated problem-solving skills and a process-driven mindset.
Proven analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to present complex ideas, verbally and in writing, in a clear, concise fashion, to technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to successfully work with cross range of teams including field service and sales, manufacturing and operations.

Preferred skills:
Experience dashboarding, and insight generation
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Good understanding and working experience in technology development best practices (such as, Agile, etc.)
Capable SQL, Python, and data-visualization skills.

Competencies/Behaviors
Ability to manage multiple strategic initiatives and projects simultaneously to drive continuous improvements in customer satisfaction and core business growth.
Accountable team player with a constructive attitude, problem-solving and customer service mindset who can work with cross-functional teams.
Consultative approach, including the ability to translate customer needs and requests into technical or strategic requirements and process flows for consumption by our service and sales teams.
Baseline ability to manage stakeholder expectations by identifying and understanding stakeholder needs, determining alternatives to meet requirements and communicating appropriately.
Flexibility in shifting direction quickly when priorities change; excellent multi-tasking skills and the ability to learn quickly in a dynamic environment.

Internal Relationships:
Customer Support Teams, Field Sales, Field Service, Commercial Operations, and Corporate Accounts, Service Management, Finance, Sales, Service

External Relationships:
Limited engagement with Customers.

About DMI:
DMI (Digital Management, LLC.), the world’s first end-to-end mobility company, combines all the skills and services necessary to deliver mobile enterprise solutions. Built to reinvent business through mobility, DMI has expertise in mobile strategy, UX, web, and app development, omni-channel commerce, brand and marketing, IoT and big data analytics, and secure device and app management. The company’s unique, integrated approach to mobility has resulted in dramatic growth as well as an expanding client base, which includes hundreds of Fortune 1000 commercial clients and all fifteen U.S. Federal Departments. DMI is headquartered in Bethesda, MD, with satellite offices around the world. The company was named one of the 2018 Top Workplaces and 2019 Top Workplaces in the Washington, DC area by The Washington Post and received Inc. Magazine’s Hire Power Award as one of the top 100 Private Job Creators in the US. Additional information is available at www.dminc.com and on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.

About the Opportunity:
DMI is seeking a senior level DataStage ETL Developer to participate as a member of an agile development team building, integrating, and maintaining a global human resource Records Management Application (RMA) for the United States Army. The ETL Developer will work as part of a product development team and be involved in the design, build, unit testing, and deployment of ETL jobs and sequences built using IBM DataStage. The developer should expect to pull multiple formats of source data, including XML, web services, delimited flat files, and other sources.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Responsible for translating functional ETL requirements into a technical design document, building the DataStage jobs and sequences to pull data from the source into staging tables, from staging tables into historical tables using Change Data Capture methodologies, and then from historical tables into dimensional data marts for reporting

Designs, develops, enhances, debugs, and implements software. Troubleshoots production problems related to software applications.

Researches, tests, builds, and coordinates the conversion and/or integration of new products based on client requirements. Designs and develops new software products or major enhancements to existing software.

Addresses problems of systems integration, compatibility, and multiple platforms.

Consults with project teams and end users to identify application requirements.

Performs feasibility analysis on potential future projects to management.

Assists in the evaluation and recommendation of application software packages, application integration and testing tools.

Resolves problems with software and responds to suggestions for improvements and enhancements.

Acts as team leader on projects.

Instructs, assigns, directs, and checks the work of other software developers on development team.

Participates in development of software user manuals.

Qualifications:
Education and Years of Experience:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field and 5 years related experience

Required Skills/Certifications:
Experieince with IBM DataStage, SQL, Dimensional Data Modeling, Unit Test, Code Coverage, JIRA, and Extraction Transform Load (ETL)

Aetna's Internal Audit Department serves Aetna's Audit Committee and assists management in achieving Aetna's goals by conducting independent and objective assurance and consulting activities. Your time with Aetna's Internal Audit qualifies for most state's CPA experience requirements.
The Audit Senior Consultant will be a key member of the Internal Audit Direct Assistance team and will participate in the execution of audit procedures in partnership with the External Auditor, particularly those requiring experience.
As an Audit Senior Consultant, you will be responsible for performing and documenting auditing tasks under the supervision of more experienced auditors including; audit planning, executing testing procedures, preparing workpapers in adherence with methodology, researching potential audit issues, identifying opportunities to enhance the process by utilizing the data analytics tool (Alteryx), and performing review over less complex audits.
You will work with minimal supervision, performing detailed testing, analysis, and validation that will require the ability to demonstrate strong judgement, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities.
You will meet various levels of business partners that will require the ability to build a strong working relationship providing high quality deliverables and communication. Through this role you will gain a strong in-depth knowledge across various business functions.
This role will require the ability to collaborate on projects that are interdependent, and the team is mutually responsible for the end deliverable.
You will have the ability to develop leadership skills by assisting in training and developing others.
You will be expected to build project management skills by participating on multiple projects while adhering to deadlines.
This job will require travel to audit locations within the U.S. roughly 0 - 10% of the year.

Execute testing and create work paper documentation
Understand procedures, results and business impacts; and document and express such understanding in both written and verbal form

Create clear and accurate documentation and workflows of business processes and testing results and exceptions Ideal Candidate Profile:
We are looking for talented individuals to help us carry out our mission to develop and execute a risk-based audit plan using an approach that requires communication and collaboration with our customers.

Demonstrates a commitment to integrity, the Aetna code of conduct and respect for diversity
Meets administrative reporting requirements and supports department initiatives
Encourages teamwork and a positive environment to improve team effectiveness
May perform responsibilities such as participating in the execution of complex tasks for assigned audit and compliance objectives
Able to work independently

Professional designations (i.e., CPA, CIA, CISA)/advanced degrees - or measured progress in achieving, desirable
Demonstrates critical thinking and analytical ability
Demonstrated communication and collaboration skills

JOB SUMMARY:
The ERP Business Analyst understands business processes and maps them back to JDE applications, specifically as they relate to Finance and Accounting. The ERP Business Analyst drives the definition, optimization and improvement of new and existing business processes via development of business and functional requirements. This position manages process compliance as appropriate (e.g. internal controls, regulatory requirements, other business process, etc.) including development and delivery of documentation and training materials.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Gather business requirements and other documentation translating into detailed functional design document.
Provide functional support including system configurations related to JDE Finance modules/processes: General Accounting, A/R, A/P, Invoicing, Tax & Order Management. Work with business users to gather, refine, and document business requirements to enhance JDE E1 functionality based on approved user requirements.
Resolve and close ServiceNow production tickets at all levels including providing system navigation support, resolving configuration, process, and data issues for E1 and other systems. Communicates and educate changes and issue resolutions.
Work with business stakeholders, project managers and the technical team in order to analyze processes, documenting AS-IS and TO-BE business process flows and provide high quality project deliverables.
Assist in developing business cases, testing and estimates. Identify and troubleshoot risks and issues that arise pertaining to ERP platforms.
Contributes to ERP implementation activities such as business requirements & analysis, mapping business processes, system configuration, application customization functional specifications, integration testing, data migration and or data conversion, understanding the integrations between various applications.
Contributes to process and organizational continuous improvements.

SCOPE & IMPACT:
This position supports the La-Z-Boy system global enterprise, including Supply Chain (manufacturing, distribution centers), support functions (Accounting, IT, Tax, HR) and La-Z-Boy companies (Casegoods and Joybird). This position will support how processes and data work together through the business to efficiently and effectively operate the business.

Experience in JD Edwards EnterpriseOne 9.0 and higher
Excellent business communication, negotiation and presentation skills.
Strong attention to detail required
Desire to work in teams

job_information:
Main Objective:
The Data Engineering Specialist works with data engineers, data scientists, user researchers and product managers to create a data architecture that ensures the right information is available and accessible to study user behavior, to build and track key metrics, to understand product performance, and to fuel experimental analysis .

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Design lasting solutions that combine data from downstream applications in our Enterprise Data Lake to surface critical information and performance metrics.

Manage and optimize the usage of our Google Analytics 360 environment as a significant source of user data that supports decision making across the organization.

Applies data mining capabilities to aggregate, validate, and disseminate actionable insights through information delivery tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Salesforce Einstein.

Champions and further develops best practices for measuring & optimizing downstream activities through data-driven decision making.

Design segmentation models to inform our acquisition and communications strategy.

Serves as the subject matter expert on Google Analytics 360 capabilities, information availability through Google Big Query, and integrations with various applications including Salesforce.com, Marketing Cloud, and CVent.

Serves on cross-functional teams to provide user insights, set KPIs, and monitor results with a consistent goal of improving program outcomes.

Anticipates and plans analytical capabilities to answer questions that the organization will need to answer in the future.

Supports implementation of tools and the development of infrastructure to help scale analytics, increase efficiencies, and improve the quality of results.

Continuously learns and evaluates new analytics technologies and stays up-to-date on new trends and tools.

Occasional travel for training, meetings, or trade shows may be required.

Incidental Duties:
The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed in this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, and indeed additional responsibilities may be assigned, as required, by management.

Education and Experience:
2+ years of experience in an analytics role is preferred.

Bachelor’s degree in Information/Data Science, Economics, Statistics, or a related field required.

Master’s Degree or other advanced degree is a plus.

Knowledge and Skill Requirements/Specialized Courses and/or Training:

Experience with Google Analytics is required, GA 360 experience preferred.

Experience with Microsoft Azure or similar data lake solution is preferred.

Advanced knowledge of analytics best practices and data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Cognos, or similar is required.

Experience with SQL, R, Python, or similar is required.

Advanced knowledge of Salesforce.com and Marketing Cloud preferred.

Experience with sourcing data through APIs via XML or JSON preferred.

Excellent analytical skills with demonstrated ability to solve problems.

Ability to work cross-functionally across a variety of disciplines.

Ability to communicate with peers, cross-functional partners, and internal stakeholders.

Ability to work effectively in a team environment with strong attention to detail.

Ability to work on multiple projects at the same time.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Machine, Tools, and/or Equipment Skills:
Experience working with a variety of software tools including Microsoft Office Suite and industry leading Analytics and Business Intelligence software.

Reasoning Ability:
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.

Mathematical Skills

Ability to comprehend and apply mathematical principles to the degree required to perform the job based upon job requirements.

Language and Communication Skills:
Ability to comprehend and apply language skills to the degree required to perform the job based upon the job requirements listed above. Ability to verbally communicate ideas and issues effectively to other team members and management. Ability to write and record data and information as required by procedures.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

ForceFlux provides enterprise applications and services, helping customers worldwide improve operations, drive growth and quickly adapt to changes in business demands. We're engineered for speed, with the vision to empower our customers to achieve speed as competitive differentiator and a platform to reimagine enterprise software. We make decisions quickly, in the best interests of our customers. Our eyes are on the future, not the past. If this sounds good to you, then read on.

We're a company unparalleled in application breadth, market experience, open technology, and global reach. The best part is, we're achieving our goals while holding fast to the principles on which we were founded: customer service, teamwork, value, integrity, and a total cost of ownership that is lower than what any of our competitors offer.

We offer world-class solutions and professional services

We help our customers solve their most critical business challenges
We are profitable and growing rapidly around the world

About ForceFlux At ForceFlux, we bring the world closer together so every person and every company can find the fastest way to the possible. Imagine if you could run applications up to 200 times faster over your WAN, reduce network traffic by up to 95%, and collaborate anywhere as if you were in the same room- you can! OneMain Financial is the country’s largest lending-exclusive financial company. With nearly 1,600 branches across 44 states, we proudly offer safe, affordable and transparent installment loans to millions of hard-working people. Our customers turn to us to meet important financial needs, including debt consolidation, medical expenses, household bills, home improvements and auto purchases.

OneMain is constantly innovating to serve customers when, where and how they want by investing in our technical digital capabilities. Our steadfast commitment to doing the right thing extends to our customers, our employees and the communities where we live and work – a mission that hasn’t changed for more than 100 years.

About the Role

This role is responsible for building and presenting advanced reports that inform critical business decisions for our operations teams. In this position you will develop custom reports and enhance recurring reports based on relationships with key centralized and analytics leaders. Difference makers within OneMain demonstrate the ability to apply critical thinking skills, draw insights from their work and most importantly, leverage their business acumen to communicate, influence and implement the results. Key areas that will be impacted by your work include: trend reports, loss mitigation, collections strategies, production metrics and geo/heatmaps.

Core Responsibilities

Use advanced skills with data query tools (i.e. SQL/Greenplum, Base SAS, Python) and reporting software (SAS Visual Analytics, R-Shiny/Markdown, etc.) to develop and present advanced reports
Autonomously draw conclusions and make recommendations for developing or modifying existing strategies or processes based on findings of the reports
Present results to various levels of leaders and influence business / strategy decisions

Key Qualifications

At least five years’ experience in building advanced reports (prior senior analyst experience preferred) and Master’s or PHD degrees may offset experience
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Applied Statistics, Economics, Data Analytics preferred (Graduate Degree in STEM related programs highly preferred)
Business Intelligence Experience in SAS-VA, KPI Reporting, Developing Heat/Geo Maps, along with demonstrated advanced skills in SAS & SQL required.

Benefits

At OneMain, we understand that for our team members to be their best, they need the right opportunities and benefits. Our comprehensive benefits package for full-time and some part-time employees includes health and well-being options for team members and dependents, up to 4% matching 401(k), tuition reimbursement, continuing education, incentive pay, paid time off, paid volunteer time and more.

Digital Coordinator Job Description

JOB SUMMARY:
The Digital Coordinator is responsible for supporting Gaia Herbs digital and eCommerce operations, working to improve functionality, user experience and overall performance of Gaia Herbs websites. The position assists with executing digital and eCommerce strategies, Direct-to-Consumer (DTC) business initiatives and visual merchandising strategies to improve user experience and sales. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a growing team, working on projects that directly influence consumer behavior to drive revenue.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Owns product catalog updates for all digital channels, working with cross-functional stakeholders to ensure new products are published on time and ongoing updates to current products are completed per specifications.
Assists in day-to-day operation of gaiaherbs.com, supporting the execution of DTC calendar including weekly and seasonal site refreshes and product launches. Maintains content in Shopify and CMS by setting up pages, collections, promotions and promo codes and completing updates in Google Tag Manager.
Develops process for website quality assurance and performs website usability testing on an ongoing basis, ensuring optimal performance of websites and a smooth customer experience from home page to check-out.
Manages technical support in JIRA, creating tickets, writing requirements, and coordinating projects for all internal teams and vendors. Collaborates with management and internal teams to ensure project success.
Identifies and reports website defects, functionality bugs, styling issues, and submits new development requests that make up the Digital & eCommerce team's development backlog.
Manages quarterly Store Locator updates in collaboration with internal teams.
Works to increase revenue through the optimization of on-site search engine, using analytics and search technology toolset to identify opportunities.
Utilizes analytics and DTC sales performance to identify opportunities to improve conversion, product page view, cross-sell and add to cart rates, all to drive incremental sales for areas of responsibility.
Assists Digital Product Manager with the execution of SEO projects. Contributes to strategy by developing action plans to measure SEO success.
Supports Digital Marketing Manager on affiliate program, reviewing and approving new applicants, corresponding with applicants and working on special projects.
Supports consumer engagement initiatives as needed, including review and approval of site product ratings, and crossover support for DTC consumer and social engagement.
Assists Digital Product Manager with ongoing special projects, as needed.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
None

QUALIFICATIONS:Education and/or Experience:
Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Communications, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
3+ years of experience in project management or day-to-day website maintenance, with ecommerce experience highly desirable.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Strong technical understanding of website functionality with previous experience coordinating digital content; agency experience a plus
Demonstrated experience with project management and PM tools such as JIRA, Basecamp, or Asana
High attention to detail with excellent time management skills, able to juggle multiple complex projects at any given time
Strong analytical skills and data-driven thinking
Fast learner; can quickly grasp the big picture and help get things done
Hard-working and driven, with ability to work well independently and collaborative team environments
Hands-on experience with Google Tools including Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Google Tag Manager is preferred, or ability to quickly learn new software
Some knowledge or experience with SEO is preferred
Familiarity with CSV imports/exports, product feeds and databases is a plus
Experience with a/b testing and tools is a plus

PHYSICAL DEMANDS
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand and walk. The employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl, talk or hear; and taste or smell. Specific vision abilities required by this job include the ability to be able to view a computer screen.

WORK ENVIRONMENT
The work environment of this position is a standard office environment at the Gaia North location in Mills River, NC, with low noise level. This employee may infrequently pass through a manufacturing plant, where they would be exposed to moving mechanical parts, airborne particles, toxic or caustic chemicals and loud noise.

The above statements are meant to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and skills required of personnel so classified.

Autobooks works hard to make small business banking simple. Through our partnerships
with banks and credit unions, small business owners have access to a modern suite that
makes business banking easier.

When you join Autobooks, you're joining a team dedicated to small business growth. We
want your ideas, passion and experience to continue improving what we offer.

Our downtown Detroit HQ is in the vibrant Madison building, named one of the World's
Coolest Offices by Inc. Magazine. Autobooks also has a growing presence in Texas with a
satellite office in Austin; and offers flexible, remote work environments for certain roles.

Ready to help change what it means to do small business? Let's talk.

As a Customer Success Representative you will provide our SMB customers with the
support they need to grow their small businesses on Autobooks. Customer Success
Representatives manage our day-to-day inbound inquiries from SMB customers who are
looking for fast and friendly help in navigating their way around the Autobooks platform
and getting answers to product-related questions. You should be a naturally positive and
empathetic individual, with great communication skills and an affinity towards helping
small business owners, and not afraid to dig into some analytics from time to time.
Comfort speaking on the phone is a must, and familiarity with customer support software
is highly recommended. Past experience working in a support role at a software company
is encouraged.

Autobooks
Diagnose software issues and engage with our Product and Engineering teams
using established processes
Possess a holistic understanding of the unique challenges small business owners
face
Work with leadership to identify high-revenue SMBs and seek to grow their
adoption of the Autobooks platform
Provide support and guidance to SMBs of all types and sizes using AutobooksDevelop trust and rapport among SMBs to reduce their churn of the Autobooks
platform
Communicate thoughtful, customized solutions to SMBs to help them successfully
rely on Autobooks to manage their business

Show composure, resilience, and flexibility as customer needs evolve and case
volume fluctuates

Participate in sales and handoff meetings to schedule and determine the scope of
the project.

May call small businesses to assist in rollout sign up activities.

Familiarity with customer support softwareSpoken and written conversational skills and easeCollaborative, fast-moving, and comfortable with changePast experience in customer support or customer facing rolesHigh levels of empathy, patience, and problem-solving abilitiesExperience helping customers of software applications resolve problems

Detroit, MI

Advance your career at Liberty Mutual Insurance – A Fortune 100 Company!

The Company:
Liberty Mutual Investments (LMI) manages Liberty Mutual Insurance Group’s (LMIG) global financial assets across global and private domains to build capital and generate income. With over $80 billion in AUM and staffed with 250-plus investment, finance and operations professionals located in Boston, Mass., we offer the best of both worlds -— the look and feel of a boutique investment firm and the reputation and financial strength of a global leader.
LMI has been on a transformation path to spur innovation, capitalize on deep expertise, and scale its returns on long-term flexible capital through a “one firm, one portfolio, one team” mindset. Our operating model is built on three pillars: centralized portfolio construction, asset management and investment-enabling services. The teams are structured as Investment business units (IBUs), working in concert: Strategy & Asset Allocation, Risk Management, Global Fixed Income, Global Partnerships & Innovation and Investment Enabling Services (IES). Our portfolio spans a broad spectrum of public and private asset classes, and we are committed to expanding our capabilities and our toolkit in furtherance of our mission.
LMIG is proud to be recognized for a second time in 2019 as a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune magazine and as a Great Place to Work.

Responsibilities:
A portfolio manager role working in Liberty Mutual Investments’ fixed income group.
Primary responsibility for managing all derivatives, treasuries, agencies, and ETFs.
Manages interest rate and foreign currency risk exposures for all fixed income portfolios, including rates hedging of daily trading activity in other asset classes. Utilizes cash, treasuries, and derivatives to execute this mandate.
Responsible for managing all derivatives instruments at Liberty Mutual Investments, including construction, order creation, and position rolling to achieve desired risk exposures.
Manages certain market beta exposures by utilizing derivatives, ETFs, and other instruments, as appropriate.
Manages cash and cash alternatives for all portfolios, including optimization of short-term investments across available instruments, maintaining liquidity at target levels, and communicating cash flow details to asset class Portfolio Managers.
Works closely with, and largely at the direction of the Fixed Income Asset Allocation Committee and asset class Portfolio Managers who establish targets for risk exposures across fixed income portfolios.
Promotes efficiency and risk reduction in executing these various mandates by fostering the development of new ideas and strategies.
Pursues the development of technology, data and analytics needed to support this role.
Identifies opportunities for adding alpha in the management of these instruments while strictly adhering to risk targets.
Assists with the onboarding of new derivative capabilities.

Qualifications:
5+ years of experience in fixed income asset management in a portfolio management, trading, or similar role.
Experience analyzing, modeling, portfolio construction, and trading of derivative products including credit, interest rate, and/or foreign currency instruments.
Highly experienced with Blackrock’s Aladdin investment platform and Bloomberg.

Benefits:
We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, it’s our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits.

Liberty Mutual values diversity and the differences and similarities of our employees. We foster a diverse and inclusive work environment that leads to better ideas, stronger teams and more creative products and services for our customers.

We enjoy the important work we do every day on behalf of our members.

Job Summary

The VP of MassHealth product strategy is responsible for the development and execution of product strategy and end-to-end performance management of the MassHealth product offered by Tufts Health Public Plans, which features ACO partnerships with multiple provider organizations in the Massachusetts market.

Reporting to the division president, the VP is accountable for the overall success of the MassHealth product, as measured by traditional KPIs such as P&L performance, membership growth, quality rating, and compliance, as well as strategic performance drivers such as innovation and market impact. The VP’s responsibilities are carried out by effectively managing relationships across several critical domains, including the state, ACO partners and internal departments in a matrix enterprise. This role works closely with a cross-section of business and functional leaders and leads a team that manages day-to-day product-related issues for customers and other stakeholders.

Besides accountability for the MassHealth product, the VP also serves as a leader of THPP’s product strategy, who works with the president, other senior leaders of the division, along with enterprise product leaders in longer-horizon planning activities around strategic directions of the THPP product portfolio, including but not limited to, performing periodic market assessment, evaluating new product opportunities, and developing new business models of product management.

The VP is expected to manage a team consisting of directors, managers, and analysts/coordinators.

Job Description

Product performance management

Develop overall product strategy for MassHealth and define SMART goals, including strategies to meet short and long-term profit margin goals
Lead the development and implementation of product performance metrics for ongoing management and improvement
Identify, articulate and prioritize initiatives to be delivered to support product success, which involves direct collaboration with other enterprise functions. These may involve a wide array of expertise such as finance and actuarial, provider contracting, population health management, marketing, IT and operations. Work with appropriate departments to ensure implementation and oversight.
Provide periodic reporting to enterprise leadership on comprehensive product performance, highlight opportunities and risks, and recommend areas of focus
Manage relationships with customers and other external stakeholders, building trust/credibility, and resolving issues in a timely and responsible manner

State relations

Working closely with the Government Affairs department and other functional teams in the enterprise,

Manage the collaboration with MA EOHHS (the State) in relation to the MassHealth product, ensuring the organization’s dependability and rigor in its day-to-day fulfillment of program requirements
Proactively engage the State in policy advocacy and program negotiations, convening internal cross-functional coalitions and external allies as appropriate
Continuously improve overall relationship with the State as measured by visibility into State priorities and the ability to provide constructive inputs into program development

ACO strategy and partnership management

Lead the development of ACO partnership strategy and continuously strengthen the governance structure of the ACO partnerships
Develop and manage strategic relationships with ACO executives and clinical leaders in an increasingly sophisticated partnership model, with growing ability to drive innovative collaborations and change providers’ organizational culture
Oversee day-to-day business relations with ACO partners, address operational issues, and ensure compliance with state requirements and milestones
Support ACO organizations’ infrastructure development, performance improvement and accountability enforcement towards an integrated care management model, in close collaboration with the Public Plans CMO and Enterprise Health Care Services leaders
Facilitate 3-way relationship that includes THP, ACOs and the State, leading or supporting joint advocacy on behalf of the partnerships

Internal Collaboration and Change Management

Collaborate with internal business functions (Finance, Actuarial, Population Health Management, Operations, Contracting, Legal, IT, etc.) to execute on performance management and improvement initiatives for the MassHealth product. Jointly develop performance metrics with internal colleagues that help hold the organization accountable in a collaborative and productive manner
Work closely with certain key functions to develop strategies and oversee implementation of significant business model changes, such as 1) moving towards a data-driven, high-impact clinical care model that is highly integrated with ACO organizations; 2) standing up a multi-lever behavioral health and substance abuse treatment strategy to meet unmet needs for the MassHealth population.

Requirements

EDUCATION:
MBA or other advanced degree required unless an exception is uniquely justified.

EXPERIENCE:
At least 10-12 years of related experience.

SKILL REQUIREMENTS:
Deep knowledge of and experience in government health care. Direct experience working in leadership capacity with the MassHealth program highly valued
Executive leadership capabilities in strategy, finance, operations, and business performance management. Demonstrated track record of successful ownership in large-scale initiatives and functions
Strong relationship building and influencing skills; ability to work collaboratively with all levels of internal and external stakeholders
Strong critical thinking, analytics and problem-solving skills
Advanced health care finance knowledge required
Energetic and effective communicator able to matrix with executive management and business leads
Cultural competency as reflected in humility, openness, and a supportive style of collaboration
Ability to effectively manage a team of directors, managers, analysts and other contributors

CONFIDENTIAL DATA: All information (written, verbal, electronic, etc.) that an employee encounters while working at Tufts Health Plan is considered confidential. Exposed to and required to deal with highly confidential and sensitive material and must adhere to corporate compliance policy, department guidelines/policies and all applicable laws and regulations at all times.

What makes Gartner a GREAT fit for you? When you join Gartner, you’ll be part of a fast-growing team that helps the world become smarter and more connected. We’re the world’s leading research and advisory company, achieving consistent double-digit growth by steering clients toward the right decisions with business and technology insights they can’t find anywhere else. Our associates enjoy a collaborative work environment, exceptional training and career development — as well as unlimited growth opportunities. If you like working with a curious, supportive, high-performing team, Gartner is the place for you.

About this role:
With the support of their Leadership Partner, our clients are able to achieve their goals more quickly and more cost effectively and with a higher assurance of success. You will have the opportunity to learn about and deliver solutions for, the most complex business, process, people and technology challenges facing the world’s largest community of Global 1000 organizations and government agencies.

What you’ll do:
Manage a portfolio of 25-30-member relationships and participate in account planning with Gartner Leadership Client Managers and Account Executives.
Leverage data and analytics related business, process and technology subject matter expertise to create service solutions for the members and multi-member accounts.
Define and deliver innovative solutions by assessing member needs and developing a customized value plan in accordance with overall product strategy and deliverables.
Define and conduct on-site sessions for clients at their location in support of key initiatives.
Participate in all phases of the member lifecycle: pre-sale, on-boarding, relationship management, delivery, review and service renewal.
Responsible for member retention and for contributing toward growth in the region through direct support of Gartner Sales in prospect cultivation, account plan development and value demonstration activities.
Host and/or participate in periodic member activities, including special interest groups (SIGs), workshops, research analyst visits (where appropriate), roundtables and webinars (in collaboration with Gartner Research).

What you’ll need:
A university graduate (Masters preferred) with 10+ years of experience working as a Director or in a Senior management role
Successful experience in roles such as Chief Data Officer (CDO), Chief Analytics Officer (CAO), Chief Data Scientist, Data Scientist, VP of Analytics and similar
Management consulting experience
Current or past security clearance
Knowledge, experience and expertise in the subject matters noted below
Critical thinking and problem solving to assess client situation and provide actionable outcome-based business/technical advice
High tolerance / evolved ability to lead and manage ambiguous situations
Excellent relationship management skills including experience working with senior IT and business leaders
Experience coaching and mentoring senior level leaders
Collaboration and team leadership
Strong time and client portfolio management skills
Travel 25% and upwards

Who you are:
Critical thinker and problem solver demonstrating the ability to assess our Member’s situations and provide actionable, outcome-based business/technology/process/people advice as well as the ability to leverage appropriate resources to help Members achieve results
Excellent relationship management skills, including experience working with C level executives
Ability to build strategic internal partnerships with key roles across the organization and positively impact change
This role is a client-facing position that requires a high level of executive presence and ability build trust and deliver value.
Demonstrate superior verbal and written communication skills as well as strong facilitation and presentation skills.

Subject Matter Expertise:
The successful candidate will have had successful experience in a Chief Data Officer, Chief Analytics Officer, Data Science, VP/Sr. VP Business Intelligence and/or Analytics/Business Analytics role within a Global 1000 organization or government agency with commensurate responsibilities and span of control. Additionally, candidates would also have experience in executive level roles within consulting or customer facing positions. Candidates should have strong business acumen and executive presence while also possessing knowledge, experience and expertise with modern data science and/or office of the Chief Data/Analytics Officer responsibilities and topics including:

Office of the Chief Data Officer (CDO) / Chief Analytics Officer (CAO)

Provides advisory guidance to CDOs/CAOs with regard to enterprise-wide data and/or analytics strategy - e.g., expected business outcomes and roadmap, governance e.g., funding, ownership and operating structure, quality, master data, policies, standards and execution e.g., skillsets, technologies, business use cases, etc.
Extends CD/AO insight into risk and value management e.g., financial, regulation and compliance, safety, etc. and sales growth and profitability, customer experience and retention, etc.
The business value of a CDO/CAO function
Managing CDO/CAO responsibilities vs. data management under the CIO and business analytics under various C-level business functions/divisions leaders
The relationship between CDO/CAO functions and information architecture, marketing analytics, risk analytics, etc.
Organization/staffing of the CDO/CAO office

Data Science & Analytics

Broad and deep understanding of Data Science precepts and its applied nature to solving specific business problems, such as:

Precepts (sample):
Machine and deep learning
Internet of Things (IoT) data and algorithms
Cloud data monetization
Natural language processing and pattern analysis
Smart machines
Statistical analysis
Hypothesis (A/B) testing
AI / BOTS
Conceptual modeling
Predictive, prescriptive and sentiment analysis
Business Applications (sample)
Risk Management e.g., credit, interest, compliance, etc.
Growth, Revenue, and Profitability
Customer Experience, Acquisition, Servicing, Loyalty, and Retention etc.

Business Intelligence & Data Management
Leadership perspective in business intelligence, master data management, enterprise data warehouse, big data, dashboards, BI tools and technologies and approaches in key industry verticals.

Direct experience working for and with the US Federal Government Intelligence Community, Department of Defense (DoD)

Active Top Secret with Polygraph security clearance preferred with the US Intelligence Community
Extensive experience interacting at the senior executive service (SES), General/Flag Officer and Political Appointee level
Experience as direct manager of medium to large team of government employees
Experience interacting with government support contractor management and resources
Knowledge and experience with DoD and/or Federal Agency acquisition process and policy
Knowledge and experience with DoD and/or Federal Agency program objectives memorandum (POM) process
Experience interacting with and tasking government Contracting Officers in the procurement of IT services and capabilities

What we offer:
In addition to an outstanding work environment with excellent growth potential, Gartner Executive Programs provides exceptional compensation and benefits, including:

Competitive base salary
Annual bonus potential
Excellent benefits package

job_information:
Your Role at MOBE:
This is an exciting time at MOBE and we are growing fast. At MOBE, we have a lot of data: medical and pharmacy claims, marketing campaign impressions, transcripts from participant interactions, etc. The Data Modeler plays a key role in the design and implementation of data structures and systems that enable the MOBE analytics groups: Data Science, Business Intelligence, and Actuarial Science. This is not an ETL Engineering role! This role will not be responsible for ingesting data from internal and third-party sources. The Data Modeler will focus on transforming data to support data consumers and analytics needs. This is an experienced position that requires a broad base of technical data manipulation skills, pragmatic and creative data model design skills, and comfort working collaboratively with analytics team members.

Responsibilities:
Ensure MOBE?s data infrastructure is optimally designed to support fast and right data-driven decision making across the business
Drive down the time to insight by improving the accessibility and organization of data
Architect data models that are performant, reusable, and extendable
Improve the reliability and interpretability of our data through better systems and documentation
Provide analysts and data scientists with technical support related to data modeling

Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics)
2-4 years of relevant experience
Highly proficient with SQL
Experience with multiple Data Warehousing structure concepts (Star, Cube, Data Vault 2.0 etc.)
Experience working in a cloud-based environment (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Comfortable using git for version control

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience building data transformation pipelines with DBT (getdbt.com)
Experience building and maintaining highly-performant Redshift databases
Experience building and deploying Docker-based services with Kubernetes
Experience with business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker)
Experience working with healthcare data, specifically medical and pharmacy claims data

Guiding Principles:
We want employees who are kind, talented and committed, who live by our guiding principles and choose to work at MOBE because of these principles:

Care about people. We only succeed in our mission because we take good care of our own with the same energy, empathy and expertise we bring to the MOBE program. We honor who people are at work and outside of work.
Attitude counts. Our people believe in a friendly, human approach to helping people with their health and enjoy a culture built on trust, positivity, and well-being.
Do good together. As a mission-based organization, we need people who like to collaborate and are energized by doing good things.
Believe in the power of human potential. We need people who want opportunities for personal growth and believe in making a difference in the health care space, person by person.
Embrace new ideas. As a high-growth organization, we need people who have the energy and flexibility to innovate and evolve with our program.
Apply learnings. We learn by doing, and we’re going to get better at helping people by being able to anticipate their needs. We need people who embrace continuous improvement and are dedicated to delivering results.
Be relentless in the pursuit of awesome. MOBE offers a unique opportunity to help others lead more fulfilling, enjoyable lives. We need people who are ready to embrace this mission.

Anexinet, based in Blue Bell, PA, specializes in digital business transformation. We empower our clients to grow their customer base and improve workforce efficiency by envisioning, developing, and operating next generation technology solutions. Our core expertise is in digital applications, managed services, analytics, and cloud and hybrid IT, enabling businesses to rapidly transform. Our clients partner with Anexinet to support the full lifecycle of your next generation digital business. Our people come and stay at Anexinet because we are a technology focused, team-oriented organization with a culture that is second to none as reflected by our 9 consecutive Best Place to Work awards from the Philadelphia Business Journal.

Anexinet is looking for a Business Development Representative to join our growing team. The Business Development Representative is tasked with driving sales for Anexinet’s digital applications, analytics and Cloud and Hybrid IT business through a variety of sales techniques. Working closely with our Marketing Team
Identifying potential opportunities for new business within other parts of the company

Prepares sales forecast

Excellent B2B sales skills and at least a 2-5 year proven track record of achieving sales targets
Strong interpersonal skills and an ability to build rapport with senior executives
Driven and ambitious individual with a strong desire to succeed
Previous experience in an inside sales role within a similar business
Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals
Effective communicator and works well with others
Possesses strong written and oral communication skills and thrives in a team environment
Experience selling in a consultative sales approach environment
Experience with cold calling, business development and account management
Excellent time management
Works independently, self directed individual
Comfortable in a work from home environment

Initiative – Recognizes opportunities and initiates actions to capitalize on them by looking for a new and productive ways to make an impact

Summary:

The Director of Business Intelligence has the technical credibility to gain the respect of a high-quality BI team, data scientists, and data engineers.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Technical leader and manager of the business intelligence and analytics team, responsible for hiring, retaining, and mentoring data science, data engineering, and data architecture talent
Owner of the core enterprise data model for business intelligence and analytics and to democratize standardized data access for all business units

Minimizing data redundancy
Ensuring data velocity, flexibility, and scalability

Requirements:
7+ years in Business Intelligence/ Business Analytics Lead experience

Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with leadership and other lines of the business

Expert understanding of software delivery in agile and lean environments and architecting applications and platforms based on a microservices architectures
Expert understanding of the major cloud ecosystems (e.g. Azure, AWS) and offerings, and of cutting-edge technologies in the open source ecosystem

Pilot Freight Services is a leading, global, non-asset based, global transportation and logistics provider for specialized, high value, and often mission-critical freight.

Pilot’s two principal business lines include freight forwarding and e-commerce home delivery. Pilot’s expedited and time-definite freight forwarding services encompass every mode of transportation, including air, ground, and ocean, serving the domestic and international markets. Pilot provides e-commerce home delivery solutions for heavy, bulky, non-conveyable goods with a focus on value added services, including white glove services, time-definite delivery, assembly, and installation. Pilot also offers freight brokerage services and value added logistics services such as product warehousing and inventory management.

Pilot reaches more than 190 countries through a combination of over 80 locations throughout North America, additional locations in Western Europe and Asia-Pacific, and a network of international partners.

Job Summary:
Pilot is undergoing a digital and analytics transformation and seeks a Business Intelligence and Analytics Specialist to work at our Corporate Headquarters located in Glen Mills, PA.

This is a high visibility/high impact position working across the entire organization to improve and automate existing business processes, create data driven tools, and facilitate better data-driven decision making across the company.

Essential duties:
Develop data driven tools to optimize sales and operating results (e.g. pricing tools, staffing tools, route optimization tools, etc.)
Create dashboards for executives, department heads, and station district managers for improved decision making
Automate and improve existing business processes
Collaborate with functional areas of the company to identify and prioritize business use cases
As Pilot’s resident Alteryx expert, enable and train other users as necessary
Utilize business intelligence data from internal databases, cloud data sources, available industry reports, and other sources
Maintain and update business intelligence tools, databases, dashboards, and systems
Use agile project management tools to manage the backlog and pipeline of initiatives.
Work with IT to ensure the Analytics Platform meets the business needs.

Qualifications/Education Requirements:
Highly skilled in Alteryx Designer
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, finance, mathematics, statistics or related major
Experience with Tableau is a plus
Understanding of transportation & logistics is a plus
Excellent communications skills both written and verbal
Ability to work with minimal supervision
Competitive salary and benefits package, including 401k.

An Equal Opportunity Employer

It is the policy of Pilot Air Freight to consider all applications for any position without regard to a person’s race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or genetics.

Job Description

Our Marketing team is passionate about bringing our medicines and vaccines to our customers around the world. Through digital listening and patient analytics, we are able to understand our customers’ needs and strive to provide solutions to meet them.

As a member of Global Marketing Operations, the Business Automation Analyst is responsible for the identification, qualification, implementation and change management of intelligent automation solutions to enable executional excellence. The incumbent will fulfill a client facing functional role, working closely with other members of the Process Excellence & Business Automation team, Information Technology Development team and stakeholders from the business, to translate business requirements and desired outcomes to automated, scalable solutions across the Human Health organization.

Primary Responsibilities

Identify processes and tasks for improvement opportunities utilizing lean methodology and intelligent automation (Robotic Process Automation (RPA), OCR, etc.)

Develop business case for all improvement opportunities and use cases

Assist with the prioritization of improvement opportunities

Document the current “As is” process, applications used in the process, “To be” process and business exceptions handling

Work closely with functional teams and business stakeholders through the qualification, Proof-of-Concept, prototype and MVP phases to ensure alignment and clear understanding of automation process impacts and interdependencies

Identify process metrics and KPI’s to track realization of the business case

Develop training, implementation and change management plans for automation solution and process improvements

Provide training and lead the implementation and change management plans

Develop and document process and best practices

Manage and track Agile activities to deliver (and scale) each automation solution

Develop and implement communication activities as needed

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration/Management, Information Systems Management, or Computer and Information Science or an equivalent field of study

At least three years of process design and process improvement experience

Awareness or Training in Lean Six Sigma methodology

Experience with Robotics Process Automation or any other workflow automation tool

Highly motivated, with the ability to work both independently and collaborate with team members both in person and via collaboration tools

Superior project management skills, ability to prioritize work, manage many projects simultaneously and must be able to work successfully in a very deadline driven environment

Excellent Problem-Solving Skills

Excellent communication and presentation skills

Willingness to challenge the norm & drive change

Our Human Health Division maintains a “patient first, profits later” ideology. The organization is comprised of sales, marketing, market access, digital analytics and commercial professionals who are passionate about their role in bringing our medicines to our customers worldwide.

Who we are …

We are a global biopharmaceutical leader with a diverse portfolio of prescription medicines, oncology, vaccines and animal health products.

We are driven by our purpose to develop and deliver innovative products that save and improve lives. With 69,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, we offer state of the art laboratories, plants and offices that are designed to Inspire our employees as we learn, develop and grow in our careers. We are proud of our 125 years of service to humanity and continue to be one of the world’s biggest investors in Research & Development.

What we look for …

In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.

INVENT.

IMPACT.

INSPIRE.

If you need an accommodation for the application process please email us at staffingaadar@merck.com

About Hungryroot

Hungryroot is an online grocery service that delivers modern, healthy food with recipe and meal planning support. Hungryroot's mission is to help people feel their best by making it easier to shop for, cook, and love healthy food. In addition to offering a curated selection of modern brands, Hungryroot develops its own in-house line of innovative healthy products—like Black Bean Brownie Batter—and is challenging the traditional CPG model by building a customer-driven innovation platform to push outdated American grocery offerings into the 21st century.

About the opportunity

We're looking for a highly motivated problem solver who loves telling stories with data. As our first Business Analyst, you'll own all of the ways that we measure our success, and how we identify new opportunities. You'll work closely with the Product team to uncover potential wins, help design experiments for how best to test them, and help tell stories around how things perform. We'll look to this role to evangelize the value of using quantitative data in decision making and to democratize access to data for all team members so that they can realize its power firsthand.

What kinds of problems would you dig into? Some recent analyses that our Product team have done include:

How many breakfast options do we need to merchandise each week in order to cover our customers' various dietary restrictions, with as much variety as they expect from us?
What are the best predictors of a customer rating a recipe highly?
How big is the opportunity around driving more subscription reactivations and how should we invest in it accordingly?
How should we balance a short term hit to customer spend against longterm retention?

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Define key metrics and understand what moves them
Uncover opportunities and problems to drive product prioritization
Derive data insights to drive day-to-day decisions
Build analytical models to predict outcomes (in Excel or tool of choice)
Design and analyze experiments using statistics methods
Create dashboards and reports that provide ongoing insight to business stakeholders
Enable others to self-serve with easy access to data (largely via Looker)
Serve occasional ad hoc data requests from stakeholders

Requirements:
2+ years in an analyst, strategy, consulting, finance, or related role
Strong SQL querying skills
Strong Excel skills
Effective data communication, including visualization of data
A love of learning and the ability to keep up with a frequently changing environment
Highly detail-oriented and organized

Bonus points for experience with:
Looker and LookML
Google Analytics
Regression analysis

Additional Information:
Based in our Manhattan office just south of Madison Square Park
Reports to our VP Product
Competitive compensation + subsidized health benefits
Unlimited vacation policy
Monthly Hungryroot credit
Universal paid parental leave
A working environment filled with passionate, happy, smart people

The Application Fraud and Credit Models Analyst meets a critical function at the center of this framework, developing, monitoring, and refining models across the credit ecosystem.

Monitor the on-going performance monitoring of credit and fraud models.
Provide monthly read-outs summarizing the performance of the models

LOB Liaison

Lead monthly discussions with LOB partners to build the link between predictive loss mitigation strategies informed by advanced analytics and business growth objectives

BA/BS degree or equivalent experience

About Stanley Black & Decker

Joining the Stanley Black & Decker (SBD) team means joining one of the world's largest, fastest-growing, and most dynamic companies. SBD, a Fortune 200 company is a world-leading provider of tools and storage, commercial electronic security and engineered fastening systems, with unique growth platforms and a track record of sustained profitable growth. We have been globally recognized as one of the most innovative, sustainable, and rewarding companies in the world.

Summary

This position is for a Senior Artificial Intelligence (AI) Architect within the AI Group in Atlanta, Georgia. The mission of the AI group is to foster collaborations across the product groups at Stanley Black & Decker. This group helps to solve the organization's most difficult challenges based on leading AI and machine learning technologies. We work with business partners in order to identify specific business problems to which artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques can be applied. The group is also chartered with exploring the boundaries of big data analytics both in existing business units as well as emerging opportunities including areas in robotics, machine vision, UAVs, speech processing, and Blockchain/Distributed Ledger technologies.

We are looking for an experienced technical contributor to lead at the forefront of cutting-edge artificial intelligence applications. You will build AI systems and explore conceptually new solutions in a fast-paced environment. You will be at the heart of a growing and exciting focus area for Stanley Black & Decker and work with variety of its business units (including manufacturing, security services, industrial equipment and asset management, as well as other units) to apply artificial intelligence techniques to our most difficult problems.

Duties & Responsibilities

Utilize Artificial Intelligence(AI) and big data analysis methods to work within cross-functional teams to engage the internal clients and broader customer base, comprehend the internal client's problems, develop strategic analytical products, support requirements analysis, inform the creation of strategic plans for business transformation, including understanding clients' most complex business challenges, architecting a solution that delivers a measurable outcome, testing the solution, and implementing the transformation.
Apply extensive domain expertise and business acumen to develop multiple insights and theories for complex problems in the Industrial, Manufacturing and Security spaces that require the regular use of ingenuity and creativity and deep understanding of existing methods and solutions.
Extract qualitative and quantitative relationships, including patterns and trends from a wide variety of data.
Use technical and analytical expertise to explore and examine data from multiple disparate Big Data sources with the goal of discovering patterns and previously hidden insights that can provide a competitive advantage or address a pressing mission problem.
Analyze and implement analysis infrastructure and tools, analytic workflow processes, and complex data visualizations and leverage foundational comprehension of mathematical and statistical concepts, algorithm development, feature engineering, model selection, training testing and validation of different models, pipeline generation, and domain expertise to bridge the gap between decision makers and technical experts, ensuring data or modeling solutions meet business requirements.
Contribute to the development of strategies for deploying AI techniques into existing business, development of road map and requirements analysis considering both AI and business potential analysis.
Develop new concepts and experiments for variety of these ideas, translate these ideas into executable action plans, and communicate these plans to a diverse client base.
Offer technical mentorship to develop younger talent within the group.

Qualifications

MS or PhD in computer science, electrical engineering, applied mathematics, data science, physics, statistics or related field
5+ years of experience with data analysis in high performance computing, machine learning, big data analysis or related areas, deep understanding of machine learning and cloud services like AWS
Deep expertise in neural networks, convolutional neural networks, random forests, classifiers, feature representations, AI / Artificial Intelligence and/or related techniques.
Confident in the development of quantitative models for Industrial systems (reliability data, sensor data) supply chain big data analysis, revenue forecasting, or similar problems using machine learning.
Experience in modern machine learning approaches and statistics. Advanced proficiency with at least one statistical computing language for data analysis, such as R or Python
Ability to communicate effectively with internal clients or other quantitative analysts and programmers using expertise in hardware or software technologies.
Experienced in bringing AI systems into production and working with production teams.

An understanding of industry and technology trends in said area of application (security, manufacturing, consumer products and supply chain).
Experience with providing project management support for large data analytics and data quality management projects, including providing planning, scheduling, and deployment support.
Experience with working in a big data environment and addressing data operations and quality issues therein.
Knowledge of relational database concepts, data mining, data warehouses, decision support tools, and programming languages, including SQL, SAP, etc.

Are you interested in growing your career with an amazing technology company? Cipher Skin is a fast-growing data startup in which you will learn quickly, be trusted, and overcome great challenges in a supportive environment.

About Cipher Skin

Based on a groundbreaking sensor technology, embedded in garments, Cipher Skin has been revolutionizing the way data – on the human body or any other physical object – is collected, reported, analyzed and monitored. The potential of Cipher Skin’s technology truly lies in the unique data sets that it generates: the users now have access to gapless, authentic data that can be used for the prediction of any functional and structural failures. The company has designed and put into market key, innovative solutions:

– The BioSleeve – a smart compression sleeve designed as a digital tool for physical therapists, trainers and athletes in the rehab and return-to-play process. Practitioners can visualize, via an app, real-time complex motion of their client’s knees and arms in 3 dimensions.

– The Pipe Sleeve – a sleeve designed for remote, real-time pipeline asset integrity monitoring, including leak and flow detection. Cipher Skin is currently partnering with U.S. Oil & Gas companies.

Our headquarters are in Denver, Colorado, one of the fastest growing tech hubs in the country with access to growth opportunities. Denver’s cost of living is low compared to other tech markets and the outdoor opportunities are unmatched.

About the role

Cipher Skin is an informatics data platform with a patented delivery system in the form of an intelligent textile that can be integrated into the garments we wear everyday. Our step-change sensor technology and mineable database will transform how we measure and view human health and performance.

Our mission is to quantify and optimize human health and performance by creating the world’s first database of integrated human data, using our patented Cipher Skin sensor technology and world-class data science to get an integrated biometric picture never before possible. Our headquarters is in Denver Colorado, the epicenter for biotech and training products. Denver Colorado is one of the fastest growing tech hubs in the country with access to growth opportunities and challenging problems to solve. Denver’s cost of living is low compared to other tech markets and the outdoor opportunities are unmatched.

Excellent writing skills

Proficient with MS Office

We are solving an important problem: Today we can quantify and understand financial markets, networks, the weather…but not the human body. Cipher Skin’s database and sensors will change all that.

Commonwealth Financial Network® is the largest privately held Registered Investment Adviser–independent broker/dealer in the U.S., with offices in Waltham, Massachusetts, and San Diego, California. Amherst is revolutionizing the way U.S. real estate is priced, managed and financed in order to unlock opportunities for all market participants. Driven by data, analytics and technology, Amherst has a 20-year history of anticipating where the next risks and opportunities are likely to emerge and designing actionable strategies for investors to capitalize on opportunities across residential real estate, commercial real estate and public securities. Amherst, along with its affiliates and subsidiaries, has more than 1,000 employees, $5 billion under management and approximately $15 billion under advisement and oversight. In 2019, Bungalo sold its 250th home, and Amherst managed it 25,000th home. To learn more, please visit www.amherst.com.

Amherst is a leading real estate investment and advisory firm with a long track record in making our clients smarter through data-driven solutions for investing, trading and analysis. Over our firm’s 20 year history, we have accumulated the most robust real estate data set in the world. Paired with our proprietary technology and analytic capabilities, we synthesize and battle-test our data to deliver strategic advantages to our clients in the form of actionable investment recommendations based on solid fundamentals and relative value analysis.

Amherst Residential launched in 2012 to develop and operate a Single Family Residential ecosystem. As pioneers in the Single Family Residential sector, Amherst quickly scaled over the last 5 years to more than 950 employees, 19,000+ homes in 28 markets across 18 states while building a vertically integrated real estate investment and operating platform.

Holistically, we manage AUM of $5bn, and work with some of the world’s largest and most prominent investors.

Our Capital Management team oversees all capital transactions including structuring & execution, debt and equity fundraising, balance sheet management, financial planning & analysis, liability management, portfolio management and strategic initiatives such as business development and mergers & acquisitions. Within Capital Management, the Portfolio Management team interacts directly with investors to provide feedback on both portfolio performance and individual assets. They thoroughly understand nuanced investor strategies and drive / monitor progress within the Company towards realizing investor goals.

Reporting into the Senior Vice President (SVP) of Portfolio Management, the Vice President of Portfolio Analytics will bring the quantitative skills to build an effective model for optimizing the portfolio performance of Vaca Morada Partners, with a $1.2bn single-family residential developer balance sheet. Key components of the role include: manage large amounts of financial and asset-level data, analyze portfolio returns through modeling and simulations, work across the Portfolio Management team to optimize different funds, and create automated multi-variable models that programmatically run complex permutations to maximize fund returns.

Responsibilities:
Collect, clean, validate, structure and analyze large amounts of data to effectively manage the portfolio and develop actionable insights to support decision making and strategy development
Utilize complex statistical and mathematical tools, probability theory, and optimization methods to properly allocate assets across the portfolio
Apply market signals to fundamental and quantitative investment process
Conduct investor portfolio reviews to analyze the fundamental profile of the portfolio relative to guidelines and risk, reallocating assets as mandated by the defined parameters
Advise on the most efficient way to deploy capital
Partner with Asset Management, Investor Relations and Financial Planning & Analysis to facilitate investment decision making and operational processes
Collaborate with subject matter experts and technology to implement strategic data collection, integration and retention
Coordinate with Acquisition team to forecast fund sources and uses and assist in onboarding assets
Understand economic impact of revenue and expense functions
Highlight fund and asset-specific issues and opportunities
Support the SVP in preparing for board and internal presentations

Qualifications:
A bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field, e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Machine Learning, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field – Masters or Phd preferred but not required
At least six (6) years of quantitative research/modeling experience (in real estate or business analytics is a plus, but not required)
Strong quantitative and analytical skills. Experience with quantitative investing and portfolio construction a plus
Ablility to convey complex solutions in easy to understand terms through usage of data visualization and clear written and verbal feedback
Fluent in at least one statistical language, e.g. R, SPlus, Matlab
Advanced SQL skills
Python a definite plus

Interested candidates need demonstrated abilities to:
Understand current and evolving data technologies
Develop quantitative strategies
Combine individual technical expertise with team oriented collaboration
Collaborate across the organization to deliver thoughtful analysis and recommendations
Quickly synthesize and incorporate emerging data points
Seek out, understand and follow developing industry trends

Kinship’s Data Science & Analytics team is core to our strategy.
